Description: Owned by the Beaune negociant firm Louis Jadot, this producer is major among the Beaujolais crus. As in this wine, the style is rich, wood aged and intense with ripe cherry and acidity. This single-vineyard wine is structured and ageworthy. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château des Jacques 2016 Clos des Thorins  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The potential for Gamay Noir to become an important Central Coast grape is made apparent with almost every bottling. In this case, aromas of strawberry, cherry jam, gravel and singed oak lead into a broad, immensely drinkable palate of red plum, white pepper and salted meats. Glug up!
Name: Stasis 2016 Murmur Vineyard Gamay Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

Description: This well-structured, layered wine offers beautiful ripe cherry and red-berry fruits. Aged in wood, it has spice as well as great richness. Its fresh edge gives a lift at the end while the tannins will let it age. Owned by the Beaune negociant Louis Jadot, this wine should be kept until 2021.
Name: Château des Jacques 2016 La Roche  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This dense wine, aged for 22 months in wood, is rich with black-cherry flavors and structured tannins. Fresh acidity, juicy fruits and good concentration give this wine weight and the potential for a few more months aging. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Château de Lavernette 2016 Le Clos Jadis  (Beaujolais-Leynes)

Description: This wine comes from a seven-acre vineyard. It is structured, with plenty of juicy red-cherry flavors and acidity while having the weight to age well. Drink this full wine with its edge of tannins for aging from late 2019.
Name: Vincent 2016 Domaine de la Conseillère  (Juliénas)

Description: Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, this wine is full of blackberry fruits that are laced with red-cherry acidity. The wine, which is produced in the new appellation of Beajolais-Leynes, is fully structured and dense, ready to drink from late 2019.
Name: Château de Lavernette 2017 Le Clos  (Beaujolais-Leynes)

Description: This Cerdon mountain-vineyard sparkling wine entertains with a strong mousse that pushes out bubbles to go with the red-fruit flavors and touch of tannic structure. The low-alcohol wine may be described as dry but it is also fruity and lively. Drink now.
Name: Lingot Martin NV Cerdon Méthode Ancestrale Classic Sec Gamay (Bugey)

Description: Ripe red cherries and some tangy acidity balance the soft tannins of this open, fruity wine. Aged in tank, the wine sings fruitiness and easiness. Drink now.
Name: Château de Lavernette 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This off-dry rosé wine from mountain vineyards an hour east of Lyon is full of raspberry fruits and fresh acidity. Its lightness and fruitiness make it a perfect summer aperitif wine to drink now.
Name: Lingot Martin NV Cerdon Méthode Ancestrale Classic Demi-Sec Gamay (Bugey)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This cuvée features a single clone, different from the two in the winery's other Gamay Noir. It's an aromatic, elegant wine with exceptional finesse—a bowl of strawberries and raspberries, lightly dusted with cocoa powder. The finish is taut and tangy, and the wine should continue to evolve over the next half decade.
Name: Brick House 2017 Due East Gamay Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The winery continues to explore and improve its Gamays, this one a mix of two clones now 25 years old. It's full, fruity and rounded out with tangy raspberry fruit and highlights of orange peel. Tasty and tart, it drinks just as well on the second day as on the first, with a lightly mineral suggestion of black cherry soda as it finishes.
Name: Brick House 2017 Gamay Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Elkton Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Spicy and still fresh when tasted 14 months after fermentation, this brings a lively mix of pomegranate, cranberry and cherry fruit, amplified by the creamy/leesy mouthfeel. It may well have another solid year of freshness left, but it's best to drink up.
Name: Lexème 2017 Rosé of Gamay Noir (Elkton Oregon)

Description: Fresh, light and fruity, this is a crisp, red-currant-flavored wine. Refreshing acidity and a bright aftertaste are already delicious. Drink now.
Name: Maison Roche de Bellene 2017 Bellenos Rosé of  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

Description: This amazing wine comes from vines that are more than 100 years old. Its richness and concentration are impressive, while the black fruits offer juicy acidity, spice and ripe tannins. This complex wine is well worth aging. Drink from 2020.
Name: Yohan Lardy 2016 Vieilles Vignes de 1903  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Night harvesting of grapes for this wine has preserved freshness and fruitiness. It's also allowed the tannins to have great play and density. Structure and beautiful, juicy black fruits have a good future ahead of them. Drink this powerful wine from 2020.
Name: Domaine Anita 2017 Reine de Nuit  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: From a 12-acre parcel, this wine is ripe, with layers of wood, spice and black fruits. Opulent and generous, it has great potential. The concentration and richness indicate a wine to age for a few more years. Drink from 2021.
Name: Albert Bichot 2016 Domaine de Rochegrès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This wood-aged wine offers complex tannins and perfumed fruit. Ripe cherries and spice go with juicy blackberry flavors to produce a wine that will age further. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Labruyère 2016 Le Clos du Moulin-à-Vent  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The slow rise of Gamay Noir on the Central Coast shows immense promise for lovers of mineral inflected, lighter styles of wine. This bottling offers wet slate and gravel on the nose along with sagebrush and light berries. The palate's tart cranberry fruit takes a backseat to wet rocks, tobacco leaf and mossy forest floor.
Name: Martian Ranch 2016 Absolute Magnitude Gamay Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This comes from a single vineyard facing southeast across the Saône Valley. Ripe tannins and great concentration are balanced by opulent, spicy fruit and wonderful richness. The wine is just approaching maturity and will benefit from further aging. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château du Moulin-à-Vent 2015 La Rochelle  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: The name translates as “heart of the winemaker,” recognizing owner Anita Kuhnel's place among the few women producers in Beaujolais. The wine is complex and intense, while also well structured and full of smooth fruits. Velvet tannins give a sense of structure while leaving the freshness intact. Drink from 2022.
Name: Domaine Anita 2017 Coeur de Vigneronne  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This rich wine is aged in old barrels for more than two years. Spice, mint and ripe perfumed black fruits come together in a wine that has weight, density and is just now becoming ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Bertrand 2015 Infini  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Acidity and richness give this wine an opulent character. Ripe blackberry fruit are shot with acidity, still young and exuberant. The wine needs to soften and fill out to reveal its true intensity. Drink from 2020.
Name: Albert Bichot 2017 Domaine de Rochegrès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Big and rich, this generous wine has spice, juicy black fruits and fine tannins. It has developed well with a full, rich character. Coming from a single parcel, the wine shows a great sense of terroir. The estate is under the same ownership as Domaine Jacques Prieur in Meursault on the Côte de Beaune. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine Labruyère 2016 Le Carquelin  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: From a three-acre parcel, Anita Kuhnel's wine is structured, firm and juicy. Dense and rich, it offers black fruits, solid tannins and layered acidity. Still young the wine will be best from 2021.
Name: Domaine Anita 2017 Prémium Les Brureaux  (Chénas)

Description: The Grillet family's organically grown wine shows delicious, pure flavors of jammy blackberries cut with acidity. It comes from old vines in one of Morgon's cru vineyards, giving both concentration and a mineral structure. Drink from 2021.
Name: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2017 Grands Cras  (Morgon)

Description: From 70-year-old vines, this limited-production wine comes from an estate that has been in the hands of the same family since 1619. Rich tannins and black-cherry fruits are lifted and given extra dimension by the wine's fresh edge. This bold, ripe wine will repay another year, so drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Joncy 2016  Morgon

Description: Produced, like all this producer's wines, from organically grown grapes, this is an aromatic wine. Wood aging has given the wine its richness and full, generous structure. Spice, black fruits and acidity are all coming together. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Richard Rottiers 2017  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: The Grand Cras is one of the recognized vineyard areas of Morgon, producing, as here, concentrated wines. This is dense, firm and still young, with potential from the rich black fruits. A wine to age, it will be best from 2020.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2017 Grands Cras  (Morgon)

Description: A light touch of wood aging has given this wine ripe, perfumed flavors and rich tannins. A generous wine, it's full of fruit, spice and concentration. Produced from old vines, this dense wine is ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Belleverne 2016 Cuvée Mandrin  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This single-vineyard wine is dense and firmly structured. Bold tannins and rich black fruits are developing well although remain very young. The structure and dense texture show the potential of the appellation. Drink this wine from 2020.
Name: Château des Jacques 2016 Clos du Grand Carquelin  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: From one of the top vineyards in Fleurie, this wine is elegant, conveying a floral character as well as an opulent backdrop of dark black fruits. A rich wine with concentration and dense tannins, it needs to age further to become balanced and stylish. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Anita 2017 Les Moriers  (Fleurie)

Description: The 37-acre vineyard, one of the cru's largest, is on the hill of Saint-Amour, close to the village church. It has produced a juicy wine, full of strawberry flavors and ripe acidity. Perfumed and textured, this wine is developing, but needs some time. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de la Pirolette 2017  Saint-Amour

Description: The volcanic soil of this impressive vineyard gives powerful wines, like this. It is about tannins as much as fruit, but this will change. Wood aging has already done much to smooth the up-front structure and the fruit is developing well. But wait until 2021 for the wine to be at its best.
Name: Domaine des Souchons 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: This wine has power, rich tannins and perfumed black-cherry fruits. Its concentration and dark structure are impressive and sure to age well. The density of wine goes with the ripe fruit cut with acidity. Drink this ageworthy wine from 2021.
Name: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: Legend has it that the Roman Emperor Probus introduced Gamay to Beaujolais, hence the name of this wine as a tribute. It is a beautifully smooth, perfumed wine, benefiting from wood aging as well as generous tannins and black fruits. The wine is capable of further aging, so drink from 2020.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2016 Probus  (Juliénas)

Description: The wood aging of this wine is apparent in the toasty aromas. On the palate though, the rich fruits come right to the fore. The wine has concentration, density and bold black cherry and plum flavors. It needs to age. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château des Jacques 2016 Clos de Rochegrès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Beautifully wood aged, this perfumed wine is rich and elegant. It comes from a single vineyard on the estate, offering a fine line in tannins as well as great black fruits. The wine has weight along with presence and style. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château du Moulin-à-Vent 2015 Les Vérillats  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This Brouilly estate also has vines in the more northerly cru of Moulin-à-Vent. The rich and perfumed wine is in the warm, concentrated style of winemaker Lauren Frapin. It has weight, with dense black-cherry flavors along with mint and spice. Drink this full-bodied wine now and until 2023.
Name: Domaine de Briante 2015  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: This balanced, structured wine comes from the slopes of Mont Brouilly. Its tannins match the ripeness of the black-cherry flavors as well as the crisp acidity. A streak of minerality reflects the granite terroir. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de la Voûte des Crozes 2017  Côte de Brouilly
Winery: Domaine de la Voûte des Crozes

Description: Big tannins and firm extraction mark this wine. Its structure and dry core are, at this young stage, as important as the fruit. That will change and it will develop into a rich wine that is well balanced between structure and black fruits. Drink from 2021.
Name: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2017 Les Charmes by Cédric Lathuilière  (Morgon)

Description: Named after the large barrels used for aging, this is a perfumed wine. Ripe tannins are a balanced part of the rich black fruits and intense spice that are setting the wine on a course for long-term aging. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Richard Rottiers 2017 Foudres  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Black-cherry aromas and flavors are typical of this famous vineyard. They sing from this wine where they are balanced with serious tannins and acidity. The wine needs time and should not be drunk before 2021.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2017 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: While the fruit of this wine is perfumed, the structure is firm and dry. That gives considerable aging potential to this rich wine with its blackberry flavors and considerable acidity. The wine will take its time, and should be ready from 2020.
Name: Patrick Tranchand 2017 Poncié  (Fleurie)

Description: Morgon's most famous vineyard is on a long, steep slope. It has produced this perfumed, ripe wine. The tannins are fully integrated into the fruit giving richness and leaving plenty of room for acidity. This wine could age further and will be better from 2021.
Name: Château des Jacques 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: From a parcel within one of the top vineyards in Moulin-à-Vent, this wine has weight and spiciness from the wood aging. Its tannins, still young, give both structure and emphasize the richness of the fruit. It provides a fine example of the aging ability of great Beaujolais and will probably not be ready until 2020.
Name: Château du Moulin-à-Vent 2015 Champ de Cour  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: In this structured wine, some firm tannins sustain the rich black fruits. Its freshness and dark core are still very young, meaning the wine needs to age. It is heading to be a fine wine, so wait until 2020.
Name: Domaine Chardigny 2017 Le Clos du Chapitre  (Saint-Amour)

Description: From one of the top vineyard sites in Morgon, this wine has powerful, concentrated fruits and structure. Its dark tannins are big and dense, matching the blackberry flavors and acidity. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine des Souchons 2016 Grands Cras  (Morgon)

Description: From a 22-acre estate, this richly structured wine shows some mature tarry flavors as well as delicious black fruits that have integrated with time. This special cuvée is now ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Fond Moiroux 2011 Gros Vosges  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This small parcel, under two acres, is still planted with low-yielding, century-old vines. Its density and richness are impressive. This is enhanced by the wood aging that adds spice as well as hints of toast to the ripe black fruits. With this concentration, the wine needs time and shouldn't be drunk before 2020.
Name: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2016 Les Vignes Centenaires  (Juliénas)

Description: The vines in this 2.25-acre plot are more than 100 years old, densely planted and producing this impressively rich wine. Juicy black fruits and powerful tannins are still present even after two years. The wine needs to age further and will be impressive from 2020.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2017 Les Moriers  (Fleurie)

Description: The single vineyard, less than an acre, is planted with 65-year-old vines. The result is this spicy, structured, dark-hued wine, with tannins still intact but promising much. Drink this lightly wood-aged wine from 2020.
Name: Yohan Lardy 2017 Le Vivier  (Fleurie)

Description: This structured wine has layers of black fruits, rich tannins and spice. Wood aging and time in bottle have softened the ripe fruit and acidity to produce a dense, velvet-textured wine that has an open and a juicy finish. Drink now.
Name: Château de Pierreux 2016 Grande Réserve  (Brouilly)

Description: A rich and tannic wine with a solid, dry core, this needs to be aged. Its concentration comes also from the ripe black fruits and acidity that are developing. All the elements give the wine impressive potential. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Roche-Guillon 2017  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Coming from the far north of Beaujolais, this wine has the typical structure and solid tannins. They mask the promise of the black-cherry fruits that will soon burst through. Then it will be a perfumed, ripe wine with great structure and potential. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine du Breuil 2017  Saint-Amour

Description: Aged in wood, stainless steel and cement tanks, this wine brings out spice as well as clean, perfumed fruit. It has weight and structure as befits a wine from this appellation and a tense tannic character that will allow it to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine du Granit 2015 Tradition  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: With a few years of age, this wine is richly ripe in character and soft in tannins, making it ready to drink. Cherry and red berry flavors are concentrated on the palate, honed by an edge of dryness. Drink this very fine, mature wine now.
Name: Domaine Fond Moiroux 2010  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Partly oak aged, this wine has great richness and dense tannins. Coming from one of the top sites in Morgon, it benefits from the blue granite that brings out the minerality of the wine. Solid and concentrated, it will age well. Drink from 2021.
Name: Domaine Guenael Jambon 2017 Côte de Py Réserve  (Morgon)

Description: This family estate, which has grown grapes since 1619, is set in the relatively high-altitude village of Chiroubles. Perfumed and ripe, this wine has some firm tannins as well as flavors of mint and spice, all balanced by acidity. The wine will develop over the next few months, so drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Joncy 2016  Chiroubles

Description: A blend of three parcels giving three different aspects of soil, this wine is firmly structured, still developing its tannins and solid fruit. The ripe black fruits are showing well, full of acidity and spice while the dry core is just beginning to soften. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaines Chermette 2017 Les Trois Roches  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Wood aging in old barrels has helped tame the bright fruits and introduce structure. Those tannins, still firm at this stage, are the passport to wine's long-term future. With rich fruit, a dry core and acidity, the wine will mature slowly. Drink from 2021.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2016 Les Chênes  (Fleurie)

Description: Old vines are behind this structured wine, giving bold tannins as well as rich black-currant fruits. The wine is concentrated, ripe and needs to age. Drink this black-hued wine from 2021.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2017 Domaine Pardon Cuvée Hugo  (Fleurie)

Description: This wine is beautifully balanced, with rich tannins and great concentration. Ripe black fruits dominate the structure, giving it density that is enhanced by the wood aging. The aftertaste is balanced, juicy and ready to drink.
Name: Château du Moulin-à-Vent 2015  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: This mineral-driven wine from 80-year-old vines shows the granite soils of the vineyard. The resulting structure and density sustain the ripe fruits, fine tannins and acidity. The wine should be aged further, so drink from 2021.
Name: Domaine Anita 2017 Très Vieille Vigne Les Caves  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Aged for two years in old barrels, this wine has rich tannins as well as blackberry flavors. With a firm structure still developing, it is still a young wine, packed with fruit and with crisp acidity at the end.
Name: Domaine Fond Moiroux 2015  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Vines that are more than 80 years old are rare even in Beaujolais, which has many longstanding vineyards. This wine shows firm concentration and ripe tannins that are balanced by fresh acidity and black-currant flavors. Age the wine further and drink from 2020.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2017 1935 Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: The granite soils of this great vineyard give intense minerality and structure to this wine. Black fruits shine through, built up by bright acidity and structured tannins. This will develop into a rich wine, concentrated while always having a fresh edge.
Name: Mommessin 2017 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Named after the cherry orchard adjoining the vines, this wine is perfumed and full of fruit. Partial aging in old wood barrels gives a smoothness to the texture of the wine that will allow it to age well. Drink from 2020.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2017 Les Cerisiers  (Juliénas)

Description: Grown in the Le Château single vineyard, this wine is structured and firm, with dense tannins and bold black fruits. It also has juicy acidity and black-currant fruitiness that are showing well against the structure. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Robert Perroud 2016 La Fournaise du Pérou  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: In this full and rich wine, great tannins ride under the black fruits. The wine has structure as well as the fruit of the vintage, suggesting good potential for aging. Drink this well-structured wine from 2020.
Name: Château Bonnet 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Juliénas)

Description: Eighty-year-old vines trained, in the old Beaujolais tradition, up individual poles, give this wine a rich character, with some firm tannins and a sold texture. Weight and concentration balance the juicy acidity and black fruits. Drink the wine from 2020.
Name: Château de Belleverne 2017 Les Seignaux  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This wine's name refers to the ancient granite soil found all over Beaujolais. The wine is all about red berries and firm tannins. Still young, it has a bright feel, full of fruitiness. Give the wine time to fill out. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château du Châtelard 2017 Cuvée les Vieux Granits  (Fleurie)

Description: From one of the specified cru vineyards of Morgon, this firm wine has all the structure of the appellation and also the rich fruit. It is powerful and will develop well as it matures. Don't even touch this wine until 2021.
Designation: Henri et Colin Bourisset Les Grands Cras
Name: Colin Bourisset 2017 Henri et Colin Bourisset Les Grands Cras  (Morgon)

Description: Powerful and concentrated, this wine is richly endowed. Wines from this cru, one of the smallest in Beaujolais, are naturally firm and tannic, as with this wine, giving aging potential. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Anita 2017 Cuvée P'tit Co Les Brureaux  (Chénas)

Description: As befits old vines from the Collonge family's top Beaujolais cru, this wine has great weight and impressive concentration. Juicy acidity, rich tannins and blackberry flavors all lead to a complete wine that needs time to mature. Wait until 2020 before drinking.
Name: Domaine de Colonat 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: All the perfumed character and structure to be expected in a wine from this appellation are exhibited in this full, dense wine. Its juicy character is still developing, but it is doing so in partnership with fresh berry flavors. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaines Chermette 2017 Poncié  (Fleurie)

Description: Ripe and powerful, this wine has weight and concentration. Its tannins are an important element at this young stage where the fruit is also right up front. Like all good wines from this appellation, the wine needs to age and fill out with secondary flavors. Drink from 2020.
Name: Baptiste et Laurent 2017 Le Meilleur des 2 Mondes  (Morgon)

Description: Old vines are the backbone of this ripe, concentrated wine. They march with the still young tannins to give a powerful wine with density and richness. It is still structured and likely to age well. Drink from 2021.
Name: Colin Bourisset 2017 Domaine de la Garodière  (Morgon)

Description: This single-vineyard wine comes from an area that produces small berries and great fruit concentration. Rich in both tannins and bold structure, the wine is also packed with generous fruits. It needs to age and will be best from 2020.
Name: Domaine Anita 2017 Château-Gaillard  (Morgon)

Description: From a parcel of old vines, this wine is particularly rich and concentrated. It is full of tannins as well as black fruits with a rich texture. Firm, with hints of wood and spice, boosted by the firm tannins, this is a wine to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Briante 2015 Baronne  (Brouilly)

Description: This single-parcel wine, aged for seven months before bottling, is still young. Red fruits and ripe tannins are integrating with the fresher acidity to promise a wine that will have density as well as attractive juiciness. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine des Chers 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This oak-aged wine is smoothly textured, full of ripe black fruits. Spice as well as the layer of tannins give richness. Black cherries and berries add depth to the wine that is likely to age well. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaines Chermette 2017 Les Garants  (Fleurie)

Description: Still young although with fruit and tannins that have come into balance, this is a full, partially oak-aged wine. The tannins are still there and this concentrated wine needs to age further. Drink from 2020.
Name: Flache Sornay 2016  Morgon

Description: From vines close to the 19th-century chateau of Bellevue, this wine comes from one of the top sectors of Morgon. Still young, but properly structured and dense, the wine has considerable potential. Aging in wood has added spice and rich tannins while leaving blackberry fruit right in place. Drink this wine from 2021.
Name: Jean Loron 2017 Château de Bellevue Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: Structured and full of tannins, this wine has a good future. It is not ready yet, but the density of the wine will soften to give great richness, with layers of black fruits, acidity and spice from the old-wood aging. Drink from 2021.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2017 Les Thorins  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: From a two-acre vineyard, this no-sulfite organic wine has big tannins as well as generous fruits. At this stage, tannins dominate giving a wine with great structure. The fruit will come later as the wine develops. Wait until 2020.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2017 Corcelette  (Morgon)

Description: The schist soil of the vineyard has given this wine intense minerality and great structure. Behind this firm character, black fruits and acidity promise a wine that will be rich while also solid and structured. Drink from 2021.
Name: Domaine de Bel-Air 2017 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: Fruit from vines more than 50 years old have given this wine richness and density. Spice from wood aging and the acidity add a lift of freshness and extra complexity. This will be a fine wine as it ages. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2016 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Morgon)

Description: Firm and structured, this rich wine also has considerable tannins. Its solid structure, touches of minerality and youthful acidity all point to a wine in need of aging. Drink from 2020.
Name: Pascal Berthier 2017 Esprit de Séduction  (Saint-Amour)

Description: The west-facing slope of Mont Brouilly provides the grapes for this dense wine. 55-year-old vines bring concentration and richness along with a juicy black-currant character. A mineral edge adds to the structure of this ageworthy wine. Drink from 2020.
Name: Robert Perroud 2017 Foudre No. 5  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Produced from old vines, this special cuvée is richly endowed with powerful tannins as well as dense fruit. It is still too young with its broad cherry flavors and acidity. It will develop into a well-constructed wine with concentration and potential. Drink from 2021, but the wine will age further.
Name: Château de Pizay 2017 La Centenaire  (Morgon)

Description: One of the Duboeuf wines that is bottled at the estate, this is rich, spicy and full of ripe tannins. A dense black-fruit flavor suggests power which is accompanied by juicy acidity. Age this wine and drink from 2020.
Name: Château des Capitans 2017 Estate Bottled  (Juliénas)

Description: One year in older wood barrels has given an extra dimension to the ripe berry fruits of this wine. It adds richness and a smooth texture that lifts the fruitiness and acidity, providing further aging potential. Drink from late 2019.
Designation: Domaine de la Croix Barraud Cuvée Prestige
Name: Domaine du Granit 2016 Domaine de la Croix Barraud Cuvée Prestige  (Chénas)

Description: Beautifully structured, with black fruits still showing through the tannins, this intense, fresh wine is approaching maturity. Its pure line of fruit, now tempered by the hint of secondary flavors, means this wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Fond Moiroux 2011  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Powerfully structured, this wine has rich tannins and ripe black fruits. Concentration gives the wine strength and density, promising good aging potential. Drink this wine from 2021.
Name: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2017 Roche Bleue  (Juliénas)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The grape of Beaujolais should do quite well in Oregon, but has not really caught on. This striking example from Ehren Jordan may help to change that. It was fermented with native yeast, carbonic maceration and 100% whole cluster fruit, yielding a bright spicy wine loaded with cranberry and purple-plum flavors. The riveting acidity keeps it lively across the palate, and it should drink nicely over the next two or three years.
Name: Failla 2016 Björnson Vineyard Gamay Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: The negociant side of the Gellin family's Domaine des Nugues has produced a richly structured wine, showing the density and tannins of this appellation. It also hints at the fruit that is beginning to show. Let the blackberry flavors develop and drink the wine from 2020.
Name: Gilles Gelin 2017  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Grown on crumbly granite, this wine shows its mineral side as well as rich fruit. Structured with firm tannins, the wine has a perfumed character that lifts the fruit's richness and melds into the final acidity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château des Jean-Loron 2016 Les Gandelins  (Chénas)

Description: This structured wine is full of ripe tannins and juicy acidity. Its dense texture is cut with attractive freshness, giving lift to this wine with potential. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Colette 2017  Fleurie

Description: The granite soil shows strongly in this terroir-driven wine. Lees aging also gives extra intensity to the concentrated black-cherry fruits. Acidity and a fresher aftertaste complete the wine, balancing crunchiness with richness. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Colette 2017 Le Mont  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Aged for six months in large barrels, this elegantly structured wine offers perfumed ripe fruits and rich tannins. Juicy black fruits and acidity are well balanced by the structure of the wine that is now well integrated. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Mont Verrier 2015  Fleurie

Description: The latest release from this estate has had two years wood aging, giving it richness, spice and layers of wood to balance the ripe black fruits. It is a young wine, with acidity, ripeness and an excellent future. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Fond Moiroux 2016  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: A small-production wine from one of the top vineyard sites in Morgon, this is structured and firm, with a strong tannic element over the rich berry fruits. All this richness balances with a strong line of acidity. Age this wine for some time longer and don't drink before 2020.
Name: Domaine Pral 2017 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: Corinne and Vincent Flache used partial oak aging for this rich, structured and fruity wine. It is certainly young, bold with red-berry flavors and generous tannins that need to soften. Drink from 2021.
Name: Flache Sornay 2017  Morgon

Description: Named after the amethyst crystal that lies as a layer in the soil of the vineyard, this is a tightly structured wine. Rich tannins and black fruits are brought into relief by the young, tight acidity. Age at least until the end of 2019.
Name: Les Frères Perroud 2017 Amethyste  (Brouilly)

Description: Vines that are nearly 70 years old form the basis of this rich, generous and concentrated wine. Still young, it shows fleshiness and needs to soften and smooth out. The wine has potential and will be better from 2020.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2017 Les Roches  (Fleurie)

Description: Firm tannins and a solid structure befit a wine from this northern of the Beaujolais crus. Its weight shows the potential of the black fruits. Offering structure and acidity, this wine will age well. Drink from 2020.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2017 Les Mouilles  (Juliénas)

Description: This 113-acre estate, now owned by the Henriot family of Champagne, has produced an intense and rich wine. Its acidity and dense black fruits are impressive and concentrated. The wine is ready to drink, although it will age further, certainly until 2024.
Name: Château de Poncié 2015 Le Pré Roi  (Fleurie)

Description: This juicy, perfumed wine also has rich tannins, spice from wood aging and great acidity. It is a ripe wine, generous with black fruits and the structured potential to age.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2017 Chardignon  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: This rich wine is full of dark fruits, rich tannins and a juicy aftertaste. Its tannins and concentration will definitely allow this wine that is both fruity and structured to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Joncy 2016  Côte de Brouilly

Description: Low sulfur and wood aging both contribute to the deliciously structured fruitiness of this wine. With its juicy black-cherry flavors, touches of minerality and some tannins, it is a wine that will age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Saint-Cyr 2017 Les Blémonts  (Chénas)

Description: The Saint-Cyr family has produced a perfumed wine with ripe berry fruits, generous tannins and acidity. The nine months in wood have given richness and balance, while the low sulfur brings out the fruitiness. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Saint-Cyr 2017 Les Journets  (Chénas)

Description: A powerful and dense wine, this is concentrated and dark. Black fruits and a solid structure give richness and power, with good acidity to balance the structure. The wine is a blend of four different parcels. Drink from 2020.
Designation: Xavier et Nicolas Barbet Vieilles Vignes
Name: Jean Loron 2017 Xavier et Nicolas Barbet Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: From one of the top vineyard sites in Moulin-à-Vent, this wine is richly structured, firm with tannins while also juicy with cherry flavors. It is young, full of vivacious fruit and needs some time. Drink from 2020.
Name: Patrick Tranchand 2017 Roche Grès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is a solid, structured wine with firm tannins as well ripe fruit. Its concentration and minerality from the granite soil are the secret to the wine's aging potential. Give this rich wine, full of black fruits and acidity, until 2020.
Name: Vignobles Bulliat 2017  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Named after the single vineyard from which it comes, this wine is juicy, generous and full of ripe berry flavors. The fruitiness and acidity shine through this balanced wine, with added complexity from the wood aging. It will be ready from late 2019.
Name: Yohan Lardy 2017 Les Deschamps  (Chénas)

Description: From organically grown grapes, this wine is rich in wild-berry flavors, juicy acidity and silky tannins. Its fresh aftertaste brings out the fruitiness. Drink the wine now.
Name: Anthony Perol 2015 Bien Elevé Pierres Dorées  (Beaujolais)

Description: A ripe, soft wine with rich berry fruits, this is smooth, velvet textured and already delicious. Concentration comes from generous fruits with a splash of acidity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Belleverne 2017 La Madone  (Saint-Amour)

Description: This smoothly textured wine is full of ripe fruit, with a perfumed texture. A light touch of fruitiness balances with the smoky hints of wood and spice. The wine is named after the parcel of vines, literally the “magnificent lovers.” Drink now.
Name: Château de la Chaize 2016 Les Amants Magnifiques  (Brouilly)

Description: An 11-acre vineyard in the northernmost of the Beaujolais cru villages is the source of this rich wine. It has structure, concentration, generous tannins and a fresh edge of acidity. The wine will benefit from some aging, so drink from 2019.
Name: Clos de la Brosse 2017  Saint-Amour

Description: A rich wine with great tannins and attractive perfumes, this is structured and packed with both fruit and acidity. Still young, its fruitiness will soften into something more serious and concentrated.
Name: Domaine des Fontaines 2016  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Under the same ownership as Domaine Jacques Prieur in Meursault on the Côte de Beaune, this estate has produced a rich wine, generously textured and full of black fruits. It has weight and concentration as well as ripe berry flavors.
Name: Domaine Labruyère 2016 Champ de Cour  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Floral, perfumed and structured, this is a wine for aging. It has tannins, concentrated black-plum flavors and acidity. The wine has the potential for richness but needs time. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2017 Grand Pré  (Fleurie)

Description: A 2.5-acre parcel has produced a ripe, generously textured and wood-aged wine. The spice and warm tannins are balanced by juicy black-currant flavors to give a wine that will age for a few more months. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Domaine Richard Rottiers 2017  Brouilly

Description: Schist and granite rocks are behind this big, mineral and structured wine. Its tannins and black fruits are young and demanding aging. The wine has a juicy aftertaste, with black-currant flavors. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Ruet 2017 Grands Cras  (Morgon)

Description: From 60- to 80-year-old vines, this is a concentrated wine. It is rich with fruits that are moving into a more mature phase, while still preserving structure and tannins. This powerful wine needs a few more months, so drink from late 2019.
Name: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2015 Les Burdelines  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This 69-acre estate has four separate parcels, including one in the famed La Madonne vineyard. The wine is packed with tannins and with aromatic fruit, richly structured and with a good future. Drink this balanced wine from 2020.
Name: Jean Loron 2017 Château de Fleurie  (Fleurie)

Description: Wood aging has given spice to this rich, structured wine. Tannins and generous black fruits show through the still-young structure. This powerful wine, from one of the top vineyards in Morgon, will age well. Drink from 2020.
Name: Laurent Gauthier 2016 Vieilles Vignes Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: This major Beaujolais negociant has produced a good example of the most northerly of the cru villages. Its structure and dense texture partner with ripe black fruits and solid, juicy berry flavors. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Mommessin 2017  Saint-Amour

Description: The Balloquets slope is so steep it is regarded as hell (enfer) to work. But it produces good wine, like this rich, lightly tannic offering. With the structure and acidity in place, and with some wood aging flavors, the wine is smoothly textured, juicy and ready to drink.
Name: Robert Perroud 2017 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

Description: Produced from organically grown grapes and bottled without additional sulfur, this wine is part of a trend in Beaujolais. Its tannic structure and pure red-cherry flavors are already impressive, giving the wine aging potential and richness. Enjoy this wine from 2020.
Name: Vignobles Bulliat 2017 Nature  (Morgon)

Description: This vineyard lies on the steep southern slope of Mont Brouilly, which gives the vines plenty of sun, hence its name “scorching place.” The wine certainly is warm, with rich tannins and intense, juicy red-cherry fruits. Its structure and concentration will allow the wine to age, so drink from 2020.
Name: Château de la Chaize 2017 Brûlhier  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: This rich wine offers a dense black-fruit flavor that sits on firm tannins. The juicy acidity and fruitiness are still up front and need to calm down in order to give this wine its ripe character. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Saint-Amour 2017  Saint-Amour

Description: This flagship estate, owned by Beaune negociant Louis Jadot, has produced a wine with great intensity and structure. Partly wood aged, the blend of three vineyards is rich although with a strong streak of freshness and acidity. That, along with the tannins, suggests it could age. It will be better from late 2019.
Name: Château des Jacques 2016  Morgon

Description: This brother-and-sister team has produced a rich, complex wine, packing tannins and ripe berry fruits into an already delicious package. The wine has a juicy blackberry character, structured while never losing sight of the fruitiness.
Name: Claire & Fabien Chasselay 2017 L'Héronde  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: This vineyard is on the slope just below the famous windmill of Moulin-à-Vent. Bringing out both tannins and rich black plum and cherry fruits, the wood aging gives it a smooth texture as well as a touch of spice. This now-mature wine is ready to drink.
Name: Colin Bourisset 2015 Domaine Bourisset  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Touched by wood, and with plenty of spice as well as black-cherry flavors, this is a rich wine. Coming from this fine vintage, it has density and weight as well as layers of attractive, juicy fruit. Drink this wine now.
Name: Domaine de Briante 2015  Brouilly

Description: A rich wine from this ripe year, this has concentration from the 45-year-old vines and spice from the wood aging. It is packed with black fruits. The wine, with its fresh final fruitiness, will be ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2015 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Fleurie)

Description: This perfumed wine offers both richness and dense tannins. Its acidity and black fruits hold great promise, with freshness as well as ripeness. It will be ready from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Roche-Guillon 2017  Fleurie

Description: Selected from several parcels of old vines, this wine is rich in tannins and red-berry flavors. Minerality and structure are prominent at this young stage. With time, they will bring weight and concentration to this ageworthy wine. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine des Chers 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Juliénas)

Description: Named after the captains who used to control Saint-Amour, this wine has structure and layers of spice as well as some rich berry fruits. Its tannins are still young, still right up front, showing the wine's aging potential. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2017 Les Capitans  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Packed with red fruit, this rich wine is firmly structured. The dry core gives impressive richness to the tannins and to the pure fruit flavors. Its juicy character is beginning to come through, suggesting good potential. Drink this wine from 2021.
Name: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2017 Corcelette  (Morgon)

Description: Named after the parcel of vines from which it comes, this dense, concentrated wine packs tannins, acidity and black fruit. Wood aging has given this wine a ripe, smooth texture that balances well with the tannins. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine les Capréoles 2017 Sous la Croix  (Régnié)

Description: This intense, concentrated young wine demands plenty of aging. Red-berry flavors are there along with a powerful tannic structure. Still firm and dry even though with potential fruitiness, the wine should be held until 2020.
Name: Jean Loron 2017 Château de Bellevue  (Fleurie)

Description: This wine comes from a steep hillside vineyard with a subsoil of pink granite. That shows in the minerality and texture of this wine that has firm tannins for the appellation. It also offers juicy red fruits and acidity that give it great freshness. Drink in late 2019.
Name: Château de la Chaize 2017 La Chaize  (Brouilly)

Description: This château with 13th-century origins is a magnificent estate now belonging to the Boisset family. The wine's ripe cherry flavors and density are matched by the generous tannins that lie behind the fruit. It is already smoothly textured and ready to drink.
Name: Château de Pierreux 2017 Réserve du Château  (Brouilly)

Description: A two-acre parcel forms the basis of this well-structured wine. Both fresh and rich, it has perfumed tannins as well as ripe black fruits and acidity. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine les Capréoles 2017 L'Hydrophobe  (Brouilly)

Description: An impressively structured wine for this appellation, this is rich and dense. Black fruits and perfumed acidity are supported by a firm backbone that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Romain Jambon 2016 Les Eronnes  (Brouilly)

Description: From a two-acre parcel in one of the Morgon cru vineyards, this young wine still shows a touch of yeastiness. However it also has ripe berry fruits and touches of wood aging that add pepper and some spice. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Saint-Cyr 2017 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: Matured in stainless steel tanks only, this wine is perfumed and fresh, with attractive acidity and plenty of red fruits. It has a structure and a dry core alongside a fresh, crisp aftertaste. Drink this wine from 2020.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Belles Grives  (Morgon)

Description: From an estate owned by Jacques Charlet, this wine has ripe tannins and rich black-currant and cherry fruits. A firm core supports the fruit, giving an initial dry character to this wine. It will develop well and should be drunk from 2020.
Name: Jean Loron 2017 La Victorine  (Saint-Amour)

Description: The granite soil of this famous vineyard gives this wine its dense minerality and firm tannins. Paired with this solid element, the wine offers rich berry flavors and a fresher acidity. It should age well and will not be ready before 2021.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2017 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Showing the softer side of Fleurie, this wine is deliciously full of red fruits. Its young structure gives the wine a core of tannin that supports the ebullient fruits. Red cherries and acidity balance well in this wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Vignobles Bulliat 2017  Fleurie

Description: While the wine has all the bright red fruits you would expect from this appellation, it also has a firmly tannic edge that will allow it to age. It is ripe with fruitiness and acidity to match.
Name: Vins Descombe 2017 Florent Descombe  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Named after the dovecote in the family's vineyards, this wine has structure and the aging ability typical of this appellation. Tannins and dark fruits come together in a rich wine with juicy acidity and layers of black-cherry flavors.
Name: Vignobles Bulliat 2017 Cuvée du Colombier  (Morgon)

Description: This subtly perfumed wine has the smoothness that comes with wood aging. It is ripe with black-fruit flavors and generous tannins. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Belleverne 2016 Cuvée Mandrin  (Chénas)

Description: This comes from the estate of the ornate 17th-century chateau of Chénas. With its rich tannins and balance between spice and fruitiness, the wine is already open, full of berry flavors and acidity. Drink now.
Name: Château de Chénas 2016  Chénas

Description: Ripe cherry and red-berry flavors burst from the glass with this deliciously fruity wine. It has a soft texture and richness cut with acidity. This is a wine to savor from 2019.
Name: Château de Poncié 2016 Le Pré Roi  (Fleurie)

Description: The old vines that gave this wine endow it with great structure and concentration, what the seventh generation of Collognes call the signature of the terroir. Firm and solid, it has weight as well as black fruits, rich tannins supporting the juicy acidity and fruitiness.
Name: Domaine de Colonat 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Régnié)

Description: Old vines and barrel aging give this wine a perfumed character. The top cuvée from this estate, it is rich and ageworthy. Ripe black fruits convey fragrance and spice. The wine needs to age further, so drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2016 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Fleurie)

Description: A rich and structured wine, this has powerful red-cherry flavors as well as a firm substrate of tannins. These two rich elements will allow this dense wine to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine des Chers 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Named after the small workers' cabin in the vineyard, this wine has rich fruit, generous tannins and layers of spice and acidity. The wine is all berry flavors with a fresh lift. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine du Gry-Sablon 2017 La Petite Cabane  (Juliénas)

Description: This richly concentrated wine comes from a small parcel of 40-year-old vines. Its structure is matched by the ripe black fruits and intense acidity. Like any good wine from this appellation, it needs to age further.
Name: Domaine Pral 2016  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: elicious and perfumed, this wine offers touches of toast as well as ripe tannins. It shows intense fruitiness, with bold black fruits and a velvet texture. Drink now.
Name: Les Frères Perroud 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)

Description: Named after the dovecote in the family's vineyards, this wine has structure and the aging ability typical of this appellation. Tannins and dark fruits come together in a rich wine with juicy acidity and layers of black-cherry flavors.
Name: Vignobles Bulliat 2017 Cuvée du Colombier  (Morgon)

Description: This wine comes from Fleurie's most famous vineyard, which descends the hill from the La Madone chapel. Rich and concentrated, it has structure that balances well with the juicy black fruits. However it needs to age further, so wait until 2020.
Name: Albert Bichot 2017 La Madone  (Fleurie)

Description: This Beaune negociant has produced a richly structured wine from one of Morgon's best vineyards. It is ripe, fleshy with black-cherry fruits and the firm texture that will allow this rich wine to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Albert Bichot 2017 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: The vineyard for this wine is at the foot of the slope that leads up to the photogenic windmill of Moulin-à-Vent. It is a perfumed wine, full of blackberries and black cherries. Juicy and rich, the wine is reaching its maturity, so drink from early 2019.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2015 Climat Le Moulin  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Powered by its tannins, this structured wine is still developing. It has ripe fruit as well as spice from wood aging. The richness is impressive and will give a generous wine from 2020.
Name: Château de Pizay 2016 Les Sybarites  (Morgon)

Description: This wine is tight with tannins as well as juicy acidity. The young fruits are still developing through the dense texture and need more time to balance with the structure. Then this should be an attractive, ripe wine. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Domaine de Grands Fers 2017 Gamay Noir 1890  (Fleurie)

Description: From a fine Beaujolais vintage, this organically grown wine is perfumed and still structured with its dark tannins. The density and richness are still developing, giving the wine its concentrated potential.
Name: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2015 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Produced from old vines, this wine is dense and well structured. Tannins march with the black fruits and dense dry core to give richness and fullness. Drink this wine from late 2019.
Name: Domaine Romain Jambon 2016 Les Vieux Ceps  (Brouilly)

Description: Red cherry and red berry fruits are balanced by the ripe tannins in this structured wine. It has good potential, with plenty of tight acidity and spicy tones. Drink from 2020.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Juliénas)

Description: From a vineyard known as Les Mouilles, this wine is firmly structured while also rich. Its tannins and touches of licorice are balanced by the black fruits that are developing. It has a good future with its tannins, acidity and dark fruit. Drink from 2020.
Name: Jean Loron 2017 Domaine de la Vieille Eglise  (Juliénas)

Description: Fifty-year-old vines create the basis of this ripe, concentrated wine. Big tannins and juicy berry flavors are lifted by freshness at the end. This rich wine will age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Bonnet 2016 Côte de Besset  (Saint-Amour)

Description: A smoothly textured, perfumed wine, this is packed with black-cherry fruits. Richness is balanced by the tannins that are still present, suggesting a wine with potential that will be ready from 2020.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2017 Les Balloquets  (Brouilly)

Description: This wine is full of fruit and tannins. Although still young, it has plenty of freshness and fruit potential to go with the ripe, perfumed tannins. Drink the wine from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Bel-Air 2017 Granits Roses  (Fleurie)

Description: A dense wine made from 50-year-old vines, this is rich and dense. It has a smoky character with some bitterness at this young stage. Both elements will disappear into the rich fruit as the wine matures. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Bel-Air 2017 Les Burdelines  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This ripe wine is full of black fruits and generous, integrated tannins. It is rich, solid with warm blackberry fruits and crisp with acidity. The wine is ready, so it can be enjoyed for its fruitiness now, but it will also age and can be drunk until 2023.
Name: Domaine de Briante 2016  Brouilly

Description: The 22-acre vineyard belonging to the Duc family has given this rich, structured wine. While it has plenty of juicy acidity, the tannins are most marked at this young stage. The wine is dark, powerful, full of spice and pepper.
Name: Domaine des Duc 2017  Saint-Amour

Description: Firm and structured, this wine is rich in tannins while also having plenty of fresh, juicy fruit. The wine's dry core is dominant at this stage, but just wait until that fruit begins to shine. The dense texture and the wine's ripeness will let it age for several years. Drink from 2021.
Name: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2017 Corcelette  (Morgon)

Description: Ripe, fruity while also structured, this wine is concentrated. It comes from a sloping five-acre parcel, giving tannins, red fruits and good acidity all wrapped in an ageworthy parcel. Drink this wine from 2020.
Name: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2017 Les Mouilles  (Juliénas)

Description: This well-structured wine offers tannins and sophisticated black-cherry fruits. Weight backs up the richness and mineral texture. Named after the stones in the soil, the wine is ready to drink while remaining firm.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2017 Les Pierres  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Attractively perfumed, this wine is also richly structured. It is young, with a good future ahead of it. Rich black-cherry flavors are lifted by acidity and firmly structured with dark tannins. It is worth waiting for and will be best drunk from 2020.
Name: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2017 Les Garances  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Aged in neutral cement tanks, this wine is all about rich black fruits and tannins. It is ripe and dense, with layers of spice, black cherries and acidity. The wine will develop much further, so drink from 2021.
Name: Domaine de Colette 2017 Charme  (Morgon)

Description: Aged in wood and bottled without sulfites, this wine is rich with tannins and red-berry flavors. Acidity and spice add to the fruitiness of this attractive, ripe wine. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Colonat 2017 Naturabilis Ancestrale  (Morgon)

Description: Ripe red fruits and soft tannins characterize this rich wine. With berry flavors, intense acidity and developing richness, it will turn into a full, generous wine. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine des Maisons Neuves 2017 L'Ecluse  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Partially aged in wood, this smoothly textured, dense wine is packed with black fruits, bright acidity and spice. The fresh edge contrasts with the dry tannins that will soften as the wine develops. Give this wine until 2020 before drinking.
Name: Domaine des Rosiers 2017  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Named after the cherry tree in the vineyard, this wine is firm and solidly structured. It offers rich blackberry flavors and concentration. Produced from organically grown grapes, it has a good lift, ripeness and a still-young structure. Wait to drink until 2020.
Name: Domaine Franck Besson 2016 Le Griottier  (Juliénas)

Description: For a Beaujolais-Villages, this is an impressively structured wine. It has tannins as well as enticing red-berry fruits that are still young. Fresh with acidity and still with a firm backdrop, the wine needs to age. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Domaine Richard Rottiers 2017 La Sambinerie  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: The most northerly of the Beaujolais cru villages has produced a richly structured wine, firm with tannins as well as bright red-berry fruits. It has density cut with intense acidity that will soften over the next few months.
Name: Domaines Chermette 2017 Les Champs-Grillés  (Saint-Amour)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The grape were put through whole-cluster carbonic maceration in concrete, then aged in both neutral oak and stainless steel, yielding a wine with bold cranberry fruit with a vein of iron. The tannins are polished but stiffen the finish, with a thread of graphite. It's still quite young, quite tart and bursting with flavor.
Name: Evening Land 2017 Seven Springs Gamay Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: This structured wine has big tannins as well as generous black fruits. Acidity and a cool edge to the structure show the elevation of this appellation and will allow the wine to mature slowly. Great fruitiness adds to the promise. Drink from 2020.
Name: Fabien Collonge 2017 L'Aurore des Côtes  (Chiroubles)

Description: From the famous Côte du Py vineyard, this wine has considerable structure. Its black fruits and rich tannins are typical of this granite terroir. The wine also has juicy red fruits that are developing and will come to dominate from 2019.
Name: Florent Descombe 2017 Cuvée M Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: The schist soil of this estate has left its mark on this wine in its mineral texture. The wine is tight and firmly structured, with bold tannins that need to soften. Drink from 2020.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Domaine des Versauds  (Morgon)

Description: Parcels on the red-iron slopes of the dramatic 1,100-foot Côte du Py are the backbone of this rich and structured wine. Powerful tannins give the wine density and aging potential. It has a way to go, with rich black fruits and acidity that still need to soften. Drink from 2020.
Name: Jean-Ernest Descombes 2017 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Vines planted in 1939 are the essence of this rich, concentrated wine that offers solid tannins as well as ripe fruits. A touch of spice adds further complexity. Drink from 2020.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2017 En Rémont Vignes de 1939  (Chénas)

Description: The result of a collaboration between a grower and a negociant, this wine is softly textured and has rich black fruits. Generous tannins are fully integrated into the berry flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Baptiste et Laurent 2017 Le Meilleur des 2 Mondes  (Brouilly)

Description: This is an elegant wine, with acidity and red fruits already in harmony. An edge of tannins gives the wine structure and aging potential.
Name: Christophe Savoye 2017 Cuvée Loïc  (Chiroubles)

Description: This ripe, soft and jammy wine is immediately enjoyable. It has generous berry fruits, black plums and spice from the wood aging. Richness and a warm feel are lifted at the end by acidity. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine Bertrand 2016 Pisse-Vieille  (Brouilly)

Description: From vines on the north-facing slope of Mont Brouilly, this wine has plenty of rich cherry flavors as well as the fresher acidity typical of the vintage. Deliciously fruity it is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Briante 2014  Côte de Brouilly

Description: Still with its tannins in place, this wine also has fresh, perfumed fruits. The two are coming into balance to reveal a wine packed with berry fruitiness and red-cherry acidity. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2014 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Fleurie)

Description: This single-vineyard wine is firm with the tannins typical of this appellation. It has good structure and concentration, with supporting layers of blackberry fruits. The wine finishes with fresher acidity.
Name: Domaine du Gry-Sablon 2017 Douby  (Morgon)

Description: From grapes planted on volcanic soil, this wine has intense minerality as well as dense tannins. It also has plenty of blackberry fruit that needs to develop further before the wine is ready to enjoy. Drink from 2020.
Name: Emmanuel Fellot 2017 Les Cailloux  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: From soil that has some sand as well as granite, this wine has both structure and ripe black fruits. Tannins are prominent at this early stage and need to soften into the fruitiness of this ripe wine. Drink from 2020.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2017 Domaine Pardon Cuvée Tim  (Régnié)

Description: Playing on the name of Saint-Amour (named after a Roman soldier), this wine celebrates Gamay. Its juicy red-cherry flavors are bright while allowing space for tannins and aging potential.
Name: Patrick Tranchand 2017 Coeur de Gamay  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Zero sulfites and natural yeasts are hallmarks of this crisp and fruity wine. Its acidity and red-currant flavors are boisterous at this stage and need to calm down. The wine will be best from 2020.
Name: Château de Javernand 2017 Indigène  (Chiroubles)

Description: This wine is rich with young tannins that promise excellent aging. Ripe red-berry fruits have a touch of spice as well as a lightly herbal edge. It is developing well as its silky texture begins to show. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Juliénas 2017 Cuvée Tradition  (Juliénas)

Description: Partly aged in wood, this ripe wine is smoothly textured and rich. With tannins as well as red fruits and spice, the wine is already balanced although its bright fruitiness need to calm down a little. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Colonat 2017 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: Made without added sulfur, this ripe wine offers black fruits and soft tannins. The fruit is pure, juicy and clean, with attractive acidity as well as a fresh aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine de Grands Fers 2017 Gamay Originel 1890  (Fleurie)

Description: The black volcanic rock of this vineyard is a strong element in its firm, upright texture. Dark and full of tannins, the fruit is still in the background. However there is fresh acidity and hints of the red-cherry flavors that will develop. Wait to drink until 2020.
Name: Domaine de Roche Noire 2017  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: This fourth-generation-run estate has produced a rich, tannic wine. At this stage black fruits and a firm structure demand aging. The wine is likely to balance well over the next year and be ready to drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Mont Chavy 2017  Morgon

Description: Facing southeast, this vineyard is rich in sandstone and granite, giving weight and minerality to this wine. Black fruits show strongly, backed by acidity and tannins. All these elements suggest a wine that will age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Jean Loron 2017 Domaine des Billards  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Structured, spicy and with layers of rich fruits, this is a wine has tannins and concentration. The black fruits are cut with acidity and a dry edge that will soften over the next few months. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Bertrand 2017 Vuril  (Brouilly)

Description: Structured, full of dark tannins and with a strong Py mineral streak, this wine from nine acres of old vines is still young and needs time. It has weight along with fresh red-cherry flavors that contrast with the structure. Let it age and drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Javernière 2017 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: This wine from old vines in a six-acre vineyard has firm tannins as well as ripe fruit. Everything is young and exuberant at this stage, with tannins and spice dominating the fruits. Let this wine age until 2020.
Name: Domaine de la Vigne Romaine 2017  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: A blend of a selection of grapes from across the estate, this wine is open, rich and ready to drink. Generous and juicy, the wine balances tannins, good acidity and great fruitiness.
Name: Domaine Labruyère 2016 Coeur de Terroirs  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Seventy-year-old vines add concentration to this rich wine. Full of berry fruits and ripe tannins, the wine has excellent potential. It is already delicious in its young fruitiness, but let it soften further and drink from late 2019.
Name: Domaine Nicolas Boudeau 2017 La Grume Grain d'Expression  (Brouilly)

Description: This structured wine is still full of young tannins, with a dense, dry core that needs to soften. Around that center, the wine offers black fruits, ripe tannins and plenty of balancing acidity.
Name: Florent Descombe 2017 Cuvée M  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Named after the winemaker's father, Romain, this wine grown in the Saburin vineyard is packed with juiciness and acidity. Smooth tannins integrate into the fruitiness of the wine that has been softened by 12 months in old-wood barrels. Drink now.
Name: Robert Perroud 2016 Romain en Saburin  (Brouilly)

Description: Lightly structured, this wine has ripe fruit that is also fresh and crisp. With the tannins and acidity, the wine has the ability to age, introducing extra richness as it does so. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Agnès Pegaz 2017 Plaisirs de Pégase  (Brouilly)

Description: This richly structured wine has firm tannins as well as great swathes of juicy black fruits. Its richness is balanced by the acidity and the dry core that will allow the wine to age.
Designation: Charlotte et Pierre-Yves Perrachon Vieilles Vignes
Name: Château Bonnet 2016 Charlotte et Pierre-Yves Perrachon Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A rich and ripe wine that is both perfumed and structured, this shows a good balance between fruit and tannins. Aged partly in wood, the wine has a touch of spice along with the black fruits and finishing acidity. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château des Jacques 2016  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: A long maceration of the grapes before fermentation has given this wine a solid structure and intensity. Its richness comes both from the ripe red fruits and the tannins. Acidity promises plenty of freshness as the wine ages.
Name: Domaine de Colette 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Régnié)

Description: While this wine is initially juicy, its structure shows later, coming from behind to give tannins and weight to the black-fruit flavors. It is now fully balanced, rich and fruity.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2015  Fleurie

Description: The volcanic soil of Mont Brouilly has given a mineral edge to this structured wine from a seven-acre vineyard. Juicy berry flavors are still developing alongside the dry edge of tannins. It will become a spicy, fresh wine from 2020.
Name: Domaine du Riaz 2017  Côte de Brouilly

Description: Fresh berry flavors and acidity give this wine a fruity side that contrasts with the tangy, mineral edge and structure. The extra altitude of Chiroubles vineyards shows in the crispness of the wine.
Name: Domaine Méziat-Belouze 2017  Chiroubles

Description: Run by Katy and David Duthel, this estate's 60-year-old vines have produced this ripe but structured wine. It has good density, with a firm backdrop of tannins and acidity to balance the ripe berry fruits. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Ruet 2016  Côte de Brouilly

Description: Sixty-year-old vines provide an impressive legacy, giving this wine richness and a juicy black-fruit character. It has tannins, not overpowering but enough to power the wine to a rich future. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Domaines Chermette 2017 Pierreux  (Brouilly)

Description: From 70-year-old vines planted on a single parcel, this wine has richness and just the right amount of structure to sustain the ripe black fruits. The wine is all fruit, with a full aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2017 Vignes de 1940  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A crisp style of Morgon with tannins and a dense texture, this wine is ripe and powerful. The cherry flavors have considerable acidity and need to soften.
Name: Maison Rémy Passot et Fils 2017  Morgon

Description: Fine tannins support the rich black fruits of this wine. Solid and dense, it's full of dark berries, ripe tannins and good potential. Drink this full, firm wine from 2020.
Name: Château Bonnet 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Chénas)

Description: This wine has structure and rich fruits, full of tannins as well as well as blackberry flavors. Still young and with plenty of time ahead of it, this wine from a 15-acre parcel within the Darroze estate will be ready from 2020.
Name: Clos des Quatre Vents 2017  Fleurie

Description: Young vines are the backbone of this fruity, organically grown wine that offers red cherry and spice from wood aging. The wine is ripe, packed with fruitiness and smoky tannins. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2017 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: Old vines planted on granite on the Darroze estate give this richly structured and dense wine. It has a layers of red-berry fruits, tannins and a youthful mineral texture. All these elements will come together over the next few months, so drink this wine after 2020.
Name: Domaine des Quatre Vents 2017  Fleurie

Description: This smooth wine from a ripe vintage is now mature. With a perfumed character as well as generous black fruits, it is open and rounded, with a crisp edge of acidity at the end. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Clos des Garands 2015 Les Garants Vieilles Vignes  (Fleurie)

Description: Spice along with rich fruit give this wine a juicy, ripe character. Layers of gentle tannins add structure to the black-cherry and plum flavors. It is well balanced, generous and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2017 Les Extrèmes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Partially aged in old wood, this wine with its ripe fruit and smooth tannins is full of rich, perfumed flavors. The dry edge just adds to the attractive ripeness of the wine. Drink now.
Name: Domaine les Capréoles 2017 L'Amourgandise Terroir de Lantignié  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This fortified castle, one of the oldest in the region, is situated just north of the Brouilly vineyards. This wine, rich in fruit and light in tannins, is well balanced, ripe and generous. Layers of black fruits are gently cut by acidity and a structure that is just right. Drink now.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2017  Brouilly

Description: This purple-colored wine is full of fruit, with a lightly tannic texture. It is full, with black-currant and cherry flavors and light acidity. The wine is textured and another few months will allow it to open. Drink now.
Name: Château des Loges 2017 Sélection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Ripe red fruits dominate this broad wine. Rose-petal aromas are followed through with perfumed tannins that back up that fruit. Aged for eight months before bottling, the wine should be ready from late 2019.
Name: Domaine de Bel-Air 2017 Briante  (Brouilly)

Description: This ripe wine has concentration and rich tannins. Juicy fruits and a dense structure add to the power of this solid wine. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Poulard 2016  Morgon

Description: From vines up to 85 years old, this rich wine has generous tannins as well juicy red fruits. It is ready to drink despite its structure, full bodied and fruity at the same time.
Name: Domaines Chermette 2017 Origine Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: This wine has a tight character, with considerable acidity and ripe, perfumed red fruits. Still packed with tannins it has excellent potential. Drink from 2020.
Name: Laurent Gauthier 2017 Grands Cras  (Morgon)

Description: A touch of wood aging has lifted this rich wine and added spice and acidity to the berry flavors. A single-parcel wine, it is full of fruit and final freshness.
Name: Domaine Bertrand 2015 Les Petits Bois  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Richly structured, packed with tannins as well as fruit, this is a complex wine for this appellation. Enticing red fruits entwine with the dry tannins, while being lifted with acidity.
Name: Domaine de Colette 2017 Coteaux de Colette  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Grown on the slopes of the highest of cru appellations, this wine is structured, with tannins balanced by berry fruits. It has the typical cool feel of the appellation so the wine's freshness and acidity need time to fill out. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine des Pontheux 2017  Chiroubles

Description: A ripe, attractively perfumed wine, this is rich in red fruits and texture. Freshness is balanced by the undertow of ripe fruit to give a wine with a juicy aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Joncy 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This wine is initially austere, with more acidity than fruit. Red-berry flavors reveal themselves slowly through the tannins and the touch of spice from wood aging. The wine should be ready to drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine les Capréoles 2017 Chamodère  (Régnié)

Description: A blend of several parcels of vines, this wine is named after the pink granite that forms the subsoil of much of the appellation. Its structure and firm tannins indicate the aging ability of this still-young wine. As it matures, the ripe fruits will develop well. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2017 Terres Roses  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Granite subsoil gives a firm edge and minerality to this wine. Its blackberry fruits are still developing, balancing with the tannins and acidity. It should be ready to drink from late 2019.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Château de la Perrière  (Brouilly)

Description: This wine is lightly structured, with plenty of juicy acidity as well as red-cherry flavors. Coming from a single estate, the wine is full, generous and ripe. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Domaine des Nazins  (Brouilly)

Description: This wine is crisp and fruity, with fresh acidity and a touch of tannins. Still young, it needs time to calm down. It will turn into a bright wine, ready to drink from mid-2019.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2017 Haute Ronze Vieilles Vignes  (Régnié)

Description: This ripe, full wine has tannins and rich berry flavors. Dense texture and concentration partner with acidity and a fresher aftertaste.
Name: Louis Tête 2016  Morgon

Description: Ripe, lightly structured and fruity, this wine is bright with acidity as well as tannins. Black-currant freshness gives a lift to the structure and to the final acidity. Drink now.
Designation: Le Bois de Chat Vieilles Vignes
Name: Château de Belleverne 2017 Le Bois de Chat Vieilles Vignes  (Juliénas)

Description: Soft and ripely fruity, this rich wine has juicy red fruits and plenty of acidity. Red-berry flavors and good acidity give the wine an already delicious, attractive character. Drink the wine from 2019.
Name: Domaine de Colonat 2017 Les Charmes Tradition  (Morgon)

Description: This rich wine is cut with acidity. It is structured although now ready to drink. Ripe, juicy and tannic, it has layers of spice, licorice and a bright aftertaste.
Name: Domaine du Clos des Garands 2015 Tradition  (Fleurie)

Description: This soft and juicy wine comes from southern Beaujolais in the region where buildings have almost gold-colored stones (pierres dorées). It is rich with attractive cherry flavors, light tannin and plenty of acidity. Fresh and fruity, it's ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Pral 2017 Les Pays des Pierres Dorées  (Beaujolais)

Description: This wine is aromatic with ripe cherry fruits and gentle acidity. Packed with fruit, it's attractive and juicy, with a light texture of generous tannins. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Ruet 2016 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)

Description: Still firm with tannins and with an austere edge, this wine is dry and young. Its fruit is still to come, with just a hint of blackberries in the background. Drink from 2020.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Château de la Chaponne  (Morgon)

Description: With grapes from a number of vineyards, this wine has structure while pushing the red-cherry flavors right to the front. It is an attractive juicy wine with a fresh edge of acidity and great fruitiness at the end.
Name: Jean Loron 2017 Au Beau Moulin  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A young wine replete with tannins, this is also fruity while well structured. It shows power as well as concentration, with a generous red-cherry aftertaste.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2017 Collection  (Morgon)

Description: Named after the parcel of vines that produced the grapes, this wine is packed with tannins and crisp red-fruit flavors. Its structure and fruit are already in balance, finishing with a crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
Name: Laurent Gauthier 2017 Chatenay Vieilles Vignes  (Chiroubles)

Description: This tannic wine also has attractive fruit. It is still young, with its rich structure right up front. Behind that is a fresher character, red-cherry flavors and a bright aftertaste.
Name: Château de Chénas 2016  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: A perfumed wine with generous tannins as well as ripe berry flavors, this is bursting with young fruitiness. It needs some time to calm down and relax, so wait until late 2019.
Name: Château de la Chaize 2017 Rien de Trop  (Brouilly)

Description: Typical of the appellation, this wine has intense layers of acidity at this young age. These need to soften allowing the red-cherry flavors and firm edge of tannin to develop. Drink this wine from late 2019.
Name: Château de Pizay 2017  Régnié

Description: This wine is tannic and firm, still obviously young for a wine from this Beaujolais cru. Its structure will soften into the juicy cherry fruits and crisp acidity. Drink this wine from late 2019.
Name: Château de Pougelon 2017  Juliénas
