Description: A well-structured wine, this already shows rich berry fruits that shine richly. The wine has weight, with rounded fruit lifted with acidity. Gentle tannins complete this attractive wine. Drink now.
Name: Colin Bourisset 2017 Henri et Colin Bourisset  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Both fresh and rich, this wine is crisp with acidity and lively with red-cherry flavors. The bright aftertaste lifts the ripe fruit and soft texture. Drink now.
Name: Domaine André Collonge 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Light and fruity, this wine is crisp and fresh with red-cherry flavors. It has bright acidity and an edge of tannins. Its bright, refreshing fruits are very ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Briante 2014  Brouilly

Description: Bottled without sulfites, this juicy wine with hints of overripe cherries is also structured. The clean, rich red-cherry and red-berry flavors are cut with intense acidity. Drink the wine from 2021.
Name: Domaine Guenael Jambon 2017 Côte de Py Nature  (Morgon)

Description: Packed with fruit, this wine is both richly structured and fruity. It has a juicy core of berry flavors filled out with young tannins that need to soften.
Name: Domaine Ruet 2017 La Fontenelle  (Chiroubles)

Description: This wine is firmly structured and still young. Red-cherry flavors partner with the tannins, giving a fruity edge to a solid, dense wine. It needs time to develop its full potential, so drink from 2020.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Old vines at the top of the Moulin-à-Vent slope give this wine its rich, tannic structure. The fruit is fresh and crisp, with a smoky character from old-barrel wood aging. Age this wine for a few months and drink from late 2019.
Name: Yohan Lardy 2017 Les Michelons  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Named appropriately after small lizards that come out in the sun, this wine conveys a warm, sunny feel. It has acidity but the main thrust of the wine is for ripe berry fruits and a touch of tannins.
Name: Château de Javernand 2017 Les Gatilles  (Chiroubles)

Description: Aged in large wooden casks, this wine has a smooth texture as well as juicy red fruits. The structure is balanced by the intense fruits and good acidity. Drink this wine now.
Name: Château de la Chaize 2016 Rien de Trop  (Brouilly)

Description: This wine is bright with red fruits supplemented by light tannins and acidity. Made to be drunk young, it succeeds well, the forward fruitiness backed up judiciously by a drier edge. Drink the wine now.
Name: Château Grand' Grange 2017 La Cascade  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: The vines in question are 70-years-old, giving this wine its ripe concentration. It has plenty of structure as well as a ripe perfume that adds complexity. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Ready to drink, this rich wine is perfumed. Black-cherry and berry flavors blend with the soft texture and acidity. Ripe and fruity, it has a fresh aftertaste.
Name: Domaine Bergeron 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This wine has structure, with tannins as well as concentrated fruits. A backdrop of juicy black-cherry flavors is likely to come to the front of the wine and add texture and acidity.
Name: Domaine Chavy les Charmes 2017  Morgon

Description: Fresh red fruits and soft tannins give this wine an easy, attractive character. There is some backbone to balance the ripe berry flavors and acidity. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Lafayette 2017  Brouilly

Description: This rich, opulent wine is full of black fruits, ripe tannins and good acidity. It has plenty of spice and a toughness that comes from its youth. The wine needs to soften, so drink from mid 2019.
Name: Domaine des Maisons Neuves 2017 Les Bois-Combes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This perfumed wine is full of black fruits, with a firm core of tannins that will allow it to age. Its pure fruit flavors are enhanced by the structure, giving a tense character that will calm down. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Domaine Joncy 2016  Régnié

Description: Fruity and juicy but with layers of firm tannins to give structure, this wine shows promise but also needs some aging. Its rich fruitiness is right up front, packing in acidity to keep everything fresh. Drink from mid-2019.
Name: Domaine Nicolas Boudeau 2017 La Grume Grain de Sable  (Brouilly)

Description: This comes from the home vineyard of Katy and David Duthel. It is a structured wine with firm tannins that will take time to open. Blackberry and red-cherry flavors will come forward as the wine develops. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Ruet 2017 Voujon  (Brouilly)

Description: A single-vineyard wine from a parcel called Les Peloux, this is smooth, velvet-textured and ripe. Fresh acidity and a crisp edge give the wine a lift and will allow it to age a few months. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2017 Vignes de 1951  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Hillside vineyards facing southwest are the source of this structured wine. Ripe tannins parallel the bright red-berry flavors that shine from the wine. It is already ready to drink.
Name: Maison Rémy Passot et Fils 2017  Chiroubles

Description: All about berry fruits, this wine is ripe and juicy. It comes from a nine-acre vineyard of old vines that give concentration as well as bold, juicy black fruits. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Agnès Pegaz 2017 Plaisirs de Pégase  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This perfumed, fruity wine has been bottled with no added sulfur. Its red fruits and acidity are right up front, backed by enough dry tannins to give the wine structure and a chance to age.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2017 Vin Sauvage à Poil  (Régnié)

Description: Soft tannins and ripe, juicy black fruits make this an attractive wine with layers of acidity and light spiciness. It is named after the blue veins in the granite subsoil. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine de Bel-Air 2016 Les Granits Bleus  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Lightly structured and rich, this wine offers touches of spice as well as blackberry fruits. Its tannins will allow it to age, although it is already delicious. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Mont Verrier 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This is an attractive, perfumed wine, fresh with red-cherry flavors and acidity. It is softly textured, light on the tannins although full of young fruitiness. Drink from summer 2019.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Fleurie)

Description: This softly textured, bright wine is all about juicy, perfumed fruit and acidity. For the appellation and the 3.5-acre vineyard of La Madone it less structured than usual, although the fruitiness is attractive. Drink from summer 2019.
Name: La Madone 2017 Clos des Quatre Vents  (Fleurie)

Description: The structure and smokiness of this wine will allow it to age. These balance against the ripe fruit that is cut by acidity, giving freshness and richness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Guenael Jambon 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This rich wine is lightly structured and full of black currant and plum flavors. Juicy, fruity and with an edge of tannins to allow it to age, the wine is worth keeping a few months. Drink from mid-2019.
Name: Florent Descombe 2017 Cuvée B  (Brouilly)

Description: This full, ripe wine has plenty of strawberry flavors as well as acidity. The tannins are surprisingly light for this appellation, while the acidity is still intense. Wait to drink until late 2019.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Saint-Amour)

Description: From vines on the slopes of Mont Brouilly, this wine has some texture while at three years old it is ready to drink. Juicy cherry flavors predominate, tempered by acidity and a touch of tannin. Drink now.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Ripe and structured, this rich wine offers fine tannins and forward berry fruits. The generous fruitiness and acidity balance a dry edge that gives the wine shape. Drink now.
Name: Château des Loges 2016 Sélection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This wine comes from a 12-acre vineyard planted in the heart of the Beaujolais Villages appellation. It has some concentration as well as juicy red fruits, backed up by tannins that need to soften for a few months. Drink from summer 2019.
Name: Château des Vierres 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Bottled without sulfites, this wine was aged in clay amphoras. It is juicy, intense and tight with acidity that underlines the crisp red fruits. The wine needs time, so drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Colonat 2017 Naturabilis Antique  (Morgon)

Description: Plenty of juicy fruit in this structured single-estate wine balances with the tannins. The intense acidneeds time to soften. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Javernière 2017  Morgon

Description: This full, ripe wine has layers of tannins as well as fresh red-cherry flavors. Coming from this appellation, it has a structure that needs to soften before drinking. Wait until late 2019.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Morgon)

Description: This Beaune negociant has produced a ripe, black-fruit-flavored wine that has tannins as well as richness. With its structure along with the acidity and brightness, the wine could age, but is also delicious now.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2018 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Soft and fruity, this wine has attractive red-cherry flavors and a line of crisp acidity. A touch of spice give this round wine its final lift. Drink now.
Name: Château de Pougelon 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A ripe, perfumed wine with black fruits and generous tannins, this is rich and juicy. It has structure as well as layers of delicious fruits that give the wine density while keeping freshness at the end. Drink now.
Name: Château du Châtelard 2017 Cuvée les Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This wine from a six-generation estate is ripe, juicy and fresh. The bright acidity will soften into the generous black fruits as it ages.
Name: Christophe Savoye 2017 Cuvée Ma Confidence  (Régnié)

Description: Juicy fruit and firm tannins give this wine ripeness and structure. The red-berry flavors are still young and ebullient and need to calm down along with the dry core of the wine. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2017 L'Ecluse  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Rich and smoothly textured, this is a generous wine with ripe tannins and juicy black-cherry fruitiness. It has enough structure to give the wine a balanced shape, ready to drink now.
Name: Florent Descombe 2017 Château de Pougelon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: With its light structure and good balance between cherry flavors and acidity, this is an attractive wine. It is all about fresh, crisp fruit, with just the right amount of richness. Drink now.
Name: Louis Jadot 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This upfront, fruity wine has bold blackberry flavors touched with spice and finished with acidity. Berry flavors and fresh acidity come together with a rounded and light texture. It is generous, silky and lightly tannic. Drink now.
Name: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2017 La Rose Pourpre Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: A jammy, banana and red-fruit-flavored wine, this is soft and fresh. It has a crisp edge to the fruitiness and only the lightest of tannins. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine des Maisons Neuves 2017  Chiroubles

Description: Bright juicy red fruits shine out of this attractive wine. It has a fresh feel, with only a light texture and with acidity and juiciness already in balance. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine Nicolas Boudeau 2017 La Grume  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Part of Duboeuf's extensive range of classic Beaujolais single-vineyard wines, this is bright, young and fruity. But it also has some structure to go with the red fruits, banana and perfumed acidity. Drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2018 Nouveau Domaine des 3 Vallons  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This soft, fruity wine is packed with red-cherry flavors and easy acidity. There is a light dusting of tannin, although this wine is really all about fruit.
Name: Louis Dailly Fondateur 2017  Saint-Amour

Description: Five generations have run this family estate that's planted with old vines. This wine is juicy and fruity, with hints of bananas as well as some firm tannins. It will soften to give a fruity wine, so wait until late 2019.
Name: Domaine du Pourpre 2017  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: This simple wine is packed with fruit and acidity. It has a fresh character with juicy red-currant and berry flavors and a light texture. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Duperray 2017 Glou-Glou  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Ripe, juicy fruit shines from this softly textured wine. It has a rich character while keeping plenty of berry flavors and acidity. An attractive, fruity wine, it is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Saint-Cyr 2017 La Galoche  (Beaujolais)

Description: Ripe fruit and soft tannins are dominant in this wine made from old vines. It has concentration, touches of spice and bright red-cherry flavors. Drink now.
Name: Domaines Chermette 2017 Coeur de Vendanges Vignes Centenaires  (Beaujolais)

Description: Produced from the first juice to come from the press after the hand-picked grapes are at the winery, this limited-production wine is full of ripe berry fruits and soft tannins. Its acidity and lively character are all part of a wine that could age for a few months. Drink from summer 2019.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Coeur de Presse  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This wine has intense fruitiness. With ripe tannins and juicy red-berry flavors, it is open and ready to drink.
Name: Château de Belleverne 2017 Les Gays  (Chénas)

Description: This wine from a 20-acre estate is lightly structured and fruity. It is ripe with black-cherry flavors that are still developing, suggesting the wine should age further. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Domaine des Côtes du Berchoux 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This soft wine is full of juicy red-berry flavors. Easy to drink with fresh acidity at the end, the wine is ready now. Longtime producers in Beaujolais, the Tête family makes a range of cru wines.
Name: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2017 La Roche  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This wine, of course, has plenty of fruitiness with red-berry flavors. But it also has a tannic edge that could allow it to age, an unusual thought for a Nouveau Beaujolais. It will go well with food, even with Thanksgiving turkey.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2018 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This 16th-century estate close to Mont Brouilly has produced an open, fruity wine with attractive acidity. Red-berry flavors are right up front, making a wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Château de Pizay 2017 Château de Saint Lager  (Brouilly)

Description: This crisp, fresh wine offers raspberry and red-currant flavors. It has a young, fragrant character shot through with acidity. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Roche-Guillon 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This wine comes from the southern part of Beaujolais in the area known as Pierres Dorées, or golden stones, from the color of the houses. It is a bright wine with attractive black fruits and plenty of acidity. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Duperray 2017 Grains de Gamay  (Beaujolais)

Description: This juicy wine is fresh and very fruity. Lightly textured it offers plenty of acidity and a tangy aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
Name: Domaine Versant au Soleil 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: At the top northwestern edge of Beaujolais, this high-altitude vineyard has produced a rich wine, all fruit and with concentration from 65-year-old vines. The wine finishes with attractive juicy acidity. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: This wine has great fruitiness but also some ripe tannins. It is refreshing and juicy with red-cherry flavors and plenty of crisp acidity. Not a wine for aging, it is ready to drink now.
Name: Albert Bichot 2017 Château de Jarnioux  (Beaujolais)

Description: This bright, fruity wine is produced from fruit grown organically in a walled vineyard. Fresh acidity balances the smoky fruit flavors. Drink now.
Name: Anthony Perol 2016 Les Pierres Dorées  (Beaujolais)

Description: Lightly textured and with plenty of acidity, this wine is gently fruity with an elegant character that brings out both freshness and a mineral edge. Drink now.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2017 Gamay (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: This lightly perfumed, fresh and fruity wine has some fine, gentle tannins as well as black-cherry flavors and acidity. Bright and exuberant at this stage, it could benefit from calming down. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Brouilly)

Description: This wine has both tannins and ripe black fruits, With its richness, structure and acidity, the wine is still developing. Drink from late 2019 when the tannins will have softened.
Name: Mommessin 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is a ripe style of new Beaujolais, with red-berry fruits and a series of tannins that give the wine shape. It's not all serious though, with plenty of bubbly acidity as well as a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Bouchard Aîné et Fils 2018 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: Soft and fruity, this is already a delicious wine. It is packed with red-cherry flavors that are underlined by a touch of tannin and plenty of acidity. Drink the wine now.
Name: Château de Pizay 2017  Beaujolais

Description: Ripe and fruity, this soft wine comes from the southern part of Beaujolais. It has an easygoing character, with black cherries coming together with acidity to produce a wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Colin Bourisset 2017 Louis Bourisset Les Pierres Dorées  (Beaujolais)

Description: This wine tastes mature. Its fruit has changed into secondary flavors with undergrowth and mushrooms coming through the dryness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Fond Moiroux 2013  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: This wine has a firm edge behind the red-cherry and banana flavors. It has a fresh feel, with a light touch and an attractive, perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Ruet 2017 Les Bois  (Régnié)

Description: Ripe and soft, this negociant wine is made for easy drinking when young. Plenty of attractive blackberry fruits are cut with just the right amount of fresh acidity. Drink now.
Name: Florent Descombe 2017 Cuvée B  (Beaujolais)

Description: Soft red cherries and touches of bananas give this gentle wine richness. It has a warm feel to it, open and packed with fruitiness. This should be drunk now.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2017 Cuvée P  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Spicy and with attractive cherry flavors, this is a juicy, open wine. It has some structure as well as bold fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Vignobles Bulliat 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This soft, fruity wine shows a touch of tannins as well as generous black fruits. It has acidity in a light structure along with plenty of brightness. Drink now.
Name: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This fresh wine offers plenty of acidity as well as open red fruits. It shows some richness although the emphasis is on brightness and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Firm and tightly structured, this wine shows tannins as much as fruit. The dry core is very obvious with its dark character while the fruitiness seems to be missing.
Name: Louis Tête 2017  Brouilly

Description: As Beaujolais comes back in favor, the Chasselay family used its sense of humor with this label. This organic wine sums up the attractive red fruits of a simple wine from the region. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2017 Beaujolais Is Not Dead  (Beaujolais)

Description: A light and fruity wine with crisp red-berry flavors and a soft texture, this is immediately attractive. Drink now.
Name: Château de Javernand 2017 Rosé de Gamay (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: This wine is on the lean side, with tannins rather than fruit up front. It has acidity and a tight texture, missing out on weight and fruit.
Name: Domaine Ruet 2017 Douby  (Morgon)

Description: Bottled without sulfites, this wine has a farmyard character, giving off an unpleasant aroma. The red-cherry flavors are more attractive, balanced with acidity. Let the wine breathe for a few minutes for the odd smell to blow away. Drink now.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2017 Vin Nature à Butiner  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: From a single organic parcel, this wine has bright red fruits and a ripe character. Its soft texture and acidity balance well with the delicious fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2017 La Platière  (Beaujolais)

Description: Red cherries and touches of banana are the hallmarks of this fruity wine. Brightly textured and crisp with acidity, it is a light wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Domaines Chermette 2017 Griotttes  (Beaujolais)

Description: Ripe red fruits and a light structure of tannins give this wine shape. It is balanced, full of fruitiness and acidity with a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Grapes from southern Beaujolais, the land of the gold-colored stone buildings, are the main source of this wine. It's a typical, bubbly banana- and red-berry-flavored wine with a good streak of tannin and acidity. Of course, drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2018 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: A simple, fruity wine from southern Beaujolais, this has attractive red fruits and plenty of fresh acidity. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Domaine Pignard  (Beaujolais)

Description: Bright fruit with just a touch of tannin give this wine both structure and freshness. Its acidity and red fruits are spoiled by the touch of bananas. Drink the wine now.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Special Selection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Soft, ripe and rich, this is a juicy wine with simple red-cherry fruits and soft tannins. An easy wine to like, it is ready to drink.
Name: Louis Jadot 2017  Beaujolais

Description: Bright and crisply fruity, this tangy berry- and red-cherry-flavored wine has light tannins and a fine texture of acidity. It's attractively juicy and ready to drink now.
Name: Mommessin 2018 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: This simplest style of Beaujolais is soft and with red-cherry fruits. Acidity and a crisp aftertaste give the wine a bright, lifted character. Drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Beaujolais)

Description: This simple, red-cherry-flavored wine has attractive freshness along with the touch of spice. Drink immediately.
Name: Le Père la Grolle 2017 100% Bouchons 100% Mâchons  (Beaujolais)

Description: This purple-colored wine has soft young fruit, which is unhappily dominated by banana flavors. Touches of tannins lie underneath along with acidity. Drink this wine now.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2017 Collection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Banana aromas don't help this wine. It has soft tannins and banana and red-cherry flavors, giving freshness and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Gry-Sablon 2017 Emeringes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A lean wine dominated by acidity, this is fresh and crisp but lacks fruit weight. It will soften but the fruit will still not be there.
Name: Domaine Romy 2017 Vielles Vignes Les Pierres Dorées  (Beaujolais)

Description: A simple, red-fruit and banana-flavored wine, this has a soft texture and easy acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Clos Saint Roch 2017  Beaujolais

Description: Aromas of red cherry, red plum and a touch of spice fill the bouquet of this Slovenian Gamay. It is soft upon entry in the mouth, with flavors of red plum, red cherry and red raspberry. It has pleasant acidity in the persistent finish.
Name: Gönc 2016 1 Gamay (Štajerska)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Ripe fruit in this simple wine shines strongly. It has a generous character lifted by light acidity and filled out with soft tannins. Drink the wine immediately.
Name: Jean Loron 2017 Jean Gamay (Vin de France)

Description: A rare Gamay to appear outside Beaujolais, this wine is soft, with the lightest of tannins and the friendliest of red fruits. The result is a wine with attractive acidity and a ripe aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château de Chazoux 2017  Mâcon

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is rather tight and tannic for a grape that is more often fruity and forward. Flavors of blueberries and graphite come up, with hints of stem. The tannins retain some earthy astringency.
Name: Lük 2016 Havlin Vineyard Upper Slope Gamay Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Gamay Noir remains fairly rare in Oregon but occupies a useful niche; it's more of a simple country red great for midweek quaffing. High-toned plum and sour cherry fruit flavors are on display, with plenty of backing acidity.
Name: Chehalem 2016 Ridgecrest Vineyards Gamay Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Examples of this variety are an extreme rarity in the state, with this one coming from Skyline Vineyard. Aromas of raspberry jam, spice and campfire lead to plentiful mesquite and red fruit flavors. Smoky notes linger on the finish.
Name: Cedergreen Cellars 2016 Gamay Noir (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A departure into varietal wines for this Fronton estate, this soft, generously fruity wine is crisp with attractive cherry flavors and acidity. It is made to drink young, so enjoy now.
Name: Château Coutinel 2017 Domaine de Coutinel Gamay (Comté Tolosan)

Description: Mâcon is the only part of Burgundy outside Beaujolais that grows Gamay. In the hills of the region, it seems to find the same red cherry and spicy fruit as it has in Beaujolais just to the south. This easy, ripe and juicy wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château de Chazoux 2015  Mâcon

Description: A rich style of Beaujolais, this wine is ripe with red-cherry flavors and structured with generous tannins. It has a warm feel, juicy while full-bodied and packed with fruit. Drink from 2019.
Name: J.J. Vincent 2015  Juliénas

Description: From a selection of old vines on the slopes of the Côte du Py, this wine is dense and rich from a good vintage. The rich tannins and the structure suggest an ageworthy wine that will become smoother as it matures. A juicy backdrop of black cherries and red berries will become less intense as the wine matures. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Maison L'Envoyé 2015 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: For a Beaujolais cru, this is a particularly alcoholic wine. That gives the wine density and power but takes away from the fruit you expect from the Gamay. The wine needs aging and will not be ready before 2020.
Name: Château de Lavernette 2016 Le Chatelet  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Set beneath the 19th-century chapel that dominates the town of Fleurie, the vines for this wine have produced a perfumed and juicy wine. It is lightly structured, with a velvet texture that provides a smooth character over the bright final acidity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Chaintreuil 2016 La Madone  (Fleurie)

Description: Perfumed and smooth, this soft, ripe wine is full of red-cherry flavors. It has a good balance of acidity and bright fruits with a light texture. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Rochette 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This wine is all about ripe fruit. Blackberry flavors and crisp acidity come together in this juicy wine, with its bright fruitiness and soft texture. It is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Beauséjour 2017 Cuvée Vincent Gamay Noir (Touraine)

Description: The ripe 2015 vintage in Beaujolais has produced a wine full of juicy red-cherry flavors that are still bright and crisp. The light structure gives just the right shape of tannins and acidity. Drink this wine now.
Name: Michel Picard 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This totally delicious young wine is fresh and lively, with nose-tickling crushed berry and citrus aromas and tart acidity. In the mouth, it's like an explosion of strawberries. Drink now and over the next three to four years.
Name: Scott Paul 2016 Gamay Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is lean in structure and flavor, starting with a light-garnet color, then followed by aromas like tea and mahogany and flavors like tart cherry. It has a snappy tangy quality due to good acidity and moderate tannins, so it's a good palate cleanser.
Name: The Withers Winery 2016 Gamay Noir (El Dorado)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: There's not a lot of Gamay Noir in Oregon, but this goes right to the head of the class. Deep blue-purple in hue, it's a mouthful of blueberry jam, with fine tannins and a finishing lick of black tea. Additional black olive and smoked almond details add to the complexity.
Name: Anne Amie 2015 Twelve Oaks Estate Gamay Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: In a region known for its Pinots Gris and Noir, this single vineyard Gamay takes your palate in a different direction. Sharp and tangy, it's packed with potent cranberry flavors and earthy tannins. Chill slightly and set it out with a picnic basket of cured meats and hard cheeses.
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2016 Le Coeur de Tour Rain Gamay (Willamette Valley)

Description: Gamay is popular right now—even down under—and Te Mata's version (coming from 23 year old vines) exemplifies every reason why it should be. Precise, bright and bouncy, this wine is fermented partially via carbonic maceration. It's full of crunchy red berry fruit and flowers, with a little meat and savory spice to keep things interesting. The palate is light to medium bodied, with salty, silky tannins, bright acidity, peppery spice and, of course, plenty of juicy red fruit. A “glou-glou” style if there ever was one, and wallet-friendly, too.
Name: Te Mata 2016 Gamay Noir (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Ripe and fruity, this wine tastes as though it comes from warm vineyards in the south of France. Certainly its richness is palpable and generous. The wine is soft, full of black fruits and ready to drink.
Name: Jean Loron 2016 Jean Gamay (Vin de France)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: One of the finer Oregon Gamays, this deeply-colored wine is spicy and rich, from first sniff through the last sip. Intense aromas of clove and cranberry come up first and continue into the core flavors, along with fruit leather and orange peel.
Name: Duck Pond 2016 Gamay Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lovely spicy fruit stands out here and sets this apart from many of the winery's offerings. Concentrated ripe cranberry and plum flavors come with some bite to them, in a good way. The supporting acids have a citrus character, and the clean fruit continues on through a satisfying finish.
Name: Methven Family Vineyards 2015 Gamay Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is stylish and youthfully fresh and tasty. Fermented in cement and aged for 10 months in neutral oak, it's got ripe spicy berry and plum flavors, just a touch high toned. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Omero 2016 Gamay Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: Reveling in the tannins of a young Côte du Py, this wine is rich, structured and dense. The tannins give the dry edge this wine needs to age. Intense with ripe black fruits, this is a powerful wine. Drink from 2019.
Name: Jean-Marc Burgaud 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: This young wine has great potential. It shows weight and a powerful tannic structure as well as bold, ripe black fruits. Coming from the top sector of Morgon, the wine has concentration and richness. It needs to age, and won't be ready before 2019.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: This wine is hugely structured and dense, displaying the real heart of Moulin-à-Vent in its richness. Black plum and spice from wood aging give this wine a ripe character and aging potential. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Anita 2016 Coeur de Vigneronne  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Made from organically grown grapes, this wine comes from vines that are between 40 and 80 years old. It has structure, tannins and concentration as well as richness, powerful blackberry flavors and a balance with acidity. The wine will age, so drink from 2019.
Name: Richard Rottiers 2016  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: This small-production wine, produced from parcels of old vines, is impressive for its richness and density. With flavors from wood aging adding spice as well as giving extra structural dimension, the wine is set for good aging. Do not drink before 2019.
Name: Château Thivin 2016 Cuvée Zaccharie  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: From one of the top districts of Morgon, this wine is well structured and offers rich fruits. A good mix of spice and black fruit is supported by tannins. It is a rich, juicy wine with an impressive future. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine des Marrans 2016 Corcelette  (Morgon)

Description: Named after the oak trees close to the vineyard and aged an extra year, this cuvée is always impressive. It has dark, dense tannins as well as powerful black-cherry fruits and a beautifully perfumed aftertaste. Rich and structured, the wine will age well. Drink from 2019.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2015 Les Chênes  (Fleurie)

Description: This is a seriously structured single-vineyard wine. Rich tannins and black-cherry fruit are broadened by wood aging and concentrated toast and spice flavors. The wine is still young and needs to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2016 Les Garances  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: The chapel of La Madone is the landmark of Fleurie, set at the top of a hill above vineyards. This wine from a five-acre parcel of 70-year-old vines is concentrated and full of ripe black-cherry fruits. Its weight and intensity will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Gaget 2016 La Madone  (Fleurie)

Description: This famed slope in Morgon has produced yet another powerful, structured wine. This one, with dark black fruit, rich tannins and plush texture, is dense and delivers great ripe fruitiness. With its tannins and acidity it will age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Sourced from a parcel of 80-year-old vines, this wine is rich and dense, with a strong mineral texture and ripe black plum and cherry flavors. Drink this powerful, concentrated and structured wine from 2019.
Name: Domaine Anita 2016 Très Vieille Vigne Les Caves  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: One of three bottlings from this producer that showcases different aspects of Morgon, this wine is full, seriously structured and has the potential of great fruitiness. That will take time; for now the wine is a series of rich tannins that are very mineral in texture. Drink from 2019.
Name: Jean-Marc Burgaud 2016 Grands Cras  (Morgon)

Description: Sébastien Gutty is proud owner of this three-acre parcel of 90-year-old vines. They have given a wine that reflects both richness and concentration. It is densely packed with dark tannins, black fruits and a shot of acidity. This is a wine to drink from 2019.
Name: Château Gaillard 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: This is a big, rich wine, full of tannins as well as intense fruit. Concentration and dense texture are just part of the fruitiness and structure that give this wine its potential. Still developing, the wine is likely to show at its best from 2019.
Name: Domaine des Chers 2016 Vieiles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Sébastien Gutty is proud owner of this three-acre parcel of 90-year-old vines. They have given a wine that reflects both richness and concentration. It is densely packed with dark tannins, black fruits and a shot of acidity. This is a wine to drink from 2019.
Name: Château Gaillard 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: This is a big, rich wine, full of tannins as well as intense fruit. Concentration and dense texture are just part of the fruitiness and structure that give this wine its potential. Still developing, the wine is likely to show at its best from 2019.
Name: Domaine des Chers 2016 Vieiles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Fermented with natural yeasts and with little added sulphur, this wine concentrates on its fruit character. Fine tannins, rich black fruits and a dense texture all contribute to its distinctiveness. With its structure and acidity it does need to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2016  Morgon

Description: This large, 61-acre, vineyard forms part of the Piron properties. The wine has great concentration and a dense ripe texture that comes from low-yielding, 50-year-old vines. Let this wine fill out even more. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2016 La Chanaise  (Morgon)

Description: Even in old-vine Beaujolais terms, vines planted in 1935 are rare. These come from a small parcel within the Grand Cras sector of Morgon and produce a richly concentrated wine. With firm tannins, ripe black fruits and balanced acidity, this dense wine needs to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2016 1935 Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: This wine that comes from three different parcels has an open style, ripe with berries and rich flavors. The style is rich and concentrated, with a solid core of tannins. This wine could well age, and it will be best from 2019.
Name: Château du Moulin-à-Vent 2016 Couvent des Thorins  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: All the pent-up power inherent in a Morgon awaits in this wine. With dense tannins and concentration from the 85-year-old vines, this still-structured wine is packed with ripe black fruits. The juicy acidity gives a crisp edge, although the wine will need to age until 2019.
Name: Domaine Anita 2016 Château-Gaillard  (Morgon)

Description: Les Capitans is one of the top sectors of Saint-Amour, producing wines that are perfumed and have great fruit. This wine also has some firm tannins that add to the richness. It is likely to age well and, with its juicy acidity, will be best from late 2018.
Name: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2016 Les Capitans  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Produced from vines that are more than 50 years old, this wine is concentrated and dense. It also has the great style and elegance that is the hallmark of Fleurie. Black fruits are cut with good acidity, giving a juicy character to balance the ripe tannins. This beautiful wine will be ready to drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2016  Fleurie

Description: A seriously structured wine from this fine vintage will surely have good aging potential. This wine is ripe, dense with tannins and rich with blackberry fruits. It makes a powerful statement about the longevity of Morgon wines. Drink from 2019.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2015 Le Griottier  (Morgon)

Description: Derived from the location of the vineyard in Saburin, this wine's name also reminds us that the Romans were here. The wine is well structured and rich. With 12 months in wood, it conveys spice as well as generous fruit, warm tannins and final acidity. Drink this wine now.
Name: Robert Perroud 2015 Romain En Saburin  (Brouilly)

Description: Big and bold, this is a rich wine, packed with both fruit and a dense mineral texture. The wine is ripe, full of blackberry flavors and good acidity that will allow it to develop. This has structure, tannins and will age well. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Guenaël Jambon 2016 Côte du Py Réserve  (Morgon)

Description: Rich and structured, this wine offers tense tannins balanced by an underlay of ripe black fruits and acidity, although these will take time to come through. Full of ripe tannins, it needs time. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2016 Corcelette  (Morgon)

Description: Closely planted 70-year-old vines are behind this richly concentrated wine. Dense tannins and a good structure are allied to the ripe blackberry fruits and acidity. Dark and firm, the wine still needs time. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Chatelard 2016 Cuvée Terre de Lumière  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: From the Grand Cras vineyard, this wine is powered by firm tannins and a strongly mineral texture. Its rich red fruits are right there, developing well. Age this powerful wine and drink from 2019.
Name: Collin-Bourisset 2016 Les Grands Cras  (Morgon)

Description: Produced from organically grown grapes and with 12 months in wood, this wine is open and rich. A Burgundian character gives it a dense texture and obvious aging potential. With firm tannins as well as great red fruits, the wine will age and should be ready to drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine des Capréoles 2016 Diaclase  (Régnié)

Description: This structured wine has oak aging and old vines to thank for its density and ripe concentration. Its power and dark character will let it ripen well. Full of fruit and acidity, it has aging potential. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: This is a rich, full wine, given structure both by wood aging and fruit tannins. Weight, density and good acidity are coming together in an harmonious whole. From 60-year-old vines, it will be ready from late 2018.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2016 Piron et Lameloise Quartz  (Chénas)

Description: With vineyards in the family since 1877, this producer offers a good range of wines, of which this is an excellent example. It is fruity, firm and seriously structured with juicy black fruit and acidity allied to a solid tannic base. Drink this ageworthy wine from 2019.
Name: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2016 Roche Bleue  (Juliénas)

Description: This structured wine offers complex layers of tannins. Black fruits are very present, still young and developing, making for a wine that is dense, rich and needs time. Drink from 2019.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2016 Les Roches  (Fleurie)

Description: This structured wine comes from a single parcel in Moulin-à-Vent. Packed with both tannins and black-plum fruits, it is ripe, fruity and crisp. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2016 Les Thorins  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A powerful core of wood aging makes this a dry, solid wine that has excellent aging potential. Black cherries and spice contrast with the rich structure. From one of the top sectors of Morgon, the wine will be best drunk from 2019.
Name: Mommessin 2016 Les Grandes Mises Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: The combination of the famed Côte du Py vineyard and old vines is impressive and rich. This is still a structured, dense wine, very firm and with black, ripe and juicy fruit developing alongside the tannins. The wine will be ready to drink in 2019.
Name: Laurent Gauthier 2015 Vieilles Vignes Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: The Roman emperor Probus is supposed to have brought the Gamay grape to the region, hence the name of this wine. With its rich tannins and generous black fruits, this dense wine is concentrated both with tannins and fruit. It will develop impressively in the months to come. Drink from 2019.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2015 Probus  (Juliénas)

Description: Rich fruit masks the gentle tannins in this opulent wine. Ripe blackberry and juicy black-plum flavors are warm, generous and lightly structured. This full-bodied wine will be ready from mid-2018.
Name: Richard Rottiers 2016  Brouilly

Description: Grown at an estate owned by this Beaune-based producer, this wine is dense and full of black fruits and firm tannins. It is toasty, spicy and ripe, beautifully structured and balanced, and ready to age further. Drink from 2019.
Name: Albert Bichot 2016 Domaine de Rochegrés  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: The 45-year-old vines that go into this wine give it just the right amount of concentration without losing sight of the generous fruit. This wine has structure, with firm, dry tannins as well as rich black-cherry and black-plum-skin flavors that are integrating well. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2016  Fleurie

Description: Partly aged in wood, this wine is richly structured, spicy and packed with dense fruits. Blackberry and black-cherry flavors are sustained by generous tannins and the dry core. The wine will need to age, so drink from 2019.
Designation: Château de Bellevue Climat Les Charmes
Name: Jean Loron 2016 Château de Bellevue Climat Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: One in a series of small-batch production wines from this major producer, this comes from the top vineyard of Côte du Py. The bold tannins and strong mineral texture are typical of this vineyard. Combined with black plum and berry fruits, the wine becomes rich, dense and worthy of aging. Drink from 2019.
Designation: Les Grandes Mises Côte du Py
Name: Mommessin 2016 Les Grandes Mises Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Round and rich, this is a generous wine. Its tannins are happily embedded in the ripe black fruits that burst from the glass. This is a solid wine, packed with rich and concentrated fruit. Drink now.
Name: Château de Juliénas 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Juliénas)

Description: This wine comes from a three-acre parcel of 50-year-old vines. It is beautifully structured with dense tannins as well as deliciously juicy black fruits. The acidity and the firm dry core both point to good aging ability. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine Anita 2016 Cuvée P'tit Co Les Brureaux  (Chénas)

Description: From the Charme vineyard this wine is firm, dense and packed with tannins. Behind this structure await juicy berry fruits, generous acidity and a solid texture. This is a powerful wine to age, so drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine de Colette 2016 Charme  (Morgon)

Description: From one of the more structured of the cru villages, this wine is full of tannins as well as black-cherry fruit. It is dense from the concentration of old vines as well as the rich fruitiness and acidity of the vintage. This ripe wine will be ready to drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine des Chers 2016 Vieiles Vignes  (Juliénas)

Description: This wine is produced from vines grown beside the moulin of Moulin-à-Vent (windmill). It has plenty of structured tannins as well as dense black fruits, making it both rich and ageworthy. It's impressive with its dark plum fruit and dry core. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine du Penlois 2016 Sous l'Aile du Moulin  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: From the granite and schist soil of the most famous of the named sectors of Morgon, this wine has power and density. It also has a perfumed character both from the light wood aging and from the juicy red fruits. Tannins sustain the fruit and promise aging. Drink the wine from 2019.
Name: Domaine Gaget 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: A two-acre parcel of 84-year-old vines forms a great starting point for this intense wine. With considerable acidity as well as dark tannins, the black-currant fruit is still firmly embedded in the wine's dark core. So wait, and drink it from 2019.
Name: Jean-Marc Burgaud 2016 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pence is one of the few producers growing and making Gamay in California, and they're setting quite a standard. Aromas of red cherry, cola, hibiscus, pomegranate, fennel and cracked pepper lead into a lightly bodied palate full of airy berry fruit, juniper and licorice spice. Quite refreshing and just complex enough.
Name: Pence 2016 PTG Gamay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: In 1966 when this wine was first made, the best of the large barrels was No 5, and the name has stuck. It is a rich wine, full of firm tannins with the potential of fine fruit to follow. With its dark structure and acidity it needs to age a few months more. Drink this rich wine from late 2018.
Name: Robert Perroud 2016 Foudre No 5  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Beaujolais holds many old vineyards, but this one sets a record at 114 years. This wine is firm and concentrated, with wood aging giving a minty character as well as a dry core, . Low-yielding vines bring richness and a solid texture that will repay another few months aging. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Yohan Lardy 2015 Vieilles Vignes de 1903  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Firm tannins mark this wine out for a good future. Its structure and generous fruits are slowly developing, promising richness as it matures. A dense wine packed with both fruit and tannins, it will be ready from 2019.
Name: Laurent Gauthier 2016 Grand Cras Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: This wine comes from the grand estate of Pierreux with its handsome château. Rich and fruity, it has a spicy, vanilla character from aging in wooden vats. With its ripe black-plum and damson flavors, the wine is smooth and generous, ready to drink now.
Name: Mommessin 2016 Château de Pierreux  (Brouilly)

Description: Planted on the granite soil typical of the region, the vines behind this wine give a textured, mineral character to the black fruits. That makes this a rich wine, although one that needs to be aged. Drink this concentrated wine from late 2018.
Name: Château de Chatelard 2016 Cuvée les Vieux Granits  (Fleurie)

Description: Deep tannins mark out this structured wine. A dense texture dominates the young black fruit. This will change, because the fruit is as powerful as the tannins. The wine will age well; drink from 2019.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2016 Cuvée de la Lure  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Harvested at night to keep freshness, this wine comes from 35-year-old vines. It has a fruity character, bright with red-cherry acidity and a rounded, smooth texture. The edge of tannins and intense acidity make it a food wine. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine Anita 2016 Reine de Nuit  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Schist rocks in the Les Charmes vineyard give this wine its rich mineral character. Along with that are tannins both from the fruit and the wood aging, making this a rich wine that needs to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine de Bel-Air 2016 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: Owner Jacky Gauthier has produced a rich wine from low-yielding vines. The tannins and dark, firm texture are both rich and well placed to support the black-plum and berry fruits. This ripe wine will be ready to drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine de Colette 2016 Le Mont  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Old vines and 10 months in wood have given this wine both concentration and great elegance. Ripe berry fruits have been smoothed by hints of toast, balanced acidity and ripe tannins. Drink this wine from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine de la Voûte des Crozes 2016  Côte de Brouilly
Winery: Domaine de la Voûte des Crozes

Description: Ripe black fruits and generous tannins give this wine richness and dense texture. It is aged for seven months in wood, adding a caramel and toast character to the generous fruit. The wine is packed with fruit and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine des Capréoles 2016 Sous la Croix  (Régnié)

Description: Aged in large wooden barrels, this wine is dense, with a firm texture and juicy, crisp black-currant fruit. Bright acidity gives a lively aftertaste, although the structure remains firm and the wine needs to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2016  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: The Tête family is well known in Beaujolais. Here they have produced a richly textured wine with just the right amount of tannin and acidity to highlight the generous red fruits. Drink this wine from late 2018.
Name: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2016 Tradition  (Juliénas)

Description: Négociant Florent Descombe has produced a range of cru Beaujolais, including this one. Sourced from vines on the slope of Moulin-à-Vent, it is firm and packed with tannins. There is no compromise in the rich structure that permeates the ripe black fruit. Drink from 2019.
Name: Florent Descombe 2016 Cuvée M  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: From the northernmost Beaujolais cru, this wine is bold, ripe and fruity. Its tannins and acidity promise good aging and the chance to enhance the fragrant red-cherry fruitiness. This wine will be ready from late 2018.
Name: Domaine des Chers 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Amour)

Description: The 55-year-old vines behind this wine have produced a rich wine. Still-dense tannins mark it out as youthful and needing to age further. It will do this well, broadening out the red-berry fruits and increasing the density of the wine. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine Matray 2016 Aux Thèpes  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Richly fruity, this wine is dense, structured and impressive. Ripe black fruits and strong tannins will allow it to age. The property was purchased by Dominique Piron from leading restaurateurs, the Lameloise family. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2016 Cuvée Piron-Lameloise  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This estate is named for the Romans who originally planted vines here. With touches of wood aging giving spice and toast along with rich, juicy black-plum fruits, this is a wine to age. It will be best from 2019.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine de la Vigne Romaine  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This wine has a smoky character that lies over the juicy fruit, adding extra interest and texture to this already structured wine. With solid tannins and rich red-plum and cherry fruit, this wine is still developing. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine des Rosiers  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This rich, structured wine is full of both ripe tannins and generous fruit. It is dense, as befits a Morgon, while also having a layer of juicy red-berry fruits. The structure and acidity promise aging. Drink from 2019.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 Domaine des Versauds  (Morgon)

Description: This rich wine is full bodied, structured and, for a bottling from this appellation, packed with tannins. At the same time, the fruit shines through the wine's dry core, giving black plum and cherry flavors as well as acidity. The wine will develop further, so drink from late 2018.
Name: Les Frères Perroud 2015 Améthyste  (Brouilly)

Description: Named after the cherry trees (cerisiers) that surround the vineyard, this wine is richly flavored, yes, with cherries as well as crisper red currants. It is spicy, with a touch of pepper as well as some firm tannins. Drink this fruity, young wine from late 2018.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2016 Les Cerisiers  (Juliénas)

Description: Grown on volcanic soil on the slopes of Mont Brouilly, this wine has a strong mineral character as well as rich black fruits. It is a concentrated wine with a dry core and balanced acidity. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Robert Perroud 2015 La Fournaise du Pérou  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: From a selection of the estate's best fruit, this wine is richly structured, firmly textured and likely to age well in the medium term. The black fruits are still young, giving a brightness to the wine that perhaps should be allowed to calm down. Drink this ripe wine from late 2018.
Name: Robert Perroud 2016 Pollen  (Brouilly)

Description: This estate is the most famous and influential in Côte de Brouilly. This wine, from 50-year-old vines, is rich and structured while also having delicious ripe berry and black-cherry fruits. It is likely to age well over the next few months, being ready to drink from mid-2018.
Name: Château Thivin 2016  Côte de Brouilly

Description: This wine displays the typical mineral texture associated with this vineyard of granite and schist soils. The texture is given further strength by tannins that suggest the wine needs to age. There is plenty of black fruit as well, so this wine will be best from 2019.
Name: Collin-Bourisset 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: This is the fourth harvest from owners Virginie and Grégory Barbet and they've made a fine job of it. The wine, with its rich black fruits and concentrated tannins has the structure typical of this appellation. The juicy fruits go along with tannins to give a wine that should age. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine de la Pirolette 2016  Saint-Amour

Description: This wine from a 2.4-acre vineyard is firm and structured as befits a bottling from this appellation. Rich smoky tannins and fruitiness are balanced and lifted by the juicy red-fruit acidity. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine de Roche Guillon 2016  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: This dense, well-structured wine has bold tannins as well as rich cherry and blackberry fruits. The structure and the fruit are still young and up front, needing to calm down before the wine will be ready to drink. Wait until late 2018.
Name: Domaine des Maisons Neuves 2016 Les Bois-Combes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is a ripe and juicy wine. Tannins support the generous layers of red-berry and cherry fruits and acidity. The wine has a succulent quality, spicy and fruity at the end. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine des Marrans 2016  Fleurie

Description: A blend from several small parcels, this wine has richness and structure. It is dense, packed with firm tannins as well as juicy black-cherry flavors. This firm wine will age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2016 Terre Roses  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is a ripe and smooth wine. With firm tannins cushioned by rich black fruits, it is spicy, smoky and will age. The wine, from the personal property of the Barbet family that also runs négociant Jean Loron, will be ready to drink from mid-2018.
Designation: Xavier et Nicolas Barbet Vieilles Vignes
Name: Jean Loron 2016 Xavier et Nicolas Barbet Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Firm and with great poise, this ripe wine has benefitted from the ripe vintage. It is succulent, balanced between poised tannins and the black-cherry fruits. This rich wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château de Juliénas 2015 Cuvée Tradition  (Juliénas)

Description: This estate has been vastly improved since it was bought by the Richard family whose coffees are familiar in many French cafés. Richly aromatic and juicy, this wine is full, packed with fruit and acidity, and already delicious to drink.
Name: Château des Tours 2016  Brouilly

Description: Aged for a short period in large wooden barrels, this wine comes from organically grown grapes and has a smooth texture. It emphasizes the pure, clean fruit and brings out the tannins for aging potential. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2016 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: This is a ripe, densely structured wine with the typical perfumed character of the appellation. Ripe berry fruits and layers of acidity lift the wine and give it a crisp texture. Produced from 75-year-old vines, it will be ready to drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine Matray 2016 Cuvée Les Paquelets  (Juliénas)

Description: One of a range of wines produced by négociant Florent Descombe, this properly structured wine is rich in black fruits as well as tannins. Coming from the impressive Côte du Py slope, it has power and concentration as well as layers of fruit. Age this wine longer and drink from late 2018.
Name: Florent Descombe 2016 Cuvée M Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Named after the grower who owned the estate for many years (his daughter now runs it), this wine is dense, structured and complex. It has a strong mineral element as well as generous tannins and ripe berry fruits. This complex wine will age well. Drink from 2019.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Jean-Ernest Descombes Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: This wine, with its floral aroma, is rounded, potentially rich and has layers of firm tannins. It comes from a blend of two of the sectors of Juliénas, a combination that brings out great fruit and a fine, dusty structure. Drink this wine with its good potential from late 2018.
Name: Jean Loron 2016 Domaine de la Vieille Eglise  (Juliénas)

Description: Named after the rocky soil of the vineyard, this wine is suitably firm and structured. A mineral texture gives an edgy character and enhances the firm tannins. The wine, rich in fruit potential, will age well. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Chatelard 2016 Cuvée les Roches  (Morgon)

Description: This bold, ripe wine is packed with rich fruit and tannins. It is produced by direct descendants of the Loron family of négociants who still run the estate. With its dense texture and rich concentration, it will be ready to drink from late 2018.
Name: Château de Fleurie 2016  Fleurie

Description: This brother-and-sister team have produced a structured wine as part of their négociant business (they also have a family domaine). Packed with red-cherry fruits and acidity, this wine is young but promises a good future. The crisp texture and the tannins will keep the wine developing until 2019.
Name: Claire & Fabien Chasselay 2016  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: This wine is big, rich and bold. Its black fruits and tight acidity indicate the aging potential of this wine. Add in the firm tannins and mineral texture, and it will take time to mature. Drink this dense wine from 2019
Name: Domaine Guenaël Jambon 2016 Côte du Py Cuvée Nature  (Morgon)

Description: This wine is big, rich and bold. Its black fruits and tight acidity indicate the aging potential of this wine. Add in the firm tannins and mineral texture, and it will take time to mature. Drink this dense wine from 2019
Name: Domaine Guenaël Jambon 2016 Côte du Py Cuvée Nature  (Morgon)

Description: Producer Marc Delienne, fresh from Paris, has made an impression with his three cuvées of Fleurie. Aged in wood, this rich, concentrated wine has density and great power. Tannins and dark fruits promise aging potential. Drink this wine from late 2018.
Name: Domaine Marc Delienne 2016 Abbaye Road  (Fleurie)

Description: With its Burgundy-colored tile roof and porticoed facade, this is a showpiece estate in Juliénas. The wine it produces is dense, with solid, complex tannins. Ripe red fruits plus acidity and a core of dryness will allow it to age. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Château des Capitans Estate Bottled  (Juliénas)

Description: This ripe, soft wine is rich with red-cherry fruit and a generous texture from old vines. Spice, fruitiness and a hint of tannins contribute to a wine that is delicious and rounded, ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: A perfumed wine, this is rich in tannins and generous, ripe black fruits. Aged nine months in wood, it has a hint of caramel as well as spice that adds extra dimension. It is juicy, ripe and needs to age further. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine de Bel-Air 2016 Les Burdelines  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Densely tannic, this rich wine is dark and structured. The black fruits have great weight and a generous nature. The acidity, typical of the vintage, indicates the wine needs to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine de la Bouronière 2016  Fleurie

Description: The granite soil of Morgon is very much in evidence in this firm, mineral-textured wine. With dark tannins and the potential of rich fruit, the wine is structured and needs time to mature further. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2016  Morgon
Winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

Description: This ripe, succulent wine, from the producer's home vineyard, is softly textured and richly fruity. Dense texture gives it a full-bodied feel as well a dry edge. This wine needs to age further. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine de Roche Guillon 2016  Fleurie

Description: Lancié is one of the villages of Beaujolais-Villages, next door to Morgon and sometimes seeing itself as a Beaujolais cru in waiting. This wine certainly has structure and aging potential along with plenty of red fruits and acidity. These elements suggest that the wine will be ready to drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine du Penlois 2016 Lancié  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Aged in large wooden 158- and 800-gallon barrels, this wine is rich with spice and toast flavors over the soft tannins. It has great black-fruit flavors, acidity to balance and a ripe aftertaste. The wine is smooth and can be enjoyed now but will be better from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine Marc Delienne 2016 Greta Carbo  (Fleurie)

Description: Named after the general who was so involved in American independence, this ripe and generous wine is warm with red-berry fruits and attractive acidity. It is smooth, with hints of vanilla and tangy black fruits at the end. Drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine de Lafayette  (Brouilly)

Description: This is a firm, structured wine produced at one of the many estates of Duboeuf. Rich black-cherry fruit contrasts with the dry core of the wine. Ripe and juicy, it will be ready to drink from mid-2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine des Quartre Vents  (Fleurie)

Description: An 18th-century family-owned property is the source of this crisp, textured, ripe wine. With plenty of tannins to give it structure and perfumed black fruits to convey the juicy character, it is in good shape to age a little longer. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Jean Loron 2016 La Victorine  (Saint-Amour)

Description: This is a ripe and juicy young wine. With soft tannins and bright red fruits, it is crisp while also structured. It will age further to give a generous, full-throated wine. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Manoir du Carra 2016 Les Bottières  (Juliénas)

Description: This wine is called the heart of Gamay. The name could be a play on the appellation of Saint-Amour or a description of the intense Gamay fruits in this rich wine. Either way, it is dense, full of cherry flavors and with a firm structure that will help it age further. Drink from 2019.
Name: Patrick Tranchand 2016 Coeur de Gamay  (Saint-Amour)

Description: From the sector known as Les Capitans on the edge of the village, this wine is produced from vines up to 120 years old. Like other wines from this producer, it offers a mint and herbal character as well as ripe fruit. The wood aging and acidity contribute the richness of the aftertaste. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Trenel Fils 2016 Les Capitans  (Juliénas)

Description: The name of this cuvée refers to the natural yeast used in fermentation. Bottled without added sulfur, the wine is soft with a direct line of juicy acidity. It is a complex, structured wine with some firm tannins. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Château de Javernand 2016 Indigène  (Chiroubles)

Description: This bright purple wine, still very young, is sold to raise funds for a local hospital. It is rich and packed with firm tannins as well as succulent black fruit. This powerful wine needs to age further, so drink from 2019.
Designation: Moulin-à-Vent des Hospices Civils de Romanèche-Thorins
Name: Collin-Bourisset 2015 Moulin-à-Vent des Hospices Civils de Romanèche-Thorins  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Oak aging has given this otherwise intensely fruity wine extra richness. It adds spice to the red-berry fruits and bright acidity. Concentration from the 65-year-old vines intensifies tannin and enhances the fruitiness of this wine. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine de Colonat 2016 Les Charmes Tradition  (Morgon)

Description: This is a delicious wine, full of structured fruit. Acidity and bright cherry flavors are given shape and density by the concentration of old vines and the dry core of tannin. Drink this balanced wine now.
Name: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2016  Côte de Brouilly

Description: Rich and benefitting from the ripe fruit of the vintage, this is a generous wine. Bold red and black cherry fruits are broad and open with soft tannins and good acidity. The wine is smooth and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2015 Grand-Pré  (Fleurie)

Description: This wine is ripe, soft and generous. With red fruits and only light tannins it is cushioned and rounded. Happily the acidity and the crisp texture counter the richness. Drink this friendly wine now.
Name: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2016 Pisse Vieille  (Brouilly)

Description: This wine is rich and ripe with red fruits. Its structure and dry tannins suggest a wine that will age. Red berries, acidity and a dry core point to a well-structured wine to drink from mid-2018.
Name: Florent Descombe 2016 Cuvée C  (Chiroubles)

Description: Firm and with a dry core, this wine has great concentration and rich tannins. Ripe fruit lies under this solid exterior, waiting to come through in the coming months. The wine will show great richness as it matures. Drink from 2019.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine de Roche Noire  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: The vineyards on the steep hill leading down from the chapel of La Madone have given a structured wine. Weight and richness underly firm tannins. Concentrated and potentially full of fruit, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 La Madone  (Fleurie)

Description: A selection of grapes from different parcels lies behind this wine. With its dense texture contrasted with crisp acidity, it is fruity and has a dry core. Aged on its lees, the wine has a chewy character that will need to soften. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Mommessin 2016 Les Grandes Mises  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Made from 65-year-old vines in a five-acre parcel, this wine is rich with black fruits and crisp acidity. With its structure and dense texture, this wine needs to age for a few months. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Château Gaillard 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Bernard and Thomas Collonge have produced a rich and smooth wine from this three-acre vineyard. It shows the round texture typical of the appellation although with the addition of some fine tannins. The ripe berry fruits are well balanced with the structure. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Colonat 2016 Clos Reisser  (Brouilly)

Description: Named after the location of the domaine's winery, this wine is richly structured and full of spice as well as fruit flavors. Dense and concentrated with black-cherry fruit, it has a firm, dry core that will soften. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Domaine de Grand Garant 2016 Le Vivier  (Fleurie)

Description: This structured wine is firm and has an intense mineral texture. Rich black-cherry fruits are balanced with intense youthful acidity that needs to soften. This fruity, structured wine is one to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Guenaël Jambon 2016 Les Charmes Cuvée Nature  (Morgon)

Description: Chénas, the small appellation next to Moulin-à-Vent, shares something of the same structure. Coming from steep hillside slopes, this wine has a mineral character as well as solid tannins. Its black fruits are still developing, so drink this wine from mid-2018.
Name: Henry Fessy 2016  Chénas

Description: This wine has a firm structure as well as ripe red-berry fruits. The tannins are contained within a floral, rich wine that is still developing. Drink this potentially delicious wine from late 2018.
Name: Jean Loron 2016 Château de Bellevue  (Fleurie)

Description: This wine is released after 22 months in oak that gave it a delightful perfume and flavors of mint as well as black cherries. A firm tannic structure backed by the ripe fruit will likely allow the wine to age well. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Château de Lavernette 2015 Le Clos Cuvée Jadis  (Beaujolais-Leynes)

Description: This rich wine, the product of the ripe 2015 vintage, is generous, full and packed with still-developing tannins. Its structure and good acidity are still in place, indicating the wine needs to age further. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Château des Gimarets 2015 Tradition  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: These growers, based in Villié-Morgon, have produced a structured wine from arguably the top area of Morgon. It is full of tannins as well as berry fruits. It is not especially dense and the cherry flavors give the wine an attractive crisp texture and aftertaste. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Vines close to the family winery are the source of this rich, structured wine. It has power and great definition with its spice, firm tannins and solid texture. The wine needs to age further, so drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2016  Morgon

Description: Producer Cédric Lecareux makes rich wines, typically with some wood aging that enhances the ripe fruits. This wine, produced from organic grapes, is in this mold, juicy with black fruits that are lightly cut by acidity. It should be ready to drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine des Capréoles 2016 Chamodère  (Régnié)

Description: One of a series of Beaujolais cru wines from this négociant, this bottling comes from the northernmost village. It is firm and structured, layering rich tannins and plenty of spicy blackberry fruits. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Florent Descombe 2016 Cuvée A  (Saint-Amour)

Description: One of two wines named after a legendary vine grower in Morgon, this wine has weight and great tannins. Structured, ripe black fruits are generous and developing well. The boisterous fruit needs to calm down a little, so drink this wine from late 2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Jean-Ernest Descombes  (Morgon)

Description: Given the appellation (named after a Roman soldier), there has to be a wine called after great lovers in history. This wine with its good structure will indeed be lovely, or certainly deliciously fruity. Hints of black cherries and acidity suggest it will be ready from late 2018.
Name: Jean Loron 2016 Les Grandes Amours  (Saint-Amour)

Description: The sector known as Combiaty lies in the southern part of the Brouilly appellation. This wine made from 50-year-old vines is soft and ripe in the classic style of Brouilly. Crisp acidity gives a red-cherry-flavored lift. Drink this wine now.
Name: Manoir du Carra 2016 Terre de Combiaty  (Brouilly)

Description: This Beaune-based négociant has made this wine in a Burgundian style, with oak fermentation and aging in vats for up to nine months. The result is a rich wine that will age. Its tannins, spice and rich structure speak to the wood flavors. The fruit balances that, giving richness and concentration. Drink the wine from 2019.
Name: Albert Bichot 2016 La Madone  (Fleurie)

Description: Spice, cherries and some tannins are the order of the day in this wine. Tannins are present although not dominant, giving a wine that is more to do with rich berry fruits and black cherries. Still developing, the wine will be better from late 2018.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: This warm, ripe wine is full of rich black fruit and light tannins. It is dense but has a refreshing light touch of acidity. Savor this wine now for its fruitiness.
Name: Richard Rottiers 2016 La Sambinerie  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: From the Chasselay family's négociant business, this single-vineyard wine is lightly structured and full of blackberries. It has a future with its tannins and its mineral edge that need to soften. Drink this balanced wine from late 2018.
Name: Claire & Fabien Chasselay 2016 La Carrière  (Chénas)

Description: The wine, always structured, is particularly strong and tannic in this vintage. It has density and plenty of dry tannins that at the moment have a hard edge. This structure will stand the otherwise ripe and fruity wine in good stead as it ages, but it will take time. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine des Marrans 2016  Juliénas

Description: This six-acre parcel has produced a structured but fruity wine. With crisp red berries and a layer of tannins to sustain the fruitiness, it is likely to mature well, with concentration and a rich aftertaste. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2016 Les Mouilles  (Juliénas)

Description: The top wine from this estate comes from the famed Côte du Py vineyard. This wine is densely structured, full of tannins and with great potential. Black fruit is still developing under the dry texture but will surely be there in a few months. Drink from late 2018.
Designation: Domaine de Javernière Côte du Py
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine de Javernière Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Some wood aging has given this single-estate wine its smooth, polished character. Along with having the concentration of old vines, this wine is rich, generous and likely to age well. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Henry Fessy 2016 Château des Labourons  (Fleurie)

Description: This powerful wine offers rich texture and layers of tannin balanced by juicy black fruits and crisp acidity. This wine, from a southeast-facing slope, is ripe, ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Jean Loron 2016 Domaine des Billards  (Saint-Amour)

Description: This four-acre walled vineyard is owned by the Lebeaupin family. The structure and density of the wine is the product of the old vines, bringing in tannins as well as ripe fruits. Age will soften the tannins. Drink from 2019.
Name: Clos de la Brosse 2016  Saint-Amour

Description: This structured wine offers dark fruits and a dry core of tannins. It has weight and the potential of rich fruitiness. The concentration from old vines adds to the aging potential. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Domaine Matray 2016 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Juliénas)

Description: This structured, firm wine is produced from 65-year-old vines. Tannins and juicy acidity support the red-berry flavors and crisp texture. This fruity wine has the tannins to age further. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Château Gaillard 2016  Morgon

Description: This is a ripe and generous wine from a well-regarded producer. It is rich with red berries and structured with a series of fine tannins and acidity. It offers weight, plenty of fruit and is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This wine is ripe, softly structured and ready to drink. Red berres and acidity dominate, smoothed by wood aging in large barrels. It is fruity, with a crisp aftertaste.
Name: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2016 L'Ancien  (Beaujolais)

Description: Produced from the domaine of Roches du Py that this producer purchased in 2004, this wine has much of the same structure and rich tannins as a true Côte du Py. The intense black fruits are poised and will allow the wine to age well. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine Guenaël Jambon 2016 Les Roches du Py  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This family-owned estate, going back to 1700, lies in southern Beaujolais in the golden stones or Pierres Dorées region. The wine is rich and intense with black fruits and impressive texture for a simple Beaujolais. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine Romy 2016 Vieilles Vignes Les Pierres Dorées  (Beaujolais)

Description: This is a balanced, structured wine. With ripe tannins and immediately attractive spice and blackberry fruit, it is a warm wine that also has a more serious, textured side. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2016 Les Mouilles  (Juliénas)
