Description: From the smallest of the Beaujolais crus, this wine brings out the structured nature from the hilly vineyard sites. The wine is solid and firm, crisp with black cherries and black currant. It should age further, so drink from mid-2018.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2016 En Rémont Vignes de 1939  (Chénas)

Description: Warm and generous, this is a ripe wine from a steep village behind the hill of Brouilly. The slope gives the wine its hellish name because it is so tough to work. This structure wine offers a core of tannins as well as plenty of black fruits and spice. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Robert Perroud 2016 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

Description: This wine is soft, with ripe red fruit and the lightest touch of tannins. It's smooth, open and generous. A succulent, juicy character marks the red-cherry fruit and balanced acidity. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Bel-Air 2016 Briante  (Brouilly)

Description: A dense planting of old vines has yielding small quantities of concentrated fruit. This wine is dense, with a firm tannic character as well as bold blackberry fruits. It is rich and will age well. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine de Colette 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Régnié)

Description: Swathes of ripe black fruits mark out this rich wine. Coming from the village of Lantignié, it is a cut above simple Beaujolais-Villages and that shows in the berry fruits, the wood aging and the balanced acidity. Drink this wine now.
Name: Domaine des Capréoles 2016 L'Amourgandise Terroir de Lantignié  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This ripe, smooth wine is rich and full of black-currant and black-cherry fruits. It is perfumed with just the right amount acidity to balance the richness. A blend from different parcels, the wine is delicious now and ready to drink.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2016 Domaine De La Chanaise  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This perfumed wine is rich in black-cherry fruit and has a generous, rounded texture and crisp acidity. Delicious already, it is smooth and ripe, ready to drink now.
Name: Florent Descombe 2016 Cuvée J  (Juliénas)

Description: This wine is full of juicy fruit and a balanced structure of tannins. It is ripe yet shows a crisp edge of acidity. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Château de Saint Amour  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Named after the small chapel that tops the hill behind the village of Fleurie, this wine is structured and firm. It has some fine tannins as well as plenty of juicy red-cherry fruits. It will be ready to drink from mid-2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 La Madone  (Fleurie)

Description: This wine comes from a five-acre parcel planted on schist. The 50-year-old vines have produced a solid wine, perfumed with red cherries and flavored with rich berry and black-cherry fruit. The tannins are integrating well to give a wine that will be ready from late 2018.
Name: Henry Fessy 2016  Juliénas

Description: This wine is powerful, dense and has a solidly tannic structure. It also offers bold swathes of ripe red cherries and balanced acidity. The wine is almost ready to drink, just wait until mid-2018.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 Belles Grives  (Morgon)

Description: Still very young, this wine that celebrates the windmill (Moulin-à-Vent) of the appellation is bright purple in color, full of boisterous cherry flavors and shows just the right amount of tannic structure. A small amount of oak aging gives a smooth edge to the wine. Drink from 2019.
Name: Jean Loron 2016 Au Beau Moulin  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Produced from vines planted on the cool, shallow-granite soil of Chiroubles, this wine is balanced, ripe and has some fine tannins. It is smoothly textured, generous with its acidity and red fruits and ready to drink from mid-2018.
Name: Jean Loron 2016 Le Moulin  (Chiroubles)

Description: This is a full wine, juicy with attractive blackberry and rich cherry fruit. Its acidity provides a refreshing contrast to the richness. Drink the wine now.
Name: Vignoble Charmet 2016 Moulin la Blanche  (Beaujolais)

Description: This wine is ripe, full and juicy from 30-year-old vines. It is packed with rich tannins and black-cherry flavors that are generous and full in the mouth. This warm, well-made wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château de Lacarelle 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This ripe and richly fruity wine from organically grown grapes is also textured with tannins and cut with acidity. These elements make for a generous wine, full of fruit and with a medium-term future. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2016 L'Héronde  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Perfumed red fruits and firm tannins give this wine both its immediate attraction and its aging potential. It is dense as well as rich with juicy blackberry fruit freshened with acidity. Drink the wine from 2019.
Name: Domaine de la Plaigne 2016  Morgon

Description: This small family-owned estate has vines in both Morgon and Fleurie. This elegant wine is poised between ripe tannins and generous black fruit. It will age for a few more months, allowing time for its bright acidity to soften. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2016  Fleurie

Description: This estate, run by the same family for five generations, has produces a structured wine. Its firm tannins and generous black-plum fruits suggest aging potential. Full bodied and rich, the wine should be drunk from 2019.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine du Pourpre  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This wine has the typical soft, round character of Brouilly although a good backdrop of tannins gives it shape. Coming from old vines, it has density as well as plenty of crisp black fruits. Drink this wine now.
Name: Les Frères Perroud 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)

Description: A small proportion of this producer's Chénas is aged in wood. The 12 months in wood gives extra richness as well as spice and toast, producing a full, structured wine that's likely to need aging. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine de Côtes Rémont 2016 Elevé en Fût de Chênes  (Chénas)

Description: There are powerful tannins in this structured wine. Happily juicy red-fruit flavors and acidity cut through the tannins. Age the wine over the medium-term and drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine de Gry-Sablon 2016 Douby  (Morgon)

Description: From vines within sight of the winery, this wine is rich with generous tannins and bold red-cherry flavors. A good structure supports the bold, open fruitiness and acidity. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine des Maisons Neuves 2016 L'Ecluse  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: This is a cool, crisp wine from vineyards that face east to the rising sun. Its red-cherry fruitiness and acidity are bright with touches of tannin to give the wine shape. It needs a few months for the fruit to calm down from its intensity. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Fabien Collonge 2016 L'Aurore des Côtes  (Chiroubles)

Description: This is a chewy wine, still powered with the typical tannins of a young Morgon. The domaine has vines in the Charmes and Corcelette sub-regions, giving a serious structure as well as great black fruits. Drink from 2019.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine Mont Chavy  (Morgon)

Description: Full of red cherries and succulent black plums, this ripe, soft wine comes from a privately owned estate that is followed by the producer. The wine is ripe, full in the mouth and ready to drink now.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 Domaine des Nazins  (Brouilly)

Description: These vines, planted by the current owner's family in 1940, give a richly concentrated wine. Its dense texture contrasts with generous black fruits and crisp acidity to make a warm, rich wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2016 Vieilles Vignes de 1940  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This wine has the typical soft, round character of Brouilly although a good backdrop of tannins gives it shape. Coming from old vines, it has density as well as plenty of crisp black fruits. Drink this wine now.
Name: Les Frères Perroud 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)

Description: The vineyard is owned by a charitable foundation that gives money to local hospitals in Lyon. It is a rich wine, generous with both fruit and tannins, giving ripeness as well as crisp acidity. The texture is soft and smooth and the wine is ready to drink.
Designation: Domaine des Hospices Civils de Lyon
Name: Collin-Bourisset 2016 Domaine des Hospices Civils de Lyon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Softly rich and packed with fruit, this wine is generous and ripe. It has minerality and a light texture of tannins. The wine's dense fruit and acidity are balanced and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de La Grume 2016 La Grume Grain de Sable  (Brouilly)

Description: Rich with a dark, firm texture, this is a dense wine. Black fruits, generous tannins and spice are ripe and full. The touch of pepper on the palate hints at the higher alcohol of the wine. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine Raphaël Chopin 2016 Le Ronze  (Régnié)

Description: Leynes sees itself as another Beaujolais cru even if its actual appellation is Beaujolais-Villages. Nevertheless, the wines do have individuality, with minerality as well as red-cherry flavors. With crisp acidity as well as plenty of delicious fruitiness, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Sangouard 2016 La Citadelle  (Beaujolais-Leynes)

Description: From the Charmes sector of Morgon, this concentrated wine has spiced almond and toast flavors along with warm black cherries. The tannins are still firm giving a dry core. Drink from 2019.
Name: Ferraud et Fils 2016 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: From 50-year-old vines, this wine is ripe and solid with dark black fruit as well as some firm tannins. It has weight, concentration and a strong minerality from the granite soil of this high-altitude vineyard. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Henry Fessy 2016  Chiroubles

Description: This wine is structured and firm with the classic tannins of Morgon, while red-cherry and banana flavors give a bright texture. The two elements should come together to give an easy, fruit-driven wine. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 Domaine de la Chaponne  (Morgon)

Description: The structure of this northerly Beaujolais cru shows through well in this wine. A core of tannins is boosted by the great swathes of black currant and berry fruits and acidity. The wine is perfumed, ripe and ready to drink.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2016 Les PIerres  (Saint-Amour)

Description: An impressive 120-year-old parcel of vines provides this ripe wine that has concentration and loads of spicy black-cherry fruitiness. The wine is delicious and ready to drink.
Name: Vignoble Charmet 2016 La Centenaire  (Beaujolais)

Description: The extra seriousness that the slopes of Mount Brouilly give to a wine are very evident here. It is dense and structured, with flavors of mint as well as black fruits. The wine should age further, so drink from mid-2018.
Name: Trenel Fils 2016  Côte de Brouilly

Description: This 16th-century castle is an impressive landmark in the region. The wine lives up to the location with its ripe black fruits and generous tannins. The dense structure will allow it to age. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2016  Brouilly

Description: This wine comes from a vineyard called Siberia because it is so cold and late ripening. It is made without any sulfur added, hence the name Sauvage, wild. The wine is rich with upfront black fruits and some firm tannins as well as juicy acidity. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2016 Cuvée Vin Sauvage à Poil  (Régnié)

Description: Owner Dominique Morel makes this wine from a seven-acre parcel. It has red-cherry fruit, juicy acidity and a soft texture. Ripe and fruity, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Gry-Sablon 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Fleurie)

Description: The sand and granite soil of Regnié gives a soft style of wine. This ripe and fruity wine has a rounded texture and plenty of berry fruits. With attractive acidity and just a dash of tannin, it is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2016  Régnié
Winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

Description: A firm layer of tannins give this wine structure and the potential to age. At this young stage, it lies over the juicy red fruits and acidity, although this will change over the next few months. This wine has the potential to be ripe and fruity; wait until mid-2018.
Name: Domaine des Gaudets 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: The rich 2015 vintage has given a ripe wine. With acidity as well as flavors of wood aging and plenty of red-cherry fruits, the wine is juicy and has a balanced tannic base. Drink now.
Name: Emmanuel Fellot 2015 Les Cailloux  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: This domaine, one of several in Morgon followed by Duboeuf, has made a rich wine, structured and dense. It has plenty of concentration as well as bright fruits and a jammy, ripe texture. It will be ready to drink from mid-2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine de Javernière  (Morgon)

Description: This wine is rich and structured while also being ripe and full of black fruits. The tannins and concentration of this fruity wine will allow it to age. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Jean Loron 2016 Les Saprolites  (Fleurie)

Description: Rich and with fine tannins, this is a solid wine with great structure. It has the juicy fruit typical of the vintage, giving a perfumed wine to drink now.
Name: Château de Chatelard 2016 Cuvée les Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A bold and fruity wine from the smallest of the cru villages, this has some structure as well as juicy red fruits and bright acidity. The fruitiness makes this lightly textured, generous wine. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine de Côtes Rémont 2016  Chénas

Description: This is a young, boisterous wine. Its red fruit is still surrounded by tannins and a firm structure, with plenty of acidity. Crisply textured and lively, it will be ready to drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine des Maisons Neuves 2016  Chiroubles

Description: Old vines give concentration although they don't go far from the rounded fruity style of Brouilly. The result is a wine that is packed with bright berry fruits and also has depth and richness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine des Maisons Neuves 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)

Description: This crisp and structured wine comes from the highest altitude of the Beaujoalis crus. In this vintage, the tannins and structure are an important element although the bright red fruits will develop. Give this wine until mid-2018.
Name: Domaine des Marrans 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Chiroubles)

Description: Based in Juliénas, but also with vines on the lower slopes in the Beaujolais-Villages appellation, this producer has made a wine that has great fruit and a balance of tannins and acidity. It has weight and is rich and dense, laced with a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2016 La Roche  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: The organic fruit that goes into this wine gives it both richness and a pure, clean character that make it immediately appealing. It is a simple wine, all black fruit and with good acidity. Drink this ripe wine now.
Name: Domaine Perol 2015 Le Clos Pierres Dorées  (Beaujolais)

Description: Bold tannins mark out this wine as needing to age. Its concentrated structure and powerful black fruits are solid, with a firm and dry core. Drink this dark-fruit and dark-chocolate-flavored wine from late 2018.
Name: Domaine Raphaël Chopin 2016 Caprice  (Régnié)

Description: This hilly appellation next door to Moulin-à-Vent is noted for structured wines. With black fruits as well as layers of firm tannins, this wine fits the bill. The ripe, juicy character will give great pleasure from late 2018.
Name: Florent Descombe 2016 Cuvée C  (Chénas)

Description: Chiroubles, with its high-elevation vineyards, produces a light and fruity, almost cool and collected style of wine. This wine fits that bill, with crisp red fruits and light tannins giving an attractive, drinkable character. Enjoy now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine des Pontheux  (Chiroubles)

Description: This wine is smooth, juicy and ripe. With broad red fruits and acidity, it has a light touch of tannins that keeps the wine's shape and texture. The wine is fruity, rich and ready to drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine du Riaz  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: This wine is produced from vines that face the slopes of the hill of Brouilly. Ripe and full of juicy black fruits, it also has a crisp line of acidity. The soft texture is open, encouraging fruitiness and suggesting the wine is now ready to drink.
Name: Jean Loron 2016 Château de Bellevue  (Brouilly)

Description: This wine, with its firm structure, is dense and concentrated. It offers blackberry fruit, rich tannins and balanced, juicy acidity that leaves a delicious, crisp aftertaste
Name: Domaine de Briante 2016 Naturellement  (Brouilly)

Description: This rich and dense wine shows the influence of 60-year-old vines in its depth of flavor. Black cherries and generous, integrated tannins give richness and structure. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de la Plaigne 2016  Régnié

Description: This is a single-estate wine, ripe with cherry flavors and light on the tannins. The vines, within sight of the landmark of Mount Brouilly, have given a generous wine that is also crisp with acidity. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 Château de la Perrière  (Brouilly)

Description: From the granite soils of Saint-Amour in the far north of Beaujolais, this dense wine is rich in both tannins and ripe black fruits. Its structure and firm character promise good aging for this full wine. Drink from 2019.
Name: Pascal Berthier 2016 Esprit de Séduction  (Saint-Amour)

Description: A small amount of oak aging in old barrels has had a smoothing effect on this crisp wine, balancing the acidity and fresh red-currant flavors. It is fruity and ready to drink now.
Name: Manoir du Carra 2016 Non-Filtré  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: From 60-year-old vines, this wine has some concentration even though its main thrust is fruity. Tannins underneath the red-cherry fruit and crisp acidity give a wine that is lightly structured and ready to drink.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2016 Cuvée Tim  (Régnié)

Description: This is a ripe style of Beaujolais-Villages, rich with red-berry fruits that are cut with acidity. The tannins are soft but just enough to give structure. This delicious, fruity wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine André Colonge 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: With its acidity, red-cherry and pepper flavors and some dry tannins, this wine is fruity and crisp. Drink this open, light wine now.
Name: Domaine Céline & Nicolas Hirsch 2016  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: This wine is still young, with its fruit tied up with the tannic structure and dry core. However, its juicy, red-berry character will emerge as it develops into a richer, less taut wine. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine de Bel-Air 2016 Granits Roses  (Fleurie)

Description: Produced from 50-year-old vines, this is cool, crisp wine with a fine layer of tannins as well as plenty of acidity. It comes from a small parcel in the high-altitude vineyards of Chiroubles. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2016  Chiroubles
Winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

Description: This wine is traditional in style and fruity with light tannins and spice. Aromatic and crisp at the end, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Roche Guillon 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This wine has some structure and tannic character, although the fruit dominates. Blackberry flavors are shot through with acidity supported by a dry core of tannins. The wine is still developing and will be better from mid-2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Flower Label  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: From one of the top climats or areas of Morgon, this wine is richly structured but has plenty of berry fruits laced with cherry acidity. It is ripe and certain to age further with the tannins that are still prominent. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Jean-François Coquard 2016 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: This wine is fresh, crisp and offers blackberry fruit. It is light, softly tannic and juicy. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2016 Haute Ronze Vieilles Vignes  (Régnié)

Description: Spicy cocoa aromas are followed on the palate by the crispest acidity and juicy red-berry flavors. Still young with its fruit character, the wine needs to broaden to bring out richness. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine de Côtes Rémont 2016  Juliénas

Description: From several different parcels on the Côte du Py vineyard, this wine is both structured and fruity. Its crisp edge and dry tannic core both point to aging potential. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: With its fine tannins and dusty texture, this is already delicious. Layers of acidity and a sense of perfumed richness give it full, attractive fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 Château des Déduits  (Fleurie)

Description: Richly and dense, this wine has ripe berries, crisp acidity and smooth tannins that are just a background to the juicy, attractive fruit. The wine is totally ready to drink.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2016 Terre Noire Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: This wine is all about crisp fruit. It is bright and juicy, full of red cherries with a touch of pepper to add attractive spice. The wine is light, bright and ready to drink.
Name: Mommessin 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This soft, perfumed wine has red-cherry flavors and an attractive light texture. It offers some of the structure associated with the most northern of the Beaujolais crus, but the main thrust is fresh red fruits. Drink now.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2016  Saint-Amour

Description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this simple, fruity wine has a direct character that is immediately attractive. Crisp acidity and juicy cherry flavors make it ready to drink.
Name: Trenel Fils 2016 Cuvée Bio  (Beaujolais)

Description: Based in Odenas, at the foot of Mount Brouilly, Jean-François Pegaz has produced a bright wine. A tannic core gives the wine weight and potential richness, while contrasting acidity adds a crisp, fresh aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2016  Côte de Brouilly

Description: Organic grapes go into this smooth wine with its ripe fruits and soft tannins. Coming from the south of Beaujolais, the wine is soft and has an easy-going warmth. Its fruit and acidity mean it is ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2016 La Platière  (Beaujolais)

Description: From vines that average 60 years in age, this concentrated wine brings together ripe, dense blueberry and spice with a dry core of tannins. The fruit is bright and up front, and the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Colette 2016 Coteaux de Colette  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This soft wine is open, packed with red berry and cherry flavors and delicious to drink now. It has great fruitiness, light spice and pepper, and a round aftertaste just lifted with acidity.
Name: Domaine de la Madone 2016 Le Perreon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This soft style of a wine offers plenty of attractive red-cherry flavors and crisp acidity. The texture is light and open, giving immediate pleasure in a wine that is all about fruit. Drink now.
Name: Florent Descombe 2016 Cuvée B  (Brouilly)

Description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this simple, fruity wine has a direct character that is immediately attractive. Crisp acidity and juicy cherry flavors make it ready to drink.
Name: Trenel Fils 2016 Cuvée Bio  (Beaujolais)

Description: From one of the single estates vinified by the Bel Air cooperative, this wine has intense red-currant fruit and acidity. It offers a light texture with just enough tannins to give weight and concentration. Drink this wine now.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2016 Domaine des Poutoux  (Brouilly)

Description: This wine has ripe fruit and a fine line of tannins to add to the acidity and berry flavors. It conveys richness as well as a crisp texture, full of fruit and ready to drink. The 220-acre estate is one of the largest in Beaujolais.
Name: Château de Corcelles 2016  Brouilly

Description: This wine is all fruit, with black cherries dominant. The tannins are light, the fruit crisp and the structure makes this delicious wine ready to drink.
Name: Château Thivin 2016 Reverdon  (Brouilly)

Description: This wine is rich, full of black-cherry flavors while also having a crisp texture. With its light tannins and intense acidity, it is juicy, ripe and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de la Prébende 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: The 60-year-old vines that give the grapes for this wine are planted on the typical clay and chalk soil of southern Beaujolais. The result is a ripe wine with a dense character and plenty of cherry fruit. With light tannins and crisp acidity, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine des Marrans 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: One of Duboeuf's range of single-estate wines, this bottling is full, ripe while also having a light touch of acidity and berry fruits. Tannins are well integrated into this attractive, juicy wine that is ready to drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Château des Vierres  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This wine is soft for a Juliénas, with perfumed juicy, jammy red fruits and attractive acidity. It is rounded and generous, packed with fruit and only a hint of tannin. Drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Flower Label  (Juliénas)

Description: From a two-acre parcel of 50-year-old vines, this is a rich wine. It has the structure of firm tannins, rich cherry fruits and smooth concentration. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Henry Fessy 2016  Saint-Amour

Description: The style of this wine is rich, giving structure and ripe tannins as much as red fruits. It is juicy, full of red-berry flavors and has good acidity to keep it all in check. Drink now.
Name: Bouchard Aîné et Fils 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A ripe, fruity, red-cherry flavored wine, this is attractive already. It has a rich, smoky texture as well as layers of fruit and acidity. With the edge of tannin in the back, the wine could age further, although there is no real need. It's ready to drink now.
Name: Château de Lavernette 2016 Le Clos  (Beaujolais-Leynes)

Description: This ripe, fruity wine with its red-cherry flavor is open and soft. A crisp, succulent edge adds to the attractiveness, giving a bright, fruity character. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Bel-Air 2016 Les Granits Bleus  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This wine is all bright red berries and crisp acidity. It is a light, tangy and juicy wine from 40-year-old vines on a five-acre parcel. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Gaget 2016 Les Galets  (Beaujolais)

Description: Ripe cherry fruit and a dense texture give this wine its concentration and spiciness. It is a full wine, rich with red fruits and acidity, and ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2015 Les Extrêmes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This wine is crisp and bright with red-berry flavors and intense acidity. Produced from 40-year-old vines, it has some concentration as well as a tight, mineral aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Marc Delienne 2016 Avalanche de Printemps  (Fleurie)

Description: This is red-berry driven, packed with dense fruits and layered with concentrated tannins. It seems a bit overdone and takes away from the fruitiness of the Gamay. It's definitely for those who like big, powerful wines.
Name: Domaine Raphaël Chopin 2016 La Savoye  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This wine is soft, ripe and fruity. With a smooth texture only lightly ruffled by tannins, it is full of red cherries and plums with bright acidity. It is ready to drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Clos des Quatre Vents  (Fleurie)

Description: This succulent wine is full of red fruits and dusty tannins. The acidity and fruitiness are balanced by the structure that will allow this wine to mature further. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Flower Label  (Fleurie)

Description: A crisp, attractively perfumed wine, this is packed with red-berry flavors and has a light tannic texture. It has a rich side although the attractive fresh acidity brings this wine to life. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Marc Burgaud 2016 Les Vignes de Thulon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A rich wine with tannins firmly in place, this is structured, with a dry core that contrasts with the juicy black fruits. A wine to age, it should not be drunk before late 2018.
Name: Domaine Céline & Nicolas Hirsch 2016  Chénas

Description: This wine is all about crisp red-cherry and berry fruits that burst from the glass. It is juicy, perfumed and bright. The dry texture underlines the fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine des Gaudets 2016 Sornay  (Régnié)

Description: The producer's entry-level Morgon shows many of the appellation's characteristics. Tannins and ripe fruit are all there as well as the balance with acidity and a solid texture. This fruity wine is ready to drink.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Flower Label  (Morgon)

Description: Strawberry-jam aromas and ripe fruits give this wine a soft, smooth character. It has some tannins although these are incidental to the fruity thrust of the wine. Warm and ripe, it is ready to drink.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Flower Label  (Saint-Amour)

Description: A wine that goes all out in the juicy, crisp stakes, this is bright with red-currant fruit and plenty of acidity. Old vines in this case means 50 years and there is some concentration as well as good fruitiness. Drink the wine now.
Name: Henry Fessy 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Crisp and fruity, this wine is firm, with young tannins and juicy red-cherry flavors. Bright and packed with youthful fruitiness, it needs to be left for a few months. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Jean Loron 2016 Les Thibaults  (Brouilly)

Description: This wine from one of the estates vinified by this cooperative comes from 50-year-old vines. Made from organic grapes, it's juicy, light and perfumed. Drink the wine now.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2016 Domaine des Schistes  (Morgon)

Description: This wine has plenty of tannins and a firm structure. The black fruits seem reticent and slow to come forward through the tannins. There is potential, but it will take time to release that juicy, fruity character. Drink from 2019.
Name: Yohan Lardy 2016 Les Michelons  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: From a 5.5-acre vineyard on granite soil, this juicy, red-cherry-flavored wine is crisp and perfumed. It is all about delicious, forward fruit, with a light texture and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2016  Beaujolais-Villages
Winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

Description: This light and fruity wine has a crisp texture as well as plenty of acidity. These contrast with the red-currant and berry fruits that are juicy and succulent. Drink now.
Name: Domaine des Marrans 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This bright wine is full of black-cherry flavors and crisp acidity, with a light touch of tannins. It has great fruitiness and freshness, and is completely ready to drink.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2016 Cuvée P  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: With earthy aromas, this is a simple, soft wine. It has some black fruits as well as light tannins and an aftertaste with berry and spice flavors. Drink this open wine now.
Name: Les Vins Aujoux 2016 Bonne Neige  (Brouilly)

Description: This wine is soft, with full cherry flavors and an attractive layer of dusty tannins. Ripe and packed with fruit, it's totally ready to drink now.
Name: Louis Tête 2016  Brouilly

Description: This wine from 40-year-old vines is packed with crisp red fruits. It has acidity, red-currant and red-cherry flavors and only the lightest tannin texture. It is ready to drink.
Name: Château de Corcelles 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This bright, cherry-flavored wine is crisp, with a light texture and plenty of acidity. It is a classic juicy and fruity Beaujolais, ready to drink young.
Name: Domaine Dupeuble Père et Fils 2016  Beaujolais

Description: This wine has some depth and richness while preserving the crisp fruit of the vintage. Cherries, red currants and plenty of fruity acidity are the wine's light, easy hallmark. Drink now.
Name: Florent Descombe 2016 Cuvée B  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This wine has some structure, with an edge of dryness that highlights the ripe red fruits and acidity. A fruity wine from one of the top Burgundy producers, it is ready to drink now.
Name: Louis Jadot 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This wine is packed with ripe fruit with a texture giving just the right amount of tannin. The wine has weight, the result of the clay soil in which the vines grow. Tank aging has preserved the cherry flavors and crisp acidity. Drink now.
Name: Albert Bichot 2016 Château de Jarnioux  (Beaujolais)

Description: This smooth, rounded wine offers attractive black cherries and red plums. The wine is full, pure fruit, produced from organically grown grapes. It is soft and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2016 Quatre Saisons  (Beaujolais)

Description: While this wine is all about fruit, it also has some concentration that gives it a full-bodied character that contrasts with the berry flavors and acidity. It is ready to drink.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Coeur de Presse  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Produced from 60-year-old vines, this crisp, juicy wine is bright with acidity and forward red-berry flavors. Light and fruity, it's ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Bertrand 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: While this wine has some of the tannic structure of Morgon, its juicy fruits and hints of banana give a much lighter character. Fruitiness drives this crisp wine and will allow it to be drunk from mid-2018.
Name: Domaine des Gaudets 2016 Sornay  (Morgon)

Description: This single-estate wine is perfumed, lightly structured and full of ripe, juicy red fruits. With acidity and spice in equal measure, it is soft, packed with fruitiness and acidity, and ready to drink.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 Domaine Pignard  (Beaujolais)

Description: This wine is pure juicy fruit. It bubbles with red cherries, acidity and a crisp shot of acidity. A refreshing, lightly structured wine, it is ready to drink.
Name: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2016  Beaujolais

Description: Old vines with concentration and light tannins give this wine its intensely fruity character. It has a juicy, crisp edge along with good acidity and a bright aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
Name: Trenel Fils 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This attractively structured wine offers ripe cherry fruit and an edge of firm tannins. It's rich, full of fruit, smooth and ready to drink.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 Special Selection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is a simple, fruity wine, crisp and bright with red cherries. Acidity and light texture make it immediately drinkable. It is a well-made, delicious wine.
Name: Louis Jadot 2016  Beaujolais

Description: This soft, strawberry-jam-flavored wine is made from organically grown grapes. It has a pure fruity character just gently touched by tannins, presenting an almost sweet, ripe character. Drink now.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2016 Cuvée Classic  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This wine is simple and fruity. Crisp black-cherry fruit is lifted by refreshing acidity while the light texture gives the wine an attractive tangy character. Drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Flower Label  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: From vines that surround the Fessy winery, this juicy, fruity wine also has a tang of tannins. Its acidity and crisp texture are immediately attractive and the wine is drinkable now.
Name: Henry Fessy 2016  Beaujolais

Description: This is a light wine, just juicy red cherries and bright acidity. The structure is also light, leaving fruitiness and immediate drinkability as the wine's main characteristics. Drink now.
Name: Florent Descombe 2016 Cuvée B  (Beaujolais)

Description: This bright wine with a hint of toast comes from the south of Beaujolais. With a crisp texture and light tannins, it is ready to drink.
Name: Collin-Bourisset 2016 Beaujo Chéri  (Beaujolais)

Description: Soft although with a crisp edge, this wine offers flavors of red cherry and red currant. Plenty of acidity gives the wine its fresh character. It has a tangy, lightly tannic aftertaste.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Flower Label  (Brouilly)

Description: Bright, brisk and fruity, this is a light wine. Soft tannins contrast attractively with the red-cherry juiciness. Drink now.
Name: Jean-François Coquard 2016 Les Pierres Dorées  (Beaujolais)

Description: As simple and fruity as a Beaujolais can be, this is light, bright and full of red cherries. Acidity and tangy texture make the wine totally drinkable now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Flower Label  (Beaujolais)

Description: Named after the village in which the producer has its winery, this wine is all fruit. Red berries and hints of banana give a wine that is crisp, laced with acidity and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Gry-Sablon 2016 Emeringes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A three-acre vineyard of 55-year-old vines has produced this bright, crisply fruity wine. It is juicy with considerable acidity as well as plenty of red-cherry flavors. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Céline & Nicolas Hirsch 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This is a soft, simple and fruity wine. Crisp with red currants, bright acidity and a soft texture, it is ready to drink.
Name: Maison Emmanuel Giboulot 2016 Teves  (Beaujolais)

Description: This simple wine offers red berry and banana flavors. With its light structure and soft fruit, it is open and ready to drink.
Name: Louis Tête 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This is as simple as Beaujolais can get, all berry fruit, crisp acidity and light tannins. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Jean Loron 2016 Beau  (Beaujolais)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine, which sold out via Instagram before it was even released, is a fascinating conveyer of soil flavors. Extremely herbal on the nose, it smells like a freshly dug, muddy hole surrounded by towering pines and mossy ground, with exotic berries in the background. The palate is woody, full of dank mushrooms, wild berries and green peppercorns.
Name: Whitcraft 2016 Pence Ranch Gamay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: This structured wine has a dense texture as well as red-cherry fruits. It is crisp, still young, with spice as well as some firm tannins. With this bright, fruity and young character, it will take some aging. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Château de la Greffière 2016  Mâcon-Serrières

Description: This wine is packed with juicy black-cherry fruitiness. It is softly textured, young and ripe. Drink this attractive wine now.
Name: Domaine des Verchères 2016  Mâcon-Mancey

Description: With only 5% of Pinot Noir in the blend, this is essentially a ripe, cherry-flavored Gamay. As such it is fruity, soft in the tannins and bright with acidity. Made to be drunk young, it is ready now.
Name: Maison Deux-Fleurs 2016  Coteaux Bourguignons

Description: Lightly pink in color, this sweet sparkling wine is full of ripe strawberry fruit. And with its low alcohol, it's the perfect pairing for strawberries and cream. Acidity keeps it in balance.
Name: Les Rocailles NV Caprice des Rocailles Gamay (Savoie)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The vineyard lies in the Van Duzer corridor, and the regular winds thicken the grape skins, giving chewy, astringent tannins. Tart plum and wild-cherry fruit flavors carry a peppery bite. The wine was aged for nine months in a neutral barrel of Oregon oak.
Name: Martin Woods 2016 Havlin Vineyard Gamay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a bright, spicy bowl of red fruits, with penetrating flavors and buoyant acidity. It's clean and sharply etched, with a strong tannic base. Such a young wine should improve over the next couple of years; drink up by 2021.
Name: Martin Woods 2016 Motley Rose Vineyard Gamay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: From the most famous sector in Morgon, this wine reveals the intense flavor from the steeply sloped, well-exposed vineyard. The wine, with concentration from old vines, has black-fruit-skin and blackberry flavors. Packed with tannins and acidity, it will age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Wonderful old vines facing south and south-east give a powerfully tannic, structured wine. They also give great black fruits, spice and a toasty edge from the wood aging. This is a dense wine with a serious future. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Vanilla aromas indicate that wood aging has made an already ripe wine even richer. The tannins are still young, calling for aging, but bold cherry and red plum tones are ripe, full bodied and open. Drink this concentrated wine from 2019.
Name: Domaine Fond Moiroux 2014  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Bruno Copéret has produced an impressive wine from this small vineyard on his property. It is still young, full of smoky wood and broad red-fruit flavors. The tannins and the concentration are considerable, although the wine also has a more stylish edge. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine de Roche-Guillon 2015 Clos de la Tour  (Fleurie)

Description: This is a very fine expression of this always richly structured appellation. It is still young, dominated by firm tannins as well as dark black fruits and the spice of wood aging. The acidity, the black cherry flavors and the density of the wine all suggest its great potential. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015 Grand Cras  (Morgon)

Description: A blend from different parts of the Fleurie appellation, this wine is elegant and floral. Crisp red fruits are sustained by acidity and by a juicy character. As often with this appellation, it is a wine to age and will be better from 2018.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015 La Chanaise  (Morgon)

Description: This beautifully perfumed wine is ripe, structured and well on the way to being delicious. Tannins and spice flavors have melded into rich black-cherry fruits cut with acidity. The wine could age for another few months, so drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2014 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Morgon)

Description: A blend from different vineyards of the Fleurie appellation, this wine is deliciously elegant and floral. Crisp red fruits are sustained by acidity and a juicy character. As often with this appellation, it is a wine to age and will be better from 2018.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015  Fleurie

Description: From the famed slope of the Côtes de Py, this wine sums up both the great terroir and a great vintage. It has structure, with dry tannins permeating the ripe, rounded fruit. Its potential is considerable, anchored in great fruitiness and finishing acidity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Pizay 2015 Cuvée du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Dense and structured, this bottling is made from selection of wines aged in large wood barrels for 12 months. Black cherry and plum fruits are balanced by firm tannins and backed by acidity. It is ready to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Pizay 2015 Les Sybarites  (Morgon)

Description: From sand and granite soil, this firmly structured wine has dark tannins as well as the more familiar red-cherry flavors of Beaujolais. As it develops, it will become rich and fruity, juicy with good acidity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Bertrand 2015 Les Déduits  (Fleurie)

Description: Produced by Dominique Piron in association with the Lameloise family, this wine from strong granite soil reveals a firm texture and dense tannins. The fruit suggests very ripe, concentrated black plums and damsons. It is wine to age, drink from 2019.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015 Quartz  (Chénas)

Description: This wine impresses with its richness and ripe red fruits. It comes from a 20-acre vineyard that gives the wine concentration and juicy acidity. Acidity and the crisp aftertaste give the wine its final lift.
Name: Vignobles Bulliat 2016 Cuvée du Colombier  (Morgon)

Description: This ripe, generous wine is full of the bold red fruits of this fine vintage. It also has structure, spicy wood flavors and a rich, full character. With its juicy acidity in the background and its impressive density, the wine is going to age a little longer. It will be best from late 2018.
Name: Domaine de Roche-Guillon 2015  Fleurie

Description: This well-structured wine balances generous tannins with red-berry fruits. It shows both the aging potential of this appellation and its immediate appeal. Ripe and full in the mouth, the wine can be drunk now but will be better from 2018.
Name: Domaine Chaintreuil 2015 La Madone  (Fleurie)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: How delightful that Gamay grows in the Finger Lakes and further more that Sheldrake Point has managed to coax out its unique attributes there. This reserve bottling showcases Gamay's bright cherry and strawberry flavors, with elegant tones of tomato leaf, nut and granite. It's deft and crisply composed with a fine, feathery kiss of tannins.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2015 Reserve Estate Bottled Gamay Noir (Finger Lakes)

Description: This ripe, fruity and perfumed wine is delicious. Juicy red and black fruits ooze from every part of its smoky structure. It comes from vines on a small plateau called Pisse-Vieille in Brouilly. The wine is ready to drink for its fruity pleasure.
Name: Domaine Bertrand 2015 Pisse-Vieille  (Brouilly)

Description: Made from organically grown grapes, this wine is structured and still firm, with ripe berry fruits buried in the structure. As it matures, this rich wine will open out generously. Drink from 2019.
Name: Vignobles Bulliat 2016 Nature  (Morgon)

Description: Produced from vines that are up to 40 years old, this is a firmly structured wine. Concentration and dry tannins come from some firm extraction. The fruit though is ripe and juicy, showing red-berry flavors along with spice from the wood aging. Drink the wine from 2019.
Name: Château de Chénas 2015  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: This soft and perfumed wine exudes the ripe black-cherry fruit of this warm vintage. The wine is rich and smooth but shot through with acidity. It is a generous wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Albert Bichot 2015 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: This wine comes from the most northerly of the Beaujolais cru villages as it merges gently in Burgundy's Mâcon region. The wine is structured and firm, but with bright red-cherry fruit and acidity. It will age and be best from 2018.
Name: Florent Descombe 2015  Saint-Amour

Description: This rich wine with its red-plum flavors is ripe and generous, with a tannic edge that will allow it to age. That balances with the red fruits and acidity that already give this young wine a good texture. Drink from 2019.
Name: Vignobles Bulliat 2016  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Aged 18 months in older wood barrels, this wine is bold and rich, while also stylish and balanced.The firm layer of tannins comes from the smoky wood aging as well as from the rich fruits. Concentrated and firm at this stage, the wine needs time. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2015 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Morgon)

Description: Developed by winemaker Loic Bulliat, this wine comes from an estate owned by his family. It's structured, firm with tannins and juicy acidity. The wine needs aging to allow the tannins to integrate with the red-berry fruits. Drink from 2019.
Name: Vignobles Bulliat 2016 Château des Roches  (Fleurie)

Description: This high-altitude Beaujolais cru looks down on the other cru villages from its amphitheater of vines. Produced from 60-year-old vines, this wine is rich and concentrated, but has a firmly tannic streak that needs time to soften. This wine has great acidity and fine potential. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015  Chiroubles

Description: This is a structured wine, with solid tannins as well as bright red fruits that are developing well. The structure and dry core will allow this single-vineyard wine to age well. Drink from 2019.
Name: Vignobles Bulliat 2016 Les Moriers  (Fleurie)

Description: The small Beaujolais cru of Chénas is next door to Moulin à Vent. As this wine shows, it has the same firm structure and ripe fruit. The wine from the cru's chateau is dense, smoky and has plenty of firm tannins. It is a wine to age, so drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Chénas 2015  Chénas

Description: With no wood aging, the fruit speaks in this wine. However, it does have tannins and a stalky, young character, along with generous black-cherry fruit and a touch of spice. The wine needs to age a few months more, so drink from 2018.
Name: Florent Descombe 2015  Chénas

Description: Régnié is one of the smaller cru Beaujolais appellations. This Dominique Piron wine, made from a single vineyard, is in a rounded style, easy to approach when young. Juicy black fruits dominate light tannins and plenty of acidity. Drink this wine now.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015 Croix Penet  (Régnié)

Description: A blend from a range of the different Fleurie sectors, this is a a rich wine. Berry fruits are just beginning to soften into the ripe texture. It is structured and could age further. Drink from 2018.
Name: Florent Descombe 2015  Fleurie

Description: A cherry-flavored wine, this is all fruit with a bright layer of acidity and hint of tannins. Juicy and full of freshness, it needs a few months; drink from 2018.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2016 Belairissime Domaine des Ailes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: More floral and ethereal than the producer's reserve bottling, this delicately concentrated Gamay suggests juicy, crisp red cherries and strawberries. It's a pretty, subtly structured wine with softer, yielding tannins.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2016 Estate Bottled Gamay Noir (Finger Lakes)

Description: This wine has a firm structure as well as plenty of fruit. The wine's acidity, crisp red-currant fruit and bright character are balanced by the firm, smoky and dry tannins. Give this structure time to soften and fill out into a ripe wine. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Pizay 2016 Château de Saint Lager  (Brouilly)

Description: For this appellation, this is a soft wine, full of bright cherry flavors and attractive acidity. A jammy character brings out rich fruitiness that will allow the wine to be ready from 2018.
Name: Château de Pizay 2016  Morgon

Description: This rich wine features ripe, jammy red-plum and cherry fruits. It is dense, with its tannins and a touch of pepper coming from the high alcohol. The wine is a blend from five parcels. Ripe and with a juicy aftertaste, it will be best from 2018.
Name: Domaine Bertrand 2015 Vuril  (Brouilly)

Description: This wine is structured and firm, its red fruits waiting behind the wood and tannin complexity. It shows plenty of potential through its good acidity and cherry fruitiness. Drink from late 2018.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Collection  (Morgon)

Description: This structured wine benefits from the rich fruitiness of the vintage. Based in Morgon, the producer has vines on steep slopes, resulting in structured wines with firm tannins as well as generous fruits. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2015  Morgon

Description: Fruity and juicy, this wine is open and full of black-cherry flavors. The structure of Morgon waits behind the fruit, giving a dry core. This is a wine for medium-term aging. Drink from 2018.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2016 Belairissme Le Py  (Morgon)

Description: Saint-Amour is the most northern of the Beaujolais cru villages, close to Pouilly-Fuissé. Its specialty is structured, rich wine like this. It is a ripe wine, full of black fruits and dense tannins. Still young, it is a style of Beaujolais that needs to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Lavernette 2015 Le Chatelet  (Saint-Amour)

Description: This wine brings out all the fruitiness of Gamay, along with an extra perfumed character. It is soft, rounded and smooth, with cherry fruits and a touch of spice. Drink now.
Name: Bulliat 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: The Régnié wines are lighter than some of the other Beaujolais crus, giving a bright, fruity style of wine with attractive red-cherry flavors. With its acidity, soft texture ad fruitiness, the wine will be ready to drink from early 2018.
Name: Château de Pizay 2016  Régnié

Description: Now fully mature, this soft wine has berry flavors over a dry core. It is rich with a touch of pepper and jammy red fruitiness leading to a toasty aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2014 Collection  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This wine is all bright cherry fruit with juicy acidity and a jammy character. It's delicious now, with its light tannins and bright raspberry aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Vignobles Bulliat 2016 Vignobles des Roches  (Morgon)

Description: The ripe fruit of this vintage is right up front in this strawberry and spice-flavored wine. With a texture that adds a touch of tannin to the fruitiness, it is smooth and round. Drink this aromatic wine from 2018.
Name: Château des Loges 2015 Sélection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This Burgundian negociant take on Beaujolais is soft and ripe. Juicy red-berry fruits and supporting acidity receive a firm base of tannins. It is young, fruity and ready to drink from 2018.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Collection  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Red fruits and a cool edge characterize this wine from the highest elevation of the Beaujolais cru villages. It has red cherry fruitiness, a crisp layer of acidity and a dry, smoky aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
Name: Florent Descombe 2016  Chiroubles

Description: A smooth and soft wine, this offers gentle red-cherry flavors. The acidity and edge of firm tannins give this attractive wine its shape. It will be ready to drink from 2018.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2016  Brouilly

Description: This crisp wine brings out good flavor depth from the cherry and red-berry fruits. It is concentrated for a simple Beaujolais, ripe and fruity, Drink now.
Name: Domaine de la Prébende 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: A fruity, red-cherry-flavored wine, this is ripe, soft and full of juicy acidity. With a lightly smoky aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Vignobles Bulliat 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This highly perfumed wine comes from a small Gamay appellation that is in fact in the Mâcon region. With some tight tannins and rich black fruits, it is a ripe, juicy wine that has intense acidity as well as a spicy aftertaste. Drink this ripe wine from 2018.
Name: Château de Lavernette 2015 Le Clos  (Beaujolais-Leynes)

Description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this soft, fruity wine is full of red-cherry fruits. It also offers a touch of banana flavor as well as acidity and a bright, crisp juicy aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château de Lavernette 2016 Château de Lavernette  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This soft wine is fruity, spicy and full of juicy red fruits. It offers plenty of acidity as well as a layer of tannins. An easy, open wine, it is ready to drink.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2016 Bel-Air  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is a tight wine, firm with tannins and with a bitter edge. Jammy cherry fruits lie behind this structure, along with acidity. The wine will soften and be ready to drink from 2018.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Collection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is a Mâcon region-wide blend, simple and fruity with an attractively crisp texture. It has a citrus character, slightly salty as well as tangy with orange zest. Drink now.
Name: Florent Descombe 2014  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: This light and fruity wine, produced by a Burgundy negotiant, is full of bitter cherry crispness. It is ready to drink, offering acidity and a tight, bright aftertaste.
Name: Maison Jean-Baptiste Béjot 2014 La Perlière  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This cherry-fruited wine is spicy, but a strong acid streak gives a raw aftertaste that should have softened by now. It is ready to drink.
Name: Boutinot 2016 Les Violettes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Classic, simple and fruity, this is an immediately accessible wine. With bright red fruits and a soft, juicy texture, it is crisp, lively and ready to drink.
Name: Château de Pizay 2016  Beaujolais

Description: This wine has easy flavors that are bursting with red cherry. A shot of tannin gives this open, fruity wine shape. It is ready to drink.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Beaujolais)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Gamay is still fairly rare in Oregon but ripens well into a style more reminiscent of Zinfandel or Grenache than of Beaujolais. Robust and fruity, this has tart and spicy cranberry and cherry notes, with a nice acid/tannin balance that keeps the flavors moving along nicely through the finish.
Name: Chehalem 2015 Ridgecrest Vineyards Gamay Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Description: From the cru village of Boudes, this wine is now mature with its soft red fruits and juicy acidity creating a fruity refreshing wine. The wine, produced on the edge of France's central mountains comes from vineyards that are just a couple of mountain ranges away from Beaujolais in a direct line to the east.
Name: Domaine Sauvat 2015 Les Demoiselles Gamay (Côtes d'Auvergne)

Description: This ripe fruity wine is bursting with young red fruits. It has a fine structure that gives a core of dryness. It also has a crisp edge that brings out the fruit and the liveliness of this attractive wine. Ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine Sauvat 2016 Demoiselles Gamay (Côtes d'Auvergne)

Description: Produced in Boudes, one of the cru villages of the Côtes d'Auvergne, this is a young fruity wine. It has light tannins that are there to enhance the stalky red fruits. Acidity and a crisp aftertaste complete this attractive wine. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Sauvat 2016 Origine Gamay (Côtes d'Auvergne)

Description: Bright red cherry fruit and lively acidity give this wine an immediate burst of crispness. It has an attractive tannic character underpinning its ebullient fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Maison Charles Père et Fils 2015  Bourgogne

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Delicate hints of fresh raspberry and red cherry extend throughout this light crisply composed red. A still-rare American Gamay, it's accented with touches of light toast and cedar. It's a slightly fragile wine that should be enjoyed now through 2021.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2015 Estate Bottled Gamay Noir (Finger Lakes)

Description: This softly fruity wine has the lightest of tannins and plenty of simple red-berry fruits. There is an earthy edge to the young wine as well as plenty of acidity at the end. Drink now.
Name: Château Coutinel 2015 Il est des nôôôtres! Gamay (Comté Tolosan)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Spicy, peppery and potent, this brings young fruit flavors of tangy cherry and apple. It's young enough that a certain grapey character remains, like a Beaujolais nouveau. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Omero 2015 Gamay Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: The Côte du Py, one of the best cru vineyard sites in Beaujolais, is on the slope of a 3,000-foot extinct volcano. It produces structured wines that can age well. Stéphane Aviron brought out the quality of Py with a wine that is powerful, ripe and dense with considerable tannic structure. It will certainly need to age, so drink from 2019.
Name: Stéphane Aviron 2014 Côte du Py Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: Be grateful that Stéphane Aviron is an old-vine hunter. Serious tannins and concentration from 100-year-old vines give this wine its depth and richness. It has a great potential to age with black fruits, a mineral texture and acidity. This is an impressive cru wine, full of both fruit and density. Drink from 2019.
Name: Stéphane Aviron 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A firm and structured cru wine from 100-year-old vines that has layers of firm fruits and tannins. It is a wine that is likely to mature well, with its wood aging and dry core. A blend from four parcels, it is concentrated and with a rich black-cherry character. Drink this exceptional wine, from old-vine hunter Stéphane Aviron, starting in 2020.
Name: Stéphane Aviron 2015  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: This is a finely structured wine that will age well. With black-plum fruits, layers of dark young tannins and balanced acidity, it is both juicy and full of great ripe swathes of fruit. From the cru estate that is owned by Louis Jadot in Beaune, it is impressive and worth aging. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château des Jacques 2015  Morgon

Description: Produced from vines that are up to 80-years-old and now organic, this concentrated wood-aged wine is perfumed, rich and firmly structured. Dark tannins line the wine supporting the black plum and cherry fruits and acidity. Richard Rottiers, new on the scene in 2007, created a cru that is going to be a very fine wine. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine Richard Rottiers 2015  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: From this old vineyard, producer Jean-Jacques Mélinand has selected the oldest vines to make this wine. The result is a solid, firmly structured wine that will take several years to fully develop. It is intensely textured, with layers of acidity and red fruits hinting at a crisper, fruity future. Drink the wine from 2018.
Name: Domaine des Marrans 2015 Clos du Pavillon  (Fleurie)

Description: This is a concentrated structured cru wine from a single vineyard. It has dark tannins and a dense spice character from the wood aging. The fruit is still developing to give the wine its potential richness. Drink this firmly structured wine from 2018. This walled vineyard is wholly owned by producer Edouard Labruyère, making it a monopole.
Name: Domaine Labruyère 2013 Le Clos du Moulin-à-Vent  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This powerful rich wine is finely structured and concentrated. It has weight from solid tannins that contrast with the high tones of the ripe red-cherry fruits. From a single parcel, this cru wine is dense, both firm and fresh. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Domaine Chignard 2015 Beauvernay  (Juliénas)

Description: Jean-Marc Lafont's 2.8 acres of sandstone soil in this area of Moulin-à-Vent has produced a ripe, solidly structured wine. Wood aged and with a rich, tight texture and firm tannins, it is a cru wine to age. It is a bold ripe wine, ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine de Bel Air 2015 Les Burdelines  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is a delicious and fruity wine from the smallest Beaujolais cru. There are tannins although they are lost in the generous cushion of ripe blackberry and black-cherry fruits. It is a smooth, rounded wine that is packed with fruit at the moment. Give it time and it will mature well. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine de Côtes Rémont 2015  Chénas

Description: From a single-walled vineyard, this is a ripe, generous and still structured cru wine. It has layers of delicious black-plum fruits and a jammy ripe texture that cushions the tannins. The vineyard is wholly owned by Edouard Labruyère, making it a monopole. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine Labruyère 2014 Le Clos du Moulin-à-Vent  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Vines planted almost directly on the rock have produced this firm and structured wine. It is solid with dark tannins and concentrated black fruits. Plenty of acidity gives a succulent character to this generous wine. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château de Chatelard 2015 Cuvée les Roches  (Morgon)

Description: From this always impressive estate, owned by Louis Jadot in Beaune, this wine is richly structured and dense. With some wood aging, it has an extra ripeness and tannic concentration. This cru wine with its tight texture and minerality will age. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château des Jacques 2015 Clos des Rochegrès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Thus cru wine by Cédric Lecareux comes from shallow soil over granite. That gives a strong and serious character: textured and mineral. Bold ripe black plums dominate along with intense acidity. The wine, layered with tannins and wood-aged, is still young. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine les Capréoles 2015 Sous la Croix  (Régnié)

Description: From a parcel on this 12-acre estate, the wine is structured and rich. It has layers of firm tannins under the black fruits. Acidity and a crisp mineral texture mix with the solid structure and concentration. The aftertaste shows the generous future of this fine cru wine. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2015 Les Garances  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: The Chermette family has produced a rich generous cru wine. It is structured and dense with some firm tannins from maturing in wood. It also has a generous black plum and cherry fruits that are developing well. Drink this wine from late 2017.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2015 Les Garants  (Fleurie)

Description: Produced from old vines in the Côte du Py on the slopes of an extinct volcano, this cru wine is structured with generous black fruits and a series of ripe tannins and balanced acidity. It has the structure and density to age while also having a light touch of black cherry fruit. Drink from 2019.
Name: Stéphane Aviron 2015 Côte du Py Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: Although he is based in the Terres Dorées (golden earth) region of southern Beaujolais, this producer has an enviable palate of vineyards in the crus to the north. This wine comes from one. It has structure, density and a a solid core of both tannins and rich fruit. Drink from 2018.
Name: Jean-Paul Brun 2015 Terres Dorées Grille-Midi  (Fleurie)

Description: One of an impressive range of wines by this producer from the Beaujolais crus, this wine comes from the mineral-driven flint soil of the slopes beneath the famous windmill that gives this appellation its name. It is powerful and dense, full of jammy red fruits as well as acidity and structured tannins. Drink from 2019.
Name: Jean-Paul Brun 2015 Les Thorins  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This producer, who makes cru wines in a Burgundian way by avoiding the region's carbonic maceration technique, has found a parcel of prephylloxera vines that have produced an impressive wine. It is serious and concentrated, a wine that is made to age over a long period. With black fruits, intense acidity and tannins, it should not be drunk before 2019.
Name: Stéphane Aviron 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Chénas)

Description: From vines planted as its name suggests on granite soil, the wine is structured and dense with rich juicy black fruits. Packed with perfumed fruitiness and acidity, the wine is developing well, ready to drink from late 2017.
Name: Château de Chatelard 2015 Cuvée les Vieux Granits  (Fleurie)

Description: Wines from this great producer have developed a tendency towards too much alcohol for a wine from Beaujolais. It is a shame because otherwise this is a generous structured cru wine that is finely balanced. With tannins and delicious acidity, the wine is ready to develop further. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château des Jacques 2015  Fleurie

Description: Owner Arnaud Briday has made a firm structured cru wine. While it has the generous fruit of the year, it also has plenty of tannins that give it tension and concentration. The wine is rich with explosive berry fruits and balanced acidity. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine des Chers 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This cru is a solid wine. It has a dense structure spearheaded by the tannins and lifted by acidity. Black plum and berry fruits are still developing behind the firm facade. It will take some time to develop, so wait until early 2019.
Name: Domaine des Marrans 2015  Fleurie

Description: There is a firm base of structured tannin in this wine. From that comes a tight, mineral texture and red-cherry fruits. The wine is young, still with its bubbly bright fruit. It comes from one of the best sectors of the appellation. This is a cru wine with the potential to age. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Jean-Paul Brun 2015 La Rochelle  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Named after the medieval rulers of the village, this cru wine is firm and structured in the solid style of the appellation. It has rich black cherry and black-plum fruits that come with juicy acidity. At the same time, the tannins and the dry core promise considerable aging. Drink from 2019.
Name: Trenel Fils 2015 Les Capitans  (Juliénas)

Description: The northernmost of the Beaujolais cru villages can produce wines that are Burgundian in their structure. This wine fits that profile well with its dark tannins and rich concentration. Densely textured with both black-cherry fruit and a dry core, the wine is taking its time to develop. Drink from late 2017 or 2018.
Name: Domaine des Chers 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Owned by Beaune merchant Louis Jadot, this cru estate produces some impressive wines. While its alcohol is excessive for a Beaujolais, it wears its power well. The black plum fruit and tannins from wood aging that are still very present will soften over the next year to give a rich generous wine with a style that is Burgundian rather than traditional Beaujolais. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château des Jacques 2015 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: This is a rich complex wine. It has layers of tannins and juicy black fruits that are integrated beautifully. The acidity gives the wine a crisper edge although never taking away from the ripe fruit and structured character. Drink this Chermette family cru wine from 2018.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2015 Les Trois Roches  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Produced from two separate vineyards, the wine has all the concentration of old vines. It has tannins and dark fruits, blackberry and black plum. This is a finely structured cru wine that will need to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Stéphane Aviron 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Juliénas)

Description: From five different parcels in Moulin-à-Vent, this cru wine is a structured representative of the appellation. With some wood aging, the wine has gained extra richness to add to the generous black currant and berry fruits. Drink this concentrated wine from 2019.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine de la Vigne Romaine  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A firm and tannic wine from the most northerly of the Beaujolais cru villages near Bourgogne. Blackberry fruit and juicy acidity are a balance to this initially severe wine. Its dry core and mineral texture show that this wine will need to age. Drink from 2018.
Name: Trenel Fils 2015  Saint-Amour

Description: From a family-owned cru vineyard. Stéphane Aviron has produced an impressive, ripe and dense wine. It has great swathes of black fruit and generous acidity. The tannins, still young, are a background to this delicious fruitiness. Drink from 2020.
Name: Stéphane Aviron 2014 Domaine de la Madrière  (Fleurie)

Description: A dense wine with the tannins and structure to go with the density. It is concentrated with great swathes of black plum and spice flavors, shot through with acidity. Made with wild yeast and without carbonic maceration, this is a wine for serious aging. Drink from 2019.
Name: Jean-Paul Brun 2015  Morgon

Description: Produced from a selection of vineyard fruit, the wine is rich with berry flavors that lie over dark tannins. A solid texture is balanced with juicy fruits and acidity to give a wine that is ripe and likely to age well. Drink this impressive wine from 2019.
Name: Château de Chatelard 2015 Renaissance  (Fleurie)

Description: This is a rich wine, full of red-plum fruits making it ripe and generous. If it does have too much alcohol for a wine from Beaujolais, it shows in a mere hint of pepper. Full of structured tannins as well as the rich fruits, this cru will be ready to drink from 2018.
Name: Château des Jacques 2015  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Seriously structured, this is a powerful and tannic cru wine. It has a dry firm core that is guarding the blackberry and cherry fruits. As they develop, the wine will become riper and richer. Wait until 2019 to drink this long-term wine.
Name: Jean-Pierre Large 2015 Les Délys  (Morgon)

Description: This is a serious, complex cru wine from Jacky Janodet. It is full of structured tannins and rich black fruits. It is a wine that will age with its dry core and layers of acidity. There is a brighter element to this impressive wine that keeps the aftertaste juicy and crisp. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine les Fines Graves 2015  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: One of a series of single parcel wines from the Chermette family estate, this is dark and rich. It has generous tannins alongside the dark cherry and plum fruit. The cru wine's structure and richness will allow it to age. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2015 Poncié  (Fleurie)

Description: This is an ageworthy wine from 60-year-old vines. There is a fine structure that offers rich tannins and equally rich black plum fruits. It is worth keeping this finely structured cru wine to allow its tannins to integrate and soften. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: This wine is packed with cheerful red fruits that are given a more serious edge by the tannic structure and acidity,. With its touch of pepper and minerality, it will age well over the next two years. The cru wine comes from a family-owned property on steep slopes.
Name: Stéphane Aviron 2015 Domaine de la Madrière  (Fleurie)

Description: Made from the Domaine's oldest vines, this is a generous concentrated wine. With its ripe black fruits and firm tannins it is also a wine to age. It has perfumed black-cherry flavors that are enhanced and lifted by the acidity. Drink this wine from late 2017.
Name: Domaine les Capréoles 2015 Diaclase  (Régnié)

Description: A family-owned vineyard on this famous slope in Morgon supplies the grapes to Duboeuf for the wine. It is structured and dense, full of black plum and berry flavors. Acidity cuts through the tannins, resulting in a wine that will age well. Drink from 2019.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: This is a spicy wine, finely fruity with black-currant fruits and with some firm structured tannins. It is a concentrated wine that is likely to mature slowly. There is a sense of power behind this fine cru wine. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine de Côtes Rémont 2015  Juliénas

Description: The Descombes family has farmed vines in this appellation since the French Revolution and Jean-Ernest Descombes supplied one of Georges Duboeuf's first Morgon wines in 1968. The latest generation has produced a ripe and fruity wine with a balanced structure. It is dense in tannins that will soften over the next year. Drink from 2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Jean-Ernest Descombes  (Morgon)

Description: This single vineyard wine comes from a steep parcel that is wedged between crus Fleurie and Moulin-à-Vent. It is deliciously packed with crisp cherry fruits and fine acidity. At the same time, it is structured, solid and with a core of tannins. It is a wine that will age for a while longer, so drink from late 2017.
Name: Domaine Chignard 2015 Les Moriers  (Fleurie)

Description: With vineyards spread across the top sectors of the Fleurie cru, this wine is fruity and structured at the same time. It has a dry core that is surrounded by ripe berry fruits that also hint at black cherry. The wine needs time to soften, so drink from 2018.
Name: Château de Fleurie 2015  Fleurie

Description: This is a rich cru wine with red-plum flavors as well as tannins that are still young and forceful. Densely textured, the wine has plenty of potential. It will become a ripe and fruity wine while also remaining firm and structured. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine Labruyère 2014 Coeur de Terroirs  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This cru wine is still young and firm. It has great tannins and a dense character that will give a rich generous wine as it matures. Black-cherry fruit dominates along with the structure. It is a solid wine that will be ready to drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine les Fines Graves 2015  Chénas

Description: Jean-Marc Lafont's 16-acre Les Charmes vineyard is on granite soil in the west of the cru appellation. The wine is firm and concentrated with serious tannins as well as perfumed juicy black fruits. With its tannins, it is a wine to age. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine de Bel Air 2015 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: This is a complex cru wine that has ripe fruits, firm tannins and a good ageworthy structure. It has a dense texture, rich black-cherry fruits and a finish that brings out crisp acidity. Produced by this Beaujolais-based negociant, the wine will be ready to drink from the end of 2017.
Name: Trenel Fils 2015  Fleurie

Description: Although the Chermette family is based among the Beaujolais vineyards to the south, it does also possess vines in the crus villages of the north. With an open, ripe and juicy character the wine has concentration and richness. It is full, fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2015 Pierreux  (Brouilly)

Description: From one of the leading estates in this cru appellation, the wine is structured and firm and likely to age well. With black cherry and red-currant fruits it is crisp although with its solid texture it should broaden out. Drink this wine from 2018.
Name: Domaine Cheysson 2015  Chiroubles

Description: Annick and Jean-Marc Lafont's three acres on the slopes below the chapel of la Madone give a firm and concentrated cru wine that will repay aging. There are layers of red-berry fruits that are cut with solid tannins and a dry core. The wine will age, so drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine de Bel Air 2015 Granits Rosés  (Fleurie)

Description: Old vines on the slope of the Côte du Py have given a cru wine that certainly has structure. It has vivid red-cherry fruits, lightly spiced and peppery. With its attractive acidity and bright fruity character from the latest generation of the Descombes family who have been growing grapes in Morgon since the French Revolution, it will be ready to drink from late 2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Jean-Ernest Descombes Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Richly structured this wine, from well-exposed vines (hence the land of light in the name) is fruity with black cherry and some firm tannins. It is going to develop into a serious, complex wine. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château de Chatelard 2015 Cuvée Terre de Lumière  (Moulin-à-Vent)
