Description: Beaune merchant Albert Bichot has added this Domaine to its estate. The wine is rich, structured and with a firm underlay of tannins. It has a polished, ripe character, black-cherry fruits and a structure that will allow it to age. Drink from 2018.
Name: Albert Bichot 2015 Domaine de Rochegrès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Three parcels, totaling 16 acres from the Hospices de Belleville estate, provide the fruit for this wine. Wood aged and rich, the wine is fruity, packed with generous red-cherry flavors. There are concentration and some dark tannins as well as fine fruitiness and acidity. Drink this wine from 2018. This is Drouhin's second vintage making wine in partnership with the Hospices de Belleville charity.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2015 Hospices de Belleville  (Fleurie)

Description: From an small estate that also has vines in Chénas and Saint-Amour, this is a firmly tannic wine that also has attractive juicy red-berry fruits. The wine, still young, will repay aging allowing it to broaden out with rich fruit and a soft texture. Drink this cru from late 2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine de Roche Noire  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is one of several estates in this cru appellation where Georges Duboeuf makes and markets the wine. It is lightly wood aged to smooth out the ebullient fruits. Rich and with some firm tannins that will develop, it has concentration and a dense texture. Drink from 2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Château de Juliénas  (Juliénas)

Description: This cru estate is owned by the Duboeuf family. The wine has some wood aging that adds to the rich texture while not detracting from the ripe juicy red-cherry fruit. With its tannins, the wine could age, so drink from late 2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Château des Capitans  (Juliénas)

Description: From the south-east facing Côte du Py, this is a powerfully structured wine. It is as full of tannins as of ripe red fruits. The wine with its dense character it likely to age well over several years. Drink from 2018.
Designation: Domaine de Javernière Côte du Py
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine de Javernière Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Owned by the Darroze family, the cru wine from this estate is produced by Georges Duboeuf. It is a dense wine with balancing rich black fruits. Its spicy cherry-fruit flavor and rich tannins give a wine that should age further. Drink from 2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine des Quatres Vents  (Fleurie)

Description: This ripe and smooth wood-aged cru wine from small parcels on the south slope of 1,174-foot Côte du Py is now very approachable. It has generous tannins that are mature and with fine acidity and black-cherry fruits. The wine, concentrated and rich, is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Gaget 2014 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: A four-acre parcel of old vines is the source of this dense and rich wine. It has jammy red berry and cherry fruits that are lifted by the mineral texture and acidity. The wine is balanced although it does need to age. Drink from the end of 2017.
Name: Terroirs et Talents 2015 Clos de la Brosse  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Ripe perfumed black fruits dominate this cru wine. They float above the firm tannins and concentrated acidity to offer a wine that will become rich and generous as it develops. A touch of pepper and spice adds to the layers of fruit. Drink from 2018
Name: Pardon et Fils 2015 Les Mouilles  (Juliénas)

Description: Gérard Charvet took over Rosiers from his father in 1983 and remains focused on the art of vinification. A percentage (30%) of wood aging has give this ripe wine its dense texture. That contrasts with the generous black fruits that are still developing. This is a serious, dense wine that will age. Drink from 2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine des Rosiers  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A solid, structured cru wine with a fine line in tannins and black-cherry fruits. It is dense with a firm, dry core. Surrounding it are ripe fruits and acidity. A wine to keep a few more months, so drink from late 2017.
Name: Domaine des Vieilles Caves 2015  Saint-Amour

Description: Old vines, at least 40-years-old, are behind this ripely structured wine. It was wood aged to give the extra richness this producer looks for. With concentration and tannins, this cru will age. Drink from 2018.
Name: Stéphane Aviron 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: With its high elevation, it is logical that Chiroubles produces some of the coolest Beaujolais cru wines. This is fruity with a tang of acidity and a mineral texture that is enhanced by a crisp character. The wine has light tannins and a final juicy finish.
Name: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2015  Chiroubles
Winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

Description: A blend of wine that has been aged in tank and in wood, this is structured although with a great layer of juicy red fruits. The combination preserves the natural fruitiness of the wine while giving it the tannins to age. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Albert Bichot 2015 Roche Rose  (Brouilly)

Description: This is a seriously structured wine. It has layers of dark tannins over the juicy red-berry fruits. The wine has intense acidity at the same time as the complex tannins and fruit. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Jean-Paul Brun 2015  Saint-Amour

Description: From the oldest vines on the estate, this is a rich and full-bodied wine. It has plenty of the bright, full concentration that comes from old vines. At the same time it has attractive layers of ripe plum and blackberry fruits. Let this cru wine age a little and drink from 2018.
Name: Château de Javernand 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Chiroubles)

Description: Produced using natural indigenous yeasts, the wine is rich and firmly structured. It has dark tannins as well as generous black-cherry fruits. The wine is serious and complex without losing the cool, mineral texture of the cru appellation. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château de Javernand 2015 Indigène  (Chiroubles)

Description: Wood-aging flavors have given this cru wine a toasty character that balances its natural fruitiness. The structure and linear character of the wine is prominent. The red fruits and acidity come through slowly at the end. Drink from mid-2017.
Name: Domaine Labruyère 2013 Coeur de Terroirs  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Owner Dominique Morel has produced a firmly structured wine that wraps firm tannins and red-cherry fruits into a crisp parcel. It is still young, bursting with fruitiness. Drink this cru wine now for its fruit, but it's better to wait until the end of 2017.
Name: Domaine de Gry-Sablon 2015 Vieilles Vignes Gamay (Fleurie)

Description: Aged in large 130-gallon wood vats, this is Beaujolais made in a Burgundian style. It has ripe red fruits, a firm structure to allow aging and concentration. It will develop over the next two years to give a generous rich wine. This is Drouhin's second vintage of handling the vines, wines and marketing in partnership with the Hospices de Belleville charity. Drink from 2018.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2015 Hospices de Belleville  (Morgon)

Description: The wine comes from the La Madone vineyard just below the small chapel on the hill in Fleurie. It is a solid cru wine, with tannins and dark-berry fruits as well as acidity. There is a strong mineral element here, along with concentration and the ability to age. Drink from mid-2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 La Madone  (Fleurie)

Description: A rich and fruity wine that is ripe with black-plum fruits. It is soft and smooth, with a juicy berry character. The tannins act as a cushion to all this opulent fruit. It is an attractive cru wine, ready to drink from mid-2017.
Name: Trenel Fils 2015  Morgon

Description: Billards is the name of a small area of Saint-Amour. The cru wine from this vineyard is richly structured and packed with juicy black fruits. There is a mineral texture from the granite subsoil that gives the wine its structure. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Jean Loron 2015 Domaine des Billards  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Georges Duboeuf follows this cru estate, owned by the Meziat family, and produces the wine. It is a ripe wine, shot through with young, juicy acidity. There is structure as well as minerality to give the wine shape. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine des Pontheux  (Chiroubles)

Description: This is a fruity wine, full of red-cherry flavors. They are framed by the firmer texture and tannins that give the wine its character. The wine is delicious and crisp with a lively aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine des Marrans 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Chiroubles)

Description: The small Briante parcel in Annick and Jean-Marc Lafont's Brouilly vineyard has produced a fruity cherry-flavored wine. With hints of blueberry, and layers of tannin and acidity, it is still young. Let this cru soften from its total fruitiness and drink from late 2017.
Name: Domaine de Bel Air 2015 Briante  (Brouilly)

Description: The wine is fruity, bright and with cherry flavors. With its soft tannins and juicy acidity, it is a cru wine to drink young. The aftertaste is all fruit.
Name: Château de la Chaize 2015  Brouilly

Description: The wine is produced from a 15-acre parcel of 60-year-old vines. With concentration as well as juicy acidity, the wine is structured and needing to age for a few months. Red currant and berry fruits are shot through with a mineral aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine de Combiaty  (Brouilly)

Description: This is an especially rich wine. It has almost a surplus of structure and ripe black fruits. The powerful nature of the wine is balanced by the shot of acidity that keeps it crisp. The aftertaste is full bodied and likely to age for a while. Drink this cru from late 2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Juliénas)

Description: This is Drouhan's second vintage of handling the vines, wines and marketing in partnership with the Hospices de Belleville charity. This open generous wine is packed with ripe red fruit and given shape by light tannins. There is a fresh crisp aftertaste that gives the wine a great lift.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2015 Hospices de Belleville  (Brouilly)

Description: A soft and fruity wine that has lively acidity and light tannins. The wine is finely balanced, full of red-cherry flavors. It's an immediately attractive, ripe cru wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine les Capréoles 2015 Chamodère  (Régnié)

Description: The estate is located to the north west of the village of Fleurie, further into the hills. The wine is structured and tannic with layers of red berries and tight acidity. It will need to soften for a few months, so drink from late 2017.
Name: Henry Fessy 2015 Château des Labourons  (Fleurie)

Description: From dark granite soil, this wine is structured and concentrated. It has ripe black-cherry fruit and spice that add to the mineral texture and firm tannins in the background. Drink this cru wine from late 2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Fruity and juicy, this is an immediately attractive cru wine. With its ripe berry fruits and soft tannins, it has a good depth of flavor that gives it richness. The wine, with its crisp fruitiness, is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2015  Régnié
Winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

Description: From the south facing Côte du Py, this oak-aged wine is full of ripe fruit that is given a crisp edge by the acidity. Lightly textured, the wine is tight, mineral and likely to age. Jean-Ludovic Loron is the cru property's fifth generation. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine des Gaudets 2015 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Named after the sector in the Morgon cru where this wine comes from, it is ripe and balanced with acidity and solid tannins as well as juicy blackberry fruits. The wine needs to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine de Gry-Sablon 2015 Douby  (Morgon)

Description: Named after the little lizards that come out in the summer, the cru wine is attractive and fruity. With acidity as well as plenty of red fruits, it is soft and cool. Drink the wine now.
Name: Château de Javernand 2015 Les Gatilles  (Chiroubles)

Description: From one of the many cru estates that are run by Beaujolais merchant Georges Duboeuf, this wine is smooth, generous and juicy. It has red-cherry fruit that is surrounded by some firm tannins as well as juicy acidity. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine de Javernière  (Morgon)

Description: This is a romantic conjunction of names. The cru wine is silky and smooth, with integrated tannins and red-cherry fruit. It is bright and crisply textured, ready to drink from mid-2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine du Paradis  (Saint-Amour)

Description: This cru wine comes from a 44-acre vineyard with 50-year-old vines supplied by one of Duboeuf's regular growers. It is structured and dense, perhaps too dense with its heavy dry tannins. The wine will need time. Drink from 2019.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine Mont Chavy  (Morgon)

Description: Full of crisp fruit, this cru wine is bright with red-berry flavors. It is light and with a cool character that comes from the high altitude of the vineyards. There is an edgy texture that keeps the wine together. Drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Chiroubles)

Description: A floral wine, full of ripe black-cherry fruit and with a firm structure that sustains the wine. This cru wine is rich, still developing, still with enough tannins and acidity to allow it to age further. Drink this attractive wine from mid-2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Fleurie)

Description: From an estate enveloping a magnificent medieval castle, this is a lightly structured cru wine with red cherry and berry flavors. It has a backdrop of tannins and acidity that give it structure. The wine is ripe and fruity at the end and ready to drink.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2015  Brouilly

Description: This is a dense wine, packed with both tannins and acidity. It brings out the ageworthiness of this appellation with its rich potential and dark mineral texture. Drink this concentrated cru wine from 2018.
Name: Henry Fessy 2015  Juliénas

Description: The wine comes from one of the cru estates followed by this negociant house. It is a light, ripe and fruity wine. With its attractive red-berry flavors, finished with crisp acidity, it is accessible and ready to drink.
Name: Henry Fessy 2015  Régnié

Description: This estate has been producing wine in Morgon since the 11th century. The wine comes from structured granite soil in a blend of different parcels. It has a strong mineral elements as well as layers of ripe black-cherry fruits. There is just a hint of banana that does spoil the full effect of the wine and hopefully will blow away as it ages. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château de Pizay 2015  Morgon

Description: Based in the village of Beaujeu, this producer has made a dense wine that needs time for the fruits to develop. It is juicy with acidity that is beginning to show through the tannins. Give this cru wine time and drink starting from 2018.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2015 Domaine Pardon Vieilles Vignes  (Fleurie)

Description: With its hint of acidity along with the textured fruit, this is a fruity wine that is balanced between richness and crispness. It has a light tannic structure that gives the wine its shape and ability to age for a few more months before drinking. Drink from mid-2017.
Name: Trenel Fils 2015  Côte de Brouilly

Description: This cru is a structured wine that is full of dry tannins. It has hints of the typically Morgon dark-cherry fruit underneath along with acidity. It is likely to remain a firm wine. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2015  Morgon
Winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

Description: Almost too rich, this wine comes from obviously superripe grapes with dense tannins and acidity. It has structure and the potential to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Trenel Fils 2015 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Produced from cru vines at the base of Mount Brouilly, the wine has structure as well as ripe black-plum fruits. It is generous and its fruit is well balanced by acidity and solid tannins. The wines is ready to drink.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2015 Les Quartelets  (Brouilly)

Description: This is a fruity wine, packed with red-berry flavors. It is lightly textured and with plenty of acidity to keep it crisp. This wine, from the cru property's fifth generation, is going to mature over the next few months, so drink from mid-2017.
Name: Domaine des Gaudets 2015  Morgon

Description: This is an early drinking style of wine. It is warm and ripe with attractive soft tannins and plenty of red fruits and balancing acidity. The wine will just need to calm its bubbly fruitiness and will be ready to drink during late 2017.
Name: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2015 L'Ecluse  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: From one of the top vineyard areas in Morgon, the wine is dense and full of red-berry fruits. It has concentration and a firm background of tannins. The cru wine needs to age further, so drink from 2018.
Name: Ferraud et Fils 2015 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: The cru wine is soft, full of cherry fruits and with a light touch of tannin. With its fruit, it is open and generous with a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine Du Riaz  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: From the smallest of the Beaujolais crus, this wine is structured, layering tannins with black fruits and acidity. It is a wine to age at least for a couple of years. Drink from 2018.
Name: Henry Fessy 2015  Chénas

Description: A solidly structured wine with fine tannins and ripe red-berry fruits. The acidity adds a piquancy to the fruitiness giving the wine a lift. The wine comes from Henry Fesse vines. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Henry Fessy 2015  Chiroubles

Description: An attractive, lightly structured cru wine that has juicy cherry fruits. It is balanced, ripe with acidity and gentle tannins in equal measure. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Henry Fessy 2015  Morgon

Description: A rounded and soft wine that has juicy red fruits and gentle tannins. It just hints at a dry structure that will allow it to age for several months. Drink this attractive cru wine from late 2017.
Name: Henry Fessy 2015  Saint-Amour

Description: This grand estate was once a hunting ground for an even grander nearby chateau. The cru wine that's now produced here is crisp and fruity, streaked through with acidity and red currants. It has a touch of tannin as well as minerality. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Château de Nervers  (Brouilly)

Description: This is a family-owned estate whose wines is made by Georges Duboeuf. It is structured and firmly concentrated, more tannin than fruit. That gives the wine a lean character that seems to miss out on fleshy and fruit. Give it a little time and drink from late 2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Clos des Quatres Vents  (Fleurie)

Description: Light and only gently structured, this is a cru wine that is more about juicy red fruits. It has attractive acidity and a touch of spice. It is likely to be ready to drink in the next few months, certainly by mid-2017.
Name: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Léon  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is a ripe, soft and rich cru wine. With its attractive cherries and gentle tannic structure, it is fruity and easy. The acidity that comes through at the end gives the wine a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Paul Brun 2015 Pisse Vieille  (Brouilly)

Description: Vines over 50-years-old give a concentrated cru wine. It is ripe with berry fruits topped by spice. Fruity and likely to develop quickly, it is an attractive wine to drink young from mid-2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine du Pourpre  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: While it misses out on the firmer side of the Morgon cru, this is a robust ripe wine. It has attractive red-cherry fruit and juicy acidity. The structure will allow it to age for a few more months, so drink from late 2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Morgon)

Description: A structured cru wine, full of firm tannins. It is a bold ripe wine with black-cherry fruit, a hint of banana and juicy acidity. The wine comes from a single 30-acre vineyard. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: In its traditional Beaujolais bottle, like the one-pint pot that was served in local restaurants, this is a soft and fruity wine. It has classic red-cherry fruits and light tannins. The aftertaste is juicy with just a hint of banana.
Name: Château de Corcelles 2015  Brouilly

Description: Planted around a 12th-century fortress, the vines of this estate have given a crisp wine with red-berry fruit. Along with its fruit, the wine has fine bright acidity and a core of dryer tannins. Like most cru wines from Beaujolais's biggest appellation, it is ready to drink now.
Name: Château des Tours 2015  Brouilly

Description: This nine-acre property has produced a fruity wine that has only the lightest tannins. It is much more to do with red cherries, red currants and crisp acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine de la Martingale  (Brouilly)

Description: Structured and dense, the wine is dominated by its tannins. With a dry core and only the hints of real fruitiness, it is likely to take a while to develop. Final acidity provides hints of a fruitier future. Drink from 2018.
Name: Terroirs et Talents 2015 Pierre Dupond Les Grands Cras  (Morgon)

Description: Produced from Henry Fessy's own cru vineyards, the wine is fruity and very accessible to drink young. Generous berry fruits and soft tannins make this an attractive wine. The aftertaste brings in light acidity. Drink now.
Name: Henry Fessy 2015  Brouilly

Description: The wine comes from vineyards surrounding a stylish 19th-century chateau. With its bright red-berry fruit, the wine is crisp and only lightly structured. It is a cru wine to drink soon to appreciate its fruitiness.
Name: Jean Loron 2015 Château de Bellevue  (Brouilly)

Description: Ripe and fruity, this is a soft cru wine full of cherry and red-berry flavors. It has an acid core firmed up by a smattering of tannins. Mainly though it is a lively, crisp wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Maison des Bulliats 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Régnié)

Description: This is an open light wine. It has some attractive tannins as well as red-berry fruits. With its structure, it will age for several more months to give a fuller wine—hopefully with the richness that is missing at the moment. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Ferraud et Fils 2015 Domaine Rolland  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Cool and crisp with red-currant fruits, this is a fruity wine that also has layers of acidity. It has a tight mineral texture that balances the fruit. Drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: This bright wine has red fruit and just the hint of structure. It is still young, still bursting with energy. The tannins will develop quickly to give a crisp, fruity wine. Drink from mid-2017.
Name: Domaine des Marrans 2015 Corcelette  (Morgon)

Description: The wine is soft and fruity. Red berry and cherry flavors have a hint of banana as well as the layers of crisp acidity. Drink this fresh wine now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Brouilly)

Description: The wine is tight with acidity and red-currant fruits. It has structure and tannins as well as the fruitiness. That means the cru needs to age a few months, so drink from mid-2017.
Name: Henry Fessy 2015  Côte de Brouilly

Description: The cru wine is tight, missing out on what should be its fruitiness. It has some tough dry tannins that are not showing signs of softening.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Château de Saint-Amour  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Planted in 1935, this single vineyard wine is rich and structured. At this stage, it is dominated by firm tannins as much as by the perfumed juicy black fruits. As the wine softens with age, this generous fruitiness will comet through to give a deliciously ripe wine. Drink from 2019.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2015 1935 Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: The wine's name (“last breath”) is based on its origins in vines planted next to a cemetery. Putting that aside, the wine itself is impressive, richly structured and with dense tannins and concentration. The wine with its firm character and ripe black fruit will age. Drink starting from 2019.
Name: Richard Rottiers 2015 Dernier Souffle  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: The wine comes from the Côte de Py, regarded as the finest site in Morgon. It has produced a rich mineral-textured wine. The structure is balanced by fine acidity and generous fruitiness. Red berries and cherry flavors are sustained by the firm tannins that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2015 Côte de Py  (Morgon)

Description: The producer has several parcels in Moulin-à-Vent which go into this blend. It is a firm and structured wine at this stage: dense and with both spice and black fruits. It is obviously made for some long aging, so don't drink this serious wine before 2019.
Name: Richard Rottiers 2015  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Vinified without sulphur, this wine is all about fruit. It has red-berry flavors, ripe tannins and just the right amount of acidity to keep everything bright and fruity. The structure at this stage needs to soften and this fine, ripe wine will be better starting from 2018.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2015 Les Roches  (Fleurie)

Description: The aging potential of wines from this Beaujolais cru are apparent in this firm and structured wine. Dense with black fruits and with a mineral texture, it is a powerful wine from 70-yearold bush vines. The aftertaste with its acidity and dry edge confirms the aging, so drink from 2018.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2015 Les Thorins  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: The wine is pure fruit, deliciously perfumed and with a rounded ripe character. It has acidity and structure although these are just supports for the bright fruits. The acidity at the end will allow it to age further, so drink from 2019.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2014 Le Griottier  (Morgon)

Description: This is a beautifully perfumed wine, ripe with black fruits and generous with its tannins and acidity. It comes from a one-acre parcel called Le Vivier which has 70-year-old vines. It is concentrated, dense and with aging potential. Drink from 2018.
Name: Yohan Lardy 2015 Le Vivier  (Fleurie)

Description: Originally from a single wooden vat (number five), the wine is a selection from a parcel of 55-year-old vines. It is concentrated and dense, showing considerable aging potential. Dark fruits, acidity and spice come together to produce a rich, concentrated wine. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Robert Perroud 2015 Foudre No 5  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: With the same winemaking team as Bouchard Père et Fils in Burgundy, this wine is rich and generous. It has great red fruits and hints of the toast from the wood aging of part of the wine. It is a generous wine that will age well over the next year, so drink from late 2017.
Name: Villa Ponciago 2015 La Réserve  (Fleurie)

Description: Produced from 45-year-old vines, this is a fruity ripe wine. It has concentration and some firm tannins as well a generous black-fruit character. The wine's acidity and structure will allow it to age another year, so drink from late 2017.
Name: Fabien Collonge 2015 L'Aurore des Côtes  (Chiroubles)

Description: Long barrel aging has given this wine an extra richness. That supplements the ripe red fruits and intense acidity. The result is a wine that is bright with a spice and floral character. The aftertaste brings out crispness and some minerality. Ready to drink now.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2014 Les Chênes  (Fleurie)

Description: This is Yohan Lardy's top wine, produced from vines planted in 1903. Dark and dense although shot with acidity, the wine is firm and concentrated. It layers a floral character with minerality and black fruits. The wine needs to age further, so drink from 2018.
Name: Yohan Lardy 2014 Vieilles Vignes de 1903  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: The wine is structured and with intense acidity and a tight texture. A mineral character goes through the wine, contrasting with the red fruit. It is a serious wine that will repay aging, so drink from 2018. This organic vineyard is switching to biodynamic.
Name: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2014 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: Named after the cherry trees that edge this vineyard, the wine is rich and structured. It has concentrated butts and ripe black-cherry flavors. Full bodied and with an aging potential, this fine wine should be drunk from 2018.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2015 Les Cerisiers Vieilles Vignes  (Juliénas)

Description: This is a wine that comes from a parcel of 15 acres, grown on pink granite rock. Vines that are 67 years old have given this firm wine its concentration and density. Generous, full of black fruits, the wine is developing although it needs more time. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Domaine de Grand Garant 2015 Le Vivier  (Fleurie)

Description: A two-acre parcel of 75-year-old vines is the source of this jewel of a wine. It is ripe, full bodied and packed with dark fruits. The tannins and the structure promise some aging. Concentrated from the old vines and with a mineral, tight texture, the wine will take its time to be ready. Drink from 2018.
Name: Les Frères Perroud 2014 Améthyste  (Brouilly)

Description: Volcanic ash over granite gives this vineyard its structured character, which carries over into this wine. Wood aged in large barrels, it has a rich firm character that will allow the wine to develop. Powered by acidity and tannins, the ripe black fruits are juicy and concentrated. Drink this wine from 2018.
Name: Laurent Gauthier 2015 Grand Cras  (Morgon)

Description: This is a structured and still firm wine. It has black fruits, some solid tannins and concentration. The acidity and the tight mineral texture both indicate an aging potential. The wine is named after the Roman emperor, Probus, who brought the Gamay grape to Beaujolais. Drink from 2018.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2014 Probus  (Juliénas)

Description: The vineyard lies within sight of the Mâcon region of southern Burgundy on granite soil. This is a powerful, structured wine with strong minerality as well as acidity. It is a wine for aging, its bright red fruits and acidity needing time. Drink from 2018.
Name: Patrick Tranchand 2014 Roche Grès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is a firm wine, balancing some solid tannins with ripe red fruits. Still young, it is packed with fruitiness and with acidity that are centered around a firm core. Drink this stylish wine from 2018.
Name: Domaine Franck Besson 2014 Le Griottier  (Juliénas)

Description: The medieval chateau of Juliénas is surrounded by vines. This oak-aged wine is rich, smooth and spicy. It is structured with some firm tannins and fine acidity. At the same time, the rich fruit gives the wine a generous, full character. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Château de Juliénas 2014 Cuvée Prestige  (Juliénas)

Description: A firmly tannic wine that has great spice and a solid structure. It is rich and fruity with acidity supporting the generous black fruits. With its density and structure, the wine will certainly age well. Drink from 2018.
Name: Patrick Tranchand 2014 Poncié  (Fleurie)

Description: This wine comes from a small parcel of 70-year-old vines within the Deschamps vineyard. It has great concentration and a dense structure. That contrasts with the complex black fruit and ripe berry flavors. Wood aging has smoothed the fruity edges. Drink this wine from late 2017.
Name: Yohan Lardy 2015 Les Deschamps  (Chénas)

Description: Named after one of the best vineyards of Moulin-à-Vent, the wine is dark and dense with ripe black fruits and a generous texture. It has blackberry flavors, laced with acidity and structured still with some tannins. Drink from late 2017.
Designation: Vieilles Vignes Hommage à La Rochelle
Name: Domaine Gerard Charvet 2015 Vieilles Vignes Hommage à La Rochelle  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: The northernmost Beaujolais cru of Saint-Amour is also the smallest, giving wines that are structured like this. It is a firm wine, made from 55-year-old vines (his youngest vines, says the producer) and with density as well as smooth red-fruit flavors. The wine will be ready to drink from late 2017.
Name: Patrick Tranchand 2015 Coeur de Gamay  (Saint-Amour)

Description: These are definitely old vines, at nearly 100 years of age. The wine from this impeccable producer is juicy with great fruitiness and rich red-cherry flavors. It has fine acidity and light tannins. As befits a wine from Regnié, it is likely to age easily and with fine fruit. Drink from 2017.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2015 Haute Ronze Vieilles Vignes  (Régnié)

Description: Vines on the slope of the Brouilly hill give a firmly structured wine. It is has a fine sense of balance between the tannins and the bright black-cherry fruits. Rich and crisp with acidity, it is going to be a wine that brings out so much fruitiness as it matures. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Emmanuel Fellot 2014 Les Cailloux  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: This is a firm, still very young wine from a Beaujolais cru that needs to age. So its tannins are still to the fore, although black fruits are in the background ready to push forward over the next year. The juicy acidity at the end is already attractive. Drink from 2018.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Morgon)

Description: Aged in large oak barrels, the wine is soft and fruity. It has juicy red cherry and red-berry fruits that give the wine a crisp, bright and lively character. The wood aging and the tannins fill the wine out bringing spice and a touch of vanilla. At the end, it is acidity that promises some aging. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Château de Juliénas 2014 Cuvée Tradition  (Juliénas)

Description: A selection from the oldest vines on the estate, this is a firm, ripe and concentrated fruity wine. Red cherries dominate the wine, lifted by the crisp edge of acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château de Javernand 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Chiroubles)

Description: The wine is still young with its crisp red fruits and tense tannins. It is a structured wine, firm with a dry core and still developing its fruitiness. It will need to age a while yet, so drink from 2018.
Name: Yohan Lardy 2015 Les Michelons  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This three-acre parcel has produced a beautiful fruity wine. With red cherry and spice flavors, the wine is perfumed and juicy. Crisp acidity shoots through the attractive fruit to give a wine that is only lightly tannic and ready to drink.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2015 En Rémont Vignes de 1939  (Chénas)

Description: Named after the steeply sloping vineyard, the wine is cool, crisp with tight cherry flavors. It is lined with acidity and some tannins. The wine will need another few months to soften out and become richer.
Name: Robert Perroud 2015 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

Description: From the northernmost of the Beaujolais cru villages, this is a ripe and full wine. With rich cherry flavors and just enough acidity, the wine is lightly structured with some dry tannins. It is ready to drink.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2014 Collection  (Saint-Amour)

Description: While it is still young, the wine is showing great fruit and soft tannins. Juicy black cherries are ripe and full, a sign of the fine vintage. With the acidity and the dry core, the wine should age. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine Gerard Charvet 2015 La Réserve d'Amélie  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Produced from organically grown grapes, the wine is soft, ripe and full of fruit. Red cherries dominate, with a touch of wood from the 12 months of barrel aging. It has a bright, crisp and juicy aftertaste.
Name: Robert Perroud 2014 En Saburin Cuvée Romain  (Brouilly)

Description: Organically grown grapes went into this perfumed wine. It is fruity, crisp with bright cherry flavors and lifted with acidity. The wine is still developing, still bringing its tannins to the fore. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2014 Côte de Py  (Morgon)

Description: The vines around Chiroubles are some of the highest in Beaujolais. That gives wines with a structure, although here, this structure has been lost in the heavy fruit. It is very full, rich and with black-cherry flavors. Drink from 2017.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Chiroubles)

Description: The wine has tannins and a stalky black-cherry character. With a firm texture and balanced acidity, the wine is developing although it is not yet ready to drink. Wait until 2017.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Juliénas)

Description: A bright and juicy wine from this often easygoing appellation. The red-cherry fruitiness and attractive acidity make for a wine that is rounded and ripe. It is ready to drink, crisp and fruity at the end.
Name: Les Frères Perroud 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)

Description: This is a rich wine that is full of generous fruit. It has a smooth texture with its broad red-fruit character that is gently lifted by acidity. Ripe and with a soft texture, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Pascal Berthier 2015 Esprit de Séduction  (Saint-Amour)

Description: This is described as a natural wine with zero sulphite. It has a perfumed character with an earthy edge that comes from the carbonic maceration (whole bunch fermentation). With cherry fruits and bright acidity, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château de Javernand 2014 Indigène  (Chiroubles)

Description: A soft and fruity wine, this is ripe with dark cherry and spice flavors. A hint of bananas from the fermentation spoils the rest of the ripe fruitiness of this ready-to-drink wine.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2014 Collection  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: This wine, made from organically grown grapes, is ripe, full of red-cherry fruits and soft tannins. It is an immediately attractive wine, packed with fruitiness and ready to drink. The village of Leynes is on the border between Beaujolais and Macon.
Name: Château de Lavernette 2014 Cuvée Jadis Le Clos  (Beaujolais-Leynes)

Description: The high elevation of Chiroubles has produced a crisp, cool and stylish wine. It has juicy cherry fruit and bright acidity. The wine is developing quickly and will be ready to drink from early 2017.
Name: Laurent Gauthier 2015 Chatenay  (Chiroubles)

Description: Named after the small grey lizards that are common in Beaujolais, this is bright and friendly wine. It is soft with red fruits and balanced acidity. Perfumed and fruity, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château de Javernand 2014 Les Gatilles  (Chiroubles)

Description: Too alcoholic for its own good, the wine is full bodied and heavy. It has tannins, superripe black fruits while missing structure and acidity. It is developing fast and will be ready to drink from 2017.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A fruity wine with soft tannins that is ready to drink. It has banana, red cherry and light spice flavors, finished off with attractive acidity.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2014 Collection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This wine comes from the historic walled vineyard around the Château des Bachelards in Fleurie. It is floral, dense and spicy, rich with pepper, concentrated spice and tannins. With its dark character and still-firm tannins, the wine needs more time, so drink from 2017.
Name: Château des Bachelards 2014 Le Clos Gamay (Comtés Rhodaniens)

Description: This is an impressive, while unusual, take on the Gamay as grown in Beaujolais. It is spicy and minty, with the long wood aging giving a rich, smooth texture to the red-cherry flavors. It needs another few months, so drink from late 2017.
Name: Château des Bachelards 2014 Gamay (Comtés Rhodaniens)

Description: From biodynamically grown grapes, this is a concentrated wine with mint and spice flavors as well as tight red fruits. It comes from vines situated in the Moulin-à-Vent appellation, giving the typical mineral character from the granite soil as well as the structure. The wine will be ready to drink from 2017.
Name: Château des Bachelards 2014 Le Bérac Gamay (Comtés Rhodaniens)

Description: This is the first vintage at this Fleurie property by new owner Alexandra de Vazeilles. It is rich, full of red fruits with considerable acidity. Hints of the 12 months wood aging show in the spice and smoothness at the end. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château des Bachelards 2014 Grand Vin Gamay (Comtés Rhodaniens)

Description: Gamay from the Beaujolais region is blended with 10% Pinot Noir in this light and fruity wine. It has gentle tannins and forward red-cherry fruits. The wine is soft and ready to drink.
Name: Domaines Devillard 2014 Le Renard  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is a red pét-nat wine made using the old sparkling method in which the wine is given its first and only fermentation in bottle. It's a simple method that produces large bubbles. It is stalky with acidity and a smoky character that contrasts with red fruits. The aftertaste is crisp and fresh.
Name: Domaine Patrice Colin NV Perles Rouges Gamay (Vin de France)

Description: The wine has just the right density and weight for a Morgon. It comes from an 18-acre vineyard that gives a dark rich wine that is packed with tannins as well as black-cherry fruit. It is a complex wine, firm while also fruity. Drink starting from 2017.
Name: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2015 Corcelette  (Morgon)

Description: Black-cherry fruit and a soft tannic structure give this wine its fruity but firm character. It has plenty of ripe generous fruitiness that is sustained by the acidity and by the solid core of the wine. Drink starting from 2017.
Name: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine de Rochegès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Densely planted vines on a 4.5-acre parcel create this impressive, richly perfumed wine. It has structure and some solid tannins along with juicy black fruits. The wine is still young, and although drinkable now will be so much better starting from 2017.
Name: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2015 Grand-Pré  (Fleurie)

Description: From the most northern of the Beaujolais cru villages, this wine is rich and dense. It has a firm structure as well as black-currant fruits that bring out acidity as well as richness. There is a fine juicy aftertaste that is balanced with the final concentration.
Name: Mommessin 2014 Grandes Mises  (Saint-Amour)

Description: This is a ripe wine that's also fresh and fruity. It has some structured tannins, along with a dense texture. At the same time, the red cherry and blueberry fruits have a crisp edge that finishes the wine with fine acidity. While the charity Hospices of Belleville owns land as part of its foundation, the wines are made by Beaune négociant Joseph Drouhin. Drink from 2017.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2014 Domaine des Hospices de Belleville  (Fleurie)

Description: The wine is dense and structured. It has concentrated red-berry fruits that are backed up by firm tannins as well as acidity. The wine is ripe, still young and with its structure, it will be better from 2017. The charity Hospices of Belleville owns land as part of its foundation, with the wines being made by Beaune negociant Joseph Drouhin
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2014 Domaine des Hospices de Belleville  (Morgon)

Description: This is juicy, full of red-berry flavors that are balanced with attractive tannins and acidity. It has some concentration from the old vines, planted in 1951, that gives the wine considerable depth and richness. This is one of those Beaujolais that could age through 2022, although it's very drinkable now.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2015 Vignes de 1951  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: The charity Hospices of Belleville owns the land as part of its foundation, with the wines being made by Beaune negociant Joseph Drouhin. This wine is attractively fruity and soft. With its red-cherry and lightly spiced flavors, which are cut with acidity, it has a fine balanced texture, finishing with bright red-fruit acidity. Drink now.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2014 Domaine des Hospices de Belleville  (Brouilly)

Description: A finely perfumed wine that is now at its peak. It still has tannins along with rich black-cherry fruit and a dense texture. It also has ripe juicy berry and black-currant fruits that are totally ready to enjoy. Drink now.
Designation: Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup Le Regard de l'Ange
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2013 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup Le Regard de l'Ange  (Fleurie)

Description: The Tête family is well known in Beaujolais both as vineyard owners and as wine merchants. This wine comes from a family-owned vineyard close to Juliénas. It is fruity and ripe with a rich texture and warm tannins. Perfumed and with fine acidity, it is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2015 La Roche  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: From vines at La Sambinerie in Romanèche-Thorins, this ripe fruity wine is rich and full-bodied. It has spice, light tannins and juicy black-cherry fruits. With acidity and structure at the end, it is a fine wine, ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Richard Rottiers 2015 La Sambinerie  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: The wine is dense with both tannins and black cherry fruit. It has structure, some fine concentration and plenty of acidity to sustain the rich fruits. It is a rich wine and could age further, so drink from 2017.
Name: Florent Descombe 2015  Juliénas

Description: The Gelin family has produced a rich style of wine, full of red-berry and cherry fruit. The wine is concentrated and full-bodied, giving a deliciously ripe character. The tannins are there adding support and extra density. Drink now.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This is a delicious, ripe and fruity wine that comes from the south of Beaujolais. It has ripe red-berry fruits and soft tannins allied to a juicy acidity that keeps it all fresh. Drink now.
Name: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2015 L'Ancien  (Beaujolais)

Description: This is a rich and full-bodied wine. While it is certainly packed with crunchy cherry flavors, it also has a more tannic and structured side giving it a firm texture to back up the fruitiness. The aftertaste is juicy and ripe.
Name: Domaine de Roche-Guillon 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: These ancient vines provide a rich and succulent wine. Ripe black cherries and rich fruit are enhanced by the tannins and concentrated texture. It is a wine that will age, although it is ready to drink. Drink until 2022.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2015 Vignes de 1940  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Produced from a selection of old vines, this is a structured firm wine. Its black-cherry fruits and acidity are well integrated into the dense structure to give a spicy wine that is richly packed with fruits. Drink now and until 2020.
Name: Domaine Chaintreuil 2014 La Madone Vieilles Vignes  (Fleurie)

Description: The seven-acre domaine is on the east side of the village, facing south. This fruity while lightly structured wine is packed with red-cherry fruit as well as fine juicy acidity. The structure is just right for the fruitiness of this gently wood-aged wine. Drink now.
Name: Vincent 2014 Domaine de la Conseillère  (Juliénas)

Description: The 16th-century chateau of Saint Lager is on the slopes of the local landmark hill of Brouilly. The wine comes from vines below. It has spice, cherry and blueberry fruits with attractive acidity. The wine, still with a strong tannic edge, will be better from 2017.
Name: Château de Pizay 2015 Château de Saint Lager  (Brouilly)

Description: This is a ripe and structured wine of red fruits and fine acidity. With its tannins and tangy edge, it has a dry core that gives it a great chance with food.
Name: Domaine des Marrans 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This fine producer, based in Morgon, has made a rich and structured wine. With its perfumed red-berry fruits and balanced acidity, it is a savory wine that is ripe and ready to drink.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Based in the village of Lancié in the heart of the Beaujolais crus, this producer has made a ripe wine that is full of black-cherry fruits and balanced tannins. It is concentrated and ripe, perfumed with a fresh, crisp aftertaste.
Name: Domaine André Collonge 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This is a surprisingly powerful wine, with (for a Beaujolais) a high alcohol. Densely textured, the wine is concentrated and dark with plenty of acidity as well as strawberry fruits. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2017.
Name: Domaine Cordier Père et Fils 2015 Cuvée Juliette Louise  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: The Hospices is a charitable organization that has vines in Beaujolais. The wine is ripe with some tannins as well as red fruits. With its structure and concentration, it could age another few months, so wait until 2017.
Designation: Domaine des Hospices Civils de Lyon
Name: Collin-Bourisset 2015 Domaine des Hospices Civils de Lyon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Rich, dense and concentrated this is a ready-to-drink structured wine. It has blackberry fruits along with acidity and a touch of pepper. The tannins are firm, sustaining the wine so that it can age further. Drink now and until 2020.
Name: Mommessin 2013 Domaine de Champ de Cour  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is a ripe and fruity wine that is also structured. It has tannins that lift the red-berry fruits and spice flavors. With concentration as well as acidity, it should be aged another few months. Drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2015  Beaujolais-Villages
Winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

Description: A single-vineyard wine, this is soft and ripe. It has strong black-cherry fruit and crisp acidity. Minerality from the granite soil of the vineyard gives the wine a tight, firm texture. It could do with a few more months before drinking, so wait until early 2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine des Côtes du Berchoux  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A ripe wine that has some good tannins as well as rich black fruits. With a gentle shot of acidity, it is warm and full bodied. The structure will allow the wine to age further and it will be even better from 2017.
Name: Manoir du Carra 2015 Cuvée Non-Filtré  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Produced from a small parcel of old vines, this is a crisp and fresh wine. With red-cherry fruit and acidity, it is a bright wine, up-front with its fruitiness and lively aftertaste.
Name: Jean-Michel Dupré 2015 Terre Noire Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Based in Fleurie, this producer has made a wine rich in fruit and tannins. It has a smoky spicy character as well as intense red fruits. It is warm, concentrated and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Berrod 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: The wine is built with a tannic structure that gives density. Red fruits vie with the dry tannins and acidity to produce a firm wine that could still age another few months. Drink starting from 2017.
Name: Mommessin 2013 Domaine de la Presle  (Fleurie)

Description: Produced from old vines on the Chatelard estate, this wine is smooth, ripe and full of vibrant red fruits. There is a good balance between acidity and rich fruit with just a light core of tannins in the background. Drink now.
Name: Château du Châtelard 2015 Cuvée les Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Régnié, is the newest of the Beaujolais cru village appellations. The grapes come from vines owned by the chateau, giving a wine that is all about ripe fruit and some firm tannins. It is still developing and will be better from 2017.
Name: Château de Pizay 2015  Régnié

Description: This is young, bold and fruity. It has black-cherry fruit that bursts from the glass giving a spicy character to the tannins and juicy acidity. The wine is ripe, full of delicious fruit and likely to be ready to drink from early 2017.
Name: Domaine Dubost 2015 Cuvée Monthieux  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Producer Jacky Gauthier has made a ripe wine that is full of black-cherry fruit. It has structure and acidity both suggesting the wine should age another few months to bring out its potential richness. Drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine de Colette 2015 Coteaux de Colette  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Red-berry fruits and a full-bodied texture form the hallmark of this ripe wine. It has spice, a rich character that is generous and fruity. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Louis Jadot 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: The wine is almost too rich for a Beaujolais. However, it is ripe and fruity and immediately drinkable, full of juicy black fruits and soft tannins.
Name: Cave Château de Chénas 2015 Coeur de Granit  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is an impressively rich wine for a simple Beaujolais. It has plenty of fruit, while it also has a good depth with ripe red-berry fruits and some well-integrated tannins.
Name: Collin-Bourisset 2015  Beaujolais

Description: A structured and concentrated wine that is packed with tannins. It does have some black fruit under this dry structure although the wine misses out on richness. It will be ready to drink from 2017.
Designation: Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup Le Regard de l'Ange
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2013 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup Le Regard de l'Ange  (Morgon)

Description: There are some fine, dry tannins in this wine along the dark cherry fruit and acidity. It comes from a single vineyard part of the 61-acre estate of Jean-Paul Dubost. There is a ripe feeling here; drink this balanced wine now.
Name: Domaine Dubost 2015 Climat le Tracot  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is an attractive, juicy fruity wine With its red-cherry flavors, it is smooth and perfumed. There is just the right amount of acidity to keep the freshness right up front. Drink now.
Name: Château des Pertonnières 2015 Côteau Belle-Vue  (Beaujolais)

Description: This is a structured, dense wine that has fine acidity as well as rich red berry fruits. It is balanced now and ripe with layered fruit and tannin. The aftertaste is juicy and perfumed.
Name: Domaine de la Madone 2015 Le Perreon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This negociant wine is soft, ripe and smoothly textured. It has a fine balance between acidity and the rich red cherry fruit. With its edge of tannins, it has a good structure that gives it shape. Drinkable now.
Name: Stéphane Aviron 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: The wine is structured and with a tannic edge to shape up the red fruits. It has the concentration of old vines that is good. Rich and full in the mouth, this is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine des Marrans 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: Densely planted 20-year-old vines provide the fruit for this wine. With its layer of tannins over the red fruits and acidity, it is fruity while having structure. Drink now.
Name: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2015 Le Ronsay  (Beaujolais)

Description: This is a textured wine from a six-acre vineyard. It has fine tannins as well as red-plum skin and red-berry fruits. It is balanced and fruity although the texture does give it a tangy edge that should soften out from 2017.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2015 Quatre Saisons  (Beaujolais)

Description: Ripe, soft and fruity, this is a black-cherry-flavored wine. It has a good balance between the fruit and the crisp acidity, giving a wine that is both rich and bursting with fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Florent Descombe 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: From vines around the medieval castle, this wine has brilliant cherry flavors that give fruitiness and balancing acidity. There is a refreshing juicy character that is sustained by the subtle touch of tannin. Drink the wine now.
Name: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 Château de Chanzé  (Beaujolais)

Description: Produced from vineyard around the 13th-century castle, the wine has concentration, rich tannins and ripe berry fruit. Pepper and spice bring out the texture of the wine that is freshened by acidity.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is a concentrated wine—firm and structured with tannins. It has delicious red fruits, spice and a fine bite of acidity at the end. Produced on the Corcelles estate, it is a wine to age a few more months, so drink from 2017.
Name: Château de Corcelles 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A small portion of this producer's vineyard, predominantly in three of the crus, is in Beaujolais-Villages. He has produced a small-production structured wine with noticeable tannins as well as ripe, juicy red fruits. Drink now.
Name: Château Gaillard 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A bright cherry and banana flavored wine, this is fresh and fruity. It has a light structure that helps to keep it all together along with the acidity for final crispness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de la Prébende 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: This is a ripe wine with black-cherry fruit and some firm tannins. It is just now mature, packed with vivid fruit and acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2014  Fleurie

Description: The wine has tannins and a firm dry texture. With bitter cherry and strawberry flavors, it is a solid wine that finishes with perfumed acidity. Drink now.
Name: Louis Tête 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Coeur de Presse, the heart of the wine, is a ripe, juicy and fruity wine. It has friendly black-cherry fruit, a soft texture and a just-dry core to give it shape. Drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Coeur de Presse  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A mix of granite and sandy soil give this wine its lightly spicy minerality and soft texture. It is a lively, fruity wine with tannins that are fully integrated into the red-currant fruit and acidity. Drink now.
Designation: Domaine de la Madone des Loges
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine de la Madone des Loges  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: The wine has a tannic edge that suggests it is still young. Underneath there is some attractive red-berry fruit and acidity. It just needs a few more months to fill out, so drink from 2017.
Name: Château de Pizay 2015  Beaujolais

Description: Aged in large wood barrels for seven months, the wine is ripe and structured. It also has fine fruitiness, rich tannins and soft acidity. The wine will be better from 2017.
Name: Château Gaillard 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: With a vineyard planted in the traditional Beaujolais style of individual bushes rather than trained on wires, this is a light, soft and fruity wine. It has attractive tannins and fresh red fruits. Drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Château des Vierres  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: There is an earthy character to this wine. It gives a dry edge to the black fruits and crisp acidity. The wine has the tannins typical of the appellation although it also has a light herbal touch that is less attractive. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2014  Morgon

Description: Firmly structured, this is a rich wine in a style that is rounded and ripe. It has light tannins and spicy acidity to balance the general richness of the wine. Drink now.
Name: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This estate-grown wine has a really fresh character. With red-currant and red-cherry flavors, it has a juicy fruity style that is ready to drink. Light and perfumed, it is delicious now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Château d'Ouilly  (Beaujolais)

Description: This wine, bottled with minimum sulfur, is ripe with concentration and firm tannins. It is fruity although there is also a bitter edge to the ripe cherry flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2015 Natural  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: From the Ferraud family's estate in Vaux en Beaujolais, this wine is ripe and full bodied. It has a touch of pepper as well as raspberry and red-currant flavors. Lively and full of fruitiness, it is ready to drink.
Name: Ferraud et Fils 2015 Les Merrains  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is a bright, cherry-flavored wine. It has an attractive tannic edge to the ready-to-drink fruitiness. The acidity at the end gives the wine a good lift.
Name: Patriarche Père et Fils 2014  Beaujolais

Description: From organically grown grapes, this unfiltered wine is ripe with red-cherry flavors and freshened by acidity. It has a tang of tannin that adds a dry core to this attractive wine.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2015 Les Grands Eparcieux  (Beaujolais)

Description: Light, fruity and juicy, this is a soft cherry-flavored wine. It has attractive acidity that lifts the warm fruitiness and gives the wine its characteristic perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Louis Jadot 2015  Beaujolais

Description: This merchant house, with labels that carry a classic Frenchman's mustache, has made a soft rounded wine with attractive red-berry fruits. It is juicy and full of acidity that finishes the wine with a crisp aftertaste.
Name: Henry Fessy 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: From one of the estates that Duboeuf bottles separately, the wine is fruity and soft. It has attractive red fruits and light, well-integrated tannins. A touch of cherry pepper character gives it a lift. Drink now.
Designation: Domaine des Coteaux de la Ronze
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine des Coteaux de la Ronze  (Beaujolais)

Description: The name of the cuvée refers to the name of the village where the domaine is situated. It is a blend of different parcels, the result being a crisp, fresh wine with bitter red-currant and spice flavors. It is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Gry-Sablon 2015 Emeringes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is a firm and structured wine that is not yet ready to drink. With surprising tannins and a tight texture, it needs time for the fruit to come through. Drink starting from 2017.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2015 Cuvée de l'Ermitage  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Produced from a 40-year-old densely planted vineyard this wine is the epitome of crisp, light and fruity Beaujolais. Cherries and a touch of spice are cut with acidity. The structure is light, just right for such a lively wine from Xavier and Nicolas Barbet.
Name: Loron et Fils 2015 Barbet Beau!  (Beaujolais)

Description: Soft and juicy, this is a bright cherry-flavored wine. It has a fine line of acidity to bring out the refreshing fruitiness and crisp aftertaste.
Name: Collin-Bourisset 2015 Beaujo Chéri  (Beaujolais)

Description: The wine is called “summer pleasure” and its fruitiness and crisp texture seem well-suited. Red cherries, strawberries and a fine line of acidity set the scene for this soft fruity wine. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Penlois 2015 Plaisir Estival  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is a ripe wine, full of cherry fruit and bright acidity. It has a dry edge that gives the wine a structure to balance the crisp, perfumed fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Duperray 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: This is a tight wine with red-currant fruits and plenty of acidity. It is crisp and very fresh, demanding a few more months to calm down. Drink from 2017.
Name: Laurent Perrachon 2015 Terre de Loyse  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: The wine is nothing but fresh cherries from vines grown on sandy soil. Light tannins and bright fruitiness are the wine's hallmarks, giving a crisp, lively aftertaste.
Name: Louis Tête 2015 Les Sableux  (Beaujolais)

Description: Lively, fruity and made to be drunk young, this is a crisp red-fruit-flavored wine. It has acidity and a tangy orange peel character. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Bertrand 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Light tannins give this wine an attractive texture. It has bright cherry fruits along with glittering acidity. It's a fruity, fresh wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015  Beaujolais

Description: A soft banana and cherry-flavored wine that has attractive acidity and only the lightest of tannins. It is bright, fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Henry Fessy 2015  Beaujolais

Description: Produced from vines around the grand chateau, this is a crisp wine that has banana flavors and tight red-currant acidity that is crisp and lightly perfumed. It will probably be softer from early 2017.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Château de Plantigny  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Finely structured, this is a fruity wine with bright cherry fruit and acidity. It has a drier edge that gives it texture and shape. The fresher aftertaste gives the wine a fruity lift. Drink now.
Name: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 La Rose Pourpre Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: From the heart of the Beaujolais Villages area south of the cru villages, this wine has a fresh feel to it. It is crisp with red cherry and lively acidity. The soft tannins just buoy up the wine and give it an attractive shape. Ready to drink now.
Name: Cave du Château des Loges 2015 Prestige  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: From vines with an average age of 40 years old, this wine is the Duboeuf classic. It is soft, easy and fruity with its red fruits and gentle tannins. There is a dry edge to the wine, giving a touch of concentration. Drink this crisp wine now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A light and fruity wine with a slight tincture of tannin and acidity. Red-cherry and banana flavors dominate this readily drinkable wine.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2015 Les Violettes  (Beaujolais)

Description: A brand created by Pierre Ferraud in 1986, this is a ripe wine. It has red-cherry fruit that is rich and full of piquant flavor. The acidity goes through the fruitiness bringing a fresh aftertaste of red berries. Drink now.
Name: Ferraud et Fils 2015 Cuvée des Montagnards  (Beaujolais)

Description: Firm tannins make this wine solid and dry. It has banana and bright cherry fruits well integrated with the acidity. The aftertaste suggests the wine could benefit from a few more months before drinking, so wait until 2017.
Name: Domaine Foretal 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Banana aromas give this wine its fruity character. It has red fruit along with a strong layer of acidity. It is light in texture finishing with a fresh fruity aftertaste.
Name: Trenel Fils 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: The wine has pure ripe cherry fruit and a soft texture laced with intense acidity. This is an immediately attractive wine, full of fruit grown on clay soil, and with a light tannic edge to give it shape.
Name: Trenel Fils 2015 Cuvée Rochebonne  (Beaujolais)

Description: Produced from vines around the hilltop village of Oingt (claimed to be the most beautiful in France), this has a soft texture, a banana flavor and light acidity. It is the sort of wine that will be better slightly chilled.
Name: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 Terra Iconia  (Beaujolais)

Description: Soft and fruity, this is a light wine that has tight acidity and crisp red-currant fruit. It is bright and fresh and ready to drink.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2015 Domaine Pignard  (Beaujolais)

Description: The wine is tight and tannic. While it does have plenty of red-currant fruitiness, it is crisp, almost green in its acidity. It is very bright, almost shockingly fresh. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2015 Special Selection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is a banana and red-cherry-flavored wine, that has a light tannic structure to contrast with the fruitiness. It is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Boischampt 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This is a bright and fruity wine with attractive red-cherry flavors and light tannins. It has crisp acidity and a fresh aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Beaujolais)

Description: The wine is light and instantly fruity. It has red fruits and soft acidity, giving an warm rounded aftertaste.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2015 Automne Ensoleillé  (Beaujolais)

Description: This is a refreshingly crisp and fruity wine. It has the lightest of tannins to shape the fresh red-fruit flavors. The wine comes from a 74-acre estate, owned by the same family for 10 generations.
Name: Domaine Romy 2015 Vieilles Vignes Les Pierres Dorées  (Beaujolais)

Description: The wine is tight with its red fruits dominated by acidity. It shows tannins and intense freshness that creates a bitter aftertaste.
Name: Château du Châtelard 2015 Cuvée les Chalandières  (Beaujolais)

Description: This is a wine that has tannins as well as crisp red-currant fruit. It is lightly textured with a bright shot of acidity. The aftertaste is fresh and lively.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2015 Special Selection  (Beaujolais)

Description: This banana-flavored wine is soft and gently fruity. It has crisp acidity as well as a light tangy texture. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Thulon 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: From the area known as Pierres Dorées because of the gold-colored stone used in buildings, this wine is soft and fruity. It carries a touch of tannin along with red-cherry crispness. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 Salamandre d'Or  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

Description: This is a ripe, warm Gamay with black-cherry fruits that give acidity to go with the soft texture. It is juicy, fruity and will make a fine summer drink, lightly chilled. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Rin du Bois 2014 Gamay (Touraine)

Description: Made from Gamay on the granite soil of Beaujolais (hence the wine's name), this is a just pink colored wine that has apple and orange flavors. It's touched by an steely character that gives the wine texture and will allow it to age in bottle. Drink now, but better from 2017.
Name: Château de Lavernette NV Granit Brut Nature Gamay (Vin Mousseux)

Description: A complex, ripe wine that has rich red fruits, dark cherries and a serious undertow of tannin. The name comes from what the producer calls the alchemy between wood and fruit, and certainly the balance is just right. It has structure and dense tannins along with a juicy fruitiness. The wine is now ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Dumas 2011 Alchimie  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: A selection from parcels of vines in the La Rochelle section of Moulin à Vent, this wine comes from one of top recent vintages in Beaujolais. It is rich and packed with mature fruit. There are acidity, integrated tannins and secondary flavors of juicy acidity and smokiness. It is ready to drink. Owner Jean-Jacqus Parinet left the IT world for wine and bought Château Moulin-à-Vent in 2009 and Bief in 2012.
Name: Domaine de la Tour du Bief 2010  Moulin-à-Vent
Winery: Domaine de la Tour du Bief

Description: Now prizes for guessing C de B stands for Côte de Brouilly. Now perfectly mature, this is a soft, black cherry fruited wine. It is ripe, with a fine, dense texture that is lifted by the acidity and the light tannic structure. The wine is so deliciously ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Dumas 2011 C de B  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Produced from vineyards donated to a charitable hospital in the 19th century, this wine is rich and now perfectly mature. It has smoky tannins that lie under the fine, elegant cherry and red plum fruits and acidity. The wine still has freshness although the attraction here is the ripe structure. The ornate label dates back to 1926.
Name: Collin-Bourisset 2011 Hospices Civils de Romanèche Thurins  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Produced by a négociant based in Nuits-Saint-Georges, this is a ripe, Burgundian take on Beaujolais. This creates a full, plum and black cherry flavored wine where the tannins have been cushioned by the generous fruit. It does have the typical acidity and freshness of the year to give a lift. Drink now.
Name: Vaucher Père et Fils 2014  Fleurie

Description: Based in the cru villages of Chénas, Pierre-André Dumas also has vines in Brouilly. This is a soft fruity wine with attractive red cherry flavors and a minimum of tannins. It is fresh and light, ready to drink now for its fruitiness, although ready to age at least until 2019.
Name: Domaine Dumas 2013  Brouilly

Description: Although 2013 was a difficult vintage, some of the top cru wines are successful. That's the case here, with a wine that is structured and with plenty of juicy fruit. The tannins are firm, although leaving room for the cherry juice fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Château des Gimarets 2013  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Although 2013 was a difficult vintage, some of the top cru wines are successful. That's the case here, with a wine that is structured with plenty of juicy fruit. The tannins are firm, although leaving room for the cherry juice fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Château Frédignac 2013  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: This is a bold ripe black cherry flavored wine from a 19th century estate close to the Morgon appellation. Like many Brouilly, this is soft and fruity, freshened by acidity and lightly structured. It could be aged, but it is just ready to drink now for its balance between tannins and bright fruit.
Name: Château de Bellevue 2014  Brouilly

Description: Fresh, fruity and juicy, this is a red cherry flavored wine that has brought out the best of the light 2013 vintage. It is soft with only the lightest of tannins and refreshing acidity at the end. Two of the inventors of the cinema, the Lumière brothers, lived in this castle which dates from the 19th century.
Name: Château de Bellevue 2013 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: Produced on the steep slopes of the Côte du Py, this is a ripe, sunny wine. It's full of cherry flavors backed up by tannins. It's dense, structured and needing to age. Intense acidity gives the wine the freshness of the vintage. Drink from late 2016.
Name: Collin-Bourisset 2013 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Cédric Lecareux, formerly of Gerard Bertrand, took over this tiny estate in 2014. He has produced a rounded wine that has ripe berry and cherry fruits and generous tannins. It's a wine to drink soon with its fine fruit and smoky aftertaste. He has begun vineyard conversion to organic.
Name: Domaine les Capréoles 2014 Diaclase  (Régnié)

Description: The high elevation appellation of Chiroubles produces structured wine like this. It's a cool, tannin and crisp fruit flavored wine. Red currants are cut with acidity and a juicy, really fruity aftertaste. The structure will allow the wine to age a few months, so drink from the end of 2016.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2014 Vidame de Rocsain  (Chiroubles)

Description: This is a fresh and cool wine from the highest of the Beaujolais cru villages. Produced by Céline and Nicolas Hirsch, originally from Alsace, the wine is bright with red cherries and currants. It has some tannins that firm up the structure, giving it shape and the possibility of aging. Drink now and until 2020.
Name: Domaine Hirsch 2014  Chénas

Description: This is a perfumed wine that is soft, full of red cherry fruit and gentle tannins. It does have a dry core that gives the wine shape and there is plenty of juicy fruitiness at the end. The wine is made for the Hospices, a charity in Lyon.
Designation: Domaine des Hospices Civils de Lyon
Name: Collin-Bourisset 2014 Domaine des Hospices Civils de Lyon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Ripe and juicy, this is a warm, red-fruited wine. With plenty of acidity, it is fresh, although the big attraction here is the fresh fruit balanced by the firm, smoky tannins. Drink from summer 2016.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2014 La Chenevière  (Morgon)

Description: From an estate founded in 1644, this old-vine wine produced on 16.5 acres, is ripe, juicy and packed with red plum flavors. The tannins are light, smoky, showing the fruit of the year without too much structure. It's juicy and fresh with refreshing acidity at the end.
Name: Domaine de la Tour du Bief 2013  Moulin-à-Vent
Winery: Domaine de la Tour du Bief

Description: This is a structured wine whose fruit is still coming through the tannins. It has a dry core, layers of acidity and juicy bitter cherry acidity. Drink from the end of 2016.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2014 Cuvées Classic  (Morgon)

Description: Still young, this wine has considerable acidity that is surprising. Its cherry fruits are fresh with soft tannins and a juicy aftertaste. It needs another six months to calm down. Drink from summer 2016.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2014 Les Crêtes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: In keeping with the good quality of 2015's Beaujolais Nouveau, this is a ripe red fruit and black cherry flavored wine. It has really fresh, juicy acidity and the softest tannins. It's a bright, fruity wine that is just waiting to drink.
Name: Domaine de la Madone 2015 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: From a small, new appellation in the north of Beaujolais, this wine is fresh and fruity. It has a cool feel to it—mineral and with stalky, crisp red currant fruit flavors. It's a style of wine that will benefit from serving chilled.
Name: Château de Lavernette 2014 Le Clos  (Beaujolais-Leynes)

Description: This is a simple, fruity Beaujolais. It has cherry flavors that are spoilt by the hints of banana. Acidity and light tannins complete a wine that is drinkable immediately.
Name: Domaine Dupeuble Père et Fils 2014  Beaujolais

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Brick House was one of the first to plant Gamay Noir in the Willamette Valley, and may well be the state's leading producer in terms of quantity. This is loaded with chunky cherry fruit, a penetrating style that simply brings a grin with every sip. Aromatics of root beer, sassafras and hard cherry candy add to the complexity.
Name: Brick House 2014 Gamay Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented via carbonic maceration in a concrete tank, this spent 10 months in neutral oak prior to bottling. Give it a bit of breathing time to flesh out, and it rewards you with lush, spicy berry flavors, accents of fresh herb, and a hint of chocolate.
Name: Evening Land 2014 Seven Springs Estate Vielles Vignes Gamay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bursting with fresh, bright scents and flavors of strawberries, raspberries and huckleberries, this juicy, polished and powerful wine is spring in a bottle. Lush and lively acids underscore the fruit and lead into a long, spicy finish.
Name: Chehalem 2014 Ridgecrest Vineyards Gamay Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Description: From 20-year-old vines, this spent 10 months in French oak, 20% new. It's finished with a screwcap and tastes a bit reductive, so give it plenty of breathing time. It's well-muscled with tangy cranberry and purple fruit. Drink now through 2020.
Name: WillaKenzie Estate 2013 Gamay Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Rajat Parr is one of the partners in this new venture. This Gamay offers chunky cherry fruit with a pleasing peppery bite. Tannins are firm and proportionate, and the lively mouthfeel derives from fermentation via carbonic maceration.
