Description: This wine is rich, with red fruits and balanced acidity. Soft and full-bodied, it delivers spice and red plum fruits at the end, with a juicy aftertaste.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2012  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Some wood aging gives the fruitiness of the wine an added spice. Tannins support the bitter cherry flavors and add firmness to the juicy acidity. Drink from the end of 2015.
Name: Domaine du Haut-Poncié 2013 Roche Grès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: The wine is very fresh, with intense acidity and fragrant red fruits. Made from 100-year-old vines, it's tight, mineral and has a cool, light character with the merest hint of tannin. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2013 Coeur de Vendanges  (Beaujolais)

Description: Attractive cherry flavors give a ripe, rounded feel that's balanced by the acidity and tannins. Black cherries burst easily from the glass, delivering a full aftertaste.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Flower Label  (Beaujolais)

Description: The wine is warm and round, full of ripe berry fruits and soft tannins. It's ready to drink now with its full structure, balanced acidity and juicy aftertaste.
Name: Les Vins Aujoux 2013 Belle Grâce  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: While the wine has a crisp side, it's also full of red fruits and soft tannins. That makes for a wine that's fragrant, fruity, ready to drink and not likely to age much. Enjoy it now.
Name: Manoir du Carra 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: The wine is so young, it almost has a prickle on the tongue. It is very fresh and still rather tight with acidity and crisp berry fruits. Wait until 2015 for this fruity wine to settle down and open up.
Name: Domaine des Marrans 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: The year's bottle aging has rounded this wine out and has softened the fresh red fruits into a more generous, full-bodied texture. The acidity, always present shows as a counterpoint to the ripe fruits. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Dupeuble Père et Fils 2012  Beaujolais

Description: Bold and fruity, this is packed with cherries as well as acidity. A plum skin texture gives structure to this still closed-up wine. Wait until 2015.
Name: Domaine Lagneau 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: The wine is round, soft and ripe with attractive lightweight tannins. Plum fruit flavors are right up front. It's rich while remaining easy and drinkable now.
Name: Henry Fessy 2012  Brouilly

Description: The wine has weight and richness while also showing considerable acidity and dry tannic structure. It's firm, the fruitiness showing slowly through the mineral texture. It will be better in 2015.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2013 Eté Intense  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Ripe and soft, it offers attractive acidity given richness by red berry fruits. It's ready to drink, with a final balanced, velvet texture.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2013 Eté Indien  (Brouilly)

Description: This fruit and acidity-driven wine has bright red cherry and raspberry flavors. Young and fruity, it is best drunk now, although waiting until 2015 will soften the fresh tones.
Name: Robert Perroud 2013 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

Description: Very young, very tannic, this wine is hard and not showing much fruit at the moment. Heavy extraction has left a wine that's tough and needs to age to get anywhere. Try again in 2016.
Name: Pascal Granger 2013 Le Bouteau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: The wine is full of acidity as well as bright raspberry and red currant fruits. It has a light, fresh feel that's given added weight by firmer fruit tannins and a concentrated dry aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
Name: Henry Fessy 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This is fresh and juicy, relishing its cherry and light spice flavors as well as its aromatic acidity. It's balanced, with some depth of flavor that gives weight to the fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Château de Lacarelle 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Fresh and juicy, this fruity wine is ready to drink. It discloses plenty of the acidity of the vintage, but that is well integrated into the red cherry and damson flavors. It's textured at the end, but always ripe and full in the mouth.
Name: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: Red berry fruit aromas come out strongly, giving a fragrant, fresh character to this charming wine. Structured while still fruity, it has dark tannins as well as bitter cherry fruits and acidity on the palate. Drink from the end of 2015.
Name: Domaine du Haut-Poncié 2013  Fleurie

Description: The wine is ripe with red berry fruits that are well integrated into the soft tannins and juicy acidity. It shows balance along with a fresh aftertaste.
Name: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2012  Beaujolais-Villages
Winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

Description: A wine that is light and fruity. While it doesn't have great structure, it does offer fresh acidity, delicious raspberry flavors and bright acidity at the end. Drink now.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Soft, ripe and fruity, this wine is ready to drink. Light tannins shape up the cherry fruits and attractive acidity that cuts right through to the end.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2013 Ancienne Gourmand  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: With its intense acidity, this wine is still too young to drink. It has plenty of fruit, a cool texture and a crisp, berry fruitiness. Give it until mid-2015 to round out and be less acidic.
Name: Jean-Marc Burgaud 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: While there is plenty of acidity in this wine, it also has red fruit character that conveys a ripe, full feeling. It's juicy and fruity, crisp but still warm at the end.
Name: Louis Jadot 2013 Cuvée Deux  (Beaujolais)

Description: This is a bright and fruity wine, fresh and full of strawberry, cherry and red stone fruits. Plenty of acidity is well integrated into the general fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Dupeuble Père et Fils 2013  Beaujolais

Description: While the wine is dominated by youthful acidity, it's red fruits and light structure promise an attractive future. It's fresh and very fruity, with spice and smokiness at the end.
Name: Domaine de Colonat 2013 Perle de Granit  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is a soft and perfumed wine, the red fruits hanging out easily with the acidity and gentle structure. It has a juicy character, hints of banana in the background and a fruity aftertaste.
Name: Ferraud et Fils 2013 Les Merrains  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: The wine is firm with some solid tannins as well as bright cherry fruit and good acidity. A cool, mineral character keeps it fresh. With a fruity aftertaste, it's ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de la Madone 2013 Cuvée Bio  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is an earthy, firm wine based on tannins as well as ripe fruitiness. It has a mineral structure along with fresh red cherry fruit flavors and balanced acidity. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2013 Cuvée Traditionelle  (Beaujolais)

Description: Structured and tight, this shows more texture and acidity than fruit. It has a hard edge that suggests extraction and gives a bitter, too-acid aftertaste.
Name: Domaine André Colonge 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: The wine is full of ripe bananas as well as cherry flavors, very much in the style of a nouveau. It's soft and rounded, with plenty of fruitiness as well as soft tannins. The wine is ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine de la Madone 2013 Tradition  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This fruity wine offers attractive cherry flavors that are spoiled by touches of banana. However, the acidity is good, keeping the wine fresh and indicating that it will be very drinkable in 2015.
Name: Domaine du Haut-Poncié 2013  Saint-Amour

Description: There is a strong cherry-juice character to this wine. It's ripe, young and very drinkable now. But with the underlying tannins, the wine should be able to age to bring out the structure and acidity.
Name: Jaffelin 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: The wine is soft, rounded and lightly perfumed. A smoky character brings out ripe cherry fruits and a soft texture. Spice and acidity contrast with each other at the end.
Name: Château de Lacarelle 2012  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Full of cherry and banana freshness, this is a simple wine that shows attractive fruit and acidity. It is good to go now, light, fragrant and bright.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Coeur de Presse  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is a sweet and fruity wine, full-bodied and ripe. It has red cherries and bananas along with some acidity. While there are some tannins, it's meant for immediate drinking and not for aging,
Name: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2012 Léon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A ripe, fleshy wine, full of cherry notes and spice. It is rich, full in the mouth while keeping a light fruitiness that allows it to develop fast. Overpowering banana flavors at the end spoil the overall effect.
Name: Louis Jadot 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: While the acidity is intense, it is balanced by the ripe cherry fruits and soft tannins. This is not a wine for aging much beyond 2014, showing a bright, fresh aftertaste.
Name: Domaine de Roche Guillon 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This is a fruity wine with cherry fruits and a soft, juicy texture. It's lively and fresh, with good acidity at the end.
Name: Henry Fessy 2013  Beaujolais

Description: Lean and firm, the wine has a dry, tannic layer that is emphasized by a burnt, smoky character. The fruit needs time and is likely to be austere.
Name: Gérard Charvet 2013 La Réserve d'Amélie  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Bright and fruity, this is a ready-to-drink wine. Fruitiness and lively acidity are balanced by the cherry juice flavors and a light structure to finish.
Name: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2013 Le Buissy  (Beaujolais)

Description: Smoke and banana aromas make an unlikely combination. In fact they work together in this fresh wine that has a bright red berry fruit character as well as a light touch of tannin. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Thulon 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: The wine is soft and fruity with attractive red cherry favors and light acidity. It's smooth, round and ready to drink, with lively acidity and a touch of tannin on the finish.
Name: Louis Tête 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Surprisingly austere for a Beaujolais-Villages, the wine has a firm, dry character that hides the natural fruitiness of the Gamay. Dense tannins and acidity give a cool feel to this stalky wine. It has red fruits, intense and tight acidity and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Louis Tête 2013 Les Combes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: The firm texture comes from cool, underripe fruits. The cherries are given a crisp slant by the pink grapefruit and acidity that dominate. Drink now, it won't get better.
Name: Château de Chatelard 2013 Cuvée les Chalandières  (Beaujolais)

Description: Ripe cherry fruits are cut with acidity and with banana flavors that give a wine that's all fruit and no structure. It's meant to be drunk young, but to reduce the acidity, it needs until 2015.
Name: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2013  Beaujolais-Villages
Winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

Description: This wine is crisp, fruity and light. It has bright red fruits, attractive acidity and an easy, bright texture.
Name: Loron et Fils 2013 Beau Beaujolais  (Beaujolais)

Description: Very tight and closed, this firm wine has red currant flavors and considerable acidity. It doesn't seem balanced, the acidity at a distance from the structure.
Name: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2012 Côte de Py  (Morgon)

Description: Bright cherryade flavors give an attractive, herbal character. It's not sweet, although there is a suggestion of this. It finishes soft and round, and the wine is not likely to develop further.
Name: Christophe Pacalet 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: With its banana aromas, this wine is made to be drunk young. It's doing a good job with soft red fruits that are cut by balanced acidity. Drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Château de Plantigny  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: With cherryade aromas, this wine hovers between fruitiness and maturity. It can't make up its mind and this gives it an ambivalent character.
Name: Domaine Dupeuble Père et Fils 2011 Cuvée No 1512  (Beaujolais)

Description: The wine is all fruit, raspberries, fresh cherries and a touch of banana. A light tannic structure goes with the acidity to give a cool character. The aftertaste is bright and fresh.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Château de Buffavent  (Beaujolais)

Description: The wine is fresh, too full of acidity for real pleasure. It is crisp, tight and mineral, missing any real depth of flavors.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2013 Automne Ensoleil  (Beaujolais)

Description: The wine's acidity is too intense for comfort, giving an almost citrus character and a tight, cool structure. A hard edge spoils the final fruitiness.
Name: Domaine de Champ Fleury 2013 Tradition  (Beaujolais)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Noticeably impacted with scents of leather and chicken-yard soils, this also shows some muted, brambly berry fruit. It's tart and juicy, with a flavor of pomegranate or acai berry, and best to be drunk sooner rather than later.
Name: Evening Land 2012 Seven Springs Vineyard Gamay Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Lightly tannic, this wine is about red cherry and blueberry fruits, along with hints of banana. Fresh and fruity, it offers a balance of acidity and tannins at the end. Drink now.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2013 Grande QV  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

Description: This solidly structured wine shows the firm tannins and mineral structure typical of wines from Côte du Py. It has dense black cherry fruits along with sacidity that cuts through the structure. It could age another year, but is worth drinking now.
Name: Trenel Fils 2011 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: A perfumed wine, it has structured black fruits and a solid texture. It is rich, showing complexity through its tannins along with acidity and fruitiness. Still surprisingly young to taste, it should not be drunk until 2015.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2011 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Morgon)

Description: Wood aging adds a smoky character and toasty flavor, while also smoothing out the tannins. From the rich 2009 vintage, this wine shows both plum fruits and firm tannins. It could still age, drink until 2018.
Name: Loron et Fils 2009 Château de Bellevue Le Clos  (Morgon)

Description: Of course, this wine is too young to drink now. However, its ripe fruit, sweet fresh acidity and red plum fruits all promise a fine future. There is a good juicy, full aftertaste. Drink from the end of 2014.
Name: Trenel Fils 2012  Fleurie

Description: Perfumed fruits offer a ripe counterpoint to the solid tannins. Dark cherries, a touch of wood and layers of acidity come together well, leaving the chance to age further. Drink until 2020.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2012  Morgon

Description: A ripe and fruity wine, it has great red fruits, dark cherries and soft, juicy acidity. The structured tannins add a delicious whisper behind all this fruitiness. This is a warm, rich wine, ready to drink.
Name: Trenel Fils 2011  Moulin-à-Vent

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is one of Oregon's most unique wines, and one that rises confidently to the level of excellent cru Beaujolais in a ripe year. Bright and spicy with generous flavors of strawberry and blueberry, this sports lip-smacking acidity and a dash of minerality. The sweet young fruit is full, forward and delicious.
Name: Brick House 2012 Year of the Dragon Gamay Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Description: This impressive wood-aged wine has weight, rich black and red berry flavors and a smooth, unctuous texture. With its concentration, ripeness, acidity and tannins, it could age through 2016.
Name: Château de Pierreux 2011 La Réserve du Château  (Brouilly)

Description: A classic vinification in tank and barrel has produced a ripe, full-bodied wine. It has ripe cherry and dark plum fruits; layers of wood-aging flavors give a complete, dense and concentrated wine. It will age, drink until 2020.
Designation: Château de Bellevue Climat les Charmes
Name: Loron et Fils 2011 Château de Bellevue Climat les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: This is a ripe and fruity wine, full of red cherries, soft tannins and juicy acidity. It fills the glass with fresh flavors, ripe fruits all ready to drink now.
Name: Trenel Fils 2011 L'Esprit de Marius Sangouard  (Juliénas)

Description: Still young, it needs until late 2014 to bring out the ripe red berry fruit that will sustain the structure. The wine has weight, a juicy character and a real fruitiness at the end.
Name: Trenel Fils 2012  Saint-Amour

Description: The deep soil of the Grands Cras has given a wine that is rich, mature and spicy. It's dominated by bitter cherry fruits, fragrant acidity and a softly tannic structure. Drink now.
Name: Château de Pizay 2012 Cuvée Grands Cras  (Morgon)

Description: A lively, fruity and perfumed wine this is just what a young Fleurie should be. Structure supports the ripe cherry fruits and floral character. Its tannins will soon soften and leave a ripe wine with fruitiness.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2012  Fleurie

Description: This fresh, cherry fruit flavored wine blends fruit from Beaujolais Villages and Morgon. It is ripe, while also crisp and bright. The soft tannins, juicy berry fruits and acidity give a fruity while dry finish. Drink now.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2011  Coteaux Bourguignons

Description: Old vines help give smoothness and concentration to this ripe wine. It has soft tannins, well integrated into the black cherry fruits, and acidity. With its spice and rounded texture, it is a wine to drink now.
Name: Château de Pierreux 2012  Brouilly

Description: Simple but with depth, this wine has structure and some good tannins, along with the bright cherry fruit flavors and balanced acidity. It's a wine to drink now, full of flavor and ripe fruits.
Name: Domaine de la Prébende 2011  Beaujolais

Description: A fresh, juicy wine that does everything a Beaujolais should. With its cherry fruit and bright acidity, it would be great with turkey. Enjoy it now.
Name: Trenel Fils 2011 Cuvée Rochebonne  (Beaujolais)

Description: A typically light Brouilly that is fresh, full of cherry acidity and soft tannins. It has a juicy element, lightly herbal and with stalky, tight fruit at the end. Drink now.
Name: Château de Pizay 2012 Château de Saint Lager  (Brouilly)

Description: From the light 2012 vintage, this is a bright and fruity wine with red cherries and soft tannins. Intense acidity gives the wine a fresh, crisp character. Drink now.
Name: Château de Pizay 2012  Régnié

Description: Typically young and fruity, this wine is packed with fresh cherry fruits and plenty of acidity. It's almost crisp and should be drunk now.
Name: Château de Pizay 2013  Beaujolais

Description: This wine has spice and some firm tannins, with rather light fruitiness. It seems unbalanced, the cherry character turning into bitterness. Better drink it now.
Name: Loron et Fils 2011 Château de Bellevue  (Fleurie)

Description: A fruity, light style of rosé, attractively balancing acidity and fresh wild strawberries. The keen crisp texture is cut through with citrus. It's ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Pierre Guindon 2012 Gamay (Coteaux d'Ancenis)

Description: A full, rich and rounded wine that brings out the concentration from the low yielding old vines. It has rich black cherry and spice flavors that go with the delicious acidity and solid structure. This could be a wine to age, but it's so good now. If you want, drink until 2018.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2012 Vignes de 1939  (Chénas)

Description: This is solid, rich and with great fruit flavors to complement its structure. Red cherry fruitiness is lifted by intense acidity and broadened by the dark tannins and concentration. This is a wine to age for a few years, so drink after 2015.
Name: Laurent Gauthier 2012 Grand Cras  Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: A rich wine that is concentrated as well as fruity. It has much of the structure of the Côte de Py, mineral in character, bringing out the granite. Black plums, dark berries and plenty of acidity are all there, producing a wine to age. Drink from 2015.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Le Py  (Morgon)

Description: This is a rich wine with the wood aging giving extra complexity and structure. It has cherry, plum and spice flavors, a dark sense that comes from the texture and the minerality. Drink this solid wine from 2014.
Name: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2011 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: A firm and tannic wine that brings out a fine, solid structure and concentration from old vines. Power and fruitiness are allied to a dry core of tannins that give a style and shape to the wine. This is a wine to age, so drink from 2015.
Name: Richard Rottiers 2012  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: A firm wine that has dark, dry tannins, giving a wine that has fine potential. It's certainly a food wine, as its name suggests, dense and full of black plum skin and black cherry fruits. It does need to age, so drink from 2015.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Hiver Gourmand  (Morgon)

Description: This wine's name translates to “cherry,” and cherries are in its aroma along with spice. The palate shows a juicy, forward fruity character, a tang of acidity and soft tannins. It's a fine wine, but not for long-term aging so drink now and over the next few months.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2012 Les Cerisiers Vieilles  Vignes  (Juliénas)

Description: Lucien Lardy takes the risk of not using sulfur during fermentation, giving a wine that retains its great fruitiness. It's bright, full of red cherry fruits and lively acidity. Tannins are a hint in the background, enough to give structure but not to suggest long aging. Drink until 2018.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2012 Les Roches  (Fleurie)

Description: A very perfumed wine, almost heady, with its herbal and wild flower aromas. The wine is still closed up, darkly tannic and very firm. At the same time, black fruits show the same perfumed character. This is very flavorful and structured. Drink this unusual wine from 2014.
Name: Clos des Bachelards 2010  Fleurie

Description: This structured, full and ripe wine shows great cherry fruits, some chewy tannins and a delicious juicy character. It is balanced and with its tannins should age. Drink now and until 2017.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Fabien Collonge 2012 L'Aurore des Côtes  (Chiroubles)

Description: A wine that has good concentration from the very old vines along with red cherry fruits and some tight, mineral acidity. The banana character does spoil the overall ripe, full effect, so give the wine another year for this to disappear. Acidity and tannins do promise this aging.
Name: Domaine Dupré 2012 Vignes de 1935  (Morgon)

Description: This single vineyard wine has much of the right tannic structure for a Moulin-à-Vent, while also retaining a lighter touch of juicy bitter cherry fruits and tense acidity. It has a denser core that will allow the wine to age, so drink from 2014.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Domaine des Ailes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Red fruit aromas, soft tannins and a warm feeling permeate this full, fruity wine. It has an open, generous texture, packed with cherry and red berry flavors and layered with acidity. The wine ends fresh and fruity with a touch of tannin.
Name: Robert Perroud 2012 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

Description: This is a bright and fruity wine, only gently touched by tannins. Its flavorful cherry fruits fill the mouth easily. There is a good, crisp aftertaste from the very present acidity.
Name: Domaine Dupré 2012 Haute Ronze  (Régnié)

Description: A structured wine that brings out some firm, dry tannins as well as red berry fruits and taut acidity. It is structured, still quite dry in character and likely to age for a few years. Drink from 2014.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Eté Intense  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Labeled Cuvée Chic, this is certainly a light, fruity and stylish wine. Red cherries are given structure by a light series of tannins, along with fresh acidity. The wine is soft, lightly structured and ready to drink.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Château Fouilloux  (Brouilly)

Description: A cool wine that shows fresh fruitiness and a firm sense of structure. There is an attractive red berry character, laced with considerable acidity. It should age for a few months, so drink from 2014.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Eté Fleuri  (Chiroubles)

Description: While there are hints of banana, the wine does have a firm and solid structure that suggest it will age. With its red cherry fruit and structure it's ready to drink now.
Name: Gérard Charvet 2012 La Réserve d'Amélie  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This soft wine is very fruity, with banana and red cherry flavors, and very drinkable now. It has a bright feel to it, from the acidity and from the light, jaunty texture. Drink now.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Eté Indien  (Brouilly)

Description: Full-on banana aromas create a wine that tastes like an elderly nouveau. It does have some fruit and red cherries, but with a bitter edge, it really should have been drunk by now.
Name: Vignoble Charmet 2011 Masfraise  (Beaujolais)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A pretty purple-hued wine, Chehalem's Gamay Noir invites sipping with flavors of blueberries, chocolate and spice. It's fruity and forward, but seems to suddenly hit a wall, stopping short with a hint of plastic in the finish.
Name: Chehalem 2011 Ridgecrest Vineyards Gamay Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Description: Red berry and cherry flavors mark this bright, juicy wine. Soft tannins and a firmer extract show on the midpalate, along with vivid acidity on the finish. Drink in six months.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Grande QV  (Bourgogne Gamay)

Description: This is a wood-laden wine that shows more spice than fruit. It has a bitter edge, and heavy toast notes that mask the red cherry flavors. Maybe in a year it will soften to yield a more rounded, less extracted character.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Grande QV  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

Appellation: Côtes de Forez, Loire Valley, France
Description: The mountains south of Beaujolais produce a light style of Gamay. This wine is soft, juicy, easy and fruity with red-cherry flavor marked by fresh acidity. Drink now.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2011 Domaine de Montaubourg Gamay (Côtes de Forez)

Description: Powerful tannins dominate this serious wine. It has a complex, dense structure, full of wood and fruit tannins, along with blackberry fruits and a touch of spiced bitter cherry. This is Beaujolais for aging. Give it at least 3–5 years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine des Rosiers  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Big and solid, this is very firm in character. It has weight, density and dry tannins. At the same more juicy black fruits and acidity emerge from this mineral textured wine. Powered by its structure, it could well age for 3–5 years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Rochegrès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This Fleurie in the small production Prestige range shows firm tannins and structured fruit. It has a dry character, the fruitiness still developing as it ages. Acidity, a dark core and black cherry fruits promise aging for 2–3 years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Prestige  (Fleurie)

Description: Solid and textured wine, full of dry tannins and concentrated structure. It's fruit is less obvious, the mineral character dominant and only a hint of the potential fruitiness. Give this dark wine 2–3 years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Côte de Py  (Morgon)

Description: This is a concentrated, firm and tannic wine. It has a structured feel from Chiroubles, which are the highest vineyards in Beaujolais. With its black fruits, dark tannins and concentrated texture, it could certainly age for 2–3 years, although it is ready to drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine des Pontheux  (Chiroubles)

Description: Solid wine, powerful and concentrated. It has the weight of tannins, dark fruits and ripe fruitiness all well combined and with a good aging potential. Acidity adds a touch of freshness to the dark plum fruits. Give this wine 3–5 years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine Jean-Ernest Descombes  (Morgon)

Description: Attractive and fruity wine with a twist of tannin over the juicy yet bitter cherry fruit. The wine has a sense of structure, firm and showing some wood as well as tannin. Worth aging another year.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Flower Label  (Fleurie)

Description: From a traditional vineyard with old vines, this is a dense and structured wine. It has minerality, dark black fruits, a tense texture and a dry, tannic core. Drink from 2014.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2012 La Passion  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This wine, solid and dense, is full of firm tannins as well as red cherry fruits. It's also fruity, with a great juicy character that permeates right through the wine. For drinking now, but better kept for 2–3 years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine de Lavernée  (Chiroubles)

Description: This single vineyard wine is powerful with its concentrated tannins and dark cherry fruits. Good acidity goes with the fruit and the dry core. A shame that a hint of banana spoils the aftertaste.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine des Quatre Vents  (Fleurie)

Description: This is a structured, fruity wine, with red cherry flavors that go well with the drier edge of tannin. It has a layer of acidity that cuts through the ripe fruit showing a more ageworthy character. Keep this wine for 2–3 years, although with its fruitiness it can be drunk now.
Name: Château des Jean-Loron 2010 Les Gandelins  (Chénas)

Description: A wine with some structure, firm tannins and attractive black cherry and spice flavors. The wine has good weight and a dense texture that promises medium-term aging.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine de Lafayette  (Brouilly)

Description: A rich wine, full of black fruits, ripe tannins and juicy acidity. It's powerful and structured, showing a mineral texture, bold acidity and ample fruitiness.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2012 Domaine de la Croix Rouge  (Juliénas)

Description: A fruity, forward wine with a touch of smokiness to go with the red cherry fruits and clear acidity. It's a full wine, structured with its background of tannins. The aftertaste brings out bright fruits.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine de Javernière  (Morgon)

Description: With some richness as well as fresh fruit, this is an open, warm wine. Black cherries, soft tannins and the acidity typical of the vintage, this is a wine to drink now or keep for 1–2 years.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2012 Château de Souzy  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A small wine region close to the city of Lyon, Coteaux du Lyonnais produces the wine for the city's bars. This is soft, rounded, a delicious cherry flavored wine. It has a light structure and attractive final acidity.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2011 Fleurieux  (Coteaux du Lyonnais)

Description: Ripe, rich and fruity, this is Gamay from old vines that give extra concentration. The wine is full of bitter cherries, tight acidity and a light texture. Drink now.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2011 Vieilles Vignes  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

Description: This Brouilly is light and smooth in character. The wine has hints of tannins under the bright cherry fruits, fresh acidity and open texture. It's not a wine for aging.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Château du Prieuré  (Brouilly)

Description: This is a powerful, solid wine with dense black fruits and firm tannins. It offers the weight of Morgon while also keeping a forward fruitiness. The wine is likely to need aging over 2–3 years.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011 Belles Grives  (Morgon)

Description: This is a ripe and juicy wine, full of cherry fruit, that also has a sense of structure. It has tannins that promise some aging as well as the natural fruitiness of Beaujolais. Keep this generous wine for at least two years.
Name: Henry Fessy 2011 Château des Labourons  (Fleurie)

Description: Rich and ripe with great plum and black cherry fruits, this is a powerful wine, showing the structure inherent in good Morgon. The fruits, acidity and tannins are serious, promising good aging over 2–3 years.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011 Domaine de la Chaponne  (Morgon)

Description: Big, bold and tannic, this is powerful Gamay from La Tour du Bief vineyard in Juliénas. It has weight, and a concentrated texture that bodes well for the wine's future. Along with this structure are the fragrant black and red currant fruits, already delicious to drink.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Clef du Bief  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A step up from Sélection in the Moulin-à-Vent range from Duboeuf, this wine has been aged in oak for six months. The result is a ripe, smoothly textured wine, its cherry fruits offering an attractive smoky character. It could do with a year, even two, for aging.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Oak-Aged  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Firm and structured, this shows the serious side of Fleurie. It has tense tannins as well as red fruits that are developing a juicy character. With its mineral texture, it needs at least a year to age.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011 Clos des Quatre Vents  (Fleurie)

Description: Cherry fruits and firm tannins band well together in this rich wine. It offers spice from light wood aging, a touch of banana, and full forward fruitiness. The structure suggests it needs to age for a year.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011 Domaine Mont Chavy  (Morgon)

Description: Red fruits are the focus here. What gives the wine an extra dimension is the firmer, youthful, tannic texture. This gives a strong sense of structure to the attractive cherry flavors. Keep for a year at least.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Château de Juliénas  (Juliénas)

Description: You can taste the wood in this red, fruity wine. It gives a spicy character to the cherries and red currants, adding both complexity and the potential for aging. The end shows the fresh acidity of the year.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Château des Capitans  (Juliénas)

Description: This is a bright and youthful wine, with red plum and cherry fruits that are right up front, laced with acidity and given just the right punch and tannins. This attractive wine can age, but can be drunk now.
Name: Henry Fessy 2011 Château des Reyssiers  (Régnié)

Description: One of the smallest crus, Saint-Amour produces firm and structured wines. This Sélection shows both rich black fruit and solid tannins that are typical. Over the next six months, it's likely the fruitiness will become more dominant.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Sélection  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Ripe, with jammy red fruits, this is an attractively fruity wine. It has maraschino cherry flavors, intertwined with acidity to give structure, a fresh character and soft tannins. Drink this year.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011 Château de Nervers  (Brouilly)

Description: While Brouilly is one of the lighter of the Beaujolais crus, it still is a step up from Villages, as this ripe wine shows. With weight and some tannins, it promises moderate aging while also offering a delicious cherry profile drinking now.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011 Château la Perrière  (Brouilly)

Description: This is a new brand from a recently-created appellation for parts of Beaujolais. The wine has recognizable red cherry fruits, soft tannins and a juicy, slightly dusty texture. Ready to drink.
Name: Louis Latour 2011  Bourgogne Gamay

Description: This is a wine with some tannic structure adding richness and shape to its red fruit character. Ripe cherries and red currants dominate, laced with acidity. It's ready to drink, but could improve over another year.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A wine with fresh, bright, red cherry and black currant fruits along with a tight tannic edge that speaks of the granite soil. It's likely to age over the next year.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011 Domaine du Riaz  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: A jolly, fruity wine—very Beaujolais—with a touch of bananas to go with cherry flavors and soft tannins. Ready to drink, and best served slightly chilled.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Sélection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Ripe and jammy, this is bright Beaujolais. It's full of sweet fruits, soft tannins and lively acidity. At the end, the wine shows delicious cherries and just a touch of structure.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011 Domaine Pignard  (Beaujolais)

Description: The Beaujolais appellation is the source of most Nouveau. But it also produces attractively fruity wines, full of cherries, that can be drunk over the two years following the harvest. Enjoy this wine this year.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011  Beaujolais

Description: This is a firmly structured wine with a distinct tannic character to go with austere, mineral fruits. The wine is on the sour side, making it hard to love, although some juiciness does show through at the end.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011 Domaine des Nazins  (Brouilly)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A semisweet red sparkling wine made from Gamay, this deliciously refreshing, apéritif-style wine is fragrant and only just hints at tannins. Drink chilled with salami.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2011 Made by G Gamay (Vin de France)

Description: Fruity wine from one of the best produces of Gamay in the Loire. Cherry flavors, bright acidity and just a touch of tannin on this youthful wine.
Name: Henry Marionnet 2011 Domaine de la Charmoise Gamay (Touraine)

Description: Soft and lightly smoky, round and ripe, this wine has flavors of black currant and blueberry, plus a touch of wood and gentle acidity. Coteaux Bourguignons is the new appellation that replaces the rather derogatory-sounding Bourgogne Grand Ordinaire.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Grande QV  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

Description: Beautifully perfumed, this has swathes of ripe cherry and plum, with a hint of wood aging. The balance is already well established, with a line of crisp acidity that sits behind the rich, sweet fruit. With its tannins, this needs to age for at least three years.
Name: Château des Jacques 2011 Clos du Grand Carquelin  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is rich, spicy and full of red cherry flavor. It also has a dark, firm structure from the granite-based soil. The acidity that cuts through the fruit lends balance. Age this for 2–3 years.
Name: Château des Jacques 2011 Clos de Rochegrès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A densely tannic wine, showing the influence of Beaujolais's granite soil, this is currently dominated by minerality and structure rather than fruit. Considering the weight of the wine, the fruitiness is likely to develop over the next 2–3 years.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2011 Les Thorins  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Made using fruit that was sourced from vines planted in 1939, this wine shows the great concentration low yields and old vines can give. It has Gamay's natural freshness, with firm, dry tannins, a spice note and a fragrant finish. It's drinkable now, but it will be better in two years.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2011 Vignes de 1939  (Chénas)

Description: Solid and dense, this shows the structure and concentration from the famed Côte du Py in Morgon. It has a lot of tannins at the moment, although the potential of the red berry fruit and acidity is evident. Age this for four years.
Name: Château des Jacques 2011 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Owned by Beaune négociant Louis Jadot, this wine is big, bold and fruity, with black cherry flavor and acidity. It shows the structure and the potential of wood-aged Gamay.
Name: Château des Jacques 2011  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Using fruit sourced from 94-year-old vines, this is a powerful and concentrated wine. It has a serious, complex mix of fruit and tannin, with notes of leather and spice that lend power and density. Age this for at least another year.
Name: Domaine Dupré 2011 Vignes de 1918  (Régnié)

Description: Concentrated fruits dominate this ripe, juicy wine. Firm tannins lend structural support to this generous, textured selection. Age it for another year.
Name: Robert Perroud 2010 La Fournaise du Pérou  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: The sense of structure that is so evident in 2010 wines is particularly apparent in this perfumed, rich and firmly tannic selection. It shows the hard edges of granite soil, plus juicy red fruit. Concentrated and complex, it needs several years to mature.
Name: Trenel Fils 2010 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: This shows fine balance between its fragrant red fruits and firm tannins. It is a testament to how structured a Fleurie can be, with its acidity cutting through the firm structure. This is for aging for four years, when it will become round, with a rich texture.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2010  Fleurie

Description: Big, bold and finely concentrated, this shows both rich fruit and structured tannins. Notes of cherry, black plum and a touch of smoky wood come together in this wine that needs at least three years to show at its best.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2011 Les Trois Roches  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is a firm and stony wine, with dry tannins that give structure to the intense acidity and the red cherry flavor. It's dense and concentrated, with a solid feel that demands several years of aging.
Name: Richard Rottiers 2011  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: The magnificent 17th-century Château de la Chaize and its cellars are national monuments. This wine has a warm structure that's packed with black cherry flavor and finished with acidity. It could age for another year or two.
Name: Château de la Chaize 2009  Brouilly

Description: Ripe and structured, this has finely balanced flavors of bitter black cherries and juicy red plums. It has great depth of flavor, and its ripeness and fruitiness will develop over the next few months. No added sulfur was used in the fermentation of this wine.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2011 Les Roches  (Fleurie)

Description: Of all the Beaujolais crus, Morgon is the one for aging. This wine, with its powerful structure, exemplifies age-worthiness. It is weighty and dense, with a solid feel, plus juicy, opulent fruit that helps to balance the wine. Keep for 3–4 years.
Name: Château de Pizay 2011  Morgon

Description: Powerful tannins dominate this serious, complex selection. It has considerable dryness and fruit, a potentially impressive combination. It needs to age for several years.
Name: Laurent Gauthier 2011 Grands Cras Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: A full-bodied, rich and rounded wine, this has ripe tannins and red cherry and plum flavors. With a bite of spice and a chunky, solid structure, this selection can be consumed soon and it can also be aged.
Name: Château du Châtelard 2011 Cuvée Terre de Lumière  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Solid and structured, this shows the firm side of Fleurie. It is dominated by tannins that overlay the red berry fruit and the firm plum-skin texture. With its weight and concentration, this needs to age for another 2–3 years.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2011  Fleurie

Description: Using grapes sourced from stony soil, this is a serious, tight and mineral-driven wine. It has firm tannins that dominate the potentially juicy red fruits. Powerful and concentrated.
Name: Robert Perroud 2011 Pollen  (Brouilly)

Description: Contrary to its flowery name, Fleurie can produce firm and tannic wines, and this selection is a case in point. It is a solid and chunky effort that is laden with tannin and bitter cherry flavor. The tight acidity needs time to settle down, so give it a couple of years.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2011 Les Garants  (Fleurie)

Description: This aromatic, red-cherry flavored wine demonstrates the freshness of the year and the grape. It's a finely textured wine that is structured and accessible, with firm, dry tannins. It can be aged for 2–3 years.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2011 Les Chênes  (Fleurie)

Description: This selection is named after the cherry trees that border the vineyard, and it's not too much of a stretch of the imagination to find a red cherry flavor in the wine. Red berry fruits are there as well, backed up by dry, firm tannins.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2011 Les Cerisiers  (Juliénas)

Description: Full of firm tannins, this Juliénas shows solid structure and ripe red fruits. The fine acidity should help the wine age, and the juicy, fruity character should appear after a year or more.
Name: Trenel Fils 2010 Esprit de Marius Sangouard  (Juliénas)

Description: The famed Côte de Py Vineyard in Morgon has made a powerful and structured wine, with a black cherry flavor that's shaped by the dry, firm tannins. It is concentrated, dense and generous, with strong minerality and gritty texture. Age for 3–4 years.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Le Py  (Morgon)

Description: Big and ripe, this is structured with fine acids, rich berry fruits and firm tannins. The ensemble is full bodied, juicy and elegant, finishing with crisp flavors of red cherry and pepper.
Name: Château des Ravatys 2009 Domaine de l'Institut Pasteur  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Ripe and fruity, this is full of red cherry fruit. It has a mineral-driven structure that gives it a firmly textured edge and brings out the acidity. This could age for several years.
Name: Château du Châtelard 2011 Cuvée les Vieux Granits  (Fleurie)

Description: Named after a Roman centurion rather than a god of love, Saint-Amour produces structured Beaujolais. With its solid tannins and firm structure, this wine proves the point. It is concentrated, with acids and minerally red fruits dominating at the moment. It needs to age for 1–2 years.
Name: Trenel Fils 2010  Saint-Amour

Description: Intensely juicy, this is packed with acidity and tight red-cherry fruit layered with firm tannins. It feels a little austere at the moment, and it is likely to take time to open.
Name: Laurent Gauthier 2011 Côte du Py Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: An attractively balanced Moulin-à-Vent, this has firm tannins that contrast well with the damson flavor and tight acidity. The finish is fresh, with a hint of minerality.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2011 Domane de la Passion  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: An attractively fruity wine, this is rich in cherry and light spice flavors and is laden with acidity. It has a dry set of tannins, but it is so densely juicy that it is ready to drink now.
Name: Clos de Haute-Combe 2011  Juliénas

Description: Powerful and concentrated, this has a dark red-plum flavor and solid tannins. It is dense, and it shows the structure of the vintage. This is worth aging, and it certainly needs food to show at its best.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2010  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This is a rich, powerful and wood-aged wine that shows fine balance between its ripe red fruits and solid, chunky tannins. The wood rounds out the rich texture and gives character to the full, juicy finish.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Domaine des Ailes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Firm tannins set this wine on a path to aging. At the same time, it has a fine layer of intense fruitiness, and it is crisp and packed with blackberry fruit. It has the typical minerality and structure of Juliénas, so give it 2–3 years.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2011 Les Mouilles  (Juliénas)

Description: This has a mineral structure that's laced with acidity and red currant flavor. It has a tight texture and a crisp feel, showing a serious, austere side of Beaujolais. It's all balanced by the bright, crisp finish.
Name: Trenel Fils 2010  Chiroubles

Description: Made using fruit that was sourced from 100-year-old vines, this has a dark color, firm tannins and minerality, plus a solid black-plum flavor. This will age for several years.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2011 Coeur de Vendanges  (Beaujolais)

Description: Firmly tannic, this has has a dark plum flavor, layered with considerable density and dryness. With its juicy acidity and firm structure, this needs to age.
Name: Domaine Dupré 2011 Vignes de 1935  (Morgon)

Description: This is firm, concentrated and, as its name suggests, it's ready to pair with hearty fare. It has structure, followed by red cherry and blueberry fruits, and it's finished with acidity and a dry edge. Age for 3–4 years.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Hiver Gourmand  (Morgon)

Description: A wine with some depth, this is layered with fine tannins. The acidity and red cherry flavor are held up by its firm structure. It's also fruity enough to be consumed now.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2011  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: This is generous, full of red berry and plum fruits and lined with acidity. It has a firm structure that gives shape to its exuberant fruitiness. Ready to drink now, but it can be aged for another 2–3 years.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Domaine de la Calèche  (Fleurie)

Description: Bold and fruity, this is laden with bitter cherry and juicy plum flavors. The tannins are light and attractive, with juicy, refreshing acidity. Age this for a few more months.
Name: Robert Perroud 2011 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

Description: This has a firmly tannic structure and juicy fruit, suggesting its aging potential. It is rich and ripe, with black cherry and plum flavors that create a generous finish.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Domaine de la Source  (Chiroubles)

Description: For a Morgon, this is relatively light, showing more fruit than structure, with freshness that's tempered by a firm edge and minerality. Keep for a year, or drink now.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2011 Domaine de l'Oseraie  (Morgon)

Description: Showing a mineral-driven structure and firm tannins, this is a Beaujolais that needs to age. Rich and juicy, its perfumed red fruits currently cut through the dry tannins.
Name: Château de Raousset 2011  Chiroubles

Description: This is firmly tannic, with dark berry and black cherry fruits. Minerally and textured, it shows the full effect of Beaujolais's granite soil. It also has a rich feel that will evolve over the next several months.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2011 La Carrière  (Chénas)

Description: From the eastern slopes of the hill of Brouilly, this attractive, open and fruity selection shows a fine red-fruit character that's laced with fresh acidity. It has a firm structure, which creates a solid base for the fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Château de Pizay 2011 Château de Saint Lager  (Brouilly)

Description: Round, ripe and fruity, this has soft tannins that accentuate the cherry flavor and give a hint of dryness. The acidity and brilliant fruit are delicious, finishing with a bright red-fruit flavor.
Name: Château de la Chaize 2010  Brouilly

Description: A classic and fun Nouveau, this has an extra side of firm tannin that adds weight to an otherwise bold, fruity and food-friendly wine.
Name: Thorin 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: This is soft and full bodied, with round tannins that hint at dryness. With its ripe red-plum and strawberry flavors, this is a pleasure to drink now, but it is likely to age for several months.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2011 Château de Bagnols  (Brouilly)

Description: A red-fruited wine, this is a bright and crisp selection from the lightest of the Beaujolais cru villages. Its acidity cuts through the soft fruit flavors, and it has touch of tannin. Ready to drink.
Name: Château de Pizay 2011  Régnié

Description: This is a well-balanced and rich wine, with its tannins and acids giving it a sense of structure. With its black cherry and plum skin flavors, this is firm and smooth.
Name: Domaine Dupré 2011 Haute Ronze  (Régnié)

Description: Banana and ripe red-berry notes create the attractive open of this bright wine. It comes with a raw edge, but if slightly chilled it would make for a fine apéritif.
Name: Henry Fessy 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Ripe, round tannins give this full-bodied wine a rich feel. With its mouthful of bright red-cherry fruit, this is a delicious selection to drink now.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Eté Intense  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: A ripe red-fruit note offers a perfumed character to this fruity wine. A touch of banana is the only quibble with what is otherwise a bright selection.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2011 Domaine Pardon  (Fleurie)

Description: This is ripe, full bodied and delicious, with a red fruit flavor. It has all the juicy fruitiness that is associated with Beaujolais. Drink now, even slightly chilled.
Name: Château de Pizay 2011  Beaujolais

Description: Emphasizing tannins and tight structure as much as fruit, this also has a banana flavor that needs to blow off by aging for 1–2 years.
Name: Domaine Cheysson 2011  Chiroubles

Description: A griottier is an orchard of bitter cherry trees. This is fruity yet lean, with a cherry flavor. It has a hollow center, with more tannins than fruit.
Name: Domaine Dupré 2011 Le Griottier  (Morgon)

Description: Using fruit sourced from old vines, this is concentrated, with some richness and weight. Ripe red-cherry fruit mingles with balanced, dry tannins.
Name: Domaine Dupré 2011 Vignes de 1940  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: For a simple Beaujolais, this has richness and fruit density. It's as fruity as the wine should be, but it also has firm tannins. The finish has a minerally texture along with black-currant-like acidity.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2011 La Platière  (Beaujolais)

Description: Light and fruity, this is full of refreshing red berry fruits, making this a clean, forward apéritif. It has fragrant acidity on the finish.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2011 Gamay (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: This shows the depth of structure that can be found in a villages-level wine, even when it's a Nouveau. It has weight and spicy fruit, with upfront, juicy cherry and banana flavors.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2012 Château du Souzy Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is a classic, bold, fruity Nouveau, with firm tannins that add weight to the palate. Pair this with food.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Attractive and finely balanced, this has red cherry and strawberry flavors, which come wrapped in soft tannins and crisp acidity.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2011 Les Griottes Rosé Gamay (Beaujolais)

Description: A rounded wine, this has an attractive red-jelly flavor and light acidity. It is full and rich, with fine acids on the finish. Keep for six months.
Name: Trenel Fils 2011  Côte de Brouilly

Description: A bright and fruity wine, this is packed with red cherry flavor and fragrant acidity. Fresh and open, this is ready to drink.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2011 Château du Souzy  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is a festive wine, with soft, ripe fruit and acidity, plus a red berry flavor.
Name: Henry Fessy 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: With just an edge of tannins that give a dry character to the wine, this is a step up from Barton & Guestier's Beaujolais. It has firm plum and black cherry flavors, with fine acidity on the finish.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2011  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Red cherry fruit comes laced with light tannins, giving this bright wine an open, juicy character.
Name: Domaine de la Madone 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Soft and fruity, this is a generous, ripe wine that's full of juicy red-cherry fruits and gentle tannins. It has some richness, giving a sweet character to this open, ready-to-drink wine.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Eté Indien  (Brouilly)

Description: A classically fruity Beaujolais from the south of the region, this is packed with bitter cherry and ripe raspberry flavors. The tannins are soft—plentiful enough to lend structure. It is delicious, juicy and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2011 Les Griottes  (Beaujolais)

Description: This has surprisingly structured fruits and firm tannins for a Nouveau, and it still maintains a juicy cherry flavor and ripe acidity. The finish has a tangy, textured character.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: This tastes bone dry, with a caramel note that's followed by light, bright notes of red berry and apple. The finish is crisp and tight.
Name: Château de Pizay 2011 Rosé d'Une Nuit Gamay (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: Firm and tight, this is a wine that is still shaking off its baby tannins. Open this a few minutes before drinking, and its fruitiness will pair well with food. The finish is bright with acidity.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Bel Air Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Quite tart and perhaps just a bit underripe, this red checks in at barely 12% alcohol. It has a bit of a Band-Aid scent that competes with the light berry flavors.
Name: Chehalem 2010 Ridgecrest Vineyards Gamay Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Description: Flavors of banana and red berry come with some tannin. This exudes vibrant, in-your-face fruit that's crisp and juicy.
Name: Mommessin 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: This is classic and fun, bold and fruity, with weight coming from the firm tannins. Pair this with food.
Name: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: For a wine meant to be consumed now, this is almost too tannic. It has bright fruit and a flavor of black currant skin, plus a dry, tannic core.
Name: Albert Bichot 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Firm and rustic, this has red plum and berry flavors that mingle with a barnyard note. The tannins are forceful, so age it for another year.
Name: Gérard Charvet 2011 La Réserve d'Amélie  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Light, juicy and fruity, this is classic Beaujolais. A red cherry flavor and a burst of acidity come with gentle tannins. Ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2011 Les Grands Eparcieux  (Beaujolais)

Description: Light in color, this shows red cherry and strawberry flavors. The tannins are soft, creating an easy wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2011  Beaujolais

Description: This has juicy cherry and banana flavors, plus smoky tannins that give this wine a structure that's unusual for Beaujolais Nouveau. The acidity is just right, lending the finish freshness.
Name: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: Banana and ripe red-berry flavors are attractive and bright. It has a slight raw edge due to its youthfulness, but it would make for a juicy apéritif if lightly chilled.
Name: Paul Durdilly 2012 Les Grandes Coasses Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: As fresh and fruity as any Nouveau should be, this also comes with a tang of black-currant-skin-like tannin as well as red cherry fruit.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: This has an intense aroma that's almost overpowering, leading to a wine that is firm and dry. Its red cherry flavor is dominated by dense tannins. The perfumed character, joined by acidity, remains on the finish.
Name: Pardon et Fils 2011 Domaine Pardon Cuvée de l'Ermitage  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Light and fruity, this has a red cherry flavor that's filled with refreshing acidity. The banana flavor from the fermentation is a little too prominent, but this is still a bright, ready-to-drink selection.
Name: Trenel Fils 2011 Cuvée Rochebonne  (Beaujolais)

Description: Full, ripe and fruity, this is Nouveau upfront. It has a delicious juicy character thats sustained with some tannins. It has a bright, crisp finish that's flooded with a cherry flavor.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2012 Domaine de Rochecorbière Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: This is a light wine, and the fruit is dominated by acidity. It has a tart red-currant flavor, with a hint of banana.
Name: Domaine Dupré 2011 Terre Noire Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: For a Nouveau, this has surprisingly structured fruit, with some firm tannins. It has a juicy cherry flavor and ripe acidity, with a tangy, textured finish.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: Firmly tannic, this is a solid, chunky wine. It's full of dark plum, black currant and cherry flavors that fill out the firm, dry structure. Concentrated while also fruity, it's worth aging for a year.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine Moulin à Vent  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is a dense and rich wine, showing the power of a Morgon and the ripeness of the vintage. It is full bodied, dense and firmly tannic, with red plum and sweet cherry flavors. Keep this fine wine for another 2–3 years.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2009 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup Cuvée d'Exception  (Morgon)

Description: This big, burly effort is structured and solidly textured. It has weight accompanying the blackberry flavor, with a firm character that demands aging over at least 18 months. The finish is still firm and concentrated.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine Mont Chavy  (Morgon)

Description: A solid and chunky wine, this balances a rich structure with ripe, rounded fruit. Acidity cuts through the complex texture to give a juicy, fragrant feel. It's worth aging another year.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Morgon)

Description: A rich and rounded wine from a top Beaujolais vintage, this is ripe and full, packed with black cherry flavor and tannins that have now fully integrated into this warm wine. Drink now, although it could age longer.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Juliénas)

Description: This is a structured wine, showing the firm tannins of a 2010 Beaujolais. Under the dry surface, the rich, juicy fruit is there, balanced with acidity, red fruit and a dense texture. Age for at least another year.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2010 La Chapelle des Bois  (Fleurie)

Description: This is a solid, structured, mineral-driven wine from a famous vineyard. It is firm and dense, its big plum and berry flavors are supported by dry tannins and an herbal spice character. With its firm style, it needs to age for at least two years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Côte de Py  (Morgon)

Description: Firm tannins and its dark plum and blackberry fruits all point to a structured wine that has aging potential. It is ripe, with black cherry and spice notes that are balanced with acidity. Keep for one year.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine Chaponne  (Morgon)

Description: This is a perfumed wine with violet aromas and a fragrant character. It has soft plum and cherry flavors, its acidity shaped by ripe fruits. There is a touch of structure that provides a fine finish.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2010 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Fleurie)

Description: Firm, complex and full of dark tannins, this has a dry element due to its blackberry juice flavor and line of brightness. With its structure and acidity, it is likely to age for at least another two years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This big, ripe, fruity wine balances its fruit with a core of firm tannins. It's dense, with a dusty texture, a sweet blackberry-jam flavor and final acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine Jean Descombes  (Morgon)

Description: Just bottled, this wine is young, fruity and full of black cherry and red plum flavors. Combined with this is a firm character and a structure of tannins that demand aging over at least 2–3 years.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2011  Fleurie

Description: This is a firmly structured wine, but its black cherry flavor is marred by banana sweetness. Otherwise the wine is solid and tannic, with light acidity on the finish. Age for a year.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine Javernière  (Morgon)

Description: This taut, structured wine achieves a balance between red berry flavors and dry, firm tannins. It has a herbal edge and a solid, dense texture. It powers through with intense acidity on the finish.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 La Madone  (Fleurie)

Description: This rich, juicy wine is bursting with red fruits that are ready to drink. This is a ripe, full-bodied, friendly wine with just an edge of tannin and acidity to hold it all together.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2010 L'Héronde  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: This is a structured wine with firm tannins, showing a good balance of red berry and cherry juice flavors. It is rich and likely to soften over the next year into something warm and fruity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Clos des Garands  (Fleurie)

Description: Very perfumed in character, the wine has a bright red cherry flavor, with some weight and structure. There are good tannins and a warm, soft finish. The wine could age for another year.
Designation: Château la Tour de Bief Claude de la Tour
Name: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2010 Château la Tour de Bief Claude de la Tour  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This dark-colored wine is firm and marked by sweet fruit flavors. It has a hint of banana that accompanies its red fruit flavors, which sit awkwardly with the dense texture. Already mature, the wine has a ripe, soft finish.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Sélection  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is soft and ripe, with red cherry and strawberry notes. It has a light tannic texture, with acidity and a broad, rich finish.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Structured and dense, this has a solid feel to it that still preserves its attractive, fragrant character. Black plum notes provide a twist of acidity as well as a perfumed finish.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Sélection  (Juliénas)

Description: This attractively fruity effort features bitter cherry and raspberry flavors along with a light, tannic structure and acidity. The wine has weight and the chance to age over the next few months.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Sélection  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Black currant and red cherry flavors come together with a core of tannins, creating a wine that is ripe, floral and lightly structured.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Sélection  (Morgon)

Description: This is fruity Beaujolais with a sense of structure. It has a red cherry flavor that's laced with lively acidity, making this juicy and very drinkable. At the same time, the light tannins add a food-friendly element.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2011  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A soft, fragrant red-cherry flavor dominates this fruity, open and easy wine. Very ready to drink, it has attractive acidity and a light spice to the finish.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Château du Prieuré  (Brouilly)

Description: There is some of the structure characteristic of 2010 Beaujolais in this wine, but it is mainly dominated by a red cherry flavor and fresh acidity. It's ripe, fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Jaffelin 2010  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Simple and fruity, this has berry flavors that mingle with floral acidity, soft tannins and a rounded texture. Ready to drink.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine Paradis  (Saint-Amour)

Description: This tight, solid wine has more black currant than berry flavor, with a taut, dry character. It seems to lack some depth of fruit.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Sélection  (Fleurie)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fragrant, with a grapy appeal, this pure Gamay Noir comes on like a fresh Beaujolais. The cherry candy flavor is fruity and fun, but the wine thins out rapidly onto a quick finish.
Name: Methven Family Vineyards 2011 Gamay Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: This is a youthful fruit bomb, with a red fruit flavor that explodes in the mouth. It is soft and round, with a powerful shot of refreshing acidity. Drink now.
Name: Musset-Roullier 2010 Léjourie Gamay (Anjou)

Description: A splendidly rich wine, with mint from new wood adding an extra dimension to the ripe cherry fruit and sweet tannins. It's a wine that shows the full assets of the fine 2009 vintage, spice and ripeness.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2009 La Chapelle des Bois  (Fleurie)

Description: Organically grown grapes have yielded a firm, dense wine that brings out the power of Morgon. It has dark plum skins and cherry fruit, layered with firmly structured tannins. It's an impressive wine for aging 2–3 years.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2010  Morgon

Description: A structured ageworthy wine, layering tannins with dark cherry fruit. The acidity gives freshness and a textured character. With its dry flavors, the wine will age for 2–3 years or more.
Name: Gérard Brisson 2010 Les Charmes Cuvée la Louve  (Morgon)

Description: A wine that shows more of the structure of 2009 than the year's richness. It has tannins, red berry fruit, spice from new wood and layers of acidity. It could age well another six months.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2009 Premier Cru l'Héronde  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: A big, powerfully structured wine with concentrated tannins and plenty of black fruit. It has density, juicy fruitiness, layered acidity and the potential for aging at least a year.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2010 Belairissime Le Py  (Morgon)

Description: A sweet-fruited wine with flavors of raisins and dried cherries along with fresh red berry fruit and acidity. The wine has some structure and an attractive lightness.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2010 La Carrière  (Chénas)

Description: A wine that combines richness with sweet cherry flavors and a firm tannic edge. Acidity and ripeness have produced a structured, food-friendly wine.
Name: Louis Jadot 2010  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A solid, ripe wine, very much a nouveau for food, with some rich cherry fruit and an underlying smoky tannin layer. The fruit is ripe and full.
Name: Mommessin 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: With some weight, this is a smooth red-fruited wine with just a hint of bananas. The balance works well, marrying acidity and light tannins. Fruity and attractive.
Name: Domaine de la Madone 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A rich Nouveau, with fine black cherry fruit and some sweetness. It's a full-bodied wine, the tannins and acidity offering a sense of structure. A definite food Beaujolais.
Name: Henry Fessy 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: For a simple Beaujolais, this is an intensely rich wine with toast spice coming through the black cherry fruit. The tannins give a ripe structure. All the time, the wine remains true to its fruity origins.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2010 Cuvée de la Platière  (Beaujolais)

Description: With its bright cherry fruits, this is a warm and ripe wine. It has soft tannins and strawberry acidity. Drink now for red fruit pleasure.
Name: Domaine Dupeuble Père et Fils 2010  Beaujolais

Description: Excellent color on this firmly fruity wine. It has an attractive edge of tannins giving it good structure while showing all of the fresh nouveau fruit.
Name: Antonin Rodet 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: Bright red fruits in this attractive cherry and banana flavored wine. It has a soft tannic edge, laced with acidity and finishing spice.
Name: Paul Durdilly 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: A ripe, fruity wine with a light structure of tannins and acidity, it has some density while remaining fruity and juicy. The red cherry fruit blends into the closing acidity.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2010 Les Grands Eparcieux  (Beaujolais)

Description: A weighty wine that has black fruits, solid tannins and richness. It has a dense layer of spice and fruit that has acidity as well as juiciness. Worth aging for 6–12 months.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2010 Hiver Gourmand  (Morgon)

Description: A rich wine, with some weight, black cherry flavors and an edge of tannin. This is sufficiently structured to age, but the fresh fruit is all ready to appeal now.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: All red fruit, red cherries and the lightest tannins. This is full-bodied and exuberant, with the typical acidity of young Beaujolais.
Name: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A warm and rich wine that shows soft, ready-to-drink fruit flavors, a touch of red cherry and some freshness from the acidity.
Name: Domaine Chasselay 2010 Quatre Saisons  (Beaujolais)

Description: Henry Fessy's can-can dancer is with us again on this bottle of red cherry fruity wine. There is a texture of acidity, the fruit attractively integrated. Soft tannins complete this fresh, fruity wine.
Name: Henry Fessy 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: An attractively fruity wine, with light tannins and juicy fruit. It has all the right red fruited elements for a nouveau, bubbling with freshness.
Name: Albert Bichot 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A wine with a good balance between taut structure and forward fruit. Red cherries dominate this attractive light and fruity wine.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: A wine with some warm black cherry fruit as well as structured acidity. It has a dry texture to go with the fruit, making it a ripe but food friendly wine.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2010 Automne Festif  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: With relatively high altitude vineyards, Chiroubles can produce wines like this, with an austere backbone and high acidity. Together they make for a tight wine with red berries and a dry texture. Age for six months.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2010 Eté Fleuri  (Chiroubles)

Description: An attractively ripe and lightly concentrated wine, with black cherry and an edge of dry tannins. Sweet fruit, richly juicy, right up front.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: Soft and richly fruity, this has all the right red cherry and banana flavors that are immediately attractive. A delicious, juicy wine. Screwcap.
Name: Mommessin 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: A wine that shows bright acidity as well as red cherry fruits. It is soft and rounded, with the lightest touch of tannin. With its fruitiness, it should be drunk now.
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2010 Eté Indien  (Brouilly)

Description: Bright red cherry fruits, fresh and light with fruit acidity and the minimum of tannins.
Name: Thorin 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: All red cherry and banana fruit, this is a soft, juicy and bright wine. Attractive and fresh, just edged with a slightly dry texture.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: There is a layer of tannins here that impart a dry edge to what is otherwise sweetly fruity wine. It is full and juicy, with strawberry fruit flavors.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: A fruity wine, full of red cherries and plenty of acidity. There is dry structure, making it food friendly, but the wine is not for aging.
Name: Gérard Brisson 2010  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: The wine has a bitter edge with a burnt character that clashes with the red fruit and banana flavors. Maybe better in a few months, but by then, of course, it will have been drunk.
Name: Albert Bichot 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: This fruity Beaujolais features hints of bananas and red berries. It's soft, rounded and very approachable. Ready to drink.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2011 The Pairing Collection Cheese & Crackers  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Big, ripe and opulent, its ripe tannins balanced by perfumed red fruits. There is a solid core of dark and smoky dryness, a center that promises good aging. Already, though, the wine is showing its concentration and richness.
Name: Paul Beaudet 2009 Côte de Py  (Morgon)

Description: A smoothly ripe wine, with swathes of cherry and black currant fruits balanced by lively acidity. The wine, with its richness and the tannic structure, could well age for 3-4 years, although its fruitiness makes it delicious now.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2009 Cuvée de la Lure  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Like many Beaujolais in 2010, this wine has a firm and tannic structure. Being Morgon, though, it also has power and richness, the black fruits intense, with acidity to balance. This could well age for 2–3 years and more.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Ferraud et Fils 2010 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: Very ripe, as befits 2009, this is still a young wine. It is packed with fruit, some hints of wood, delicious fresh red berries and acidity that balances the firmly tannic core. Keep the wine a year at least for the full richness to develop.
Name: Domaine le Cotoyon 2009 Les Mouilles  (Juliénas)

Description: A rich, smoky wine, with some tannins from toast as well as fruit. The sweet red fruits are just ready to push forward to take over from the oak to give a powerful, ageworthy wine.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Prestige  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: An attractively fruity wine, with the richness of 2009 giving sweet red cherry fruits, blackberries and a balanced layer of tannin. Produced in the vineyards of the 18th century Château de Fleurie, this is a wine with good concentration and weight as well as fine fruit.
Name: Château de Fleurie 2009  Fleurie

Description: Bottled unfiltered, this is a richly ripe wine, layered with a more smoky, even mineral, texture from the volcanic soil of the vineyard. It is dense, the tannins giving hints of wood as well as a black plum skin character.
Designation: Cuvée Jules de Souzy Vieilles Vignes
Name: Château de la Terrière 2009 Cuvée Jules de Souzy Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)

Description: A structured wine, with some tight black cherry flavors as well as firm tannins. The wine has a mineral edge, the acidity giving a juicy character to the fruit, while the texture is dry, tannic. Age for a year.
Name: Gaël Martin 2009 Les Fouillouses  (Juliénas)

Description: Still firmly tannic, this is a wine that needs aging. It has weight and a dry core to go with its rich dark cherry and red berry fruits. There is also a fine juicy element that pushes right through the tannins. Keep for a year.
Name: Château de Pizay 2010  Morgon

Description: Tight, structured wine, with intense acidity as well as red berry fruits. It feels lean and sinewy, needing a few more months to settle and round out. Keep a year.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Ferraud et Fils 2010 Les Ravinets  (Juliénas)

Description: Smooth and rich wine with fresh blackberry fruits and a hint of raisins. The wine relishes both its acidity and its ripe fruit character, the tannins giving an attractive final support.
Name: Gaël Martin 2009 En Pressins  (Saint-Amour)

Description: With some firm tannins and considerable red fruit juiciness, this is a wine that combines a good fruity character with a solid structure. The balancing side is the acidity and very fresh finish.
Name: Domaine de Billards 2009  Saint-Amour

Description: Rich, full of black plums, a wine that shows sweetness from black cherries, only hinting at tannins. This is a charming, ripe wine, showing aging potential for maybe a year or two.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2008 Tradition  (Brouilly)

Description: Rich, fruity wine, with great red fruits, black cherries and a structure that melds easily into the ripe character. Tannins and a plum skin texture suggest another year's aging.
Name: Domaine le Cotoyon 2010  Juliénas
