Description: A wine that is dominated by dark, smoky tannins and acidity. It has a light fruit character but feels dry, with the wood aging given an important position.
Designation: Cuvée Jules de Souzy Vieilles Vignes
Name: Château de la Terrière 2008 Cuvée Jules de Souzy Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)

Description: Showing definite maturity, this remains a solid, chunky wine. It has richness as well as a light structure of acidity and raspberries. It is very ready to drink now.
Name: Loron et Fils 2005 Réserve Caveau Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Dominated by red fruits, this wine also has the structure of 2010. It is firm and concentrated while always fruity and accessible. It could be kept for a few months, but really is ready to drink now.
Name: Château de Pizay 2010 Château de Saint-Lager  (Brouilly)

Description: An elegant style of wine, this packs concentrated cherry and blackberry fruits. There is a light tannic character, attractive acidity and stylish fruit.
Name: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2009  Chiroubles
Winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

Description: Rather light for the vintage, this is still an attractively fruity wine. It has tannins, black currant and plum skin fruit. Juicy, lively, ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2009  Morgon
Winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

Description: A very structured wine, still young. It has tannins as well as ripe red cherry fruit flavors and considerable acidity. It's a wine for aging another year.
Name: Domaine le Cotoyon 2010  Saint-Amour

Description: With some weight and attractive fruit richness, here is a wine that brings out all the red fruitiness of a Beaujolais cru, while not being unduly burdened with tannin or structure. Its fruitiness should be taken advantage of now.
Name: Château de Pizay 2010  Régnié

Description: A vibrant and immediately accessable expression, Duboeuf is always consistant in its bottling of Beaujolas-Villages. The expected strawberry, bubble gum, cotton candy and banana notes are found both on the nose and palate. Juicy and colorful, this fresh quaff brings pleasure alone or paired with lighter entrées such as roasted turkey or chicken. Drink now. Imported by W.J. Deutsch & Sons, Ltd.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2006  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A solid, chunky wine, its fruit layers of jammy plums over light tannins. It has some richness along with an attractive juicy character that gives a dusty, almost sweet aftertaste.
Name: Louis Chevallier 2009  Morgon

Description: Light and fruity, full of red cherries, sweet tannins and attractive acidity. The wine is softly attractive with some of the warmth of the year.
Name: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2009  Régnié
Winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

Description: A soft, rounded wine, with delicious plum and black cherry fruit flavors. It is rich, along with acidity, ripe tannins and an easy, light finish.
Name: Labouré-Roi 2009 St Amand Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Fresh, fruity, red berry flavors, with only a light touch of tannin. This is classic Beaujolais, ready to drink in the next few months.
Name: Château de Pizay 2010  Beaujolais

Description: A red fruit flavored wine, light and packed with acidity. The wine may not have the richness of the vintage, but it does have a fine line in red cherry flavors. Drink now.
Name: Louis Chevallier 2009  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Rather dilute wine, it does have some fresh cherry flavors with very soft tannins and a clean line of acidity. For the vintage, it could have done wth more concentration.
Name: Jaffelin 2009  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Dark-hued wine, dominated by acidity as well as firm tannins. It shows solid, chunky structure, ripe fruit and plenty of sweetness. Of course, there is acidity as well, the charm of Gamay coming through in the fresh cherry flavors. Age 2–3 years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Domaine Montchavy  (Morgon)

Description: The rare ripeness of the 2009 vintage is shown in the high alcohol, for Beaujolais at least, of this wine. Not that it shows, except in weight. The acidity is right there along with ripe plums. An ageworthy, finely concentrated wine.
Name: Paul Beaudet 2009 Clos de la Brosse  (Saint-Amour)

Description: The 2009 vintage of this wine was one of the stars from Georges Duboeuf, and this 2010 fits the same pattern. It has great richness, spice, black cherry fruits, the acidity offering the fruity side of the wine. Ready for aging two years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Domaine de la Chaponne  (Morgon)

Description: A richly aromatic wine, with swathes of sweet fruit, ripe tannins and a juicy, jammy feel. This is so generous, open, welcoming. There is structure as well, cushioned by the sweet fruits.
Name: Henry Fessy 2009  Fleurie

Description: Ripe, rounded and generous, a warm plum juice-flavored wine. There is power and concentration. It is a very complete, ageworthy wine, although accessible now.
Name: Henry Fessy 2009  Saint-Amour

Description: From two different domaines on the Côte de Py slope, this is a dense, firm wine, very solid and powerful. The wine has opulence under its structure, with rich plum and sweet jelly flavors. Worth aging for another year.
Name: Paul Beaudet 2009 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Such a concentrated wine, with the intensity of red Burgundy but with the juiciness of Beaujolais. Swathes of smooth fruit wash around the palate, coupled with a touch of minerality and a dense texture. Age for 2–3 years and more.
Name: Jacques Charlet 2009 Champ de Cour  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A wine that combines richness with a great structure. It is ripe, smoky, the red fruits rich and concentrated. A wine that is packed with juicy fruit and also with a good aging potential.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2009  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: A finely perfumed wine, touched with wood, Beaujolais in a Burgundy style, structured and with intense acidity. It is packed with firm tannins, surrounded by a lively cherry and rich fruit character.
Name: Château des Jacques 2010 Clos du Grand Carquelin  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Intense and rich wine, with touches of smoky wood, the tannins ripe, the acidity a refreshing balancing factor. With its cherry character, there is fruit already, but wait a year and this will be impressive.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Domaine des Rosiers  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A powerful style, very much OF the year. There are initial austere tannins as well as acidity. The juiciness of the wine takes a while to come through, the jammy character in the background of what is still a structured wine.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Ferraud et Fils 2009 Le Reposoir  (Fleurie)

Description: A really ripe wine, rich and with a generous feel to it. The sweet cherry fruit is powered with plum juice, dense tannins and structure. A wine for aging.
Name: Henry Fessy 2009  Morgon

Description: A firmly structured wine, with dark, ripe tannins. The black plum and berry fruits add juiciness, while the wine also has touches of spice and a full rich texture.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2009 Les Moriers Vieilles Vignes  (Fleurie)

Description: Despite its underlying richness, this is a very structured wine, solidly based on dry tannins and firm acidity. This texture, which is also given extra liveliness by its red cherry fruits, suggests a wine for aging over 2–3 years.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2009 Les Crots Vieilles Vignes  (Juliénas)

Description: An impressive wine, as ripe as the year, intense, with powerful layers of jammy fruits, sweet acidity and dusty tannins. It has plenty of freshness, which is well integrated with the ripeness.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Prestige  (Morgon)

Description: Sweet strawberry and cherry fruits are the soft cover to this intensely tannic wine. That structure shows its power, concentration and ageworthiness. Keep for three years and the richness will be fully revealed.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2009  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: A rich wine with spice and red fruits, the tannins well integrated. It shows aging potential both from its ripe fruit and its dry, firm core. The wine is very structured, powerful, a fine example of this exceptional vintage.
Name: Jacques Charlet 2009 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: With the embossed bottle and the extra years aging, Duboeuf's Prestige range does have an extra quality. This Juliénas is ripe, concentrated, a powerful expression of Gamay with a more serious intent.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Prestige  (Juliénas)

Description: Smoky wine, rich as well as structured. The acidity of the year is integrated into the structure, the firm tannins and juicy red berry fruits a balanced pleasure to taste.
Name: Richard Rottiers 2010  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Griottes are a type of bitter cherry used in cooking, and this wine shares some of that character. It is firmly structured with acidity and an edge of attractive lightness. Age for 2–3 years.
Name: Mommessin 2010 Les Griottes  (Morgon)

Description: Still so tannic, there is a question of how this wine will soften. The fruit is a series of hints behind the firm structure. Dense and concentrated, it reveals the terroir-driven nature of wines from the famed Côte du Py slope. Keep for 3–4 years.
Name: Paul Beaudet 2008 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: Structured, with layers of dark tannins and black cherry flavors. It's packed with plum juice, hinting almost at Pinot Noir, while also retaining the lovely open Gamay fruit.
Name: Mommessin 2010 Domaine de Champ de Cours  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: With some tannins, even a touch of wood, this is a weighty wine, giving juicy plum flavors along with acidity. It is rich and concentrated, although ready to drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Prestige  (Brouilly)

Description: A wine with an important structure, tasting very young at this stage. There is great acidity through a lovely, fragrant, forward wine. The acidity gives everything a lift of fruitiness.
Name: Mommessin 2010 Les Pêchers  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Very firmly tannic, still young and needing another year to age. The red berry fruits are present, layered with the tannins and acidity. The wine has structure, plenty of freshness, finishing with cherry acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Château de Juliénas  (Juliénas)

Description: Powerful, rich and chunky wine. It has the ripest jammy plum and crushed strawberry fruit, along with a serious tannic structure. Just approaching drinkability, its texture is now refreshed with delicious fruit.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2009  Morgon

Description: Firm wine that is packed with tannins as well as solid fruit. The wine is concentrated with a dense plum skin texture. Chunky, perfumed and solid.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Ferraud et Fils 2009 Les Ravinets  (Juliénas)

Description: Firm tannins push this wine into the concentrated direction. It is rich, ripe, although with plenty of juicy red fruit flavors. The wine, with its pure line in acidity, has an attractive chewy structure.
Name: Robert Perroud 2009 Pollen  (Brouilly)

Description: Ripe, densely structured wine, balancing tannins, acidity and red plum and cherry fruit flavors. There's a strong mineral edge here, a wine that needs 2–3 years of aging, to round out its edges.
Name: Laurent Gauthier 2010 Côte du Py Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: A firmly terroir-driven wine, solidly based on its tannins and the richest of red fruits. Very mineral, chewy at this young stage, densely concentrated, the acidity a sharp light through the fruit. Powerful stuff.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: A very structured wine, as befits this normally powerful cru. It is packed with dark tannins and minerality. The wine is angular, and you can taste the granite and schist soil. This edge of austerity is balanced by delicious fruit.
Name: Henry Fessy 2010  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Rich and perfumed, the wine is packed with black cherry and damson fruit flavors. It is concentrated with its tannins firmly integrated, giving great final fruit and ripeness.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine Desmures  (Chiroubles)

Description: Impressively powerful, structured wine that has spice, richness, plenty of firm tannins as well as a punch of sweet plum and red cherry flavors. There is an edge of acidity that suggests aging potential.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Domaine Jean Descombes  (Morgon)

Description: An opulent, ripe, full-bodied wine, with sweet cherry and spice flavors, very rich. The juicy sweetness of the fruit is given shape by the firm, dusty tannins. Likely to age, this is already drinking well.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2009  Fleurie

Description: A very complete wine, firm but flattering on the palate. A mix of cherry skins, red plums and lovely juiciness all come together in an harmonious whole.
Name: Mommessin 2010 La Cerisaie  (Fleurie)

Description: Sweet plum juice and strawberry flavors, a typical wine of the vintage. Acidity and tannins are well integrated into the ripe character of this delicious wine.
Name: Henry Fessy 2009  Chénas

Description: Firm tannins here and rich fruit underneath, but the wine is spoilt by the banana flavor that intrudes. Perhaps recent bottling has brought this out, in which case a few months wait will see the full potential.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Domaine Javernières  (Morgon)

Description: So, why not take advantage of the appellation name to declare a wine spirit of seduction? You''ll find soft, ripe and warm fruits, delicious juiciness and well integrated tannins.
Name: Pascal Berthier 2010 Esprit de Séduction Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Tannins, acidity, black fruit, everything is in its right place in this wine. It has the structure of the vintage, with a series of dry, smoky bacon flavors, the weight apparent.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Belles Grives  (Morgon)

Description: Warm and ripe wine, very open with its red fruit acidity well integrated. There are tannins and a more dry character of course—this is a 2010 wine, but the main effect is of weight and some power.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Château des Capitans  (Juliénas)

Description: Producers love to play on Saint-Amour (in fact a Roman legionary), and this Sorcerer Cuvée is in a good tradition. The wine is soft, ripe, open and generous, with spice and juicy cherry and raspberry flavors. The tannins are in the background.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Ferraud et Fils 2009 Cuvée Ensorceleuse  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Ripe fruit with soft acidity chracterize this wine that has great concentration, jammy flavors, strawberry jelly and a generous plum skin texture.
Name: Henry Fessy 2010  Juliénas

Description: Powerfully rich wine, with jammy fruit flavors to go with its strawberry fruits. The wine is driven by its ripe fruit, the acidity coming through the sweetness to finish freshly and with some tannic, ageworthy structure.
Name: Paul Beaudet 2009 Domaine de Chardignon  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Hints of smoky bacon and wood are now giving this wine some maturity. It has firm tannins still, but also a rich texture, with some red berries still present.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2008 Cuvée de la Lure  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: There is an austere character to this wine, tannins edged with minerality. It has weight as well as concentration and, as compensation, sweet cherry juice to go with all this structure.
Name: Henry Fessy 2009  Chiroubles

Description: Tight and tannic, the wine reveals acidity, structure and red cherry juice flavors. There is a definite minerality here, giving the wine an austere feel. It needs a year or two to be at its best.
Name: Laurent Gauthier 2010 Grand Cras Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: A wine that still has young and fresh fruit. It has attractive acidity, a core of tannins. The weight and ripe fruit flavors are hiding in the background, offering the potential for a wine that is solid and concentrated.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Domaine de la Vigne Romaine  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: With some maturity, this has become a rounded wine with attractive soft tannins, freshly peeled plums and bitter cherry flavors. Everything is softening together, the acidity calm and balanced.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2008 Réserve  (Morgon)

Description: From a selection of parcels, this cuvée is, for the vintage, concentrated and rich. Firm and tough tannins do show, although the dominant character is sweet fruit.
Name: Henry Fessy 2010 Cuvée Confidentielle  (Brouilly)

Description: Rounded and rich wine, its acidity pushing through firm tannins and lively red fruits. There are both freshness and structure here, with final juiciness.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Sélection  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: The showpiece château and estate owned by Mommessin has produced a rich, characterful wine, the fruits balanced by acidity. The structure of the year does show through, but always there is the juicy fruit.
Name: Mommessin 2010 Château Pierreux  (Brouilly)

Description: There are certainly plenty of tannins here, but they are balanced by rich fruit, strawberry juice flavors and freshness. Structured ripeness is the hallmark here.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Ferraud et Fils 2010 Domaine Rolland  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: A rich and spicy wine, its red fruits given a jammy feel by sweetness and ripeness. The acidity lies underneath this attractive surface, while tannins give the final structure.
Name: Pierre Dupond 2009 Domaine de Boischampt  (Juliénas)

Description: Rounded and ripe, this is delicious, soft Gamay. It has the concentration of the vintage, giving red cherry spice and juicy fruit to go with the acidity. An enjoyable wine already, although still with some potential.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2009  Brouilly

Description: Laced with tannins, this has intense, very pure red cherry fruits and a cool feel to it. The wine's juiciness has a smoky edge, while remaining fresh.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Domaine Desmures  (Chiroubles)

Description: The Hospices de Beaujeu is a charitable foundation. Mommessin makes the wine from the foundation's vineyards. This vintage is packed with black cherry fruit and lively acidity. It is also structured, creating an excellent balance.
Designation: Hospices de Beaujeu Cuvée des Sires de Beaujeu
Name: Mommessin 2010 Hospices de Beaujeu Cuvée des Sires de Beaujeu  (Régnié)

Description: Fine, aromatic wine, very cherry, its structure and bright fruits already integrating well. Acidity is a dominant element, with the underlying tannins pushing through the intense juiciness.
Name: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2010  Fleurie

Description: Warm, rounded and open style of wine with attractive fruits, hints of raisins and a smoky character. Not for aging.
Name: Henry Fessy 2009  Côte de Brouilly

Description: A wine with considerable structure, balanced by a good dollop of sweet fruits. The wine has weight, a tight final acidity and a finish that hints at some aging potential.
Name: Henry Fessy 2010  Brouilly

Description: In Beaujolais, 2010 was a firm and structured year, and this is very evident in this darkly tannic wine. It is packed with juicy acidity and red berry fruits, while it is also in need of several months' aging.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Sélection  (Juliénas)

Description: Some richness and smoky flavors, although the acidity is also very present. Flavors of red cherry and pepper are balanced by a core of tannins.
Name: Robert Perroud 2010 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

Description: Boasting weight and some richness, the wine shows that the northern Beaujolais crus are the most successful in 2010. The cherry and sweet plum flavors are laced with ripe acidity as well as a mineral edge.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Sélection  (Saint-Amour)

Description: For the year, this is ripe and soft, the core of dry tannins providing the counterbalance to the juicy red cherry flavors. The finish has lively acidity.
Name: Mommessin 2010 Château de Briante  (Brouilly)

Description: The wine has a lively, bright feel even though the structure is very present. The fruit is as crisp as possible, giving a tight as well as refreshing final taste.
Name: Mommessin 2010 Les Muriers  (Chiroubles)

Description: Soft and fruity, this is a warm-feeling wine. The hints of banana do not detract from the black cherry and juicy flavors. There is some weight as well, with dense tannins.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Domaine de la Seigneurie  (Juliénas)

Description: There is plenty of acidity here, but that is balanced by the edge of dryness and the enticing raspberry juice flavor. A wine with freshness a-plenty as well as some dry weight.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Domaine de Riaz  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Earthy, fruity wine with bitter cherry and plum flavors. The wine has some weight, along with its acidity. Serve slightly chilled.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2009 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This property, belonging to Henry Fessy, has produced a light-hearted wine, with hints of minerality, some dry tannins, juiciness and lively acidity.
Name: Henry Fessy 2010 Château des Reyssiers  (Régnié)

Description: In 2010, this cool-climate cru of Beaujolais has produced a fruity wine, very structured while retaining all the right red berry flavors. It would be possible to age this for a year or two.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Sélection  (Chiroubles)

Description: Generous ripe fruit is found on a wine packed with cherry and raspberry flavors. Hints of banana appear along with the vintage's signature tannic structure. Keep for 6–9 months.
Name: Pierre Dupond 2010 Domaine de Boischampt  (Juliénas)

Description: This is a soft, ample wine, with an attractive tang of black cherry and ripe acidity. The wine has just the right juicy fruitiness.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Ferraud et Fils 2010 Domaine Rolland  (Brouilly)

Description: There is the proper Morgon weight, the tannins very much to the fore. The results is a wine that is structured, with hints of black fruits behind the firm front. Fine acidity gives just the right lift.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Sélection  (Morgon)

Description: Tight and tannic with as much structure as fruit. The freshness comes from the acidity, although at the end strawberry juiciness shows through.
Name: Domaine Dupré 2010 Haute Ronze  (Régnié)

Description: There are tannins here, with tight acidity and clean cherry fruits. The structure is balanced by this red fruit character. For drinking now.
Name: Lucien Lardy 2010  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Very fresh and crisp, packed with ripe juicy cherries. There are tannins, but they are an afterthought compared to the bright fruit and acidity.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Ferraud et Fils 2010  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A series of firm tannins goes with acidity, raspberry fruits and attractive juicy sweetness. A wine for drinking on cold winter evenings.
Name: Henry Fessy 2010  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Sweet cherry and raspberry flavors, with soft tannins. The acidity melds into the ripe fruits, in a wine that is rounded and ready to drink.
Name: Paul Beaudet 2009 Domaine Romy  (Beaujolais)

Description: With intense acidity, this is a firm and tannic wine, unusual for a Brouilly. The tannins give the wine weight, an almost severe feel, the acidity cutting right through the juicy berry fruits.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Sélection  (Brouilly)

Description: With a very mineral texture, this is a wine with as much tannin as fruit. It does have a bitter cherry character that gives some freshness, while the aftertaste combines both the dryness and the acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Sélection  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: A lean wine, all tannins and missing the fruit. It has acidity, a smoky character, but there is a hollow feel to it.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 La Trinquée  (Juliénas)

Description: Fruity wine, with sweet cherry flavors and warmth. Just a touch of structure and acidity.
Name: Henry Fessy 2010  Beaujolais

Description: the banana side of Beaujolais, there are also acidity, red fruits and a dry, tannic core.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Château de la Perrière  (Brouilly)

Description: Fresh, soft cherry fruit wine, with light tannins and bright acidity. Simple, soft and fruity.
Name: Domaine Dupré 2009 La Trend Attitude  (Beaujolais)

Description: Well structured wine, the red cherry fruits laced with some banana hints. The wine is deliciously fruity, the tannin edge just a light coating.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Sélection  (Régnié)

Description: With bright red fruits and acidity, this shows structure, piles of red cherry flavors, followed by firm tannins.
Name: Mommessin 2010  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Showing up-front fruit, with tense acidity, this is all about freshness. There's a cool, textured feel to the wine, more plum skin than juice.
Name: Paul Beaudet 2010 Domaine Romy  (Beaujolais)

Description: A very fine Beaujolais, from this premier hillside in Morgon that brings together red cherry and plum fruits on one side and firm tannins on the other. Big and concentrated, for aging over three years and more.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2009 Côte de Py  (Morgon)

Description: Granite soil with strata of quartz gives this wine its intense texture, very structured and tight. It's at a young stage, the red currant and dark cherry fruits integrating with the firm character of the wine. Keep for two years.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2009 Domaine Piron-Lameloise  (Chénas)

Description: A concentrated wine, full of firm tannins as well as delicious red cherry fruits. The wine has weight, richness, structure, definitely for aging, while retaining the open fruit of delicious Gamay.
Name: Gérard Brisson 2009 Les Charmes Cuvée la Louve  (Morgon)

Description: In a firm style, this is a dense wine, its black fruits packed into a solid structure. It has power as well as ripe fruit, with tannins and acidity, and is likely to age for a couple of years.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2009  Morgon

Description: Round and soft, very much in the style of warm-hearted Brouilly. The wine has a layer of tannins, while it's the delicious red berry fruits that dominate. Ripe, full and ready to drink.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2009 Combiaty  (Brouilly)

Description: Ripe red cherry fruit, laced with refreshing acidity, gives this wine a great lift and liveliness. Its fruit goes right through the palate, with soft tannins as a backdrop. Drink this year.
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2009 Domaine de la Chanaise  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Full-bodied, rich-feeling wine, quite sumptuous in its texture. It has a layer of tannins to give structure, although the wine is essentially soft and enveloping.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2009  Brouilly

Description: Delightfully perfumed wine, revealing all the richness of 2009 while preserving the red fruits and acidity. Lively, ripe and ready to drink.
Name: Gérard Brisson 2009  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: The wine has a feeling of being sugared, with a jammy, toffee character overlying the red berry fruits. The final acidity is more attractive.
Name: Michel Picard 2009  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: With firm tannins, rich berry fruits and more typical red cherry flavors, this has weight and a ripe juicy core. It's ready to drink, but could be kept for another year.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2009  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Light red cherry-flavored wine from a fine year for Beaujolais. The wine is all juicy fruit, rounded tannins and light, smoky acidity.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2009  Beaujolais

Description: Still fresh, with bitter cherry flavors, acidity and light tannins. A lightweight, deliciously fresh wine.
Name: Cédric Vincent 2006  Beaujolais

Appellation: Vin de Table Francais, France Other, France
Description: A Gamay-based wine from one of the leading Morgon producers. Soft tannins, red cherry flavors and a touch of banana are enlivened by fine acidity on the finish.
Name: Marcel Lapierre 2009 Raisins Gaulois Gamay (Vin de Table Francais)

Description: From the most famous slope in Morgon, this is a powerful wine, its tannins still working their way into the fruit. Black cherries, and sweet plums are dominated by a firm, concentrated structure. Give this wine another year.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Côte de Py  (Morgon)

Description: One of Duboeuf's 2009 successes, this is powerful, excellently balanced between solid tannins and fresh fruit. The black cherry flavors revolve around a dry core, concentrated and complex, with a full and ageworthy aftertaste.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Prestige  (Fleurie)

Description: As rich as it is tannic, this is powerful and concentrated. It shows the rich 2009 fruit at its best, full of sweet berries, deliciously ripe. Enjoyable, while it is also serious.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine de la Chaponne  (Morgon)

Description: Rich as well as tannic, this is concentrated, with dense fruits and sweet acidity. Its structure offers good aging as well as pleasurable fruit now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Château du Grand Pré  (Fleurie)

Description: A big, bold and fruity wine that is full of ripe berry fruits, rich and generous. This is Beaujolais at its most exuberant, a celebration of delicious fruit. It could age, but is ready to drink.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine des Rosiers  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A solidly tannic wine that powers with bitter chocolate, plum skin and black berry flavors. Very concentrated, it has the structure and acidity to offer aging potential for 2–3 years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Carquelins  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: An elegant wine, its berry fruits fitting well into a structure that balances tannins and soft acidity. It has style, the fruit full of sweet black berry juice and a lift of acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine du Paradis  (Saint-Amour)

Description: A finely structured wine, very firm, with a dark edge of tannins over ripe black fruit. The wine is concentrated and dense, still developing and showing great final juicy character.
Name: Domaine Pral 2008 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: Tannic and mineral, this is intensely structured. With its firm tannins and dark plum flavors, it is on the dry side, needing 2–3 years to show its best. This is Beaujolais for aging.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Belles Grives  (Morgon)

Description: Dominated by its dry tannins, this is a tight black currant and dark plum skin-flavored wine, surrounded by a firm core of tannins, a firm and dark-hued wine.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Clos des Garands  (Fleurie)

Description: There is great structure here, with dusty tannins percolating through the rich wine. It has power, concentration and density, with cocoa and cherry flavors well integrated. Think about aging for 1–2 years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Sélection  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Firm and structured, this is serious Beaujolais. The ripe cherry and plum flavors are surrounded by dry, dark tannins that promise some aging. Hints of smoky minerality go well with the final juicy acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine de la Seigneurie  (Juliénas)

Description: A textured, structured wine, solid and packed with tannins. It is full of concentrated black currant and prune flavors, layered with dark coffee. It is worth aging for at least 1–2 years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine de Montchavy  (Morgon)

Description: Full and rich, this is a ripe, generous wine that offers great swathes of black berry fruit. It is well structured, the tannins folding into the ripe fruits, although never losing sight of delicious jelly acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Château de Prieuré  (Brouilly)

Description: Ripe and juicy, this is an immediately appealing wine, full of forward fruit that is rich and sweet. Dark cherry lies over cranberry sharpness. The wine flows easily from the glass, an example of the sunny side of Beaujolais.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine du Moulin-à-Vent  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Lean and tannic, this is a tough wine, its tannins dominating the underlying juicy fruit. It has power, with a firm and dry texture. Give it 2–3 years to develop.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine Jean Descombes  (Morgon)

Description: This is dry Beaujolais, boasting as much structure as fruit. The tannins are prominent, underpinning the spicy black berry fruits. The effect is rich, a wine that will age well over 2–3 years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Château des Capitans  (Juliénas)

Description: A complex and intense single-vineyard wine, it has ripe berry fruits with dark tannins. Only at the end is the juicy character of the wine on show.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine des Versauds  (Morgon)

Description: Bringing out the tannic side of Fleurie, this Sélection is a chunky, structured wine whose black currant-skin flavors mingle with bitter cherries. It layers a fine juiciness with the structure.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Sélection  (Fleurie)

Description: A well-balanced rich wine, showing the ripe fruit of 2009, giving sweet plums, ripe acidity and some firm, structured tannins. It is even worth aging for a few months.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine de Riaz  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Rich, fruity wine that is full of black plum juice and soft tannins. Milk chocolate sweetness adds to the generous nature of this juicy wine. Drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine de Michelons  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: On the austere side, as befits a wine from the highest vineyards in Beaujolais, this is also balanced and elegant. It shows black berry fruits, a firm edge of tannins as well as delicious juicy flavors.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Sélection  (Chiroubles)

Description: A finely structured wine that has firm tannins to go with the ripe juicy red fruits. Bitter cherry and crisp acidity fit easily together, while the dry core comes out strongly in the aftertaste.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Château de Nervers  (Brouilly)

Description: The year 2009 seems to have been a tannic one in Fleurie, producing wines that will benefit from some aging. This fits that bill well, a mineral and austere black fruit flavored wine, with a smoky aftertaste to go with tight acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 La Madone  (Fleurie)

Description: Full in the mouth, this is a rich and easy wine, packed with jammy fruit. It is soft, the plum flavors rounded and only light brushed by tannin and acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Sélection  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Initially all tannins, this wine is taking its time to develop ripe fruit. It has a mineral, gravel-like texture, with stalky berry fruits.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Sélection  (Morgon)

Description: There's a fine force of tannin here, giving the wine weight and structure. This balances well with red berry fruits, a light citrus edge and final juicy acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Sélection  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: There is no question about the wood here. It dominates the aroma and the palate, burying the fruit in a smooth, vanilla character. It is a pleasure to drink, but seems to have removed itself from Beaujolais.
Designation: Cuvée Elevé en Fût de Chêne
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Cuvée Elevé en Fût de Chêne  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A ripe, smoky wine, full of sweet jelly berry fruit. It is rounded and rich, a delicious wine that rolls easily around the mouth.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Clos des Quatre Vents  (Fleurie)

Description: With crisp black berry fruits, this is pure juice in a glass. It has fresh acidity, a light layer of tannin and a sweet underlay to the attractive fruitiness.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Sélection  (Juliénas)

Description: Packed with strawberry aromas and red berry fruits, this is a ripe, fruit-forward wine only lightly disturbed by tannins. There is a great juicy quality here.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Château des Bachelards  (Fleurie)

Description: Ripe and also tannic, this is structured wine, its berry fruits pushing through a dry plum skin texture. It is solid and chunky while remaining fresh and fruity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Château des Vierres  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Packed with juicy red cherries, this is a fresh, fruity Beaujolais to drink this winter. There is just a touch of tannin as well as refreshing acidity.
Name: Domaine Pral 2009 Cuvée Terroir  (Beaujolais)

Description: This is a soft, open wine, full of ripe berry fruits and red cherries. There is only the lightest tannin, along with bright acidity, a wine that is so ready to drink.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Sélection  (Brouilly)

Description: Full-bodied wine that is soft, washing easily over the palate. The downside is that it lacks definition, the tannic structure lost in the velvet texture. Drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Château de la Perrière  (Brouilly)

Description: A surprisingly dumb wine, not giving much beyond very dry tannins. The result is a wine that has bitterness, with dark chocolate and bitter cherry fruits. Will it open up? Maybe, but the jury is still out.
Designation: Domaine de la Tour du Bief
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine de la Tour du Bief  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Fresh berry fruits and soft tannins combine to give an easy, jammy wine. This is ripe, juicy and fruity, and ready to drink now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Sélection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Appellation: Vin de Table Francais, France Other, France
Description: The partner to Copains d'Abord, this wine sports a label of women having a good time at a party. The wine suits the image: fresh, fruity and juicy.
Name: Domaine des Sablonnettes 2008 Les Copines Aussi Gamay (Vin de Table Francais)

Description: The wine shows bitter fruits, a layer of dry tannins as well as attractive acidity. It has a touch of spice over the juicy, fruity aftertaste.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Château du Grand Vernay  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: With just a touch of tannin, this big-selling Beaujolais-Villages has both weight and richness. Most of all, it has bright red fruits, a hint of spice and crisp acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: While there is some unfortunate banana flavor, the rest of this wine is attractive. It has juicy black berry flavors, an edge of citrus and final lively acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine de Grand Croix  (Brouilly)

Description: A smooth, fruity wine, with fine red-cherry flavors and very soft tannins. It is spoiled by a banana flavor that intrudes into the fresh fruit.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine du Buyats  (Régnié)

Description: The banana aromas are off-putting in this light, juicy wine. Although there are tannins, they are not enough to make sense of the simple, jammy fruit.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 La Trinquée  (Juliénas)

Appellation: Vin de Table Francais, France Other, France
Description: Made by Beaujolais producer Gilles Gelin, this sweet rosé is full of ripe, crushed strawberries, a touch of caramel and a rosehip aftertaste. More acidity would be welcome, but it works well as an apéritif.
Name: Domaine des Nugues NV Gamay (Vin de Table Francais)

Description: The most famous hillside in Morgon gives a satisfyingly structured wine, dominated by a warm character of well-exposed vines, but also with a more serious edge of acidity and fresh juiciness. The wine has a good dense final texture and could age for a year or two.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Côte de Py  (Morgon)

Description: A big, solid wine, dominated by both tannins and dark red fruits. This is an impressive wine, its structure full of dark corners. The acidity is an integral part of the rich fruits. Definitely ageworthy.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Domaine de la Chaponne  (Morgon)

Description: On the tannic side of Gamay, this could be young Pinot Noir in its mineral structure and solid texture. It is a wine for aging with its black plum and spice flavors, with the acidity lighting up the aftertaste.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Belles Grives  (Morgon)

Description: This is big Fleurie, dominated by floral aromas and dry tannins at this stage, and therefore likely to develop for a year or two. The fruits are dark plum, full in the mouth. The acidity offers freshness but also adds to the weight of the texture.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2008 Château des Moriers  (Fleurie)

Description: A big, firm and solid wine that shows the proper power of Morgon, while retaining some delicious sweet fruits. The wine is dense in tannins and fruit, giving licorice and spice as well as the final, fresh acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Domaine des Versauds  (Morgon)

Description: The Duboeuf family property on the edge of the village of Juliénas produces a satisfyingly full-bodied wine, its fruit and tannins offering balance and ripeness. Acidity and cherry flavors are dominant over the dry core.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Château des Capitans  (Juliénas)

Description: A wine for short-term aging, despite the relative lightness of the vintage and wine. It has firm tannins and dark berry fruits, layered with plum skins. The fruit sits on a base of tannins and acidity, while the surface remains bright and fresh.
Name: Louis Tête 2007  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Tannins dominate here, the fruit offering some bright support. The wine is certainly firm, although it misses some concentration. But it is well balanced, berry fruits showing well against a drier core. The aftertaste offers freshness and acidity. Drink over the next year.
Name: Louis Tête 2007 Les Charmeuses  (Morgon)

Description: Certainly an attractive presentation with its cute pink heart on the label, this is also an attractive, finely structured wine which brings together some good tannins and ripe fruits, a hint of licorice and fresh acidity.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2008 Domaine de la Passion  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A pure strawberry jam wine, its ripe fruit scintillating with freshness and acidity. The wine is also round, with tannins giving some weight. The aftertaste is deliciously fruity.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2008 Domaine Leroux Morin  (Chiroubles)

Description: There is a good depth of red fruit flavor here, along with a touch of tannins, a granite feel to the structure, but also an open acidity. The wine has a delicious, fresh and juicy finish.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2008 Domaine des Grands Cèdres  (Fleurie)

Description: A wine that starts bright, and then reveals a more bitter, austere side. The tannins move forwards, hiding the cherry fruit flavors. That makes for a complex wine, the acidity offering a fresh respite.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Cuvée Jean Descombes  (Morgon)

Description: A rounded, generous wine that shows red plums, fresh red berry acidity, but also a layer of tannins. That puts it into a food-friendly category, full of flavor and fruit, but also well structured.
Name: Louis Tête 2008 Le Chatelin  (Brouilly)

Description: This is a serious, tannic wine that has a mineral edge to go with the tight fruit. It is, in fact, ageworthy—for a year or two, with the dry character needs to soften. At the end, the sweet Gamay fruits triumph.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Séléction  (Saint-Amour)

Description: A fruity style, not powerful but bright, with some rich strawberry jam flavors. It has an edge of tannins as well as spice, dried fruits and a cool, soft aftertaste.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Domaine Mont Chavy  (Morgon)

Description: Soft, open wine, the dry tannins a subplot to the fresh strawberry fruits and gentle acidity. There is a final bright, clear aftertaste.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2008 La Folie  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Classic, fresh and fruity, with lively strawberry flavors and a fine burst of acidity. The tannins are light, but fit well into this bright, breezy wine.
Name: Domaine Pral 2008 Cuvée Terroir  (Beaujolais)

Description: Simple juicy fruit, just touched by tannins, but more driven by ripe plum juice and the brightest, delicious acidity.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2008  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Soft, but with an edge of dusty tannins, this wine has bright forward jammy red fruits that fill the mouth easily. It is open, fresh and, finally, almost sweet.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Domaine de Sablons  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Broad, open wine with berry fruits, black cherries and a soft texture. The wine has freshness, plenty of acidity, for drinking now.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Séléction  (Juliénas)

Description: Light, freshly red cherry-dominated wine. The light tannins are a background to the acidity and the fresh fruit. Easy style of Beaujolais.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Flower Label  (Juliénas)

Description: For a Beaujolais-Villages, there are surprisingly firm tannins here, but the vibrant fruit seems equal to them. There is freshness, with a bright cherry aftertaste.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2008 Domaine de l'Aubépin  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A hard-edged wine showing a tough, mineral character, one that promises some aging. The wine is big and powered by tannins as much as fruit, although there is an unfortunate banana flavors that creeps in.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Séléction  (Morgon)

Description: Soft and juicy, but with a layer of minerality. High acidity marks the red fruits and the open tannins of this bright wine.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2008 Château de Bagnols  (Brouilly)

Description: A comparatively serious Villages, its tannins firmly in evidence. There is a touch of woodiness as well. Only gradually does the red fruit come through. The aftertaste has fruity and acidity, but still those tannins.
Name: Louis Tête 2008  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A soft wine, full of cherry preserve flavors, along with a bright, fresh waft of acidity. It is just spoilt by the banana flavor from the vinification.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2008 Le Chat Rouge  (Beaujolais)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A delightful bottle, this fruit-packed Gamay has more stuffing and sweetness than most of the Oregon Pinots from 2007. Plums, cherries and black currants ramble through the mouth, running into some fairly stiff, chewy tannins. This is a sturdy, immediately drinkable, thoroughly enjoyable quaffer.
Name: WillaKenzie Estate 2007 Gamay Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: Sweet, strawberry jelly aromas lead to a wine that shows ripe, spiced and red plum flavors lifted by definite wood characters. The acidity is a constant right through this attractive wine.
Name: Mommessin 2007 Le Clé Saint-Pierre Oak Aged  (Bourgogne)

Description: A majestic wine, great Beaujolais by any standard. The fruit is tense, structured, dense, with black figs, strawberry jelly and ripe red plums fitting well into the texture. It manages to be both fruity and firmly structured. This is Beaujolais for aging, an impressive wine ready to mature over five years or more.
Name: Domaine Louis-Claude Desvignes 2006 Javernières  (Morgon)

Description: Exploding with perfumes, aromas of violets, sweet cherries and spice, this is an impressive wine, with wild cherries and damson plums. It is taut, almost Pinot Noir in its velvet texture, finishing with ripe, sweet fruit sustained by tannins.
Name: Château des Jacques 2006 Clos de Rochegrès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Desvignes is blessed with part of Javernières, at the heart of the Côte du Py, a schist and clay site exposed well to south and west. This wine is solid, tannic and structured, finely balanced. The acidity is important here, suggesting ageworthiness, while the fruits are still enjoying their ripe, black berry primary stage of development.
Name: Domaine Louis-Claude Desvignes 2007 Javernières  (Morgon)

Description: Perfumed, earthy, spicy, this is a balanced wine that brings its tannins firmly together with black fig, black plum skins and sweet juicy black cherries. The core is dry, but the delicious fruit finally dominates. That said, it is sure to have some good aging.
Name: Château Thivin 2007 Cuvée Zaccharie  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Full, almost meaty-textured wine, with dense tannins and black plum skin flavors that go with the black raisin sweetness and spice and a smoky finish. It is firm, concentrated, but never losing sight of a charm and immediate attractiveness. However, the tannins certainly promise aging.
Designation: Château des Lumières Côte du Py
Name: Château des Jacques 2006 Château des Lumières Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: The wine comes from a parcel on the steep slopes of Chiroubles called Les Roches, appropriately enough with its very stony soil. It is a gorgeous, ripe wine, with light toast over the black fruits, ripe plums, cherries. The tannins are now soft, but still give weight to the rich, velvet texture of the sumptuous fruits.
Name: Domaine Cheysson 2006 La Precieuse Vieilles Vignes  (Chiroubles)

Description: Opulent and generous, this is one of Duboeuf's most charming wines. That is not to say it doesn't have structure balanced with the layers of red fruits, but it is the richness allied to a velvet texture that makes it so attractive. Give the acidity six months to calm down, and the wine will be ready.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Domaine des Quatre Vents  (Fleurie)

Description: Bottled unfiltered, this shows extravagant fruit, very rich, black cherry in character, with tannins that veer between serious structured concentration and balanced with the fruit. The texture is sweet, the fruit deliciously ripe, showing good concentration as well as an exuberant play between acidity and fruit.
Name: Marcel Lapierre 2007 Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: A wonderful confection of strawberry jelly and black plum juice, powered by firm tannins. There is acidity, but this wine—from one of the finest vineyard slopes in Beaujolais—is full of life as well as richness.
Name: Domaine Louis-Claude Desvignes 2007 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: This wine is part of the limited edition range of wines that is setting a new standard at Mommessin. With its smooth, rich character, flavors of chocolate, red berry fruits and balanced wood, it is worth aging.
Name: Mommessin 2006 Les 3 Terroirs Grande Exception  (Saint-Amour)

Description: A firmly tannic wine, a complete contrast to Pierre Chermette's other Fleurie, Poncié. This is serious, full of dark tannins, black plums and firm fruit, very solid. There is even a touch of minerality to add to the complex texture.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2008 Les Garants  (Fleurie)

Description: From some of the finest slopes of Morgon comes this intense and concentrated wine. It is big, beefy, full of black fruits, with an edge of cranberry tannin and dark cherries. The texture is as dense as the fruit, making this a certain candidate for aging.
Name: Jean-Marc Burgaud 2008 Côte de Py Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: Big, bold and round, profiting from a good vintage and showing richness. It is certainly full-bodied, but there is a definite structure here, dark tannins over rich plums, delivering spice and a firm, almost stony texture from the soil.
Name: Domaine Louis-Claude Desvignes 2006 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: This is a fine example of how well some Beaujolais can age. The fruit is fading but it has been replaced by a wine with fine maturity, rich, concentrated, showing sweet tannins over still-fresh acidity. There is just a hint of wood aging to underline the richness of the wine.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2005 Quintessence du Gamay  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A supremely ripe wine, the fruit fitting well into the structure, which shows the perfumed, enticing character of Gamay. Flavors of red plums mingle with the lightest touch of tannins, the full-bodied character of the wine just edged with fresh acidity. As its name suggests, if you want to taste Gamay, this wine says it all.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2006 Quintessence de Gamay  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Big and powerful, this is a rich, concentrated expression of ripe Gamay. The black plums and cherries are mouthfilling, almost sweet, with tannins that show generosity as well as structure. Age for 1–2 years.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Flower Label  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A deeply concentrated wine that makes full use of its tannins to go for black fruits, some sweetness and a final dense texture. It has power, but the fruit is still refreshing with its acidity, balancing each other in a comfortable double act.
Name: Pascal Aufranc 2007  Juliénas

Description: A beautifully perfumed wine, rich, the fruit well balanced with the soft, velvet tannins. It has touches of wood from six months barrel aging. A fine, warm wine with further aging potential.
Name: Château des Jacques 2006  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Rich, concentrated red and black plum flavor dominate a wine that shows structure as well as intensity. This is powerful stuff, a delicious wine, fruity but with a core of dark tannins. It is just edging into maturity, so drink this year. The name recalls the Counts of Souzy who once governed the region.
Designation: Vieilles Vignes Cuvée Jules du Souzy
Name: Château de la Terrière 2006 Vieilles Vignes Cuvée Jules du Souzy  (Brouilly)

Description: With its aging in large barrels, this has a fine sense of dense structure allied to minerality and tight minerality. Flavors of cherries, concentrated fruits, violets, spice, all suggest an aging potential of five years plus.
Name: Château Thivin 2008 Cuvée Sept Vignes  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: A finely textured, elegant wine, where black fruits play along with wood hints and a rich structure. The wine is smoothly textured with sweet cherries and spice, given a lift by a fine line of bright acidity.
Name: Christophe Pacalet 2007  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: Big, firm, dense wine, a classic structured Moulin-à-Vent, designed for aging. The tannins are solid, dark, the wine layered with acidity, black plum juice, dried raisins and final acidity.
Name: Henry Fessy 2007  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: The richness and structure of 2006 are evident in this wine, which has some spicy wood character as well as bouncy red fruits and soft tannins. The acidity and the wood need another month or two to properly come together. But this is certainly superior Beaujolais.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2006 Carquelin  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A wine that has fine, serious concentration, a definite candidate for aging. The fruit is powerful, the extraction just on the right side of too much, bringing out the ripe sweet red fruits while leaving room for good acidity. Impressive and worth decanting if drunk now.
Name: Domaine Rochette 2008 Les Micouds  (Morgon)

Description: As befits the most ageworthy of the Beaujolais crus, this is concentrated, firmly tannic stuff. Black berry flavors vie with cranberry acidity and texture. On top of that, there is dark toast and spice. Although it doesn't lose sight of the fruit, it certainly needs aging.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2008 Les Trois Roches  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: From the estate owned by the Descombes family, this big-hearted wine is packed full of sweet, juicy fruit. Like many 2007 Beaujolais, its acidity is prominent, but the raspberry and red plum flavors balance well. The tannins are a firm core, but never very dominant.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2007 Cuvée Jean Descombes  (Morgon)

Description: Ripe and full, this is a wine that's bursting with red berry fruits. The light smoke and red fruits aromas burst out of the glass, and then, on the palate, the wine is all fruit, just with a light dry edge. The aftertaste shows fresh acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2007 Domaine des Quatre Vents  (Fleurie)

Description: With its lightly reductive, earthy aroma, this is on the farmyard side of Gamay. But on the palate, its richness show there is also plenty of promise with a wine that is stuffed with bright sweet red fruits, a solid structure and richness. The acidity is all there, but held in balance by the texture.
Name: Mommessin 2006 Les Caves Grand Exception  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Jean-Paul Brun uses only natural yeast, giving a wine that is rich in fruit, and that has a delicious light bounce to it. The flavors are of wild strawberries, red cherries and refreshing acidity.
Name: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2008  Côte de Brouilly

Description: Definitely a wine with structure. It has a dense core of dry tannins, which leave the impression of a concentrated wine. The fruit is only just there, demanding time for aging. That it should age well is indicated by the deliciously juicy finish.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2007 Cuvée de la Lure  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Aged in wood, and bottled without filtration, this is a smooth, rich wine that has certainly benefited from the extra concentration of old vines. The flavors—red plums, licorice, black fig jelly—are given weight by dryness from wood and from tannins.
Designation: Vieilles Vignes Cuvée Jules du Souzy
Name: Château de la Terrière 2007 Vieilles Vignes Cuvée Jules du Souzy  (Brouilly)

Description: From 30-year-old vines, this is a big, jolly wine packed with ripe fruits, red plum juice and a full burst of richness in the mouth. The fruit is so ripe it is almost sweet, leaving a delicious strawberry flavor.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2008 Poncié  (Fleurie)

Description: Structured, with firm tannins, a far remove from the image of Brouilly as the softest of the Beaujolais crus. There is spice, fresh juiciness with berry flavors rolling around the wine. But the structure comes through strongly, the finish with fresh acidity.
Name: Château Thivin 2008  Brouilly

Description: A firmly tannic wine in Duboeuf's flower label which, as often with Morgon, needs time. The red plum fruits are powerful, dense, with a dry tannin core to go with the sweet juiciness of the fruit. Resist the temptation to drink this delicious wine now. It should be aged, certainly for a year.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2007 Flower Label  (Morgon)

Description: Chiroubles, at the highest altitude of the Beaujolais cru villages, produces structured wines, and this is no exception. The tannins are bare bones under the textured flesh of plum skins and dried fruits. Mineral and austere at this stage, the wine needs aging.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Flower Label  (Chiroubles)

Description: A wine that sits well with its elegant tannins and ripe black berry fruits. It has a fine structure, followed by light acidity, but its dominant character is sweetness and final so-refreshing freshness.
Name: Didier Desvignes 2007 Clos les Charmes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Great structure and ripe fruit produce a wine that has both sweetness, concentration and richness. The spice and acidity combine to create a full-bodied wine, packed with black berry fruits and an edge of minerality.
Name: Domaine Cheysson 2008 Cuvée Tradition  (Chiroubles)

Description: This is a great glass of fruitiness, all red berry flavors, sweetness and softness. It has density at the same time, coming from the concentrated, ripe fruits. This is a pleasure of a wine, the only hint of aging potential coming from soft tannins and final acidity.
Name: Domaine Jean Foillard 2007 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

Description: The vast 190-acre Château de Pierreux is Mommessin's showpiece estate. From it comes this rich wine, with velvet sumptuousness that is kept in check by some firm tannins. It's a powerful wine, likely to age, its flavors of strawberry and red currant combining with a weighty texture.
Name: Mommessin 2007 Château de Pierreux  (Brouilly)

Description: While the new wood is apparent here, it still fits well into the sweet tannins and soft fruit. This is a very appealing wine, ready to drink now, smooth, the red cherries fresh but warm.
Name: Pascal Granger 2007 Cuvée Spéciale  (Juliénas)

Description: The personal holding of the Duboeuf family, Château des Capitans has produced a 2007 that is much more structured and dense than most 2007s from Beaujolais. The rigor of vineyard selection shows in the firm tannins and big, bold black fruits. There is, of course, some delicious sweet juiciness, but this is definitely a fine, solid wine.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2007 Château des Capitans  (Juliénas)

Description: Strawberry jelly aromas are followed by a more stern, mineral wine. The tannins are firm, with an underlying sweet berry fruit. But it does need time, with a density of texture that needs to round out. But worth waiting for.
Name: Domaine Manoir du Carra 2008  Fleurie

Description: With the extra maturity, this wine has a fine, rounded character. It has depth of plum, berry and spice flavors, to go with the dusty, soft tannins. There's a fine velvet quality, as the wine fills out.
Name: Domaine Ruet 2006 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)

Description: A rounded, smooth style, its fresh fruits given a sweet edge by ripeness. The structure, just dry, is almost an afterthought in this fruity, accessible wine. To finish, there is delicious acidity as a palate lifter.
Name: Château du Chénas 2007 Sélection de la Hanté  (Fleurie)

Description: Very fruity, the red berry fruits are all round this juicy wine. It does have tannins, and they are about to assert themselves as the wine passes from its purely primary fruit phase. Then expect the wine to get richer, more concentrated, possibly worth aging for 3-4 years.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2008  Fleurie

Description: Initially, this shows full-on fruit, in the softer Regnié style. Then the wine brings on light tannins, allied to acidity. But the sweet red cherry flavors are dominant, a delicious, gushing style.
Name: Domaine de Colette 2007 Vieilles Vignes  (Régnié)

Description: The wood element is prominent in this wine, from the toasty aromas to the way in which the wood spice dominates the Gamay fruit ebullience. It adds richness and an extra dimension to make this a firmly structured wine.
Designation: Cuvée Elevé en Fût de Chêne
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2006 Cuvée Elevé en Fût de Chêne  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A firm, properly tannic wine, with good dense structure and some powerful black berry fruits. The acidity shoots through the fruit, giving a delicious early juiciness. The tannins promise a good development - worth keeping.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Flower Label  (Chénas)

Description: An austere style, exhibiting the more stony side of Beaujolais. The tannins have some severity, while the acidity is prominent. At the end, the wine softens, fresh berry fruits showing through.
Name: Vincent 2007 Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: An open, rich wine, full of juicy red berries, a touch of coffee, with the freshest of fruit and a ripe, final aftertaste. This is great quaffing wine, nothing too serious, but delicious over the next months.
Name: Domaine de la Chapelle des Bois 2007  Fleurie
Winery: Domaine de la Chapelle des Bois

Description: With good concentration, genuine tasting ripe fruits, this is an impressively rich wine for simple Beaujolais. It has red berry fruits, lined with tannins and a great final burst of freshness.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2008 Cuvée Traditionelle Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: A well-structured wine, densely filled with big tannins, spice, ripe berries and juicy acidity. It is certainly concentrated, a powerhouse of rich fruit. And at the end, the freshest acidity comes shooting right through.
Name: Domaine Berrod 2007 Les Roches du Vivier  (Fleurie)

Description: With a ripe, juicy character, this wine brings out the richer side of Fleurie. It is perfumed, concentrated, packed with black berries, plums and serious tannins. A wine for aging.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2008 Domaine des Grands Cèdres  (Fleurie)

Description: A soft, gentle wine, the tannins a cushion as much as a structure. The red plum and black cherry fruits fit well with the ripe strawberry jelly texture. There is just a hint of spice on a wine that is already very drinkable.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Flower Label  (Fleurie)

Description: With its dense fruits and soft tannins, this is the epitome of sunsoaked, ripe Gamay. The red cherry and berry fruits are ripe, the wine is balanced, it is open, easy. Structure may be missing, but then the fruit is so attractive.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Pierre Ferraud et Fils 2008 Domaine Rolland  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: Fresh, young wine that shows intense potential textured tannins to go with rich red berry fruits. Behind the attractive freshness, there is a fine structure, with obvious aging potential.
Name: Château du Châtelard 2008 Cuvée Terre de Lumière  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A firm, tannic style, a real step up from the Brouilly from the same producer. The wine is tight, with red berry and raspberry fruit flavors, and a mineral, terroir-driven character.
Name: Henry Fessy 2008  Côte de Brouilly

Description: For a 2007 in Beaujolais, this has some weight. True, the fruit has more bubble gum flavor than intensity, but, with a tight band of dry tannins, there is substance in the structure and in the strawberry flavors. Age over the next year.
Name: Château du Chénas 2007 Sélection de la Hanté  (Chénas)

Description: A big, burly wine, it fruit bursting out of the tannins. It has sweetness, ripe fruits and a fine, juicy character. What it does lack is the over-arching structure of the best Morgon, but the compensation is the delicious fruit.
Name: Château de Pizay 2008  Morgon

Description: An excellent, full-bodied, intensely fruity wine. It is big, ripe, the black cherry and red plum flavors bursting out, spiced with some wood. This is very drinkable now, but in 6–9 months, this will bring in some textured tannins as well.
Name: Domaine Rochette 2008  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: The freshest of red cherry and candied acidity give this wine both delicious fruitiness and some weight. The touch of tannin that shows through towards the end adds some depth. Drink now, this is not for aging.
Name: Vincent 2007 Domaine le Cotoyon  (Juliénas)

Description: A rich style, with ripe black fruits, touches of fig and firm tannins. For a Villages, this is powerful and dense, with ripe, warm licorice. Acidity comes through finally, giving a lift of freshness but not taking away from the richness.
Name: Domaine de la Madone 2008 Le Perreon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A relatively full-bodied wine, ripe and smothered in raspberry jam. It has a layer of banana flavor, acidity and even some tannin. It's like drinking red berry juice.
Name: Louis Tête 2009 Le Pot Beaujolais Villages Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Bottled unfiltered, which allows the fruit to be even more ripe and forward. And the black cherry and wild strawberry fruits really do burst out of the glass, giving freshness allied to richness. Drink now, age for six months.
Name: Domaine Manoir du Carra 2008 Non-Filtré  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is on the lean side, but that's to do with the fresh acidity that permeates right through. The texture is all there, but not quite fleshed out. However, there is a compensation in the fresh, juicy aftertaste. Worth waiting for 6 months.
Name: Domaine Chassagne 2007 Côtes de Ruillères  (Morgon)

Description: Still impressively young, the tannins are pushing forward with the berry fruits behind. There is richness here, with delicious, almost refreshing plum juice acidity.
Name: Domaine de Colette 2007 Coteaux de Colette  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Solid, structured, still young, its fruit restrained by firm tannins. The acidity bursts through together with berry and black cherry flavors, but this is an early stage, and the wine is tight and closed. Give it another 6 months and it will be impressively balanced.
Name: Paul Janin et Fils 2008 Domaine des Vignes des Jumeaux  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: In the flower label series, this deliciously bright soft wine has a great lift of berries, cranberry texture and a bubble gum exuberance. Always one of the most popular cru Beaujolais, this wine, from a light vintage, shows the delicious, immediate fruity side.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2007 Flower Label  (Fleurie)

Description: The freshest of fruit, packed with redcurrants and early season raspberries. The wine has a light, crisp character, its tannins an adjunct to the flavorful fruit.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Domaine des Buyats  (Régnié)

Description: Ripe, jammy fruit flavors are the main character of this wine, which shows sweet candy shop Gamay fruits, topping light acidity and some dry tannins. Certainly ready to drink now.
Name: Château du Chénas 2006 Sélection de la Hanté  (Juliénas)

Description: A fruity, ripe, spicy, immediately attractive wine. It bursts with simple sweet fruit and soft tannins. Bold, juicy and ripe, drink soon.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2008  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A well-made, tightly structured wine emphasizing tannins and berry fruits. It would almost be worth aging, with its weight and dry texture. The fruit is solid and firm.
Name: Domaine de la Madone 2009 Beaujolais Villages Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This is developing well, a wine from a fine year in Beaujolais. The fruit remains, with black plums, black berries and a light bubble gum freshness. But it has gained depth, and tannins are showing well over the acidity.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2006  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A delicious wine, full of the freshest berry fruits, reticent tannins, and a bright, vibrant berry character, balanced with easy sweetness. Perfect for drinking now.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Pierre Ferraud et Fils 2007 Les Merrains  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Sweet bubble gum aromas are followed by soft, open, extreme red fruit flavors. This is like drinking raspberry juice, with just a touch of tannin thrown in. It's a light wine, delicious, full of fresh, vivid acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2007 Domaine de Grand Croix  (Brouilly)

Description: Simple, fresh red fruits, packed with berries and sweet cherries, spiced up with a touch of toast, walnuts and fresh acidity. To drink soon.
Name: Domaine de Chardignon 2008  Côte de Brouilly

Description: On the dark side, this wine is layered with tannins, that cut firmly through the red plum juice flavors. That gives it a dry character, which is certainly more powerful than the fruit. At the end, the freshness is there, a fine burst of acidity and vibrant red fruits.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2007  Fleurie

Description: Very young, but already full of exuberant fruit, ripe and fresh, carried along by berries over the crispest acidity. Drink over the next year.
Designation: Domaine des Grands Fers Grande Cuvée
Name: Christian Bernard 2008 Domaine des Grands Fers Grande Cuvée  (Fleurie)

Description: A decisively fresh wine, its red fruits laced with immediate acidity. It is intensely fruity, offering soft flavors, touched with some cinnamon, and layered with sweet tannins. At this stage, it is all fruit, but aged for 6 months and the secondary flavors will come out.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2007 Domaine des Rosiers  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Red cherry aromas with a touch of smokiness promise well. But the palate is light for a Morgon, bringing out acidity and austere tannins. The acidity comes through the redcurrant flavors, with candy sweetness showing to finish.
Name: Château de Pizay 2007  Morgon

Description: Although this starts lean, a juicy character comes through, structured with tannins that are tight around the black fruits. The finish remains vivid, fresh, but those tannins promise some aging.
Name: Domaine Aucoeur 2008 Cuvée Jean-Claude Aucoeur  (Morgon)

Description: Fresh, gushing strawberry and red cherry fruit. There is just a side order of tannin, and a hint of wood, but this wine just shows very fresh fruit and sweet and sour acidity. Drink now.
Designation: Cuvée Elevé en Fût de Chêne
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2007 Cuvée Elevé en Fût de Chêne  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A soft, rounded wine, with attractive spice, layered with some light tannins. The wine has delicious, open fresh red fruit flavors, spiced with cinnamon on black cherries.
Name: Henry Fessy 2008  Brouilly

Description: Initially this one seems very dry, then richer black fruits come through, providing some weight. It finishes deliciously fruity.
Name: Louis Tête 2009 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: Full bodied, ripe and soft, certainly ready to drink, with sweet, mouthfilling fruit. It is big and chunky, but still keeping its balance. A fine, ripe, black cherry-fruited wine.
Name: Domaine les Fines Graves 2007  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Good tannins here, with fresh fruit, red cherry skins and acidity that is just so thirst-quenching. This is proper, easy, fruity Beaujolais, a pleasure to drink.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2008  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A wine that brings out all the richness of 2009. It has great plum and red cherry flavors, touched with spice, then finished with sweet acidity. The concentration is there, along with final acidity.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2009 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes Primeur  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: With a smooth, velvet texture this negociant wine is topped by black berry and plum fruit flavors, followed by some sweet tannins and wood. It's in a modern style, where the wood is very apparent, but it does still benefit from final juicy acidity.
Name: Trenel Fils 2008 Tirage Limité  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: For a 2007, considered a light vintage in Beaujolais, this has good structure, its red fruit flavors given intensity and concentration by firm black plum skin tannins. The aftertaste, though, is all juicy fruits, balanced by sweet acidity.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2007  Brouilly

Description: On the dry side, showing some lean tannins with the fruit and banana. There's a serious side to this wine and it needs a few minutes to breathe before offering up its ripe fruits and final jammy sweetness.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2009 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: A juicy wine that is too soft for its appellation. The wine has open, lively red cherry flavors, black berry juice and sweet plum skins, but with acidity dominating, it misses out on density and structure.
Name: Domaine Raymond Bouland 2008 Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: Sweet strawberry fruit with an edge of crispness and soft tannins. This is a fruity, juicy style, full of easy, attractive red berry and plum flavors. To drink soon.
Name: Henry Fessy 2008 Château des Reyssiers  (Régnié)

Description: Fruity, candy floss aromas followed by strawberry jam flavors give this wine a fresh, lightweight character, easy to drink now. There are some tannins, giving weight, but this just reinforce the fruitiness.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2007 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Crisply fresh, this shows some of the weight of 2009. It's a wine that has attractive red fruits, acidity and a good depth of bright tannins. The aftertaste features banana and spice.
Name: Albert Bichot 2009 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: With all the raspberry and strawberry juice flavors of Gamay, this is a light wine from a light vintage. It remains fresh. There is some tannic structure, but it needs to be drunk soon.
Name: Domaine des Nugues 2007  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: All fresh, crisp red currants and raspberries, this is tight and taut, the fruits just beginning to burst out over the layer of tannins. Drink this year, chill lightly.
Name: Château du Chénas 2008  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A fat style with good berry fruits and tannins. The fresh acidity is of course present, but fits well with the raspberry and cherry flavors. Screwcap.
Name: Mommessin 2009 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: This has weight and some rich fruit. On top of this are ripe tannins, bananas and black cherry flavors. The acidity is present but balanced.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Beaujolais Villages Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: With its ultra-fresh red berry fruits, this is a light, juicy wine that shows the softness of Brouilly. The tannins are as sweet as the bright fruit flavors.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2007 Flower Label  (Brouilly)

Description: With fresh, crisp acidity, early season yellow cherries and crisp fruit, this seems initially light. There is a core of tannin to give weight, but this is not a wine for aging.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Flower Label  (Brouilly)

Description: There is some richness in this wine, which has density and bright, forward and juicy fruit. The fruit has lively raspberry acidity and the tannins are tight, but in a few months it will be all about fresh, friendly fruit.
Name: Domaine Aucoeur 2008 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A well-rounded wine, all ripe fruit with good berry flavors and lively acidity. Very complete, this is quaff-it-now Beaujolais, and it's delicious.
Name: Domaine Chassagne 2008  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Dominique Morel's Morgon is something of a disappointment. Sure, it is fresh, soft, juicy. With its banana aromas and ripe black cherries, it has all the forward fruit you could want, but there is only a hint of texture or structure from this normally long-lived Beaujolais cru.
Name: Domaine de Gry-Sablon 2008  Morgon

Description: Attractively in balance, this wine, from 40-year-old vines, shows concentration to go with its red currant flavors. It is fresh, touched by tannins, worth keeping a few months, but already its fruit is openly delicious.
Name: Jean-Marc Burgaud 2008 Château de Thulon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A wine that shows perhaps too much tannin for a Nouveau, and will probably be more accessible next year. It has a tight side, with the acidity fitting well into the ripe plum flavors.
Name: Albert Bichot 2009 Beaujolais Villages Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: There is some good weight here, with the fresh acidity balanced by ripe plums and black cherries. With its touch of dry tannins and spice, this looks likely to age well over the next year.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Flower Label  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Licorice, raspberry candy aromas give a wine that has a definite crisp side, but this is rounded out with some ripe cranberry and spice. The acidity cuts through, a fresh layer within the friendly fruits.
Name: Mommessin 2007 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Light and fruity, this is a wine that flows easily and softly. Bright acidity and some weight broaden out the red plum and raspberry fruits.
Name: Pierre Dupond 2009 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: Typical fresh, light and fruity Beaujolais. It is from a particularly light year, with red berry flavors and fresh acidity dominant. Definitely a wine to drink now.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2007  Beaujolais

Description: For Primeur, read Nouveau in this wine that starts with a barnyard character, but that then turns into richness, a sign of the vintage. There is easy ripe cherry with a light touch of tannin. Bananas and acidity are there to finish.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2009 Pierre Chermette Beaujolais Primeur  (Beaujolais)
