Description: The tannins and acidity complement each other well, but the ensemble is overly influenced by the strong banana flavor. The berry acidity and the concentration helps restore the balance.
Designation: Château de Maladrets Beaujolais Villages Nouveau
Name: Paul Beaudet 2009 Château de Maladrets Beaujolais Villages Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Light, crisp, very fresh, this has flavors of green peppers, tight acidity, filled out with juiciness. The texture is simple, clear, with the acidity giving a final lift.
Name: Château de Pizay 2007  Beaujolais

Description: Made by negociant Michel Tête, a wine that has an attractive earthy, rustic character, filling out with its plum skin texture. There is strawberry jam fruit, the tannins almost an afterthought.
Name: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2007  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Fresh, with red currant acidity and bright red fruits, only a hint of tannins. There's a dusty texture, followed by the freshest of acidity. A wine that is on the light side.
Name: Château de Pizay 2008  Beaujolais

Description: A wine that has some weight and good berry fruits. There is some concentration of red plums and strawberries, and the tannins and acidity are well under control. Banana comes through in the aftertaste.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: A real alternative to red Beaujolais Nouveau. An intense strawberry flavored wine, with acidity and freshness. It has some weight as well, but mainly it is bright and lively.
Name: Paul Beaudet 2009 Domaine Romy Beaujolais Nouveau Rosé Gamay (Beaujolais)

Description: As with many Beaujolais Nouveau in 2009, the color here is dark, a bubbly purple. The fruit though is somewhat lean, the acidity too prominent. The wine has a deal of banana and redcurrant fruits.
Name: Paul Beaudet 2009 Domaine Romy Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: The freshest, lightest Beaujolais, with flavors of red currants, bitter cherries and very tight, crisp acidity. A touch of banana comes through to finish.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Flower Label  (Beaujolais)

Description: Banana aromas that follow through to the flavors on the palate. The texture is soft, open, very fruity. Wild strawberries are a hint behind the final spicy acidity.
Name: Domaine de Gry-Sablon 2008  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Juicy, with hints of banana, this a bright wine, all open red fruits, totally fresh from acidity. Ready for drinking, lightly chilled.
Name: Signé Vigneron 2008 Château de Souzy  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Strawberry flavors dominate the intense acidity and fresh fruit. There is a banana flavor that gives it sweetness, the light tannins just offering some contrast.
Name: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2009 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: Berry fruits lie as a layer of fruit over licorice and bitter tannins. The wine has a fresh spring character, but is too light for its own good. Best drunk chilled.
Name: Domaine Dupré 2007 Terre Noire  (Beaujolais)

Description: Curiously lightweight, with only a hint of berry fruits. It is soft, very open, leaving freshness but lacking flavor.
Name: Trenel Fils 2008  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A total bubble gum wine, from the first aromas right through the palate. That character gives sweetness to the acidity, and less obvious redcurrant flavors.
Name: Labouré-Roi 2009 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: Very light and on the austere side. It has freshness, acidity, but the fruit is dilute, just hinting at berries.
Name: Domaine Ruet 2008  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A wine that has both tight tannins and an unpleasant banana character. There is some texture, but there is precious little flesh.
Name: Château de Lavernette 2007  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A mouthwatering cherry fruit- flavored wine, with an attractive touch of acidity. There is sweetness and a circle of tannin around the full, ripe fruit. This will age a couple of years, but is also delicious now.
Name: Château de Fuissé 2006 Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: A relatively austere wine, showing its mineral side, with tight tannins and firm structure. But, of course, this being a fine Beaujolais, there is also ripe, exuberant fruit under all this severity. Give it another 6 months to a year.
Name: Château de Fuissé 2006 Domaine le Cotoyon  (Juliénas)

Description: Ripe red fruits are aided by a core of dark tannin to give this wine good intensity. There is acidity, followed by bubbling fruit, topped with berries and spice. Worth keeping until next year.
Name: Domaine du Moulin Berger 2007 Vayolette  (Juliénas)

Description: With nearly 200 acres of vines, this is one of the largest Beaujolais estates. This Brouilly is ripe, raspberry-flavored, with fine sweet fruits and a tight core of tannin. The essential acidity is well balanced.
Name: Mommessin 2006 Château de Pierreux  (Brouilly)

Description: It may be labeled Nouveau, but this wine is hardly ready for drinking at this early stage after the harvest. It is a properly structured wine, which shows relatively ripe berries and a gush of lively fruit and acidity. It is worth keeping until the end of the year.
Name: Louis Tête 2008 Le Pot Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Moving towards richness, with a smoked meat character, this offers a rounded, ripe texture. The blackberry flavors are layered with some tight tannins, and boosted by spice and vanilla. A definite for food.
Name: Henry Fessy 2008 Beaujolais Villages Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A pretty salmon pink wine from Gamay. It has quite a full textured feel, enhanced by the ripe red cherry and strawberry flavors. Very soft, the freshness comes from a light layer of acidity, rounded out by caramel, and given vivacity by a touch of dryness. Screwcap.
Name: Louis Jadot 2007 Rosé Gamay (Beaujolais)

Description: This is rich for a nouveau, its blackberry jammy texture offering more than just juicy fruit. The burst of strawberry and banana is classic, but the ripe fruit gives the wine some additional complexity.
Name: Louis Tête 2008 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: A deliciously ripe wine, its black berry fruits bursting with vitality. The wine is fresh, its acidity an important element in its drinkability. The wine finishes with a suggestion of tannin, but also of juicy fruit.
Name: Henry Fessy 2008 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: A full, ripe wine that has dark plum flavors as well as fresh acidity and berry fruits. There is some good structure here, fleshing out the fruit and finishing with a dry, firm aftertaste. This should go well with rich food.
Name: Prosper Maufoux 2008 Beaujolais Villages Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Fresh but with some good dense berry fruits, this is an attractively concentrated wine with some smokiness creeping between the vivid fruit. It has some banana split sweetness, while lively fruit returns in the aftertaste.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2008 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: Full and soft in the mouth, this currant, raspberry and banana flavored wine is lively and fruity. Its tight acidity is balanced by some smokiness and the finish is vibrant and fresh.
Name: Pierre Dupond 2008 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: Probably the biggest selling Nouveau, and certainly the best known. A powerful aroma of ripe bananas leads into a palate of bright fresh red berry fruits. The wine is fruity, easy and, with just a touch of tannin, totally ready to drink.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: The Beaujolais Villages appellation adds weight to this Nouveau. There is structure, some density, and firm but not bitter tannins. A banana flavor is everywhere, edging between the fruit and freshness. The aftertaste works, though, with its lively, smoky character.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Beaujolais Villages Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Very fresh and light, this red cherry flavored wine is a burst of fruit and bright acidity, crispened by tight tannins. Some smokiness adds an extra dimension. Screwcap and PET bottle.
Name: Mommessin 2008 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: There is some weight here as well as texture. The wine has a sweet edge to it, giving richness reminiscent of fruity Jello lying on top of the acidity. The finish, with light tannins, reaffirms the weight.
Designation: Château des Maladrets Beaujolais Villages Nouveau
Name: Paul Beaudet 2008 Château des Maladrets Beaujolais Villages Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Light, its fruit showing bright, crisp blackcurrant juice freshness, this is the epitome of the easy quaffing Nouveau. Very berry in its texture, it finishes with stalkiness and tight acidity.
Name: Paul Beaudet 2008 Domaine Romy Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: A light, freshly fruity wine, with edgy green tannins and tight redcurrant fruit flavors. Its fruit is a burst of juice in the mouth; light, bright red, and with prominent acidity. Buy a bottle, and the UN will plant a tree in Africa is the claim that comes with this screwtop, PET bottle.
Name: Labouré-Roi 2008 Beaujolais Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

Description: Puy means a hill, and the steep slopes of the Côte du Puy offer great exposure for the vines. The result is a densely structured, very muscular wine that shows richness as well as dark tannins. The aftertaste is sweet, streaked with acidity.
Name: Domaine Jean Foillard 2006 Côte du Puy  (Morgon)

Description: There's an explosion of rich, intense fruit here: dried prunes, black plums and even some licorice. The wine is attractively edged with wood, giving a fine, ripe finish.
Name: Domaine Chignard 2006 Cuvée Spéciale  (Fleurie)

Description: Aged in wood, this cuvée is powerful, ripe and intense. The jellied red fruits are all sweet and rich, touched by acidity but mainly with good depth of flavor and structure. It would even be worth aging this for another year.
Name: Château du Châtelard 2006 Cuvée Tradition  (Fleurie)

Description: Gamay often becomes more like Pinot Noir as it ages. That's true of this wine, which displays strawberry and spice flavors, as well as an element of minerality. The aftertaste has ripe blackberry jelly.
Name: Domaine Chignard 2005 Cuvée Spéciale  (Fleurie)

Description: Lapierre bottled two versions of this wine, one using no sulfur, one using some sulfur. It makes a fascinating contrast, but this version without sulfur is inevitably the better, not losing one iota of the ripe fruit, the rich cherries and immediately attractive bonbon and candy flavors.
Name: Marcel Lapierre 2006  Morgon

Description: A very structured wine with tannins and dense fruit. Very Pinot Noir-like in its richness, smoothness and plum flavors. Deliciously rich and velvety smooth.
Name: Jean-Paul Thevenet 2006  Morgon

Description: This is a big, concentrated wine, impressive for 2007. There are solid tannins, with additional great acidity, and plenty of structure and ripeness. Red plums give a finishing lift.
Name: Château du Châtelard 2007 Les Vieux Granits  (Fleurie)

Description: A rich, rounded wine, benefiting from concentrated fruit. There are solid tannns, dark bitter cherry fruits, licorice and fine ripeness. The aftertaste is ripe and sweet.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2006 Les Trois Roches  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: A big, ripe wine, with firm tannins, powerful with black plum flavors. It is aged in large barrels, adding an extra complexity, structured with some dryness in the aftertaste.
Name: Domaine Cheysson 2005 La Secrète  (Chiroubles)

Description: From a 15-acre vineyard owned by Georges Duboeuf. It is a big, bold, ripe wine backed by light wood flavors, and juicy red plum fruits. It is vivid, colorful and solid.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2006 Château des Capitans  (Juliénas)

Description: One of the best vineyards in Morgon, Corcelette has produced a delicious, ripe, intense wine. The fruit is sweet, almost jammy in its richness, just touched by smooth wood. A fine, smooth wine.
Name: Domaine Jean Foillard 2006 Cuvée Corcelette  (Morgon)

Description: Although there is some structure, this wine is dominated by very fresh, crisp red fruits. Any depth of flavor comes from plum-skin tannins and some hints of spice.
Name: Château du Châtelard 2007  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: This wine benefits from the great, forward fruits of the 2006 vintage, giving red berry and spice flavors. It is ripe, charming and deliciously fruity, with a jammy, rounded aftertaste.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2006 Domaine des Sablons  (Saint-Amour)

Description: Rounded, and rich, this is touched with spicy wood and has plenty of black berry fruits. A solid structure, some fruit tannin and plenty of red-plum-skin edge finishes ripe.
Name: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2006 Cuvée Prestige  (Juliénas)

Description: Made from old vines and aged in wood, this is a rich, dense, now mature wine. The bright red fruit is softened by the wood, rounded out, then balanced with tannins.
Name: Domaine Cheysson 2005 Cuvée Prestige  (Chiroubles)

Description: Good structured fruit, with ripe sweet cherry flavors, appears alongside hints of raspberries. Fresh, but with some weight and solidity.
Name: Château du Châtelard 2007 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A tannic, structured wine, full of rich stone fruit flavors, with the acid hints of red berry fruits. It is fragrant and ripe with some depth and intensity.
Name: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2006 Cuvée Tradition  (Juliénas)

Description: Named after one of the proponents of Saint-Amour wines, this is appropriately serious and rich, with tight tannins and acidity. Underneath the structure, the red currant fruits promise some freshness.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2006 Domaine Louis Dailly  (Saint-Amour)

Description: The largest of the Beaujolais crus makes relatively soft wine, and this is no exception. It has open fruit flavors dominated by red berries and tinged with acidity. The background is soft tannins and the foreground is all fruit.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2006  Brouilly

Description: Plum-jam-flavored wine, this is very sweet, rich and very direct. The freshness is here, but this is more about the dense, superripe fruits.
Name: Domaine Chignard 2006  Fleurie

Description: A hint of wood is a good sign of the richness and balance of this wine. There is some dryness and tautness to go with its black cherry and plum-skin flavors. There is a big and bold fruity aftertaste.
Name: Terroirs et Talents 2006 Château de la Terrière  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: From biodynamic producer Marcel Lapierre, this is probably as good as it got in 2007. It's a rich wine, concentrated, although the crisp fruits of the year tend to dominate. There are raspberry flavors, very pure, very fresh, but with some good depth of flavor.
Name: Marcel Lapierre 2007  Morgon

Description: Aged in wood from Domaine de la Romanée-Conti, this rich wine has sweetness, just enough tannins and wood to give structure, and a deep red cherry fruitiness.
Name: Domaine de Gry-Sablon 2006 Cuvée Tradition  (Juliénas)

Description: A wine that is all intensely fresh cherry fruits, very bright and just ripe. It just bursts out of the glass, a deliciously ripe, fresh, fruity wine, delicious to drink now.
Name: Domaine Chignard 2007  Fleurie

Description: This is composed of pure red fruits, with just a light touch of wood, but more cherries and acidity. There is a dry cranberry edge, which needs to soften out.
Name: Terroirs et Talents 2007 Domaine la Chapelle des Bois  (Fleurie)

Description: While this is certainly structured, the wine shows green pepper flavors and very fresh raspberries, a product of the lightness of the vintage. It is attractive, offering some good freshness, but needs to be consumed now.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2007 Les Trois Roches  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This ripe, full-bodied structured wine brings together good cherry and red berry flavors. It's a well-knit, dense wine with intense fruit.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2006  Juliénas

Description: A structured, ripe wine with big, boisterous fruit. There are fresh strawberry flavors, hints of banana and candy; the aftertaste is solid, with dry tannins.
Name: Domaine Cheysson 2006  Chiroubles

Description: Very fresh, crisp raspberry flavors are layered with acidity. This shows the bright red fruit character of 2007—light, fragrant, maybe finishing with some leanness.
Name: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2007 Cuvée Tradition  (Juliénas)

Description: Soft and fruity, showing attractive ripe red cherry fruits along with hints of candy, light acidity and gentle tannins. It's a pleasing wine, easy and ready to drink, one of those Beaujolais that is best slightly chilled.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2007  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: There are raspberry flavors, certainly, but raspberry with attitude, as this wine, with its firm tannins and open fruit, attests. The acidity and the dry edge point this wine firmly toward food.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2006  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Fresh, simple, raspberry-flavored wine, this is very soft, candied and fruity. There is just enough tannin to give the wine some structure, but the crispness of 2007 shows right through.
Name: Domaine Pral 2007  Beaujolais

Description: Made from old vines, this has some concentration, but the crispness of the red berries and a touch of astringency conflict with the density of texture.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2007 Cuvée Traditionelle  (Beaujolais)

Description: A vivid, vibrant, red-fruited wine, bursting with crisp fruits, light acidity, and red cherry flavors. Very fresh.
Name: Terroirs et Talents 2007 Château des Maladrets  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Crisp, red hedgerow fruits and wild strawberries add to the acidity in this wine. There is an edge of greenness, but there is also some weight. Certainly not a powerful wine.
Name: Terroirs et Talents 2007 Domaine de Boischampt  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Dominated by acidity and red currant flavors, this shows some concentration, but is essentially tense and crisp, ending very fresh.
Name: Domaine des Crêtes 2007  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A bright, vivid style dominated by fresh red berry fruits. Light and juicy, finishing with acidity.
Name: Domaine Cheysson 2007  Chiroubles

Description: This is light, crisp and very fresh with vibrant fruit, touches of green pepper and red currant to finish. There is some wood here, from old barrel aging, rounding out the fruit and softening it.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2007 Coeur de Vendanges  (Beaujolais)

Description: Good cherry fruit flavors, with a touch of juicy banana and plenty of ripeness. There is definite freshness to this wine, shown best in its crisp acidity.
Name: Domaine de Gry-Sablon 2007  Juliénas

Description: Beaujolais is desperate to sell its wine. Maybe a Super Bojo (after Superman) label could work? The wine is classic raspberry bubblegum Gamay, fresh and fruity. Drink now.
Name: Super Bojo NV  Beaujolais

Description: Rather lean, but with attractive red currant edginess, this is definitely a lightweight wine to be served chilled.
Name: Domaine du Vissoux 2007 Les Griottes  (Beaujolais)

Description: A very cherry wine, with tight acidity and some green on the finish; a cool-vintage wine.
Name: Domaine des Crêtes 2007  Beaujolais

Description: A very fresh, light wine with simple red currant fruit. It's delicate, like the gentle burst of fruit drops. Great lightly chilled during the last days of summer.
Name: Terroirs et Talents 2007 Domaine Rémy  (Beaujolais)

Description: Black cherry and dark raspberry fruit blend with background citrus accents, leading into a vibrant but short finish. Drink now; may also be served slightly chilled.
Name: Abarbanel 2006 Château de la Salle Kosher  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: While it retains plenty of freshness, this shows layers of wood, richness, spice flavors and some smooth tannins. Black cherries, juicy fruits and toast come together on a rounded finish. Despite its obscure appellation, this wine is more than just a curiosity.
Name: Domaine Geoffrenet-Morval 2006 Cuvée Jeanne Vieilles Vignes Gamay (Châteaumeillant)

Description: A deliciously crisp, Gamay-based rosé that sings with crisp, acid fruit, flavors of currants and fresh raspberries. The finish is crisp, with white peach tastes.
Name: Domaine Geoffrenet-Morval 2006 Cuvée Comte de Barcelone Gamay (Châteaumeillant)

Description: From its origins in the fifth century, Châteaumeillant has produced wines on the edge of the Massif Central. This crisp, unoaked red is a simple, red cherry, fresh Gamay, with lively acidity and a touch of earthiness.
Name: Domaine Geoffrenet-Morval 2006 Version Originale Gamay (Châteaumeillant)

Description: “Gris” in this case means a pale rosé; this Gamay-based wine has a very fresh, if light, structure. Flavors of wild strawberries are here, but it is mainly dry and crisp.
Name: Clos de la Briderie 2005 Gris Gamay (Touraine Mesland)

Description: Basic Beaujolais, light in body, with grapy, black cherry-ish aromas and flavors and a hint of fresh greens. Ends on a note of bitter chocolate.
Designation: Château de la Salle Old Vines Kosher
Name: Abarbanel 2005 Château de la Salle Old Vines Kosher  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Designation: Chateau des Lumieres Cote du Py
Name: Louis Jadot 2003 Chateau des Lumieres Cote du Py  (Morgon)
Mommessin 2003 Le Montagne Bleue  (Côte de Brouilly)

Description: This gorgeous Beaujolais will stand up to whatever your picnic serves up, from roast chicken or ham to cold meatloaf and all the accompanying salads. The bouncy black cherry fruit is gulpable, so you won't have to bring back any unfinished wine. Put it in the fridge the night before, pack your basket that morning and by the time you reach your destination it will be at perfect serving temp. Imported by W.J. Deutsch & Sons.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2003  Régnié

Description: Aromas of sweet strawberries make this an immediately attractive wine. It is lightly colored, with flavors of fresh fruit and just a hint of dryness. Soft and easy, it is almost like alcoholic strawberry juice.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2002  Beaujolais

Description: As we brace ourselves for the crush of this year's Beaujolais Nouveau, it's worth remembering that last year was the year that the region's most famous négociant described as “the vintage [that] may turn out to be the greatest vintage of my career.” It's not the nouveau that turns the “may” into a “will”—it's cru wines like this fragrant, intensely concentrated Juliénas. Here, sweet berry fruit fleshes out into a long, vibrant and persistent wine, one that lingers on the palate for an impossibly long time.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2003  Juliénas

Description: Yes, I know Beaujolais Nouveau is out of favor, it's yesterday's wine. But this isn't Nouveau, this is the real stuff, the original up-front fruity wine. Made from the Gamay grape, it's packed with strawberries, cherries and soft, generous fruit. There's a slight earthy, mineral touch to it that stops it just being a fruit bomb, and turns it into an easy food wine, especially with salamis, sausages or burgers.
Name: Louis Jadot 2003  Beaujolais

Description: Unlike the candied aromas exhibited by some Beaujolais, this boasts a seriously vinous nose, with cherries and herbs and a hint of smoke or rock dust. To further distinguish it from ordinary Beaujolais, it's fairly full-bodied and shows tea-like tannins on the finish.
Name: Coudert Pere et Fils 2002 Clos de la Roilette  (Fleurie)

Description: Brun packs a lot of complexity into this wine. Briary, stemmy aromas add a wild touch to the crystalline black fruit, and those same elements re-emerge on the long finish. Crisp and clean, and with enough weight that it's hard to believe the label's stated 11% alcohol.
Name: Jean-Paul Brun 2002 Terres Dorees L'Ancien Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

Description: Fruity and fresh, this wine is as packed with grapes and cherries as a wine can be, yet still picks up hints of plum and chocolate on the finish, imparting added complexity. Duboeuf, the largest producer of Beaujolais, seems to have struck gold in this vintage; if you can't find this Morgon, try one of the other crus. And look for the domaine wines Duboeuf commercializes when they are released.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2002 Grand Cuvée Flower label  (Morgon)

Description: Beaune-based Louis Jadot has upgraded its Beaujolais operations in recent years, seeing an opportunity for growth. The 2002 vintage of its flagship Beaujolais, Château des Jacques, hasn't been released yet, but this fine Beaujolais-Villages shows that the commitment to quality is real. The glass overflows with blackberry and black cherry aromas, while in the mouth the wine is clean, fresh and charming.
Name: Louis Jadot 2002  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: A bit sterner stuff than we're accustomed to seeing from Duboeuf, with cedar and leather layered over black cherry and vanilla. Still firm on the finish, this uncommonly long-lived Beaujolais could use another 12 months in the cellar.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2001 Domaine des Quatre Vents  (Fleurie)

Description: This is a fun wine, loaded with crunchy cherry and mixed berry fruit. It's light, fresh and a bit tart, with the focus on red fruits. Deliciously quaffable.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2002 Flower label  (Fleurie)

Description: Filled to near-overflowing with bouncy, fresh, exuberant fruit, this fine Brouilly is a winner. Cherries and mixed berries cascade over the palate, finishing with crisp acidity.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2002 Grand Cuvée Flower Label  (Brouilly)

Description: Better known for its whites from the Maconnais, Vincent has crafted a successful wine from the difficult 2001 vintage. Sappy, briary and herbal notes impart complexity to the ripe cherry flavors. Long finish.
Name: Château de Fuissé 2001 Domaine Le Cotoyon  (Juliénas)

Description: The Duboeuf Prestige cuvées see varying amounts of oak aging, in this case giving the wine some modestly toasty notes that complement the wine's sappy black-cherry fruit. A velvety texture makes it go down easily, despite only modest levels of fruit.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2001 Prestige  (Morgon)

Description: This wine has an earthy edge to it, which gives it something more to offer than simple fruity flavors. The boisterous black cherry aromas combine with scents of damp clay. This light-bodied wine finishes with loads of red berries and a hint of licorice.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2002 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: $10. Intriguingly floral at first, but this is at heart a simple wine, cleanly made. Grapy and fresh, with some modest tannins on the firm finish. Give it six months to round into shape.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2002 Flower label  (Régnié)

Description: This wine features an enticing, exotic berry character that picks up hints of raspberry jam on the structured finish. Yet it also seems a bit bulky in the mouth, oversized for the restrained fruit. Drink now, as this imbalance is only likely to worsen with age.
Name: Château de Fuissé 2001 Charmes  (Morgon)

Description: Brouilly is the largest of the Beaujolais crus (the individual villages in the northern part of the Beaujolais region). Its wines are the softest and least demanding of the crus, and this wine is typical. It has an enticing purple color, aromas of cherries and red currants, and open, generous flavors of strawberries. In the month when Beaujolais Nouveau 2003 will be launched, it is worth remembering that some Beaujolais is better drunk after a year's aging.
Name: Mommessin 2002  Brouilly

Description: This is a light, delicate, almost ethereal rendition of Beaujolais, best admired on its own or perhaps with a modest baguette au jambon. Lithe and acidic, with granite-edged flavors of cherries and herbs, and a mouthwatering finish.
Name: Chateau des Pethieres 2002  Beaujolais

Description: It's often said that Gamay can take on Pinot Noir-like qualities with age, and this wine is a prime illustration. It's supple and rich, filled with black cherries, dried spices and leather. Still shows some fine-grained tannins on the finish.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2001  Moulin-à-Vent

Description: The black cherry fruit that forms the core of this wine is still remarkably fresh and vibrant under layers of tree bark, chocolate and earth. The supple texture is a treat; a notable success for the vintage.
Name: Château de Pizay 2001  Morgon

Description: Toast and cedar notes are backed by black cherries and clove in this medium-weight wine. Finishes tart and a bit oaky, but with good persistence. Drink up.
Name: Louis Jadot 2001 Chateau de Bellevue  (Morgon)

Description: Despite some pleasant scents of warm, dusty earth, this wine fails to deliver a lot of complexity. The black cherry fruit is supple in the mouth and offers ample flavor, finishing with tart acids.
Name: Potel-Aviron 2001 Château Gaillard Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

Description: Under a veneer of cedary wood you'll find some simple black cherry fruit. Shows good purity and concentration, finishing short and clean.
Name: Potel-Aviron 2001 Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is a lightweight, cheerful wine, boasting earthy, herbal aromas offset by cherry fruit. A hint of chocolate creeps in on the finish.
Name: Château de la Chaize 2001  Brouilly

Description: With its muscular, oaky nose dominated by toast, this is another woody effort from Potel-Aviron. The flavors are mostly dried spices and cedar, wrapped around a modicum of black cherry fruit. Despite the oak, it's supple and tasty.
Name: Potel-Aviron 2000 Vieilles Vignes  (Fleurie)

Description: This leathery, earthy wine seems to be in keeping with Drouhin's style of Beaujolais. Scents of new baseball glove are more interesting than the modest cherry fruit. Tart and a bit short on the finish.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2001  Fleurie

Description: Earthy and dusty, with these elements leaving a more lasting impression that the wine's modest cherry and plum fruit. Tart, with some dusty tannins on the finish, but not enough stuffing to age. Drink up.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2001  Morgon

Description: This fairly big, extracted Beaujolais has held up remarkably well. Cherries and raspberries are beginning to fade into earth and bracken, so drink up.
Name: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2001  Beaujolais-Villages

Description: Maybe the only disappointment in Duboeuf's 2002 lineup, this wine offers leathery aromas married to ripe black cherries, yet finishes with hints of Play-Doh and bubble gum. Still, the midpalate is fresh and light, offering bounteous red berries.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2002 Flower label  (Juliénas)

Description: A disappointing effort from this normally reliable estate, the 2001 shows hints of raisin and leather on the nose and slightly cooked black cherry flavors along with a supple mouthfeel.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2001 Jean Descombes  (Morgon)

Description: Herbal and light, with cherry, strawberry and rhubarb flavors on a lithe frame. Still remarkably fresh.
Name: Château de la Terrière 2001 Cuvee Jules du Souzy  (Brouilly)

Description: An ebullient wine, with nothing shy or restrained about it. It's loaded with black cherry aromas and fresh fruit flavors. Finishes tart, with hints of licorice.
Name: Mommessin 2002 Old Vines  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: Aromas of bright, candied cherries burst from the glass, along with scents of bubble gum and cotton candy. This is a light, quaffable wine, yet it carries some tannin on the finish, perfect for cutting through rich charcuterie.
Name: Olivier Ravier 2002 Domaine des Sables d'Or  (Beaujolais)

Description: Tough on the outside, with aromas of dried spices and leather and a tannic finish; full-bodied but slightly hollow on the inside, with only modest fruit.
Designation: Domaine de la Tour du Bief
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2001 Domaine de la Tour du Bief  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This is all about the wood—from the clove and cinnamon aromas to the dry, baking-spice flavors and the toasty finish. Some faint cherry notes linger in the background.
Name: Mommessin 2001 Domaine de Champ de Cour  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Damp leather and black cherry aromas lead the way, then sweet, candied fruit takes over on the palate, backed by tart acidity.
Name: Château du Basty 2001 Lantignié  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A bit raisiny and leathery on the nose, as if the fruit is drying out. Offers some black cherry and anise flavors, with caramel notes on the finish.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2001 Domaine des Rosiers  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Understated cherry aromas carry a slight medicinal edge that deepens and broadens on the palate, leaving a cherry cough-syrup impression that's a bit cloying on the finish.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2001  Brouilly

Description: This wine is fading a bit, but still offers some pleasure. It's plump and supple in the mouth, with flavors of raisined black cherries and leather.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2001 Tradition  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: The wine is light and lemony, with thin red-berry flavors.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2002 Saint-Louis Tradition  (Beaujolais)

Description: Lean and a bit disjointed, with an odd disconnect between the very sweet attack (raisin) and very tart (sour cherry, lemon) finish.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2001  Chiroubles

Description: Light and lacking intensity, with sappy cherry fruit and green herbs. Finishes tart.
Name: Mommessin 2001 Les Canneliers  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: This wine's better days are behind it. Earth and leather on the nose, plum and prune on the palate, still tannic on the finish.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2001 Chateau de Nervers  (Brouilly)

Description: Very dark and saturated for Beaujolais, with heavy but fragrant new-oak aromas. The palate is big and beefy, with blackberry and bubble gum flavors. A chewy, rather tannic finish ends the show. There is plenty of oak influence throughout but also a healthy undercurrent of fruit. It's a modern wine, and a good one. But you must like oak-driven aromas and flavors.
Designation: Riserve du Domaine de Champ de Cour
Name: Mommessin 2000 Riserve du Domaine de Champ de Cour  (Moulin-à-Vent)

Description: Light and pretty is the best way to describe this tasty, racy wine. Your basic berry and cherry aromas get a lift from lavender and citrus rind nuances. The flavor profile is all red cherry, but it's mildly rustic and leathery, too. The finish is tight, clean and a bit airy. Balanced and proper; a really nice Beaujolais.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2000 Prestige  (Fleurie)

Description: Sweet and dusty aromas of Bing cherries rise up from the glass, followed by a nice dose of fresh strawberry fruit. The mouth is properly acidic, so it seems juicy and ripe. While it's totally fruit-forward and young, the wine carries a mild but welcome dark edge and a hint of smoke. The mouthfeel is warm and substantial.
Name: Mommessin 2001 Les Grumières  (Brouilly)

Description: Fresh and forward, with ample strawberry and cherry aromas. The mouthfeel is slightly sharp, so the cherry fruit seems to run a bit fast over the palate, while the finish is surprisingly light and simple. Overall it's a lightweight, but a pleasant one.
Name: Mommessin 2001 Chateau De Montmelas  (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: The nose is a bit heavy, bordering on weedy and murky but not quite succumbing to that. However, the earthiness that such aromas portend does come through on the palate along with black plum and chocolate flavors. The wine feels right on the tongue, but it's missing clarity and pop.
Name: Mommessin 2000 Reserve  (Fleurie)

Description: FEATURING A DEEP GARNET COLOR, THIS IS A TART, JUICY WINE WITH A PLEASING PLUMMINESS.
Name: WillaKenzie Estate 1998 Gamay (Oregon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cherry Kool-aid red, with a grapey, cherry-Lifesaver nose. Light cherry fruit tells the whole story. A wine to sip cold on a hot day.
Name: Preston 1998 Beaujolais Rose Gamay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: From the “King of Beaujolais,” this wine's sweet cherry and grapey fruit epitomizes the best of that region's wines. Forward and juicy, there's enough spice to add a touch of complexity, plus a dash more depth than most Beaujolais.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 1997 Pisse Vieille  (Brouilly)

Description: Slightly earthy tart cherry aromas and flavors offer an authentic Canadian take on Beaujolais. Low tannins and moderate acidity make this a likely candidate to serve chilled with charcuterie and mild cheeses.
Name: Cave Spring 1997 Gamay Gamay (Niagara Peninsula)
